jobText: TXT/50671497.txt	§Senior Account Manager – Integrated Marketing Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Account Manager – Integrated Marketing Agency§§Advertiser: §The Marketing Syndicate Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§We have an exciting opportunity for a highly experienced Senior Account Manager to join our integrated marketing agency on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. Working with the GAD and a small team of passionate people, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining strong working relationships with your clients, including taking an active role in new business opportunities. § §Key Responsibilities:§Manage the day-to-day contact with clients to implement campaigns§End-to-end management of the creative and strategic development process§Driving and building existing client relationships and identifying growth opportunities §Manage external relationships and suppliers and negotiate rates and quotes§Guide and support the junior account management team§Manage campaign financials and ensure forecasts and efficiencies are being met§Write, compile and present client presentations and manage weekly WIP meetings§Drive new business pitches from brief to presentation under the guidance of the GAD§Providing strategic guidance and direction to your clients§ §Skills & Experience:§5 years’+ experience in a creative agency§Understanding and implementing agency processes to ensure effective workflow§Good understanding of strategically sound creative §Thorough knowledge of the production process§Experience in developing strategic post campaign analysis reports §Proactively problem solve and work well under pressure§Experience and confidence presenting and pitching to clients§Proven success in client relationships and account growth§ §Values & Personal Traits:§Positive and fun personality with an enthusiastic approach to work§A desire to be challenged and drive success for your clients and the agency§Continually demonstrate that you are a team player§Exceptional project management skills with great attention to detail§Enjoy a challenge, energetic and forward thinking§Great understanding and passion for the creative process and industry§ §About Us:§The Marketing Syndicate, a.k.a TMS, are a dedicated full-service marketing agency with a reputation for delivering strategically-driven creative campaigns that get results. Our focus is on the customer experience and we specialise in shopper, digital, social, promotional marketing and product launches. We understand the importance of creating strong client partnerships, driving innovation and creating awesome work. We also know how to have fun whilst doing it! §At TMS we’re passionate believers in the power of collaboration. We bring a team-oriented approach to everything we do and with our office located on Sydney’s beautiful Northern Beaches we all enjoy a good work/life balance.§ §www.themarketingsyndicate.com.au [link removed]§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50705981.txt	§Trainee Arts, Culture & Tourism Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trainee Arts, Culture & Tourism Officer§§Advertiser: §Lake Macquarie City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$729.08 per week plus 12% superannuation§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§Temporary (2 Years), Full Time§ §2 positions available § § §Earn while you learn and grow in a large, diverse Local Government§ §Be mentored and supported by highly skilled professionals§ §Contribute to arts, culture and tourism experiences within the Community§ §LET’S EXPLORE THE JOB§ §This is an entry level position designed to develop, support and mentor the successful applicant in all facets of the role. § §This exciting role is part of Council’s Education to Employment (E2E) program that offers apprentices, trainees and cadets the opportunity to learn, work and grow in a supportive environment while actively contributing to our Community. Benefits of the program include paid work experience whilst studying towards a qualification, paid course fees, paid time for compulsory course attendance, and gaining valuable transferable skills!§ §Lake Macquarie City Council (LMCC) invites applications from creative and enthusiastic people interested in undertaking a traineeship with LMCC’s Arts, Culture and Tourism team. The Trainee Arts, Culture and Tourism Officer will be involved in a range of activities to support operations of public gallery, libraries, heritage and museum sectors (GLAM), cultural initiatives, events and arts marketing. The Arts, Culture and Tourism traineeship will provide a variety of exposure and education during the term contract for you to engage with and develop career opportunities within the public cultural and creative industry.§ §The position may require shift and/or weekend work and travel and/or work across multiple facilities in order to meet schedules and departmental needs.§ §Key areas of responsibility include (but not limited to):§ § §Provide a high standard of customer service to visitors to our cultural facilities through education and public programs§ §Provide accurate information to customers about current and future cultural activities and programs, events, resources, equipment and technology§ §Participate in team and community engagement initiatives to support the planning and development of creative activities§ §Assist with marketing activities including collating visitor data (e.g. visitor numbers and surveys), promoting cultural activities and developing collateral including online media, mail outs, websites and visual merchandising§ §Assist in the planning and preparation of creative events and programs for all age groups through developing, creating, delivering and evaluating these activities§ §Work with all team members to assist in achieving operational objectives§ §Assist with functions and special events, both within hours and after hours as required and negotiated§ §Please note: A full list of accountabilities is located within the attached Position Statement.§ §LET’S DESCRIBE YOU§ §Our ideal Trainee is enthusiastic with good communication skills who has a strong interest in the creative arts profession and a commitment to providing quality customer service.§ §To be eligible to apply you will be able to meet the following criteria:§ § §Completion of Year 12 HSC or equivalent§ §Demonstrated interest in cultural activities and events, libraries, galleries, marketing and museums§ §Commitment to customer service with good communication skills§ §Proven ability to work in a team environment§ §Experience in multi-tasking and working in a fast paced and changing environment§ §Enthusiasm, flexibility and willingness to undertake the required qualifications online and within the two-year term of this role§ §Desirable - Class C Driver’s license§ §Desirable – good computer skills particularly with MS Word, Excel and Powerpoint§ §LET’S REVEAL THE PERKS§ § §$729.08 per week plus 12% superannuation§ §35-hour working week and nine-day fortnight§ §full payment of course fees§ §paid time for compulsory course attendance§ §valuable work experience and transferrable skills§ §be mentored and supported by highly skilled supervisors§ §PPE supplied§ §Corporate fitness programs§ §LET’S TALK ABOUT US§ §When you join us, you are not part of an organisation; you are part of a future that more than 205,000 Lake Macquarie residents depend on every day. To work here is to be connected. To be part of a true community who value creativity and collaboration, wellbeing and sustainability, opportunity and diversity. Together, we believe in shaping our own future - not waiting for it.§ §Lake Mac strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, the LGBTIQ+ community, refugees and people with disability. We understand the skills and attributes veterans can bring to our Council.§ §LET’S START§ §Position Statement – Trainee Arts, Culture & Tourism Officer§ §Capability Framework – Team Member§ §Guide to Applying § §Recruitment Timeline – We endeavor to get back to you by 9 November 2020.  § § §Applications close midnight, Sunday 25 October 2020§ §For enquiries related to the duties of the role, please contact Renee Morante, Cultural Staff Development Leader, on §02 4921 0166§ or via email §rmorante@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§.§ §If you need assistance with submitting your application, please contact Catherine Khalil, Talent Acquisition Advisor, on §02 4069 0042§ or via email §ckhalil@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§.§ §Please note that as part of Lake Macquarie City Council’s recruitment process, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates may be subject to a medical assessment with Council’s doctor.§ §After the close date, a panel will assess all applications for suitability against the essential criteria for each of the positions. Once completed, an interview, skills assessment or task and reference checks may be undertaken. All candidates will be notified of the outcome via the email address you supply as part of your application.§§§§

This is a new role emerging from a very recent restructuring of CMVic’s operations to reflect our new strategic plan for 2021-24. The Program Coordinator will have a crucial role in planning artistic programs which address both the development of skills for community music group leaders, and the delivery of participatory music events. jobText: TXT/50709904.txt	§Social Media Officer, International§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Officer, International§§Advertiser: §The University of Sydney§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Base salary of $87K pa., + leave loading and super§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Social Media Officer, International §      §        §About the opportunity §        § §        §We are seeking a §Social Media Officer (International)§ to work closely with the social media team in the development and implementation of the University’s social media strategy. As part of the Brand and Content Team you will work collaboratively with Marketing and Communications colleagues to execute paid and organic social media campaigns in key international markets.  §        § §        §About you§        § §        §The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a §Social Media Officer§ who: §        § §        §          §ideally holds a degree and experience in a relevant field or an equivalent combination of training and experience §          §demonstrates high level verbal and written communication skills in both Mandarin and English, interpersonal, negotiation, analytical and problem-solving skills §          §demonstrates in-depth understanding of organic and paid functions of Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, WeChat, Weibo, Baidu and the TenCent suite and knowledge of international social media campaigns in markets such as China and India§          §demonstrates experience and skills in repurposing and tailoring social media content for international markets and their platforms in both a paid and organic capacity§          §is able to work with Marketing and Communications teams, business partners and agencies to adapt social messaging and tactics based on geographies, audiences and platforms§          §displays proficiency with the analytics and paid advertising components of all social media channels as well as third-party platforms.§        §        § §        §About us§        § §        §Marketing and Communications is a professional service unit responsible for communicating the University’s values and messages in ways that target audiences – including prospective students, current students, staff, alumni, donors and external influencers – notice and understand, and which prompt them to action. Marketing and Communications creates a distinctive University of Sydney brand and articulates our role as a research and education leader, in partnership with faculties, University schools, portfolios and professional service units. We strive to establish the University as the best in Australia and a global leader – recognised and ranked as one of the worlds top 20 universities.§        § §        §We communicate the Universitys stories with audiences across Australia and around the world. Our work is guided by three strategic objectives, which include:§        § §        §          §enhancing the Universitys research reputation and our rankings performance§          §diversifying our international student cohort and sharing the student experience§          §building a brand that differentiates Sydney and helps open doors.§        §        § §        §Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across our campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 60,000 students.§        § §        §We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us. §        §How to apply§ §For more information on the position and University, please view the position description available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website. §All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.§ Visit §sydney.edu.au/recruitment§ and search by the reference number §1131/0920F§ to apply. §Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position § §Closing date: 11.30pm, Sunday 18 October 2020§ §The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. §©§ The University of Sydney §The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment§      §      §      §    §  §§§§About the opportunity § §We are seeking a §Social Media Officer (International)§ to work closely with the social media team in the development and implementation of the University’s social media strategy. As part of the Brand and Content Team you will work collaboratively with Marketing and Communications colleagues to execute paid and organic social media campaigns in key international markets.  § §§About you§§ §The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a §Social Media Officer§ who: § §§ideally holds a degree and experience in a relevant field or an equivalent combination of training and experience §demonstrates high level verbal and written communication skills in both Mandarin and English, interpersonal, negotiation, analytical and problem-solving skills §demonstrates in-depth understanding of organic and paid functions of Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, WeChat, Weibo, Baidu and the TenCent suite and knowledge of international social media campaigns in markets such as China and India§demonstrates experience and skills in repurposing and tailoring social media content for international markets and their platforms in both a paid and organic capacity§is able to work with Marketing and Communications teams, business partners and agencies to adapt social messaging and tactics based on geographies, audiences and platforms§displays proficiency with the analytics and paid advertising components of all social media channels as well as third-party platforms.§§ §§About us§ §Marketing and Communications is a professional service unit responsible for communicating the University’s values and messages in ways that target audiences – including prospective students, current students, staff, alumni, donors and external influencers – notice and understand, and which prompt them to action. Marketing and Communications creates a distinctive University of Sydney brand and articulates our role as a research and education leader, in partnership with faculties, University schools, portfolios and professional service units. We strive to establish the University as the best in Australia and a global leader – recognised and ranked as one of the worlds top 20 universities.§ §We communicate the Universitys stories with audiences across Australia and around the world. Our work is guided by three strategic objectives, which include:§ §§enhancing the Universitys research reputation and our rankings performance§diversifying our international student cohort and sharing the student experience§building a brand that differentiates Sydney and helps open doors.§§ §Since our inception 160 years ago, the University of Sydney has led to improve the world around us. We believe in education for all and that effective leadership makes lives better. These same values are reflected in our approach to diversity and inclusion and underpin our long-term strategy for growth. We’re Australias first university and have an outstanding global reputation for academic and research excellence. Across our campuses, we employ over 7600 academic and non-academic staff who support over 60,000 students.§ §We are undergoing significant transformative change which brings opportunity for innovation, progressive thinking, breaking with convention, challenging the status quo, and improving the world around us. §§How to apply§ §For more information on the position and University, please view the position description available from the job’s listing on the University of Sydney careers website. §All applications must be submitted via the University of Sydney careers website.§ Visit §sydney.edu.au/recruitment§ and search by the reference number §1131/0920F§ to apply. §Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position § §Closing date: 11.30pm, Sunday 18 October 2020§ §The University of Sydney is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. §©§ The University of Sydney §The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Primary Wedding Videographer / Editor Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700926.txt	§Primary Wedding Videographer / Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Primary Wedding Videographer / Editor§§Advertiser: §Storytellers Wedding Collective§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §South West & M5 Corridor§§Salary§§$40 - $44.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Hey there! We are looking for a passionate and skilled Primary Videographer and editor to join our team of Storytellers at Storytellers Wedding Co in a casual position. If you are confident, creative, are passionate about photography, love to have fun and can easily adapt to different shooting environments, then we want you to join our team of wedding photographers and videographers!§ §Who are Storytellers Wedding Co.?§The Storytellers Wedding Collective are a team of visual artists and storytellers consisting of photographers and cinematographers who are passionate about capturing and re-telling the stories and moments of couples who are wildly in love.§ §We are wanderers – young at heart, energetic in nature. Our passion for film and photography is driven by a search for meaning, to tell the stories that matter. As Storytellers, we’re here to tell stories in everything we create, revealing the deep passion and romanticism between couples through the celebration of love.§ §Why join Storytellers Wedding Collective?§As a Storyteller, you will have the opportunity to create and capture moments worth reliving in the most breath-taking locations, with some of the most amazing people! At the Storytellers Collective, we value creativity and thrive off of seeing our Storytellers expand their creative ability and increase their skill. Take your creative ability to the next level by joining a team of professionals who are passionate about love and creativity. Not only will you grow in all areas, but you will be part of a team that encourages you to thrive. The sky's the limit!§ §Hours between 27-36 hours per week involving editing and shooting§The successful candidate welcome to work/edit from home§The successful candidate candidate is welcome to choose own hours each week§ §The successful applicant must have:§ §Experience shooting weddings§High adaptability to different environments§Drivers License (P2 or higher)§A strong wedding Portfolio§Excellent communications and interpersonal skills§Strong organisational skills and attention to detail§Strong personal and time management skills§Experience operating shoots on their own and as a team§ §When applying please include the following:§ §Instagram profile§Portfolio§Camera equipment owned (camera, lenses, etc)§ §Check out our Instagram and website! If you think you have what it takes, apply today!§Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/storytellersweddingco/§Website: http://storytellersweddingcollective.com/§ §Hourly rate: $37-45 depending upon experience§§§§

jobTitle: Ambassador Coordinator Job in Gold Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50713555.txt	§Ambassador Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ambassador Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Fiona Watson Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§HOTA, Home of the Arts is a growing and ambitious arts precinct in Bundall that attracts over 680,000 visitors every year. The two indoor theatres, two cinemas, a large outdoor stage and beautiful parklands will be joined by HOTA Gallery in April 2021 which makes this the true cultural heart of the Gold Coast. §An essential part of this organisation will be the 200 Ambassadors (Volunteers) who will welcome, orientate and enable visitors during their time at HOTA ensuring enjoyment and safety of visitors, buildings and art.§ FWR are excited to be working with HOTA to recruit an Ambassador Coordinator. This role will build, enable and lead the Ambassador Community. Collaborating with the Visitor Services team, the role will be responsible for -§ § §Developing and maintaining a strong community of Ambassadors§ §Coordinate and execute recruitment, training and evaluation of Ambassadors§ §Coordinate Ambassador roster to ensure coverage of events, exhibitions and opening hours§ §Fill unanticipated Ambassador gaps as required (walk the talk!)§ §Proactively participate in briefings, debriefings, evaluations, meetings, planning to support continual improvement of the HOTA visitor experience§ §Ensure a safe environment for art work, visitors and staff ensuring risk mitigation, reporting of incidents etc§ §Resolve any Ambassador team issues and manage escalation§ §Manage the administration of incident reporting, RTW schedules, timesheets and leave requests§ § This is a role for someone who is truly passionate about the arts and customer service. A critical aspect of the role will be to maintain a high level of knowledge relevant to visitors about HOTA, the HOTA Collection, artworks on display, art making techniques, exhibitions in the Gallery and the broader precinct, facilities and amenities, public transport and other cultural/recreational experiences on the Gold Coast. You will share this knowledge with Ambassadors during training and also with the public as you provide tours, programs around the Gallery and precinct.§ §Maintaining relationships with the Ambassadors is essential, so the role will involve working a roster pattern to ensure face to face contact with each Ambassador at least monthly. This will require some evening, weekend and public holiday work as the HOTA Gallery is a 7 day operation.§ §You will be a highly organised individual with the ability to lead, influence and problem solve. You will have exceptional communication skills to have difficult conversations, convey artistic concepts and interpret artworks with visitors. You will love working with people of all backgrounds and interests.§ §To find out more about this role, please call Fiona Watson for a confidential discussion on §0415 656064§ or APPLY NOW§§§§

jobText: TXT/50669167.txt	§Social Media/TikTok Content Creator/Videographer (ADELAIDE)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media/TikTok Content Creator/Videographer (ADELAIDE)§§Advertiser: §SnapWireless Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§$25 - $30 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§Social Media/TikTok Content Creator/Videographer (ADELAIDE)§  §SnapWireless is seeking a talented, hard-working individual for a Videographer /Content Creator role to help us continue to create amazing content. If you are a motivated and passionate creative, who loves creating content then this is the role for you! Come and join our fun, dynamic team in a positive and exciting start-up environment. §  §About SnapWireless§Launched in 2017, we are a fast-growing Australian owned consumer electronics company focused on wireless charging. We are shaking up the old boring consumer tech industry with our unique products and a strong focus on wireless charging. Our online content has reached millions of people through social media marketing strategies and has in return created over 40,000+ happy customers!§  §We are a content powerhouse. We are passionate about creating original and engaging content. With new platforms on the rise such as TikTok, we are looking to create more content than ever! We are seeking a creative and talented Videographer/Content creator to join us in a casual role.§  § §  §About The Role§ §  §You will be working closely with the directors, marketing coordinator and in-house videographer to plan and create powerful and exciting content that will be pushed out daily online through our social media platforms. Possessing additional skills such as photography and creating graphics and marketing knowledge will be highly regarded§  § §  §This role will be a temporary 3-month casual position over Q4, which may roll over to an ongoing casual position depending on the candidate performance and marketing ROI.§  § §  §Key Duties/Responsibilities§ § § §Video content creation mainly focused on TikTok, LinkedIn & daily vlogging§  § § §Identifying and understanding new trends, styles§  § § §Brainstorming and storyboarding of video ideas, different content categories and how it can drive brand engagement and sales§  § § §All forms of content creation for social media platforms such as Youtube, Instagram and also our blogs§  § § §  §About You§ § § §Have previous experience in videography and content creation - Preferably 1-2 years minimum   §  § § §Experience across social platforms: Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Youtube§  § § §Be confident in using programs such as Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator and Final Cut Pro etc. §  § § §Be very well rounded. Pre-production, post-production. Not only just shooting but editing.§  § § §Fast editing and turnaround.§  § § §Have the ability to learn quickly and adapt to the changing social media environment.       §  § § §Have extremely high attention to detail.    §  § § §Have a very creative mind.   §  § § §Have your own camera gear (Lights/tripods/studio area etc will be supplied)§  § § §Strong understanding of social media marketing strategies & concepts.§  § §Skills and attributes aside, company culture is very important to us and you must be a positive person who is always seeking to learn more and grow personally and professionally.  §  § §  § §  §What we offer you:     § § § §A positive and fun working environment in a small dynamic team       §  § § §The opportunity to work for a fast-growing innovative start-up §  § § §The possibility to continue working with us in an ongoing casual role§  § § §  §To Apply  §  §If this role interests you in any way, please forward your CV and cover letter by email to Mark/Michael at: §careers@snapwireless.com.au§.  Please include any links and examples of work and content produced.§  § §  §LOCATION: Ferryden Park, South Australia 5010§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§What's your expected hourly rate?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

jobText: TXT/50703864.txt	§Media Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media Manager§§Advertiser: §NSW Department of Communities and Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Media Manager §    §      §Company description:§        §Supreme Court of New South Wales§Job description:§        § §        §Media Manager§        §Supreme Court of New South Wales§        § §        §          §Ongoing part time opportunity, two days a week, Thursday and Friday§          §Location: Sydney§          §Clerk Grade 11, (full time salary §$128,089 pa – $133,519 pa), plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading§        §        § §        §About us §        §The Supreme Court is the highest court in NSW. It has unlimited civil jurisdiction and hears the most serious criminal matters. The Court has both appellate and trial jurisdictions.§        §This role will manage and co-ordinate the development and implementation of strategies that will increase and enhance public awareness of the courts, and ensure the provision of timely and accurate information of court-related matters to the media.§        § §        §About the Opportunity§        § §        §The role is focused on increasing the public awareness of the courts.  The role is responsible for the development and implementation of media and communication activities that will lead towards increased community and media understanding of the operations and functions of the courts. §        §Strong links with the media will be fostered and maintained to ensure that accurate and timely information is provided to, and reported by, the media in relation to various cases and court-related matters.§        §The Media Manager works closely with the Chief Justice, other heads of jurisdiction, the President and Chief Judges to plan and develop coordinated media information strategies.  The strategies address problems encountered in the reporting of court cases and ensure that current and reliable information is provided.§        §The role provides assistance and advice to judges and staff of the courts in relation to the handling of media inquiries.§        § §        §Essential Requirements§        § §        §          §Tertiary qualification in a relevant media/journalism/communication/public relations discipline or equivalent experience within a Government, media or public relations environment.§          §Extensive experience as a public relations or public affairs professional, or as a media adviser working with executive level staff.§          §Extensive experience in carrying out media liaison functions relating to complex and sensitive issues, within public and/or private sectors.§          §Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation and communication (both written and oral) skills.§          §Sound knowledge of the Australian legal system and workings of the NSW courts and legal profession.§          §Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgement and work without supervision.§          §Well developed, analytical and strategy development skills.§          §Ability to act confidentially and with integrity.§          §Knowledge and experience of ministerial and parliamentary operations.§        §        § §        § §        § §        §This is an ongoing opportunity in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.§        § §        § §        § §        §How to apply§        § §        §For your application to be considered, please;§        § §        §          §Attach a resume that sets out your work experience as relevant to the role§        §        § §        §          §Attach a cover letter that details your experience as relevant to the role§        §        § §        § §        §When preparing your resume and cover letter we are looking for you to demonstrate your competence in the Focus Capabilities as outlined in the §Role Description§, so please consider your responses with this in mind.§        § §        §Please submit your application via Success Factors including the information outlined above (applications cannot be accepted outside of Success Factors)§        § §        § §        §Closing date§: Tuesday 13th October 2020 @11.59pm§        § §        § §        §For further information about this opportunity, please contact; Chris D’Aeth on §02 9230 8097§ or via email §chris.daeth@justice.nsw.gov.au§        § §        § §        §Part of the assessment process may include additional online capability testing, skills testing or work samples in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013; therefore you may be contacted to participate. You may also be asked to complete a Health Declaration Form in later stages of the assessment process.§        § §        §Find out more§        § §        §Click §here§ to view the role description.§        § §        §For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click §here§        § §        §Important§        §To ensure recruitment at the Department of Communities and Justice continues without interruption during the COVID-19 pandemic, some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods. This may include video interviewing, telephone interviewing and online assessments. If you are successful following review of your application, you may need to perform assessments and/or interviews via online platforms using a PC, laptop or smart phone. By doing so, we will be adhering to the strict social distancing advice currently in place. §        § §        §The Department of Communities and Justice is committed to building a workplace that values and supports diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§        § §        §The Department encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.§        § §        §If you experience technical issues when submitting your application, please contact Dean on §02 9765 3526§ or via email §Dean.Antpohler@facs.nsw.gov.au§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Company description:§Supreme Court of New South Wales§Job description:§ §Media Manager§Supreme Court of New South Wales§ § §Ongoing part time opportunity, two days a week, Thursday and Friday§ §Location: Sydney§ §Clerk Grade 11, (full time salary §$128,089 pa – $133,519 pa), plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading§ § §About us §The Supreme Court is the highest court in NSW. It has unlimited civil jurisdiction and hears the most serious criminal matters. The Court has both appellate and trial jurisdictions.§This role will manage and co-ordinate the development and implementation of strategies that will increase and enhance public awareness of the courts, and ensure the provision of timely and accurate information of court-related matters to the media.§ §About the Opportunity§ §The role is focused on increasing the public awareness of the courts.  The role is responsible for the development and implementation of media and communication activities that will lead towards increased community and media understanding of the operations and functions of the courts. §Strong links with the media will be fostered and maintained to ensure that accurate and timely information is provided to, and reported by, the media in relation to various cases and court-related matters.§The Media Manager works closely with the Chief Justice, other heads of jurisdiction, the President and Chief Judges to plan and develop coordinated media information strategies.  The strategies address problems encountered in the reporting of court cases and ensure that current and reliable information is provided.§The role provides assistance and advice to judges and staff of the courts in relation to the handling of media inquiries.§ §Essential Requirements§ § §Tertiary qualification in a relevant media/journalism/communication/public relations discipline or equivalent experience within a Government, media or public relations environment.§ §Extensive experience as a public relations or public affairs professional, or as a media adviser working with executive level staff.§ §Extensive experience in carrying out media liaison functions relating to complex and sensitive issues, within public and/or private sectors.§ §Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation and communication (both written and oral) skills.§ §Sound knowledge of the Australian legal system and workings of the NSW courts and legal profession.§ §Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgement and work without supervision.§ §Well developed, analytical and strategy development skills.§ §Ability to act confidentially and with integrity.§ §Knowledge and experience of ministerial and parliamentary operations.§ § § § §This is an ongoing opportunity in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.§ § § §How to apply§ §For your application to be considered, please;§ § §Attach a resume that sets out your work experience as relevant to the role§ § § §Attach a cover letter that details your experience as relevant to the role§ § § §When preparing your resume and cover letter we are looking for you to demonstrate your competence in the Focus Capabilities as outlined in the §Role Description§, so please consider your responses with this in mind.§ §Please submit your application via Success Factors including the information outlined above (applications cannot be accepted outside of Success Factors)§ § §Closing date§: Tuesday 13th October 2020 @11.59pm§ § §For further information about this opportunity, please contact; Chris D’Aeth on §02 9230 8097§ or via email §chris.daeth@justice.nsw.gov.au§ § §Part of the assessment process may include additional online capability testing, skills testing or work samples in accordance with the Government Sector Employment Act 2013; therefore you may be contacted to participate. You may also be asked to complete a Health Declaration Form in later stages of the assessment process.§ §Find out more§ §Click §here§ to view the role description.§ §For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click §here§ §Important§To ensure recruitment at the Department of Communities and Justice continues without interruption during the COVID-19 pandemic, some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods. This may include video interviewing, telephone interviewing and online assessments. If you are successful following review of your application, you may need to perform assessments and/or interviews via online platforms using a PC, laptop or smart phone. By doing so, we will be adhering to the strict social distancing advice currently in place. § §The Department of Communities and Justice is committed to building a workplace that values and supports diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of women, people with a disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§ §The Department encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment process and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.§ §If you experience technical issues when submitting your application, please contact Dean on §02 9765 3526§ or via email §Dean.Antpohler@facs.nsw.gov.au§ § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50708148.txt	§VIDEOGRAPHER / PHOTOGRAPHER §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§VIDEOGRAPHER / PHOTOGRAPHER §§Advertiser: §Crafted Property Agents§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Southern Suburbs & Logan§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§Our company specialises in Acreage Property Sales in the Brisbane and Logan region and have been serving the area for over 40 years.  Our agency has a strong focus on creating exceptional and creative content for properties and branding ads for numerous digital platforms.§The Opportunity§We are looking for an enthusiastic videographer/editor to join our team full time.  You will work both independently at times as well as alongside our Director and Marketing Manager.  The primary role will be capturing and producing cinematic property videos plus photography for new listings coming to market.  Additionally, creating digital video content for social media and our website such as Client Testimonials, Suburb Profiles and Market Updates. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person to broaden their production and post-production experience/portfolio. §Skills and Experience§Must be creative and forward thinking and a great communicator §Digitally savvy and someone who passionately lives and breathes video§Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment§Must be organised, have strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritise and meet deadlines§Highly proficient in using Adobe Creative Suite in particular Premiere Pro, After Effects, Lightroom and Photoshop§Experience with using Camera Equipment plus other video tools (some training will be provided)§Need to have a current driver's license and reliable car§Responsibilities §Capture video footage and photography at properties§Produce Cinematic Property Videos (combining drone footage)§Content Development: Capture and produce Video content for Social Media and our website such as Client Testimonials, Suburb Profiles and Market Updates§Capture and upload Matterport 3D Scans and order floor plans§Equipment§All equipment is provided (Cameras, gimbals, drones, 3d, software and pc)§Preference will be given to applicants who provide a portfolio/examples of previous video/photo work that they have done and a cover letter explaining why they love video and what they could bring to the role.§§§§

It was created to be an essential element of the building’s architectural fabric reflecting the unique qualities of Australia.  The collections include:§Historic Memorials Collection§Architectural Commissions§Gifts Collection§Rotational Collection of contemporary and Indigenous artworks§ §The Art Collections Section is responsible for the custody, care, development and control of the Parliament House Art Collections.§These roles oversee the art services to the Parliament and contribute to a range of projects supporting the delivery of collection care, digitisation and project works.   A key part of these roles will be to develop, implement and monitor appropriate documentation, procedures and policies for the management of the Parliament House Art Collections.§The successful candidates will need to have demonstrated extensive experience in similar roles as well as high level organisational, time management, staff management and stakeholder engagement skills.§Candidates selected for interview may be asked to submit a portfolio of recent work and undertake a practical exercise as part of the selection process.§      §      §      §    §  §§§The Department of Parliamentary Services (DPS) is recruiting for PSL6 level staff to undertake the ongoing roles of Manager Collections Care, Projects Manager and non-ongoing role Senior Photographer in the Art Collections section.  The Senior Photographer role is available for a period of 18 months with the possibility of extension.§DPS are responsible for a wide range of services and facilities, working closely with the Department of the Senate, the Department of the House of Representatives and the Parliamentary Budget Office to support the operations of the Parliament and its Committees. § §The Art Collections within Parliament House are nationally significant collections consisting of more than 6,500 works spanning all genres of Australian art. It was created to be an essential element of the building’s architectural fabric reflecting the unique qualities of Australia.  The collections include:§Historic Memorials Collection§Architectural Commissions§Gifts Collection§Rotational Collection of contemporary and Indigenous artworks§ §The Art Collections Section is responsible for the custody, care, development and control of the Parliament House Art Collections.§These roles oversee the art services to the Parliament and contribute to a range of projects supporting the delivery of collection care, digitisation and project works.   A key part of these roles will be to develop, implement and monitor appropriate documentation, procedures and policies for the management of the Parliament House Art Collections.§The successful candidates will need to have demonstrated extensive experience in similar roles as well as high level organisational, time management, staff management and stakeholder engagement skills.§Candidates selected for interview may be asked to submit a portfolio of recent work and undertake a practical exercise as part of the selection process.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50691592.txt	§Video Producer (Casual)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Video Producer (Casual)§§Advertiser: §ANGRYchair§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§We're looking for some extra help producing our shoots! §  §Our growing team of video production pros need an extra set of hands to call on to produce our shoots.§  §In this role, you'll work alongside our camera operators on shoots with our clients to ensure we're capturing everything we need for our post team to create some crackerjack video content. You'd also look after our client through our pre-production process and brief our post team.§  §Opportunities you'll get ... § § §To work across a massive range of projects from simple content marketing pieces to big brand content pieces.§ §To grow with us as we grow.§ §To flex your creative muscle in producing cool content for a wide range of brands and organisations.§ §Responsibilities you'll have ...§ § §To liaise directly with clients and knock their socks off on location.§ §Supervise shoots and ensure all footage we need is collected.§ §To communicate clearly and regularly with clients about their video projects before, during and after the shoot.§ §To work efficiently and meet deadlines.§ §This role is perfect for someone who has some experience producing shoots for TV or professional video content and who loves having a chat with people while a camera-op works their magic next to them. §  §You must:§ § §Be passionate about telling a story in an authentic way.§ §Be driven to create the very best product every time.§ §Have an attitude that makes people want to work with you.§ §Be up for the challenge of creating compelling videos for business and not-for-profit clients.§ §Be able to respond professionally to feedback from our team and from clients.§ §Be up for the challenges of creating awesome content within the limitation of clients' deadlines.§ §You'll need to have:§ § §Experience working as a producer with a focus on interviewing people who haven't been on-camera before.§ §Experience dealing professionally with customers/clients in a previous role.§ §Minimum 2-3 years experience at a Production Company or Network.§ §Application procedure:§  §Call §03 9088 6067§ to find out more and express your interest in this job.§PLEASE NOTE: §Our hiring process is unique and stringent to ensure we end up with only the very best people on our team. Please do not send any CV's or cover letters until you've called this number. Only applications that follow our outlined process will be considered. Our recruitment process is extensive and includes a number of phone/zoom/in-person interviews, a Caliper Profile quiz and possibly some test-shoots before we decide on a successful candidate. §  §We appreciate the demands on your time that hunting for a job makes! The reason our application process is so multi-stepped is because we'll only ask you to let us know a bit more about yourself at each step - instead of asking everyone for a lengthy application upfront.§  §We value your time and our own, so if you haven't heard from us, or we're asking you to complete yet another step, this is a sign that you're progressing!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50712817.txt	§Publications and Studio Support Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Publications and Studio Support Officer§§Advertiser: §Early Childhood Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§Early Childhood Australia§ §Early Childhood Australia (ECA) has been operating since 1938. Our vision is ‘every young child thriving and learning’. To achieve this vision we champion the rights of young children to thrive and learn at home, in the community, within early learning settings and through the early years of school.§ §Our work builds the capacity of our society and the early childhood sector to realize the potential of every child during the critical early years from birth to the age of eight. ECA specifically acknowledges the rights of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children and their families, and the past and current injustices and realities for them around Australia.§ §About the role§ §The Project and Administration Support Officer is responsible for a range of ECA’s project and publishing functions to ensure they align with ECA’s values, maintain consistency, and achieve the objectives set out in ECA’s Strategic Plan. Responsibilities include: § § §New product project management and administration§ §Provide administration support for ECA’s Research and Academic Publishing§ §Communicating with stakeholders, content providers, reviewers and committee members§ §Communicating with ECA Studio clients and ECA teams§ §Selection Criteria§Required§1. Minimum 3 years’ practical experience in publishing and/or project management—demonstrating capability in managing competing timelines and work schedules.§2. Advance Microsoft Office Skills—especially Word, Excel and MS Outlook including skills in editing, tracked changes and comments in Microsoft Word.§3. Highly developed written and verbal communication.§4. Attention to detail and accuracy§5. Demonstrated ability work collaboratively§ § §Desirable§1. Editing and strong writing skills (including editing mark-up in hardcopy and electronic format)§2. Experience in publications such as copy-editing or design§3. Experience in managing stakeholder relationships.§4. Understanding or knowledge of the early childhood sector§5. Working knowledge of Wordpress.§ §Benefits§ § §The Salary for this role is at Level 2 ($64,705–$68,668 ) as per Early Childhood Australia’s Enterprise Agreement and sets out all applicable terms and conditions of your employment. As a registered charity ECA is eligible for fringe benefit tax rebates and offers salary packaging options.§ §The role is a part time (15-22.5 hours per week) 9-month Parental Leave position. ECA is open to flexible work arrangements and location. Hours are negotiable but primarily during business hours am – 5pm.§ §The position is based in our National office at 16 Mildura St, Fyshwick ACT.§ § § §How to Apply§ §Further information is available via ECA's web site under 'careers': §http://www.earlychildhoodaustralia.org.au/careers/§. Applications must address the selection criteria and be submitted electronically in word or pdf format. Applications not addressing the selection criteria will not be considered. Along with the response to the selection criteria applications must include a CV listing 2 referees and are to be submitted by §midnight Sunday, 25 October 2020§ via email to employment@earlychildhood.org.au, please ensure that in the subject line contains your full name and the position you are applying for.§ §Contact Officer: §For a confidential discussion please contact §Christopher Jones§ on §02 6242 1800§ §or §cjones@earlychildhood.org.au§. § §ECA is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander persons. § §Applicants must be located in and have a genuine right to work in Australia.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a publishing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Have you worked in a role where your duties included proof reading and sub-editing?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50659139.txt	§Business Concierge§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Concierge§§Advertiser: §City of Port Phillip§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §The City of Port Phillip is committed to a culture of ethical leadership, openness, respect and integrity and provides a great work-life balance. §      §Business Concierge §      §      §      §      §      §        §§        §• Permanent Full time§        §• Band 7 $96,794 to $108,318 plus 9.5% Super§        §• Based in the St Kilda Town Hall and during COVID-19 Pandemic, with Executive Leadership Team/DHHS direction, this role is able to work from home and is predominantly based online§        §About the Organisation §        §The City of Port Phillip is an inner-city Council with around 900 employees who deliver more than 100 programs and services to our residents, businesses and visitors. These range from events and festivals, markets, childcare and immunisations, to libraries, management of parks and open space, rubbish collection, road maintenance and more.  §        §About the Role§        §Do you have strong vision to deliver sustainable communities, support businesses and reactivate public space? We seek a confident, enthusiastic communicator with the ability to work at pace to deliver a large program of work with huge success.  You will be a strong team player who supports the Head of Economic Growth and Activation, Senior Public Space Coordinator and Industry Development Coordinator.§        §The primary objective of the City Growth and Culture Department is to support economic growth through business support and the reactivation of public space, and promotion of the many unique neighbourhoods in the City of Port Phillip. §        §This is important at all times but even more so post-COVID-19, as our local community, spaces and businesses will be important as our community recovers from COVID-19, culturally, socially, environmentally and economically. As the Business Concierge you will participate in and manage the planning and delivery of strategic initiatives with the Economic Growth and Activation team within the City of Port Phillip. §        §Duties§        §• Serve as a single point of contact for businesses who have enquiries on how Council could support them§        §• Respond to business enquiries (once elevated by the Economic Growth and Activation Officer) and refer these requests to the relevant area for action and monitor to ensure progress is made if it is not our Team§        §• Advocate within the Organisation for the needs of business in terms of policies, process and their development to remove red tape§        §• Build, maintain and manage a business database to better promote opportunities to our business community §        §• Help deliver / support delivery of Business Support Program linkages with other bodies and grant opportunities §        §• Support the Senior Public Space Coordinator with extended footpath trading and parklet initiatives across the municipality §        §• Develop and deliver Business Forums §        §• Build relationships with Real Estate Agents and work together to fill non-residential vacancies across Port Phillip, and provide reports on progress. §        §• Act as a point of contact for businesses in the municipality that may wish to establish a Traders Association and or explore the special rate process, together with the Industry Development Coordinator. §        §• Brief in, to the Communications team, marketing, promotional, media opportunities, design tasks etc §        §• Assist with submitting Grant applications §        §• Weekend and after-hours work will be required§        §Skills and Experience §        §• A be a problem solver and someone who is driven by delivering outstanding customer service.§        §• Experience in: economic development; working with trader associations; building strong stakeholder relationships as outcomes; the ability to function as a member of a small team in a high pressure, service-based environment; and the ability to manage challenging stakeholders.§        §• Possess highly-developed analytical and lateral thinking skills and the ability to take the initiative, drive change and implement innovations; excellent interpersonal, negotiation and persuasion skills, with the ability to use discretion and judgement in a complex business and political environment. §        §• Flexibility to work 38 hours/week including weekends and irregular weekday hours due to the nature of the role and meeting the needs of our communities.§        §Culture§        §We are a welcoming Team who work hard, celebrate our achievements and are supportive of each other. Port Phillip offers a vibrant and diverse work environment where our employees can develop both professionally and personally whilst planning and delivering a range of important services and programs for the community.§        §How to Apply§        §Click APPLY.§        §Applicants must respond to each of the key selection criteria contained in the Position Description in the same document as their 1-2 page cover letter, and submit a CV on the City of Port Phillip system. Applications that do not address the selection criteria, will not be considered. §        §Note: Only applications submitted via the online Recruitment Portal will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be provided feedback.§        §Further information can be obtained by contacting §Anita Donnelly, Head of Economic Growth and Activation via §anita.donnelly@portphillip.vic.gov.au§        §Applications close at midnight on§ 11 October 2020§. Interviews will be conducted in the week commencing 12 October.§        §The City of Port Phillip is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive and accessible environment where diversity is valued. If you have accessibility requirements or require an adjustment to participate in our recruitment and selection process, please contact Gia Tran (HR Business Partner) on §03 8563 7657§ or email: §helppc@portphillip.vic.gov.au§        §The City of Port Phillip has zero tolerance for child abuse and is a committed Child Safe organisation, so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse. A successful application is subject to a satisfactory police record and Working with Children Check.§      §      § Applications close  §        § At City of Port Phillip we value and encourage diversity in our workplace.§      §    §    §  §§§• Permanent Full time§ §• Band 7 $96,794 to $108,318 plus 9.5% Super§ §• Based in the St Kilda Town Hall and during COVID-19 Pandemic, with Executive Leadership Team/DHHS direction, this role is able to work from home and is predominantly based online§ §About the Organisation § §The City of Port Phillip is an inner-city Council with around 900 employees who deliver more than 100 programs and services to our residents, businesses and visitors. As the Business Concierge you will participate in and manage the planning and delivery of strategic initiatives with the Economic Growth and Activation team within the City of Port Phillip. § §Duties§ §• Serve as a single point of contact for businesses who have enquiries on how Council could support them§ §• Respond to business enquiries (once elevated by the Economic Growth and Activation Officer) and refer these requests to the relevant area for action and monitor to ensure progress is made if it is not our Team§ §• Advocate within the Organisation for the needs of business in terms of policies, process and their development to remove red tape§ §• Build, maintain and manage a business database to better promote opportunities to our business community § §• Help deliver / support delivery of Business Support Program linkages with other bodies and grant opportunities § §• Support the Senior Public Space Coordinator with extended footpath trading and parklet initiatives across the municipality § §• Develop and deliver Business Forums § §• Build relationships with Real Estate Agents and work together to fill non-residential vacancies across Port Phillip, and provide reports on progress. § §• Act as a point of contact for businesses in the municipality that may wish to establish a Traders Association and or explore the special rate process, together with the Industry Development Coordinator. § §• Brief in, to the Communications team, marketing, promotional, media opportunities, design tasks etc § §• Assist with submitting Grant applications § §• Weekend and after-hours work will be required§ §Skills and Experience § §• A be a problem solver and someone who is driven by delivering outstanding customer service.§ §• Experience in: economic development; working with trader associations; building strong stakeholder relationships as outcomes; the ability to function as a member of a small team in a high pressure, service-based environment; and the ability to manage challenging stakeholders.§ §• Possess highly-developed analytical and lateral thinking skills and the ability to take the initiative, drive change and implement innovations; excellent interpersonal, negotiation and persuasion skills, with the ability to use discretion and judgement in a complex business and political environment. § §• Flexibility to work 38 hours/week including weekends and irregular weekday hours due to the nature of the role and meeting the needs of our communities.§ §Culture§ §We are a welcoming Team who work hard, celebrate our achievements and are supportive of each other. Port Phillip offers a vibrant and diverse work environment where our employees can develop both professionally and personally whilst planning and delivering a range of important services and programs for the community.§ §How to Apply§ §Click APPLY.§ §Applicants must respond to each of the key selection criteria contained in the Position Description in the same document as their 1-2 page cover letter, and submit a CV on the City of Port Phillip system. Applications that do not address the selection criteria, will not be considered. § §Note: Only applications submitted via the online Recruitment Portal will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be provided feedback.§ §Further information can be obtained by contacting §Anita Donnelly, Head of Economic Growth and Activation via §anita.donnelly@portphillip.vic.gov.au§ §Applications close at midnight on§ 11 October 2020§. jobTitle: General Manager - 7XS Queenstown Job in Devonport & North West - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50592490.txt	§General Manager - 7XS Queenstown§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Manager - 7XS Queenstown§§Advertiser: §Grant Broadcasters§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Devonport & North West§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§A rare and unique opportunity has arisen on the beautiful West of Tasmania. Based in iconic Queenstown, the home of the West Coast Railway, world class mountain bike circuits, heritage, majestic landscapes, mining and a wonderful community, we are looking for a new General Manager to take this important radio station forward. It’s an ideal opportunity for any radio or sales professional who wants to enter management and who is looking for future promotion.§  §With the strong support of the West Coast Council, local business, government and our company, this station plays an important role in keeping Strahan, Queenstown, Zeehan, Rosebery and Tulla informed, entertained and connected to all that’s going on. In keeping with our strategy to be genuinely local in everything we do, we seek a community minded General Manager who wants to lead our business and become part of and integrate into the fullness of life on the West Coast.§  §As a fully subscribed member of the Tasmanian management team, you will enjoy the autonomy, independence and the authority to lead the company and being accountable. You will be fully supported in everything you need to make a real success of the opportunity.§  §We would love to hear from you if you are interested and the following sounds like you.§  §If you:§ § §Are willing to live in Queenstown, Strahan or Zeehan§ §You possess advertising and or sales skills and can demonstrate previous success in achieving targets§ §See yourself becoming over time a local leader within the community§ §Are known to be highly dependable, honest conduct and are motivated to succeed§ §Have strong people skills, capable of empathy, understanding§ §Have a solid grasp of media, sales and management.§ §A salary, an incentive scheme and a fully maintained company car is provided to the successful candidate.§  §If you are up for a life changing opportunity leading a local media business, please apply by COB Monday 5th October. §§§§

jobTitle: Part-time On-camera Finance Journalist Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50680716.txt	§Part-time On-camera Finance Journalist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Part-time On-camera Finance Journalist§§Advertiser: §Sequoia Financial Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Sequoia Financial Group is an ASX-listed financial services company that works with financial advisers, business and individuals to manage and grow their wealth. We offer a full range of products and services, including financial advice, superannuation management and administration, stockbroking execution and clearing and a legal documents/company establishment service. The company operates on a stand-alone basis and is not associated with a bank or super fund.§  §Over the past 5 years, Sequoia has grown rapidly and this is expected to continue against a background of more Australians looking to take control of their financial future. The Sequoia Group operates a number of businesses and brands including InterPrac, Morrisons Securities, Sequoia Direct, NTAA Corporate and Finance News Network.§  §The culture at Sequoia is one that values customers, business ethics, staff, collaboration and community.§  §The opportunity:§  §Finance News Network (FNN) is looking for an experienced and committed finance journalist to join the team based in the Sydney CBD. FNN is one of the largest providers of online finance video news in Australia. We interview CEOs, chief economists and other market experts; you will get the chance to see a news studio in action every day!§  §This is an opportunity to work as part of a small but, highly experienced team where appropriate journalism experience, skills and knowledge of financial markets is essential.§  §To be successful in this role, you will have a §minimum of 2 years’ experience in journalism and finance§ and §have a thorough knowledge and understanding of financial markets§.§  §The successful applicant will work with our finance journalists and studio operators in the newsroom, sourcing material and creating finance and business news content for our website.§  §You will be involved in:§ § §Writing and presenting up to date stock market reports and company news to the camera§ §Writing interview questions§ §Conducting on-camera interviews with C-level executives (such as CEOs, COOs etc) and finance experts§ §The ideal candidate will:§ § §Have a finance background §*essential§ §On-camera presenting/reporting experience *§essential§ §Excellent writing and grammar§ §Work well under pressure§ §Meet deadlines while providing the highest quality of work§ §Work well in a team and autonomously§ §Reliable, accountable and enjoy being in a fast-paced environment§ §Hours are flexible and can range from part-time to even full-time dependant on Finance News Network's requirements.§  §Benefits:§At Sequoia, we offer a competitive salary, flexible working arrangements, health and wellbeing programs, and so much more.§Please ensure you provide a cover letter and an example of on-camera work, telling us with you are the ideal candidate for the role. §  §NB: Shortlisted candidates will need to come in for an on-camera screen test §  §Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a journalist?§Do you have the ability to work from home when required?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Media Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641144.txt	§Media Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media Manager§§Advertiser: §White Bay Search§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Salary§§$80,000 - $110,000 + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§Media Manager§ §The Company:§This forward-thinking agency is continually looking over the horizon. They have made their name by discovering innovative media solutions that ultimately deliver campaigns and experiences that connect consumers and deliver results. Part of a wider group of agencies, the group is united by a desire to break free of media that talks at people. They create authentic, engaged spaces between brands and consumers, where its people, clients and communities are more enriched for the experience. They're a family-first, Australian owned, independent business. §The Role§The Media Manager is an integral role ensuring that the day to day operations of media planning and buying across the agency delivers innovative and effective media solutions across all ATL media channels, whilst ensuring absolute accuracy and efficiency in campaign management. This role is a hands-on role which requires rolling up the sleeves and managing everything on from the strategy, planning, buying, trafficking, reporting and invoicing. To succeed in this role, you will need to think holistically across all areas of the media and marketing.§ §   § §Stakeholder Management (30%)§ § §Collaborate closely with internal teams to aid in the development of strong media plans for campaigns that deliver on client objectives.§ §Establish and nurture strong relationships with key media partners§ §Report to key stakeholders on the performance of marketing campaigns§ §Update the internal team members on upcoming media updates, packages & offers§ §Initiate meetings with relevant media owners to establish strong relationships and have the most up to date information within their channel.§ §Contribute to team WIPs and support workflow and resource allocation within the team.§ §Manage up and identify opportunities with the ability to sell in your ideas over and above media recommendations.§ §Present, timely and accurate reporting on all campaigns, including commentary and learnings for future campaigns.§ §   § §Process & Innovation (50%)§ § §Liaise with internal and external stakeholders in order to execute marketing campaigns§ §Be responsible for the entire process from briefing; through to the development and execution of a plan.§ §Facilitate media & agency processes, ensuring smooth deployment & execution§ §Negotiate and book media advertising campaigns across TV, Radio, Outdoor and other mass market channels§ §Manage & Implement marketing campaigns across all key offline channels§ §Proactively look for new marketing opportunities for Frontier clients e.g, partnerships, distress media, new innovative channels or offerings.§ §Manage and optimise all media activity to deliver the best solutions for Frontier clients.§ §Track and ensure media budgets, across all clients, are managed effectively and efficiently, meeting all KPI’s§ §Set clear campaign goals and deliveries along with relevant partners§ §Upload booked media into system for billing/ invoicing and checking of invoices for accuracies§ §Update of media schedules and other relevant media related reports for client’s campaigns§ §Prepare detailed TV schedules for clients with TV campaign to ensure on-target performance (TARPs as well as R&F targets)§ §Compile and prepare all campaign/ advertising evidence (such as print tear-sheets, screen-caps, OOH photos, impression reports etc).§ §Provide concise, timely and accurate reporting on all campaigns, including commentary and learnings for future campaigns.§ §   § §Commercial Performance (20%)§ § §Ownership of the group/client media budgets, and its impact on forecasting P&L§ §Ensure booking delivery is in line with booked parameters and any discrepancies are resolved§ §Ensure that all media bookings are loaded efficiently and accurately to ensure minimal
