jobText: TXT/50676487.txt	§Media Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media Lead§§Advertiser: §Uniting NSW & ACT§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§125k base + Super + Salary packaging = 147k Pkg§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§ABOUT UNITING§§Our purpose:    §To inspire people, enliven communities, and confront injustice.§Our values:       §As an organisation we are §Imaginative, Respectful, Compassionate,§ and §Bold§.§At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities, and confront injustice.  Our focus is always on the people we serve, no matter where they are at in their life.§ This role leads Media and Social Media strategy and activities to promote Uniting, it’s service and advocacy objectives and to protect and enhance its reputation. The position works across Uniting as well as with the Church Media team, Affiliates and Partners to achieve media’s strategic objectives. §Key Accountabilities§§With the Head of Department, planning and developing the Media and Social Media strategy that elevates the Uniting brand and is consistent with Uniting’s advocacy strategy §Supervising and supporting team members to implement the Media and Social Media strategy with operating plans and measurable outcomes§Expertly guiding Media and Social Media opportunities §Providing expert advice and management of Media and Social Media during crises and issues, and proactively anticipating reputational risks  §With other Uniting teams as appropriate, developing and implementing a program of recurring public relations/thought leadership campaigns to support Uniting strategy and objectives   §Leading and developing feature articles, editorials, and other communications initiatives for external audiences that position Uniting as a thought leader on relevant advocacy issues  §Leading and creating Media content and collateral including news releases, fact sheets, briefing packs, talking points, photos, video news releases, radio news releases, video and audio content, and other content as required§Drafting speeches and presentations for Executive team §Provide specialist expertise in Media management to support internal clients  §Monitoring external trends and practices, and actively applying these insights to Uniting’s Media and Social Media activity §Provide guidance for Media support on marketing/brand campaigns§Lead formative and evaluative research methodology, including monitoring of Media coverage, including campaign reporting, and quarterly reporting and analysis §Providing expert and proactive program of Media training and coaching to senior internal stakeholders to ensure that Uniting is professionally represented in the Media by well-supported spokespeople §Leading development and evaluation of Media and News sections on Uniting website §Ensuring consistency and alignment with stakeholders within the Uniting Church in relation to Media campaigns and issues  §Being flexible with working hours, with out of hours work required  §§Qualifications:§Bachelor qualification in a relevant field or equivalent experience, including Media, Communications or Journalism   §Experience:§§This is a management role, typically requiring 6 or more years’ experience, including two or more years’ experience supervising a small team of specialists.  You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, be organised, systematic, thorough, accurate, and disciplined.§Proven ability to apply strategic level thinking, problem-solving, and decision making to the resolution of complex issues, and to steer Media stakeholders through this process §Proven track record in Media management, including in-house or agency experience§Proven experience managing complex communication campaigns§Experience using formative and evaluative research methodologies§Subject matter expert on crisis and issues management§Strong, established, and demonstrable Media network and relationships   §The ability to work effectively with photographers, filmmakers, and multimedia producers to develop compelling Media products for a range of platforms§First-class editing and sub-editing skills. Strong attention to detail  §Proven track record in proactively recognising and responding to advocacy opportunities  §Understanding of Social Media strategy and implementation§§ §Even better:§§A solid understanding of marketing (digital and traditional) will be a distinct advantage §Success in developing and implementing public communication and social justice issue campaigns  §Experience producing content for broadcast media, including video and radio news releases and content  §Social Media experience§§Benefits & Culture§Uniting is proud to be an EEO employer who supports an inclusive approach in the workplace. §§Base salary at 125k + Super + salary packaging  - Total package at 147K§Paid travel entitlement§Ongoing training & development§Career development opportunities§§For a confidential discussion regarding this fantastic role, please call Louise Massie at §0468 341 590§ or email §lmassie@uniting.org§ §PD - Media Lead 2020.pdf§§Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which may include a National Police Check and Reference Checks.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50610773.txt	§Production Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Production Manager§§Advertiser: §Artspace§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§Production Manager§ §Hours§Monday to Friday 10am to 6pm, additional hours may be required for events such as openings, previews and public programs§Terms of Employment§Permanent full-time, subject to a six-month probationary review§Salary §$60,000 per annum plus 9.5% superannuation§Penalty rates for Sundays and public holidays§ §ARTSPACE VISION§Ever changing, ever challenging, Artspace is a place where audiences meet the artists and the ideas of our times.§ §ABOUT ARTSPACE§Artspace is one of the leading institutions for the production and presentation of contemporary art in the Asia-Pacific. Artspace’s mission is to enhance our culture through a deeper engagement with contemporary art. Embracing risk, experimentation, criticality and collaboration, Artspace’s multi-platform program facilitates new commissions, exhibitions, performances, artist residencies, public programs, publishing and advocacy. Underpinned by a commitment to reflecting and advancing social and cultural diversity, Artspace catalyses new artistic visions and enables artists of all generations to test ideas and shape public conversations.§ §PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE ROLE§The Production Manager plays a key role in supporting Artspace’s vision through its artistic program, operations, and building management. Under the direction of the Artspace executive, the Production Manager is expected to work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team that includes all Artspace staff as well as external consultants, contractors and casual employees.§ §To support Artspace’s program, the Production Manager will coordinate and oversee the production, fabrication, construction and installation phases of exhibitions and associated activities and events. The Production Manager is responsible for planning, procuring and maintaining equipment according to project plans and budgets, as well as coordinating relevant consultants, contractors, and casual staff.§ §The Production Manager is also responsible for supporting Artspace’s operations and building management. They will coordinate and directly contribute to activities necessary to manage and maintain the Gunnery building, as well as its ongoing development as a successful and vibrant contemporary art space.§ §The Production Manager is expected to have high level production capabilities; a thorough understanding and appreciation of gallery practices; the ability to multitask and contribute to several projects simultaneously with competing deadlines; high level communication skills; strong project management skills; an understanding of industry standards such as Workplace Health and Safety (WH&S) guidelines in relation to building regulations and production environments; the ability to self-direct and work collaboratively; and flexibility with evolving priorities and opportunities.§ §KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES§ § §Work closely with the executive to provide achievable, accessible, creative and technical solutions across Artspace’s artistic program, operations and building.§ §Support the development and implementation of systems, procedures and management plans that facilitate Artspace’s artistic and strategic planning objectives.§ §Coordinate systems and practices so that AV technology use and maintenance, freight logistics, artwork registration and condition reporting are implemented professionally, consistently and in a timely manner.§ §Oversee contractors and casual employees to facilitate Artspace’s artistic program, operations and building maintenance.§ §Identify opportunities and implement improved working practices that reflect best practice in relation to Artspace’s strategic objectives.§ §Maintain building facilities, digital infrastructure, equipment and resources, service agreements and contribute to system initiatives and upgrades.§ §Actively contribute to supportive and collaborative relationships with team members, artists, contractors, peer institution staff and other key external stakeholders.§ §Ensure that Artspace procedures comply with all legal obligations for WH&S to safeguard the health and safety of employees and visitors.§ §ESSENTIAL CRITERIA§ § §A tertiary degree in a relevant field and/or equivalent experience in the cultural environment. § §Experience in planning, scheduling, resourcing and delivering projects, including exhibition design and installation as well as managing contractors and casual employees.§ §Experience in supporting business operations and building management.§ §Strong communication skills and an ability to build and maintain professional relationships with diverse stakeholders.§ §Demonstrated ability to think laterally to develop and implement creative solutions across different platforms to support the artistic program and operations.§ §Demonstrated ability to apply practices and principles of WH&S and Workplace Diversity, and operate in a collaborative work environment.§ §Artspace is committed to equity and inclusion and welcomes applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people of all abilities, and people from LGBTIQ+ communities.§ §Please email applications to §Michelle Newton§, Deputy Director, Artspace, §atjobs@artspace.org.au§ and include the following:§ §Current resume, including three referee contacts§1–2 (A4) pages total addressing each of the essential criteria§If you would like to discuss this position further or if you would like more information, please contact Michelle Newton on §(02) 9356 0555§ or §jobs@artspace.org.au§ §Applications close 11:59pm, Thursday 8 October 2020§. Please note that late applications will not be accepted.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50673312.txt	§Food Director, Commercial - Mass Food §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Food Director, Commercial - Mass Food §§Advertiser: §News Corp Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§§What’s the role? §Reporting the the Digital Director you will: §§Be the creative food lead for all recipe-led commercial content briefs across Australia’s #1 and #2 food media brands.§Work closely with the digital, print and video production teams to devise original recipe content with the power to inspire shoppers and drive action.§Using the very latest insights, brainstorm unique video concepts with viral potential, designed to stand out among the clutter of today’s social media feeds.§Manage the commercial recipe development process from concept ideation to reviewing final stills, copy and videos, as well as commissioning freelance contributors.§Ensure all content is visually immersive and adheres to our brand style guidelines. §Liaise closely with studio shoot teams, including stylists, photographers, chefs and producers, to troubleshoot any issues quickly and ensure each recipe is tested to the highest standards before publication.§Shoot stills and short, social-led videos at home using mobile phone and tablet cameras, when required.§6-month maternity leave contract.§Who are you? §§Highly experienced Food Director with a deep understanding and evangelistic passion for mass food. §A genuine passion for creating achievable yet delicious recipes that appeal to everyday Australian cooks.§Proven ability to drive integrated commercial content from ideation to publication (print, video and digital).§Budget management and commissioning experience.§Creative thinker with a strong visual eye for creating recipes that inspire readers to click - and cook!§Highly collaborative publishing professional with proven track record in recipe development and contributor management.§Experience in creating recipe content for video and an understanding of the video production process.§Ability to create content that delivers across any channel - from Facebook, Instagram and TikTok to magazines and cookbooks.§Experience working to specific creative briefs, including utilising supermarket ingredients in new and innovative ways.§Ability to work to daily deadlines and deliver quality recipe content in an extremely fast-paced environment.§Internal and external stakeholder management.§Experience working as hand talent for video shoots (face-to-camera experience also highly regarded).§What’s in it for you? §Lucrative salary§Collaborative environment§Opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward§Variety of work where no two days are the same§Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands§Build a huge portfolio of work across Australia’s top 2 food media brands§Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation§Who are we? §We are Australia’s number one and most influential media organisation with more than 150 prestige brands across news, sport and lifestyle. Each month more than 17 million Australians choose to consume news and information from our digital and print products – more than any other media group in Australia.§What’s next? §Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50583674.txt	§Content Marketer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Marketer§§Advertiser: §TALK Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gosford & Central Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§TALK is a digital agency headquartered in Wyong, NSW, with team members across Brazil, Portugal and Australia. We drive revenue growth for clients using full-stack digital marketing and profit improvement using digital tools and systems.§ §We service a range of clients and industries and are currently deep in the process of building out a robust strategy to take the business and team to new heights as we look towards late 2020 and into 2021. § §Our business operates across four teams; creative, marketing, technology and client services. We're currently seeking a new team member to join the client service team as a content marketer.§ §The day to day of the content marketer role includes;§ § §Developing ad campaigns across Facebook, Instagram, Google Ads and other channels - witty, sharp as a tack copy is a must § §Writing long-form blogs using SEO best practice principles to ensure content ranks and delivers traffic over time§ §Communicate with clients on project updates and reporting§ §Writing web copy for website and app projects, including headlines, body copy, product guides etc§ §The content marketer we are seeking could look like;§ § §Someone who loves writing and as a background in writing, with some experience in digital channels (Facebook, Google Ads, WordPress etc) and is looking to develop a career path into a client-facing role or senior content role over time§ §Someone who values a culture-driven environment. We think of ourselves as a high performing family, so you'll be focussed on those around you rather than yourself, but you'll perform to a high standard and expect the same from your teammates§ §Someone who is both passionate and humble. Humility is a powerful tool at TALK, particularly given our laser-sharp focus on quality client service§ §We're currently deep in a very data-driven test around working from our office, hybrid or from home and we'll know where we land with this later in the year, so the ability to work from home part of your working week would be advantageous but not essential. Our business is also building out into SaaS and new market opportunities, so there is a strong pipeline of opportunity for the right candidate. § §You'll be working with a great team, in a great location, on great projects, so touch base with us today for immediate interview. If you can send in an application that highlights your written comms skills, that would be great. §§§§

jobTitle: JOURNALIST Job in Bundaberg & Wide Bay Burnett - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50610835.txt	§JOURNALIST§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§JOURNALIST§§Advertiser: §Bundaberg Today§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bundaberg & Wide Bay Burnett§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§ §Permanent full-time  § §New independent news media business§ §Based in Bundaberg, the gateway to the Great Barrier Reef§ §A unique opportunity exists for an experienced journalist to join a new independent news media business serving the Bundaberg Region.§  §Bundaberg Today §is a printed weekly newspaper and digital content provider operated by experienced independent publishers and a local team of experienced media professionals.§  §A permanent full-time opportunity is now available for an experienced Journalist to join us based in Bundaberg, Queensland. As a critical member of the team, this role is responsible for providing quality local news content. §Bundaberg Today§ focuses exclusively on the local news and information that affects the lives of our community, and broader issues that directly impact our region.§  §Required Skills and Experience§ § §Previous experience as a journalist;§ §Have an affinity with regional issues;§ §Ability to write balanced, accurate reports to a high standard of spelling, grammar and style;§ §Have proven skills in writing for print, online and social media audiences and tight deadlines;§ §Be able to show initiative in generating story ideas while also working to the direction and in collaboration with the editorial team as required;§ §Show strong organisational skills;§ §You must be able to build and maintain strong contacts within the community. § §About Bundaberg§  §Picture this, you wake up to the soft sounds of the ocean with birds chirping in the background and the warm coastal breeze on your face. You make a fresh cup of coffee and wander out to the balcony where the sun glistens on the water while your significant other finishes a chapter of their book. You think to yourself, is this what dreams are made of? We’re here to tell you yes and it’s only four hours’ drive north of Brisbane. Welcome to Bundaberg, the gateway to the Southern Great Barrier Reef.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50690866.txt	§Campaign Production Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Campaign Production Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Global Media Solutions Group Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§CAMPAIGN PRODUCTION CO-ORDINATOR§ §Work in Australia’s leading and most sophisticated Chinese and multicultural marketing agency § §Help establish a first-class creative and production service for leading brands and government§ §Become a media expert with on-job training and support working across leading Chinese and western digital media§ §Global Media Solutions Group is an innovative leader in media planning and advertising to international and multicultural Australian markets, launching campaigns on behalf of an enviable list of global and national advertisers.  While we run campaigns across the globe, § §we are renowned as Chinese marketing experts enjoying§ §unique media relationships with China’s biggest media including global preferred supplier status for Tencent and WeChat. § §A natural progression of our company’s growth has been the launch of an exciting new service that has seen the development of a dedicated production department with diverse responsibility to support the many campaigns we run. Now we are searching for a young professional to join our team and co-ordinate this service. § §We already provide translation and production services for campaigns, but an additional dedicated person to manage and promote our in-house and preferred supplier facilities to clients, will allow us to raise our production profile significantly. § §The Position Description describes key responsibilities that include: § § §Translation Coordination§ – servicing our contractors for various languages and assisting in inhouse mandarin and Cantonese translation services.§ § §Typesetting Postproduction§ – typesetting translated txt, video and voice into formats such as, but not limited to, §Static (Banners, posters, display, etc), HTML5 and social media assets, Video subtitle, etc. Creative adaption§ §Design/Creative Adaption Services§ –  §Design for asset creation, Production of original assets, Content for longform article, etc.  § §To be successful in this application§ you will demonstrate experience in post-production, design and the relevant software.  Ideally you have 1-5 years’ experience in these disciplines. You will also be familiar with Chinese digital and social media as you will be managing the production of many formats across platforms such as WeChat, Weibo, LRB, and many others. Familiarity with western media will also be advantageous.  It is not necessary to have vast experience in any of these media platforms as you will have a lot of support from the broader team, although it will be important to have experience in design and post-production including video.  § §You will also assist in the project management of the work we brief to our preferred suppliers and thus a second language will be highly regarded especially Mandarin. § §Importantly, you will have a genuine interest in advertising and the global media landscape and the consumer trends affecting it, but most of all, you will have enormous enthusiasm for learning and working in a team-oriented environment. § §Responsibility will grow in this position as all aspects of production and translation services develop but in the first instance you will report to the Campaign Director.   § §In order to understand our company’s unique service and philosophy you will also have the chance to help plan and execute campaigns for clients such as the leading cosmetic, retail and education organisations in Australia along with a growing level of government strategy and execution. In fact, the best things about joining our company are the amazing clients we assist in an environment that is multicultural and supportive. § §This is a full-time role, however a part-time position may be considered for certain candidates. (Beyond COVID you will conduct this from our office in the business precinct of St Kilda Road, Melbourne, Victoria.)§ §We are a small company with big clients and we really know media.  § §If you've read this far, you probably should take one more simple step...forward your CV to GMS, immediately. § §_______________________________________________§ §Key attributes and skills: § § §Intermediate to Advanced skills in Microsoft Office suite, Adobe Creative Cloud § §Video editing skills will be an advantage § §Service-orientated, proactive and highly-organised § §Excellent verbal & written communication skills § §Some media and advertising knowledge is preferred but not essential § §Able to work in a deadline driven environment § §A Bachelor degree in any discipline will be considered highly.§ §Ability to work in Australia  § § § §Please send CV, Cover Letter and Digital Folio to: § §Jane Omond (Group Business Manager) § §admin@mediasolutions.global§ §APPLICATION CLOSE 19/10/2020 5pm§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Have you completed a qualification in marketing?§§§

With more than 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across more than 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.§The ABC's a great place to work; we provide various opportunities for Indigenous staff, including attending the national Indigenous staff conference, activities during NAIDOC week, regular networking events and mentoring support.§ §You'll have a friendly and supportive environment to learn and grow in, with a vibrant, dynamic and cohesive team and a manager who will help you with any questions and give you regular opportunities to talk about your progress. You'll also have access to a network of Indigenous staff and support from the ABC's Lead, Indigenous Employment and Diversity.§About the Role§Working alongside the Rockhampton team, you will be responsible for creating news content for multiple platforms, engaging the diverse local and national audiences.You'll produce and present news bulletins, Q&A's interviews and packages, including breaking stories.§About You§You're an experienced journalist with a strong focus on digital and multiplatform storytelling and in particular the issues that affect the interest of the diverse local audience.  You will have initiative, drive and be a strong team player.§This is a great opportunity to utilise your skills, knowledge and experience in journalism, to deliver high quality content.§For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:   §50059444 REPORTER ROCKHAMPTON.pdf§§For further information on this position please contact Chrissy Arthur, Chief of Staff on §(07) 4924 5110§§We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position§For more information on working at the ABC visit §https://www.abc.net.au/careers/indigenous/§§For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to §ABC LinkedIn§ and §Life Page§§Applications Close: 11:55 pm, Sunday 11 October§§Please complete the online application form and submit as part of your application a Cover Letter and Resume. §(Please note, there is no requirement to address the Selection Criteria as part of your application.)  §§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Head of Brand Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50644685.txt	§Head of Brand§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Brand§§Advertiser: §Verizon Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§A Bit About Us§The RYOT team is a driven, passionate and hard-working group who consistently succeed and deliver the best. They are focused on building the next generation telling stories that move the world. RYOT's goal is to work with leading brands and agencies to make sure a brand’s story isn’t just well-told; it’s also well-heard. RYOT has already partnered with household names including Kia, Nestle and Mazda, to name a few.§The Role§The Head of Brand position was created to champion creative solutions for our Verizon Media brands such as HuffPost, Yahoo Finance, Yahoo Lifestyle, etc. devising compelling opportunities for our brand partners and driving revenue through the commercial team.§In market, this role is crucial to evangelise and develop the RYOT Studios’ proposition in Australia as a credible branded content and ad-tech partner through creative ideation and thought leadership. Partnering with the National Sales Director to locally leverage the global successes and key learnings to build momentum and growth for branded content revenue.§Your Day§ § §Position RYOT as a brand that offers thought leadership, innovation, engaging branded content and access to Verizon Media brands§ §Offer brand partners a bespoke and curated experience with RYOT and Verizon media though custom solutions and insights§ §Drive branded content campaign excellence and innovation§ §Partnering with the head of sales to help educate commercial teams to ensure best-in-class processes across campaign ideation and delivery§ §Support National and State Sales Directors in formulation and creation of agency group deals§ §Contribute to leadership meetings, strategic off sites and provide insights into pipeline of opportunity and partnership management§ §Build new and leverage existing relationships with key contacts in agency in partnership and content departments§ §Constantly identify and drive proactive opportunities for business growth with key clients§ §Lead, inspire and develop a team of experienced specialists§ §Define market needs, customer requirements, develop measurement metrics and the GTM strategy and priorities§ § §You'll Need § § §Proven experience in either a digital creative solutions or branded content partnerships leadership position§ §Highly developed communication, leadership & analytical skills coupled with a broad understanding of the media industry with relevant industry contacts § §Developed strategic thinking and a thirst to create brilliant, award winning work§ §Clear ability to lead and develop high performing teams across multi disciplined individuals in creative ideation through to implementation§ §Demonstrable sales & negotiation skills§ §Presentation & communication skills§ §Passionate, innovative spirit, and a desire to work in a flexible and fast-paced environment§.§ § § §Why Verizon Media / RYOT§People enjoy working for Verizon because every individual is empowered to push boundaries and challenge the norm. By combining world-class technologies and premium content, we create kickass experiences that shape the digital world.  Together we deliver - for each other, our clients, our users and as individuals and as one, we enrich people's daily lives. Our globally known brands include Yahoo, TechCrunch, HuffPost, RYOT plus more. §   §Collaboration is reflected in our culture. We work together and play together…community days, ping-pong tournaments, boat parties, trivia nights, whole company lunches, sports teams and more!§  §If this sounds like you, please apply now and one of our recruiters will contact you if your application is successful.§________________________________________________§§§§

jobTitle: Account Executive Job in South West Coast VIC - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50628754.txt	§Account Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Executive§§Advertiser: §Envisage HR Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§$55,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§ABOUT US§ §www.ivystreet.com.au§ §Ivy Street is a Geelong based, Creative and Digital Agency focusing on Innovation – Approach – Brand – Design – Print and Digital. We are a fully integrated agency with a creative team of people that inspire, create and succeed!  Ivy Street’s vision is ​to become a national leader in Creative and Digital.§ §We will do this by living our values of:§ § §Open Communication § §Teamwork § §Creativity and Innovation § §Respect § §Honesty and Integrity § §We are currently looking for a person who is passionate about what they do and can bring their expertise to our team, someone who wants to work within a dynamic, busy and evolving business. Ivy Street is a collaborative, supportive environment of professionals. Here you will be able to continue to grow through structured mentoring and development opportunities.§ § § §THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING§ §The Account Executive provides support to the Account Management team. In this role you will also be managing your own portfolio of clients directly. For the right person, further responsibility and complexity is expected to develop quickly within the AM side of your role.§ §This pivotal role essentially provides:§ § §timely and effective administration support for both internal and external clients, and§ §proactive management of a client portfolio.§ §To be successful at this role, you will be aware of all aspects of the current, upcoming, and newly closed projects the Account team are handling – and that you are handling directly.§ §THIS IS WHAT YOU HAVE ACHIEVED ALREADY§ § §Relevant tertiary qualifications in marketing, communications or related discipline§ §1-2 years full time workplace experience preferably within a Creative Agency environment or within the Real Estate / Property industry§ §Demonstrate an array of customer service skills and problem-solving techniques§ §Process and efficiency focused admin experience§ §Solid social media & digital knowledge§ §Proven ability to navigate, nurture and collaborate with multiple stakeholders§ § § §THIS IS WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR§ § §Someone who is highly organised, one step ahead with your finger on the pulse of the team’s pressure points§ §Adaptability, determination, and a strong eye for detail§ §Proven customer service experience in a fast-paced creative environment§ §Strong organisational skills, planning is a must§ §The ability to manage competing priorities and deliver under pressure§ §Reliable, punctual and work focused§ §Attention to detail is essential§ §A passion for what you do!§ § § §BONUS§ § §Experience with iMacs and the Google Platform: Google Docs, Google Drive, Gmail an advantage§ §Face to face direct sales-based experience§ § § §HOW TO APPLY§ §Join this sought-after industry leader and enjoy an energetic and supportive team environment. § §Don’t miss out on this amazing opportunity!§ §Ivy Street is a dynamic and contemporary business that offers a very supportive environment. If you are looking to join a positive culture who truly support their people, then apply now.§ §Take a look at our website for more information ivystreet.com.au§ §If you would like a copy of the position description or a confidential discussion about this exciting role please email §jacqui@envisagehrsolutions.com.au§.§ §We look forward to hearing from you!§ §...§ §Please note:§ § §We respectfully ask you to not contact Ivy Street directly so we can attend to our daily workload§ §Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted throughout the recruitment campaign§.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an account executive?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Videographer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50602613.txt	§Videographer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Videographer§§Advertiser: §Spotlight Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Salary + Super + Profit Share§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§Reporting to the Marketing Content Manager, you will be an experienced video-led creative who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You are a story-teller who can influence stakeholders and engage our audiences. There is no denying that this role is hands-on. You will be responsible for filming, editing and delivering outstanding video content suitable for all our digital channels across our 3 high-profiled and varied retail brands.   §Working collaboratively with an enthusiastic digital team, you will be managing multiple projects simultaneously and working across multiple brands. You will have proven stakeholder experience and be the first point of contact for the extended Marketing team. Therefore, strong verbal and written communication skills are a must.§We are a business that thrives on the constant challenges of the retail environment – therefore an excitable, energetic, enthusiastic and spirited character is needed.§In return, we’ll give you the chance to build your skills and advance your career in a supportive and collaborative environment, with a team who like to have fun and get great work done.§YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:§§End-to-end development & production of video content based on agreed strategy across all digital platforms§Consideration of target audiences & amplification strategies to achieve maximum audience awareness and engagement for every campaign and promotion§Play a pivotal role in deepening our brand stories for better customer engagement through our content strategy§Stakeholder Management – the ability to guide, influence and manage the creative process§Storyboard development, shooting video and editing creative assets for multi-content channel delivery§Manage time & produce quality work across multiple projects and (at times) to tight deadlines§§ §DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:§§3+ years proven experience in digital content production – with proven end-to-end video production eg. creative concepting, planning, shooting, editing, lighting, sound & post-production§Proven proficiency with Adobe CC & Editing Suite software eg. Adobe Illustrator, Premier Pro & After Effects§Storyboard development for stakeholder approvals is desirable for when required§Proven ability to manage multiple projects – prioritising time and work effectively§Sharp eye for detail with good creative sensibility§Enthusiasm and drive to create great work§§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Advertising Consultant Job in Shepparton & Goulburn Valley - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50600996.txt	§Advertising Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advertising Consultant§§Advertiser: §McPherson Media Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Shepparton & Goulburn Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      § Advertising Consultant §      §        §          §LOCAL OPPORTUNITY AT THE LOCAL PAPER§          §PART OF A FAMILY-OWNED MEDIA COMPANY§          §BASE SALARY + MONTHLY & QUARTERLY COMMISSIONS§          §PART-TIME OR FULL-TIME ROLE §        §        §The Cobram Courier, which has successfully navigated COVID-19, is looking to grow again and we need a self-starter, a sales machine, to help us on our next, incredible journey. We're looking for someone who knows the town, including Barooga, and knows its people, particularly local businesses. You don't have to be a fancy talker, just a good communicator, because this job is about establishing and growing lasting, and profitable, relationships. You'll get the training you need and all the tools you require to make the most of this opportunity and you'll be part of a small Cobram team, which is part of a much larger family-owned business, which publishes 13 mastheads each week across regional Victoria. Selling experience is a natural advantage for any candidate, but if you've never sold before and you think you have the energy and a desire to succeed, we want to talk to you as well.§        §ABOUT THE ROLE§        §This role is responsible for building long-term commercial relationships with the Cobram/Barooga businesses community, including pitching, and closing, advertising campaigns across print and digital products, including social media. Key features of the position include:§        §          §Achievable KPIs and generous commissions§          §An exciting and broad range of media products§          §Existing portfolio of clients, which is all yours from day one, with new ones to come, from you§          §Proudly deliver a local paper, with a rich history, to a devoted local community§        §        §OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU§        §McPherson Media Group is a growing, family-owned business, with strong cultural values, which takes great pride in its responsibility of producing local news and advertising to regional markets. Our organisation promotes a workplace built on trust and respect, while understanding the importance of a healthy life-work balance. We are happy to consider flexible hours and alternative work arrangements, as well as working out of one of our other regional offices. We are committed to training you, looking after you, and providing you with the opportunity to grow professionally, including internal promotion.§        §APPLY NOW§        §If you like the sound of all this and want to join our team, please send us your CV and a compelling letter telling us why you want to work at the Courier. If you have any questions, please call the advertising manager, Paul Mole, on §0456 196 024§, any time including after hours, he will take the call.§        §Applications close October 21, 2020.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ §LOCAL OPPORTUNITY AT THE LOCAL PAPER§ §PART OF A FAMILY-OWNED MEDIA COMPANY§ §BASE SALARY + MONTHLY & QUARTERLY COMMISSIONS§ §PART-TIME OR FULL-TIME ROLE §The Cobram Courier, which has successfully navigated COVID-19, is looking to grow again and we need a self-starter, a sales machine, to help us on our next, incredible journey. We're looking for someone who knows the town, including Barooga, and knows its people, particularly local businesses. You don't have to be a fancy talker, just a good communicator, because this job is about establishing and growing lasting, and profitable, relationships. You'll get the training you need and all the tools you require to make the most of this opportunity and you'll be part of a small Cobram team, which is part of a much larger family-owned business, which publishes 13 mastheads each week across regional Victoria. Selling experience is a natural advantage for any candidate, but if you've never sold before and you think you have the energy and a desire to succeed, we want to talk to you as well.§ABOUT THE ROLE§This role is responsible for building long-term commercial relationships with the Cobram/Barooga businesses community, including pitching, and closing, advertising campaigns across print and digital products, including social media. Key features of the position include:§ §Achievable KPIs and generous commissions§ §An exciting and broad range of media products§ §Existing portfolio of clients, which is all yours from day one, with new ones to come, from you§ §Proudly deliver a local paper, with a rich history, to a devoted local community§OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU§McPherson Media Group is a growing, family-owned business, with strong cultural values, which takes great pride in its responsibility of producing local news and advertising to regional markets. Our organisation promotes a workplace built on trust and respect, while understanding the importance of a healthy life-work balance. We are happy to consider flexible hours and alternative work arrangements, as well as working out of one of our other regional offices. We are committed to training you, looking after you, and providing you with the opportunity to grow professionally, including internal promotion.§APPLY NOW§If you like the sound of all this and want to join our team, please send us your CV and a compelling letter telling us why you want to work at the Courier. jobTitle: AV Producer and video editor Job in Sydney - SEEK

Your experience and capabilities will include;  §• Degree in Media Arts and Production, Digital Media, Screen and Sound Production, Broadcasting or a similar degree / relevant experience§• Minimum of 2 years producing audio and visual content to a professional standard for websites and social media i.e. show reels, promos, event/brand videos, corporate content§• Can originate and story board show reels and produce shot lists §• Expert-level at operating Livestream Studio and editing using Adobe suite – Premiere, After Effects§• Able to safely prepare, operate, maintain and troubleshoot our in-house studio (equipment and products) and shoot content for editing§• Professional effective communicator  §About us: Across an integrated business supported by digital, events, broadcast, research, print and social platforms, we are guided by the purpose: Be better informed This passion for informing, educating and inspiring drives us to build more engaged communities, delivering greater leadership to the markets we connect to and forging closer relationships with our audiences. Being at the forefront of media innovation, backed by a pioneering spirit, has been central to Momentum Media’s growth. §We’re an evolving, forward-thinking business based on a purpose that supports corporate Australia and the markets critical to our nation’s economic prosperity and security. §We’re also focused on delivering exceptional value to our commercial partners. We adapt on a daily basis to rapidly changing market places; jobTitle: Account Manager Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50683903.txt	§Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Type and Pixel§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§The role§We're seeking a talented Account Manager with 5 years+ experience and a passion for brand and design. As the agency lead for one of our most important creative accounts, you'll be adept at maintaining and developing strong client relationships and balancing client advocacy with internal collaboration. An excellent communicator with a knack for writing killer creative briefs, you’ll need to possess seriously good organisational skills and get a kick out of solving problems (after all, that’s why clients come to us).§We're big believers in flexible working and so we're happy to consider a part-time role if the candidate is the right fit. This is an opportunity to be part of the growth of our fledgling agency and work closely with a team of passionate senior creatives and strategists on award-winning campaigns across the consumer and b2b sectors.§Salary negotiable commensurate with experience.§ §The agency§Type + Pixel is a small-but-perfectly-formed creative studio specialising in brand and digital. It was founded in 2016 by two former big agency heads who wanted to create a different kind of agency: one staffed almost exclusively by experienced creatives and strategists who who share our belief that amazing work starts, not with a project brief, but with a deep understanding of our clients’ brands. §We design brands and experiences that put the audience first. We promote honest, collaborative relationships with our clients. And we're committed to doing things differently: we produce great work without the agency sweatshop mentality.§ §Our philosophy§We believe creativity is a quality, not a title (in other words, leave your ego at the door). We embrace ambiguity with open arms. We sweat the details - because great work doesn't just happen, you have to make it great. If that sounds like a philosophy you can get on board with, we'd love to hear from you.§Job tasks and responsibilities§Reporting to the agency directors, here's what you'll be involved in day to day:§Client service and account management, specifically leading the account of our flagship client Baskin-Robbins§Working on creative and branding projects across a client list that spans retail, FMCG, property, NFP, healthcare and tech - from initial quoting and briefing stages through to design handover and invoicing .§Driving best practice and improving our account management processes§Accurate financial and timeline management to ensure projects run on time, on budget and to scope§Strategic direction for both our clients and the agency§Exposure and contribution to brand strategy development§Supporting the directors on business development§Clear communication with client and internal agency team§Client retention and relationship management§Motivating and generating enthusiasm within the team.§Skills and experience§Understanding of strategic disciplines, primarily brand, design and marketing but also digital and UX design§Experience managing a range of creative projects including print and digital§At least 5 years' account service experience in an agency environment§Ability to work across multiple projects, think on your feet and prioritise workload§Great organisational and time management skills - and the ability to effectively plan and manage your team’s time§Articulate and confident presenter with excellent relationship building and communication skills§Proactive self-motivator with a keen interest in design and strategy§A team player with a collaborative approach and positive attitude§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§§§

jobText: TXT/50610746.txt	§Digital Copywriter§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Copywriter§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$80,000 - $100,000 + Super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§ §Work for successful Fintech business w./ solid Career Progression +  Job Security§ §Enjoy working in a busy, deadline-driven, creative environment§ §You are the key copy and content brand guardian and will create a seamless, positive user experience§ §Bring your agency/in-house experience as a copywriter, and broader agency/ corporate experience in a content role§ §About Reach Markets§ §We are a fast-growing self-funded Fintech business that has experienced significant profit led growth. Seeking to significantly expand our operations. We specialise in providing finance to Private Equity, Venture capital partners as well as building solutions for managing communications with the investment community. We are a business that seeks to disrupt the old financial services model and help Australian business access the capital and manage their relationship with their investors so they can grow. We are passionate about helping sophisticated and professional investors get access to opportunities and information they need to complete their due diligence.§ §Job Overview§:§ §We are on the lookout for a Digital Copywriter with experience writing for the complete user journey, from persuasive marketing copy to helpful support content, intuitive micro-copy and everything in between.§ §Reporting to the Operations Manager, this role is pivotal to the success of Reach’s marketing and sales strategy and connecting with a large captured audience. You’ll work within the marketing department, as well as across cross-functional teams with UX and analytics experts, product managers and marketing and communications specialists.§ §You’ll be responsible for developing useful, usable and engaging content to communicate to our clients and investors within the finance industry. You’ll work across the business to act as the key copy and content brand guardian and create a seamless, positive user experience.§ §You’ll write with SEO considerations and work with performance marketing specialists to attract new investors to our website. You’ll work with the Marketing Teams to ensure we’re engaging our many audiences and you’ll work with our analytics experts to ensure everything we do is informed by data, measured and optimised.§ §You’ll be hands on, working directly in systems like our Hubspot CMS to update our live communications. Your ownership is end-to-end: from ideation to copywriting, webpage creation, testing and optimization and you will be heavily involved and campaign tactics and strategies.§ §As a vital member of the team, you’ll actively contribute to the practice and capability growth, sharing your knowledge and learning from others.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Copywriting and content planning for digital assets, websites, social media channels, blogs and eDM’s.§ §Effectively manage client relationships in conjunction with other departments, respond to briefs to deliver outstanding content pieces that hit the brief§ §Manage all day-to-day content project activities including timelines, briefings, websites, social media channels/communities and final product.§ §Identify and coordinate relevant internal & external resources to successfully deliver on content requirements.§ §Required skills and experience§ § §3 years+ agency or in-house experience as a copywriter, plus at least an additional 2 years broader agency or corporate experience in a content or journalism role.§ §Demonstrated experience researching and collating content that can be used to support campaigns and understanding how that utilize that content to hit the brief§ §Experience delivering & coordinating integrated content campaigns§ §Skill and experience managing client relationships and internal stakeholders§ §Strong verbal and written communicator, excellent collaborator, must exhibit problem resolution abilities and good judgment.§ §Copywriting and content planning for digital assets, social media channels, blogs and eDM’s.§ §Excellent writing skills for a variety of digital formats (and some print where needed). A portfolio will be required.§ §Experience implementing content strategy, and of advocating its importance.§ §Experience writing for Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) to capitalise on organic traffic.§ §Understanding of the role content plays in UX/UI and how to maximise the effectiveness of that content.§ §Experience working with a Content Management System (CMS).§ §Desired skills and experience§ § §Creative/agency experience preferred however not essential.§ §We would hold in high regard candidates with experience within the finance industry or working with clients involved in the finance industry§ §Ability to write analytically and creatively is essential§ §Benefits & Culture§ § §Great Salary commensurate on experience ($80,000-$100,000 plus super)§ §Culture of inclusive, passionate, hardworking and high-performing Team§ §Reasonable work hours to achieve work/life balance§ §Strong career progression planning - career development and immediate education opportunities§ §Central CBD location; close to all public transport§ §The successful candidate must have a passion for creativity, innovation and technology and enjoy working in a busy, deadline-driven, creative environment. They must be able to multi-task, work well under pressure and understand the importance of effective time management and meeting deadlines.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of copy writing experience do you have within an agency environment?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50650649.txt	§Campaign Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Campaign Executive§§Advertiser: §Infopeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§As a Campaign Coordinator working on a National Commercial Property account, you'll be required to build relationships with key client contacts and be seen as their trusted day to day partner. §   § Reporting into an Account Director, you’ll collaborate with your peers to manage a high volume of property marketing campaigns; organising briefs and adhering to corporate branding guidelines; engaging and liaising with suppliers; maintaining deadlines and dispatch via an online marketing platform, plus completing general administrative duties.§   § §On any given day you might:§ § §Manage day to day campaign activity from initial client briefing through to artworking and dispatch.§ §Communicate with contacts through a ticket triaging system for the prioritization of requests.§ §Manage the activation of campaigns on approval of quotes and receipt of payment.§ §Communicate with key suppliers and media reps, to manage rate negotiations, special deals and artwork dispatch / deadline management.§ §Assist senior team members with the development of proposals and delivery of large scale campaigns.§ §Collaborate with the Performance Analyst team to leverage their expertise and insights to determine future spend, opportunities and success§ §§§§

jobTitle: Editor Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50596253.txt	§Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Editor§§Advertiser: §Mi-3 Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§Mi3 has a leadership position across the marketing, media, agency and tech sectors.§  §It is a series of weekly briefings/editions that bring into sharp focus the key issues that matter to the marketing industry and its diverse supply chain of advisors, media and tech providers. The editorial agenda aims for constructive, considered and challenging conversation in an environment that is “brand-safe” for professionals.§  §It is less about the daily news cycle of industry announcements, people moves and product launches and more about strategy, thought leadership, analysis and market implications.§  §Mi3 was born out of hundreds of conversations with industry leaders looking for a different perspective on the Australian and international industry evolution.§  §As such it’s a briefing that helps industry leaders and emerging leaders join the dots between the relentless pace of global and local news and cross-industry developments. It endeavours to break down the important trends and developments that industry leaders and emerging leaders need to be across. §It challenges but contributes constructively and intelligently§.§  §Mi3 is a subsidiary of the Media i Group, which is part of Australian Media Channel & Executive Channel Holdings Pty Ltd, the most consumed trade media platform for media agencies. Media i constantly seeks to improve communication within the media industry via three core pillars - Our §digital screen network§ connects media professionals in over 75 media agency locations nationally; Our §survey program§ is the largest mood and sentiment tracking study in the country for media agencies and owners and our §awards program§ is the only initiative dedicated to championing media owner professionals and the role they play in helping agencies deliver stand-out results for their clients.§  § §  §The Opportunity§:§  §Working with the Executive Editor (EE) in the newest, and already one of the most credible trade publishing brands in the Australian marketing, media and technology sectors, Mi3’s Editor role is a rare opportunity for an experienced professional to help advance a new approach to industry publishing via a blend of journalism and sector analysis.§  § §  §We stress, it’s an unusual blend..§  § §  §The role is broad and deep, loaded with opportunity for an energetic, well-credentialed journalist-editor who can grasp the diverse and rapidly developing shifts in marketing, media, agencies and tech.§  § §  §The editorial model is in perpetual experimentation and development.§  § §  §Much more is to come. It’s exciting but certainly not for the faint-hearted. Fast, creative, flexible, lateral, strategic and unconventional. It requires an unconventional work ethic and encourages imagination.§  § §  §Aims of the Job§:§  §The Editor role requires creative, lateral thinking about what an industry journal could and should be for the future, while shaping and managing weekly editorial content line-ups, the editorial team and numerous industry contributors. Importantly, the Editor has direct responsibility to maintain and lift high standards of quality control in content and its delivery across the publishing platform.§  § §  §Mi3’s Editor also requires strong capabilities in managing the editorial agenda with simultaneous input for commercial partners§  § §  §This is a serious and stimulating role for someone to join a team with proven credentials to change and innovate industry publishing and editorial models, just as unprecedented structural pressures hit the economics of the industry.§  § §  §The Editor’s task is to help lead and advance the editorial strategy for Mi3 and contribute and shape how the industries it covers respond to the fast-moving structural shifts they too face. We are looking for a hungry, energetic, very well credentialed Editor who can manage all aspects of publishing and editorial management and industry engagement.§  § §  §Key Responsibilities and Role§:§  §Working directly with EE, the successful applicant needs to be highly capable of working independently, flexibly and bring a positive and proactive attitude to the editorial agenda and be constantly experimenting to improve the output. The ability to maintain a fast pace and juggle multiple editorial and commercial partner agendas is critical to:§ § §Oversee, with EE, the daily, weekly publishing process and editorially contribute to Mi3§ §Develop faster, efficient and effective editorial systems for the editorial team and output for now and future developments and initiatives   § §Help set and execute short-to-mid-term editorial strategy and execution§ § §  §Editorial Responsibilities:§ § §Lead, deepen, broaden Mi3’s in-market presence across the marketing, media, tech and agency sectors§ §Work with the EE to develop strategies that shape and further the Mi3 editorial agenda which include § §Entrench Mi3’s fast rise to a leadership position in the marketing, media, tech and agency sectors § §Develop Mi3’s reputation with marketers e§ §Develop Mi3’s reputation across the tech community§ §Develop the editorial product by: § §creating new and progressive editorial formats and industry alliances that contribute and advance industry debate§ § § § § §Work with EE to develop and manage the weekly Mi3 editorial schedule and planning, specifically: § §Document, manage and execute weekly editorial plans§ §Contribute to, schedule, and manage content pieces across all content verticals§ § § §Build Mi3’s profile via 1:1 engagement with leaders across key sectors and have a pro-active presence and participate at media briefings, industry events and conferences.§ §Manage quality control in publishing – deadlines, style, tone, sub-editing for all content§ §Manage and co-ordinate editorial team and contributors     § §Co-lead input to commercial content development§ §Contribute editorially via all content covering features and analysis, podcasts and physical and virtual event moderation with industry leaders across the key sectors Mi3 covers§ § §  §Responsibilities:§ § §Oversee all publishing functions for the weekly edition in the Drupal CMS§ §Oversee and develop industry contributors in managing and curating availability/schedules§ §Manage team in creating, testing and executing EDM weekly distribution§ §Oversee, monitor, create and craft content distribution on social media channels – and website commentary.§ §Manage and report audience analytics to help shape future editorial agenda.§ § §  §Essential Skills / Experience§ § §Ten §years minimum experience in B2B editorial environments§ §Reporting experience across all areas in the marketing, media, agency and technology and telco sectors§ §Very strong work ethic and time management§ §Superior attention to detail§ §Ability to communicate, develop and maintain relationships with marketers, agencies, technology companies and media owners.§ §Ability to co-ordinate and execute commercial partner programs and meet key deadlines.§ §Sound knowledge of image, graphics and design software in Photoshop and other key programs§ §Strong understanding of Drupal CMS§ §Manage email and digital newsletter delivery§ §Have existing, and continue to build, relationships with senior industry contacts across key sectors§ § §  §Requirements§:§ § §BA/BS degree preferred§ §10 years+ experience as a journalist with five years in media, marketing, and technology journalism§ §Experience in digital publishing start-ups§ §Experience in running an editorial team§ §Exceptional understanding of the marketing, media and agency sectors and ability and preparedness to deepen skills and networks in technology§ §Proven experience in managing teams§ §Demonstrable ability to grow and engage digital audiences§ §Intelligent, balanced communication and interpersonal skills§ §Strong familiarity with digital media and developments§ §Excellent organisational and leadership skills§ §Flexible and strong work ethic – a can-do attitude critical§ §Proven ability to balance multiple priorities with strong attention to detail§ § §  §Structure§ § §Reports to the Executive Editor§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a publishing role?§Have you worked in a role where your duties included proof reading and sub-editing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50704779.txt	§Piano Teacher / Accompanist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Piano Teacher / Accompanist§§Advertiser: §Westbourne Grammar School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Performing Arts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Piano Teacher / Accompanist §      §      §      §        §          §Exciting opportunity to help shape the young musicians of the future§          §Convenient Western Suburbs location§          §Part time (2 days per week) commencing January 2021§        §        §Are you committed to creating a challenging and engaging learning environment in which students can grow and flourish?§        §If the answer is yes, then working at Westbourne Grammar, a leading independent co-educational school, is the right career move for you. jobText: TXT/50628345.txt	§Graphic Designer/Web Designer/Creative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer/Web Designer/Creative§§Advertiser: §Anomaly§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§$60,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§WHO WE ARE§  §Anomaly is an Adelaide-based, full-service creative agency that works across video production, digital marketing, graphic design and traditional media. We are a small but highly experienced team who bring our best game to the table every day. Our creative thinking is fuelled by doing things differently and by going above and beyond client expectations. §  §Our unique working environment inspires great ideas and encourages personal benchmarks to be broken. We have a fun, friendly and professional culture and love nothing more than when great minds can collaborate to deliver outstanding results. We need someone awesome to join us.§  § §  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  §This is a multi-disciplinary role. We are looking for a Graphic Designer with at least two years experience completing paid client work with a broad knowledge of a range of platforms, as well as a good history of designing websites. We are also looking for someone who can come up with great creative ideas for our clients and participate with the team to find the best solution using all of the tools at the agency’s disposal.§  § §  §In the Graphic Design/Web Design part of the role, you will be responsible for:§ § §Creating Proposals, Client Facing Documents, Internal Documents using Keynotes / Pages in collaboration with the Creative Director§ §Pitching and presenting work in collaboration with the Creative Director§ §Attending client meetings where required§ §Being able to use Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Adobe XD in your sleep§ §Understanding the client brief and being able to create designs that suit the brief aesthetically§ §Designing logos to a high standard and being able to export them in all relevant file sizes and formats needed (png, eps, ai, jpeg etc)§ §Creating detailed Brand Guidelines including overall look and feel, font selection, colour palette selection, imagery selection, creating logo rules and dos and don’ts§ §Able to design and create high quality printed collateral including but not limited to: brochures, letterheads, business cards, leaflets, posters, signage and then be able to work on them so they are ‘print ready’§ §Understanding of how to set up design work in the correct colour settings for appropriate formats (CMYK, RGB or Pantone etc)§ §Following and keeping up-to-date with latest design trends and fonts§ §Using stock sites to source and download imagery, graphics, icons needed to assist designs§ §Able to occasionally use Word or Powerpoint to create client collateral such as letterhead or Powerpoint templates. § §Being able to use Adobe XD confidently and proficiently including the prototype feature. § §Being able to structure website designs using initiative rather than a detailed brief explaining how the layout should be and what should go there§ §Creating Website Maps – again using initiative rather than being told what to put where – thinking always about what is best for the client’s customers.§ §Designing modern and beautiful websites and apps from landing pages to full e-commerce shops from scratch or from a template§ §Basic understanding of social media, digital marketing and SEO§ §Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS§ § §  §In the creative part of the role, you will be responsible for:§ § §Contributing to overall creative strategy for clients when required under the Creative Director§ §Contributing to creative sessions on video concepts, websites, naming, branding and taglines§ § §  §As a human being, we’d like you to have the following traits:§ § §Being a hard worker who is passionate about the work they create and really cares about doing a good job§ §Able to take feedback on work without taking it personally as this will happen on a daily basis§ §Amazing attention to detail and a strive for the best work possible§ §Be a self-starter – if you don’t know how to do something – be willing to learn and teach yourself the skill§ §Be able to take ownership over projects and complete them from start to finish with a high attention to detail § §Able to keep focused on the job and be able to complete things on time. § §Overall you will need to be a self-motivated individual with the ability to build collaborative relationships with colleagues and clients. A keenness to manage a wide variety of design jobs from a broad range of industries is integral as well as an in-depth know-how to deliver results across a number of formats.§  §This is a great opportunity to work with a talented creative team in a role that offers an exciting variety of experience and exposure. Anomaly has an excellent reputation in the industry and if you work for us, no day will be the same as another, you’ll create awesome work for awesome clients, and have a great time doing it.§  § §  §HOW TO APPLY§ § §First stage §- submit your resume to SEEK.§ §Second stage§ - if you are shortlisted you will be invited to submit a pitch based on the creative brief provided. This will be similar to client briefs we normally receive, and we want to see what you come to the table with. This will be for a fictitious client. Anything you design will remain yours and Anomaly will not use it at any point. We just want to see how good you are!§ §PLEASE NOTE: You must live in Australia to apply for this position. Any applications from people living overseas will be instantly disgarded.§  §Applications close Friday 9th October.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a graphic designer?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§§§

Our team consists of die hard media buyers, who look to expand their knowledge daily & move into positions of leadership as our agency grows! § §In 2020 our agency has grown 589%. This growth calls for rapid team expansion which is why we need your help!!§ § § §Qualifications & Experience: § § §Must have at least 1 years experience running Facebook & Instagram ads for eCommerce Brands§ §Must have experience creating strategies and structures tailored to specific online stores§ §Must be able to communicate & liaise clearly with clients§ §Must understand data points such as CPM, CPA, ROAS, CPC.§ §An in depth understanding of Ad Funnels, creating retargeting audiences,§ §Ability & eagerness to learn new social media ad platforms§ §Basically, if you know Facebook & Instagram ads, we'll teach you Snapchat, TikTok, ManyChat, and whatever else is the next up and coming social media craze! § § § §Tasks & Responsibilities: § §Manage test, scale and optimise campaigns across Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok & ManyChat§ §Analyse & Optimise existing paid campaigns including campaign structure, creating new campaigns, refining audience targeting and any other optimisation required to scale revenue and increase profits§ §Manage client expectations, offer reassurance, guidance & advisory for their day-today business activities§ §Develop, alter & optimise existing client strategies to improve ROAS § §Write compelling ad copy for ads in campaigns § §Manage multiple social media ad accounts across several different brands, in different industries, with a variety of different products§ § § §About You: § §Must love eCommerce§ §Get excited when you look at our team (check out our Instagram: @toptiermarketing_)§ §Great attention to detail and time management skills§ §Eager to learn more about the digital marketing § §You're passionate about new social media trends§ § § §Job Benefits:§ §Based in Burleigh Heads on the Gold Coast, our culture is fun, energetic, fulfilling and very much growth oriented. We're offering a flexible working environment with a massive opportunity for growth & personal progression! § § § §Contact Us: § §If you think you've got what it takes to add value to our agency, click “Apply for this job”, provide your CV and include a Cover letter explaining why you think you're best suited for our agency (making mention of your previous Facebook & eCommerce experience will be favoured!). §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years' experience do you have in digital marketing?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§§§
