jobText: TXT/50705951.txt	§Front End Developer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Front End Developer§§Advertiser: §Out of the Square Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§§The Company:§  §Out of the Square (OOTS), is an award winning, leading regional agency based in Newcastle. Our passionate and talented team of 22 delivers high quality creative solutions to national and local clients on a daily basis. We’re all about ideas, strategy and driving serious results, whilst enjoying ourselves along the way. §  §At OOTS we love the thrill of birthing ideas and sending them out into the world. This coupled with the urge to make something awesome from literally nothing is what gets us up in the morning. Sometimes we can’t believe this is actually a job.§  §Our office is located in the heart of Newcastle, harbour views, surrounded by cafes and only 5 minutes to a lunchtime beach swim.§  §If you want to get a good feel for what it’s like around here, please check out our website at §www.outofthesquare.com §or stalk us on social media. §  §The Role:§  §We are looking for a mid-senior front end developer with a minimum of 3+ years' experience (more senior is wonderful too), with keen attention to detail, a passion for user experience, technology and innovation. If you thrive in an exciting and dynamic environment, love collaborating on exciting projects and want to be part of a fun team at one of Newcastle’s leading agencies then we want to hear from you. Finding the right person is just as important as finding the right skills and we are on the hunt! §  §While our office comes with an incredible ocean view - remote work arrangements, work from home and flexible hours, full time and part time are all up for discussion. If you’ve got the skills, we want to hear from all of you!§  §What will you do in this role?§  §• Develop web application user interfaces using HTML, Javascript and CSS§  §• Help inform designs with a strong focus on usability, and further refine existing designs to improve user experience and performance§  §• Write maintainable and well-structured code§  §• Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle including ideation, code reviews, basic testing and ongoing support§  §• Collaborate with relevant departments to execute integrated campaigns and projects§  §• Bonus if you have experience developing wireframes/prototypes§  §• Advise creative teams on latest digital design trends and standards §  §• Assist with advising on quotes and scope of works integrating across teams to ensure all projects are delivered on time and on budget§  §• Be part of the brainstorming, creative problem solving and idea sessions§  §• Be willing to help wherever required, be a team player and like to have a good laugh §  §Who are you?§  §You are an experienced developer who’s constantly looking at ways to further your own work and progress yourself to reach new levels in your career. You’re obsessed with UX and using next generation technology to help clients.§  §• Ideally a minimum of 3 years' experience as a Front End Developer (we would love to see samples of your work)§  §• Strong HTML / CSS and Javascript skills required§  §• Strong experience in Wordpress and ability to build custom themes from the ground up§  §• Experience supporting Shopify sites a bonus§  §• Ability to assist with conversion tracking via GTM and analytics or a willingness to learn§  §• Experience in wire framing, prototyping and digital design and familiar with related software/tools a plus (i.e. Sketch, InVision, Illustrator, etc)§  §• Passionate about UX/UI with a focus on mobile first§  §• Ability to convert complex requirements into intuitive 'human centred' products§  §• Meticulous attention to detail; coupled with analytical and problem-solving skills§  §• Ability to work individually and as part of a team§  §• IT and/or Design degree preferred§  §• Experience in online animation a bonus!§  §Reports to: Senior Digital Strategist§  §If this sounds like you and you like the sound of us, then apply now and get in touch!§  §Remuneration commensurate with relevant experience.§  §Please email Martin Adnum, Managing Director at §ideas@outofthesquare.com.au§ with your questions or CV and portfolio. §  §All applicants will be treated in the strictest confidence. §  §Only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview§.§  §Applications close: Friday October 23rd 2020, 5pm§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a front end software developer?§§§

jobTitle: Administration and Events Manager Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50571363.txt	§Administration and Events Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration and Events Manager§§Advertiser: §Queensland Show Choir Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§Background§ §The Queensland Show Choir (QSC) is Queensland’s leading performance choir, catering for young performers from 4 to 18 as well as for adults of all ages in our various ensembles. QSC is a community-based, non-profit organisation founded in 1984 to develop the art of Show Choir in Queensland. A Show Choir is a singing group that performs a popular style of music incorporating choreographed dancing focused on providing an entertaining experience for the audience.§ §QSC provides a caring and supportive environment in which children, youth and adults of all ages engage in the development of singing and performance technique, choralography, self-confidence, teamwork, personal friendships and a sense of community. The organisation fosters personal development as members join or progress through each ensemble. QSC maintains a significant performance program. Locally the ensembles regularly perform at corporate functions, sporting and charity events and major festivals in addition to QSC’s own concert series. The Queensland Show Choir tours both nationally and internationally.§ §The Queensland Show Choir Inc is an incorporated entity under the Associations Incorporation Act and has a management committee elected each year. It also has a dedicated volunteer administration team that supports our four ensembles in rehearsals, events, touring and various administration functions.§ §Position Purpose§ §The Administration and Events Manager role is a part time position which provides coordination and support to our artistic staff and ensemble members to ensure memberships, rehearsals and performance events are managed appropriately.  It is responsible for the marketing of QSC activities, and to prospective members and various external performance agencies. The position is also responsible for the management and coordination of our volunteer ensemble administrators and other volunteer activities.§ §Key Accountabilities§ §·  Oversee and initiate membership records, including applications by new members, for our ensembles. § §·  Ensure all rehearsals have administrative coverage and regularly liaise with volunteer administrators to ensure QSC standards and strategic direction are understood and implemented appropriately. § §·  Maintain a key register for access to QSC premises.§ §·  Coordinate the planning and oversight of QSC performance events including preparation of run sheets, programs, bump in/out, sound checks, risk management, client and venue liaison, etc.§ §·  Perform marketing activities including social media updates, email promotions and ad campaigns to support QSC events and ticketing, maintain member communication and attract new members. § §·  Seek out and coordinate funding opportunities on behalf of the management committee through government, business or other sources, eg arts, gambling grants, Bunnings BBQs, etc.§ §·  Ensure membership systems & records are up to date and appropriately maintained to enable effective communication with QSC members and ensure data security.§ §·  Administer and update the QSC website, Facebook pages and other social media platforms as required.§ §·  Develop positive, constructive relationships with committee members, artistic staff, volunteer administrators, performing members, chorister families and other key stakeholders.§ §·  Undertake other duties from time to time, as may be required by the management committee.§ §·  Provide a timely written report for and attend monthly management committee meetings.§ §For more information, a detailed Position Description and Organisational Chart are provided on our website at  https://www.queenslandshowchoir.com.au/about/employment§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Philanthropy Relationships Manager Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50594362.txt	§Philanthropy Relationships Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Philanthropy Relationships Manager§§Advertiser: §Canberra Symphony Orchestra§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$75,000 - $85,000 pro rata (incl. superannuation)§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§ABOUT US§  §The Canberra Symphony Orchestra (CSO) is dedicated to reaching and enriching a broad audience through artistically vibrant musical experiences. §  §The CSO programs symphonic masterworks alongside compelling Australian compositions, championing Australian voices and stories. The CSO is proudly grounded in the arts ecosystem of the Canberra region, with a global outlook. §  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  §The Philanthropy Relationships Manager is responsible for fostering a growing, engaged CSO philanthropic community. This includes building relationships with key donors, developing and implementing philanthropy programs and campaigns and increasing philanthropic giving. §  §Reporting directly to the CEO, the Philanthropy Relationships Manager will be responsible for meeting income, retention and growth targets. The Philanthropy Relationships Manager will work in close collaboration with staff responsible for external relations, marketing and communications, event management, artistic planning and ticketing.§  §This is a part-time position (22.5 hours per week – negotiable).§  §Key areas of responsibility§  §The Philanthropy Relationships Manager will assume responsibility for the development and implementation of the Philanthropy Program Roadmap§, in alignment with external relations strategy and the CSO artistic vision. §  §Implementation of the roadmap will include:§ § §Managing donor relationships§ §Proactively steward and develop relationships with current donors and long-term CSO supporters. This includes developing individual giving programs, coordinating consistent donor acknowledgement and managing donor requirements and expectations.§ § §Driving fundraising initiatives§ §Drive philanthropy and fundraising initiatives in alignment with the CSO strategic framework and artistic vision. This includes planning and implementation of the annual CSO Fundraising Gala, End of Financial Year appeal and other bespoke events and campaigns in collaboration with staff responsible for external relations, marketing and communications, event management, artistic planning and ticketing.§ § §Identifying new philanthropy opportunities§ §Identify and engage prospective donors through the CSO’s community of partners and supporters, and other philanthropic trusts and foundations.§  §Develop new philanthropic initiatives, including a CSO bequest program.§  §CONDITIONS§  §The Philanthropy Relationships Manager will be required to engage with CSO donors and other stakeholders at CSO events and performances and therefore cannot hold a performing position with the CSO.§  §ABOUT YOU§  §This role requires exceptional interpersonal skills, creativity and attention to detail. §  §Our ideal candidate has five years’ experience in philanthropy management or a similar area of work, with demonstrated expertise in relationship management.§  §Experience in the not-for-profit and / or arts sectors, an understanding of marketing and communications principles and an interest in orchestral, classical and art music is desirable. §  §To apply, provide a CV and one-page cover letter outlining your experience and suitability to the role to Rachel Thomas, CEO, via §recruitment@cso.org.au§ by COB Friday 9 October 2020.§§§§

An analytical, problem-solving "Do-er" with a creative flair. You are solutions and client focused, with a real passion for helping clients stay ahead of the curve with powerful modern marketing.§ §You are able to demonstrate your ability to build strong client relationships and communicate effectively with clients, team members and partners. You must be passionate about delivering outstanding results and driven to succeed.§ §If you’re ambitious, motivated, forward-thinking, and you get weirdly excited by marketing - this is the opportunity for you! § §This is the dream - live AND work on the Central Coast doing something you love with people who are serious about success.§ § § §DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES§ § § §Work on high performance marketing strategies and campaigns§ § § §Organise, manage and plan task prioritisation for projects and campaigns§ § § §Schedule and coordinate priorities with internal channel managers§ § § §Provide quality and thorough briefs to creative team§ § § §Demonstrate creative judgment; protect the brands and inform designers about style, look and feel§ § § §Analysis of marketing data and creating client reports§ § § §Work cooperatively with key team members, clients and vendors§ § § § §SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS§ §Required Skills§ § § §Strong task management, project management and ongoing client service skills§ § § §Interest in managing clients in an agency§ § § §Solid knowledge of marketing channels including Social Media, Search Engine Marketing, Email Marketing, and Websites§ § § §Strong data analysis skills.§ § §Highly Desired Skills§ § § §Bachelor Degree in Marketing or Related field§ § § §Exceptional task prioritisation, communication and decision making skills§ § § §Ability to operate autonomously, as well as within a team environment§ § § §A veracious enthusiasm for learning§ § §WHAT WE OFFER:§ § § §Friendly work environment promoting work/life balance (most of the time at least)§ § § §A workplace where we work hard but have a good laugh§ § § §Fast growing business with lots of future opportunities§ § § §A competitive salary based on your experience§ § § §Creative work environment. We love fresh, new ideas and creative thinking§ § § § §HOW TO APPLY§ §If you meet the above requirements and you have current working rights in Australia, apply now. § §No overseas or out of state applicants as you will be required to work in the West Gosford office. Include your up to date resume and covering letter.§ §Only applications submitted through seek will be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

In this role you will interface with the design community – a group of passionate and creative people who rely upon our mediums for business and market profile.§ §This role is advertised as full time but we will flex hours around the right candidate.§ §Essential Skills – Print Production, plus excellent verbal and written communication skills and a passion for home design.§ §If you are interested and have at least three years’ experience in magazine production, and/or content marketing, please submit a resume to Janice Williams at §jwilliams@umco.com.au§ §About Universal Media Co§ §Universal Media Co recruits passionate individuals who excel in their areas of interest or expertise.§  With more than 50 brands and businesses, Universal Media Co is one of Australia’s largest media companies. We operate in a fast-paced and evolving industry and are committed to innovating and transforming our teams and products to continue to grow. Our business is built on strong storytelling by creatives who are deeply connected to their markets, coupled with cutting-edge technology equipped for content delivery, to ultimately connect brands with audiences.  Universal Media Co recruits passionate individuals who excel in their areas of interest and expertise. We create a dynamic working environment that encourages creativity, initiative and personal development.  §§§§

In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. Our teams include many of Australia’s best-known and most respected journalists.§About the Role§We are seeking an energetic, proactive Digital Producer with previous experience in writing and subbing content for Digital News platforms. You will be responsible for producing and sub editing digital content for news websites using CoreMedia and other production systems. Under the direction of the NT Deputy News Editor you will also:§§Write and check stories for factual and style errors/inconsistencies. §Liaise with newsroom colleagues from TV and radio and the online central editorial team covering Territory stories. §Provide direction to staff to achieve high standards of journalistic and production craft§Contribute ideas for digital coverage of metro and state stories and events and take part in editorial meetings as required. §Maintain an understanding of current events and issues, monitoring a wide range of media outlets/sources.§Develop and foster a network of contacts and sources. §§About You§Using your Digital journalism skills and experience of working in a news environment and strong understanding of online news and social media, you will have sound methods of online content distribution and engagement. You will also have:§§A demonstrated track record as a meticulous, fast and accurate sub-editor able to correct and, where necessary, rewrite copy to the highest standards. §Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively as part of a small team and with other teams in the ABC. §A wide range of knowledge of local, national and international news issues with a strong understanding of and commitment to the needs of the audience. §Exceptional time management skills and the ability to work accurately and autonomously to tight deadlines are essential. §§For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:  §50059584 DIGITAL PRODUCER PM.pdf§§How to Apply§§We would love to see your work.§ Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).§For further information on this position please contact Sara Everingham on §08 8943 3189§.§We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.§For more information on working at the ABC visit §abc.net.au/careers§§Applications Close: 11:55 pm, 13 October.§§The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. jobText: TXT/50490405.txt	§Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Kimberlin Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§Are you passionate about designing digital campaigns and platforms that engage teachers and kids alike?§  §Are you a talented creative thinker and digital design expert?§  §Are you ready to dive head first into a fast paced, growing agency that specialises in digital education campaigns?§  §About Us§Kimberlin Education is a specialist creative agency supporting teachers by making learning fun for kids through the development of interactive games, websites and resources.  A specialist team of tech geeks, creative geniuses and teacher's pets, we know how to get a message across to students in a fun, engaging and educational way. We are proud of what we do and know we are making a big difference.§  §The Role§We are looking for a passionate Digital Designer to drive the creativity of our client campaigns, our teacher targeted website and our business overall. §  §You will be working within a close knit team of in-house developers, creatives, education managers and client managers.  §  §Key Responsibilities§ § § §Create and communicate concepts and develop interactive design solutions from inception through to completion and delivery§  § § §Create offline teacher resources for client campaigns§  § § §Oversee the creativity of the studio including our agency space, websites and client/teacher facing communications§  § § §In collaboration with our Digital Product Manager and Content Manager, be responsible for the creative of our teacher resource website§  § § §Collaborate with our Education Managers and Development team to deliver the most creative and innovative solutions for students and teachers§  § § §Oversee the output of a Jnr Graphic Designer§  § §Essential skills§ § §5 years+ digital design experience§ § §Expert Adobe Creative Suite skills (Photoshop, InDesign, Flash, Illustrator etc)§  § § §Knowledge of the latest UX design standards and wireframe design§  § § §A creative portfolio of work including website design, online games, online content, email templates, social media designs etc ideally with an education, youth or kids focus (but not essential)§  § § §Working knowledge of HTML/CSS (but not essential)§  § § §Experience with video editing and filming a plus§  § § §Excellent written and verbal communication skills and experience dealing with internal stakeholders, clients and suppliers§  § § §Strong people skills and a personable nature§  § § §Fast-paced designer able to multi task and work under pressure§  § § §Self motivated, disciplined, methodical and passionate§  § §About You§You love producing highly creative work and ideally have some experience in the youth/ kids/ educational space (but not essential). You love being part of a team but also think outside of the box and love innovating and creating.§  §You are constantly thinking about the way our business and our clients can demonstrate their creativity. It's in your blood and much like the rest of us you're a kid at heart!§  §What we offer:§ § § §Mixture of being in the office and working from home (currently Tuesdays from home; Fridays always from home)§  § § §Alexandria-based office including couches, creative spaces, studio, beanbags and Lego corner§  § § §Work from home Fridays and a day off for your birthday§  § § §Pet-friendly office… although we are lacking a team pet right now. Do you have a dog?§  § § §Opportunity to produce creative work for youth and kids§  § §Sound like your dream role? Please provide a cover letter explaining why you would like to work here and what you would bring to our business. Please include a portfolio of your work as well. §  §You must be an Australian resident to apply for this position. Please no recruiters, we are seeking applications from direct candidates only.§  §www.kimberlineducation.com.au§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a digital designer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Ceramics Studio Technician & Teacher Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50681765.txt	§Ceramics Studio Technician & Teacher§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ceramics Studio Technician & Teacher§§Advertiser: §MakerSpace and Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$25.18/h M-F & $31.48/h SAT + $50/h Teaching§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§Part time Ceramic Technician & Teacher§ §Salary:§ Approximately 20 hours per week tech work: $25.18 per hour Monday - Friday & $31.475 on Saturday. Approximately 4 hours a week of teaching. Teaching hours paid at $50 per hour.§Mandate: §Be the central cog of our passionate community of ceramics members, studio tenants, teachers and students. §Commencing: §October 25th 2020. §Hours:§ The hours will be in a fixed roster but will include a mix of days, evenings and Saturdays. §Benefits: §Be a part of Sydney’s most exciting maker community. Access the workshop facilities and classes to develop your own skills and projects. Option to extend the role with additional teaching.§ §About the organisation:§MakerSpace & Co is a not for profit organisation founded in Sydney's Inner West providing access to equipment, expertise and space for emerging designers, entrepreneurs, artists, makers and artisans. MakerSpace & Co is equipped with cutting-edge machine workshops, studio spaces and education programs that are so needed by designers. It is also a place for locals to participate in the culture of making, and for visitors to experience the best in Australian design across furniture, ceramics, metalwork, woodwork, recycled plastics and industrial design. It helps build Australian creative businesses, employment and communities.§ §About the Role:§We are looking for the perfect part-time ceramics technician & teacher who can look after the kilns, manage firings, clay recycling, studio supplies and oversee workflow systems (location of greenware, bisqued, glazed and finished works).§ §You’ll have an excellent working knowledge of throwing, handbuilding and slip-casting processes, glazes and firing. You will induct and train new members on the machinery and tools, talk through making strategies and techniques for their projects. You need to not only love making things with clay, but you need to be passionate and patient when guiding others who are just starting out.§ §As the head of the Ceramics department, you will be closely involved in our short courses program, developing new clases, and sourcing new teachers. The role will include a minimum of 4 hours of teaching every week, helping beginners and more advanced students to learn new skills. §Providing a great customer experience is essential. As part of a growing team, you’ll know the ins-and-outs of MakerSpace & Co so you can keep our members and the public up to date with upcoming events and developments. In this capacity, you will also be answering phone and email enquiries that are both specific to the ceramics department, and general enquiries. You’ll help customers by answering questions, booking people into classes, signing up new members and placing people on wait-lists.§ §Who will you be working with and reporting to?§ §●  You will report to the Education Program Manager and Building and Memberships Manager.§●  You will work closely with the rest of our team - our Workshop Manager, our Marketing Coordinator, our Managing Director and our teachers. §●  You will liaise with the rest of the teaching, member and tenant community in regards to education programs and events. §●  You will also assist with training volunteers to help in the Ceramic Studio.§ §Responsibilities:§ §●  Managing firings (loading and unloading kilns, firing timetables for earthenware and stoneware firings etc.)§●  Managing consumables - ordering clay, glazes and other requirements§●  Maintenance of equipment in the ceramics studio.§●  Training new members and staff in equipment use.§●  Studio supervision and assisting members and students with their pottery projects.§●  Teaching students, from beginners to advanced.§●  Assist with programming short courses in the Woodwork department, and in collaboration with other departments.§●  Assisting Education Program Manager with class timetables for classes taking place in the ceramics studio (and relevant firing schedules).§●  First Aid Officer (training provided if necessary).§●  Customer service - in person, via phone and email.§●  Basic filing of documents.§●  Using booking platform to book and change classes, create new accounts and troubleshoot.§ §Skills and Experience:§●  Management of ceramics studio§●  Teaching and assisting others with technical and design aspects of ceramics.§●  Patience - you know it’s always ok to be a beginner and not to know, and you know that humans get things wrong sometimes.§●  Experience in throwing clay, slip-casting, handbuilding clay, glazing, and troubleshooting all of the above.§●  Use of kilns for firing mixed works and mixed glazes.§●  Friendly, un-intimidating, open, sharing, knowledgeable and generally lovely.§●  Basic confidence with computer systems - you will be using our booking platform to manage memberships, bookings and sales, and other basic programs.§ §Benefits and culture:§Be a part of Sydney’s most exciting cultural development. As part of the MakerSpace & Co family, you will be exposed to opportunities to hone your creative skills and interests with professional development opportunities including teaching, taking classes, access to the facilities, production work and the potential to shape and grow the role.§ §Applications:§To apply, please send your §CV + Portfolio + Availability + Cover letter to §hello@makerspace.org.au§ .§ §The Cover Letter should be a maximum of two pages and cover a selection of the Responsibilities and Skills and Experience dot points listed above. § §For any enquiries, please call our Managing Director Kris on §0405138635§.§§Apply now, the position will be filled as soon as we find the perfect person to join the team. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50620768.txt	§Account Manager - Digital Publisher§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager - Digital Publisher§§Advertiser: §WhistleOut§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§WhistleOut is the #1 telco comparison site in Australia, the USA and Canada, with an audience of over 8 million visitors every year. We’re looking for someone smart and motivated to join our Sydney team in Crows Nest (when you’re not working from home!).§ §Reporting into the Marketing Director, we’re looking for an Account Manager who can help us take our client relationships to the next level. You’ll be responsible for the day-to-day management of our Telco clients (including Optus, Telstra, Vodafone, TPG and more), financial tracking, client strategy, reporting, and new commercial opportunities. You’ll do this whilst working with our experts in Marketing, SEO, SEM, UX, Dev & Design.§ §We feel this role would suit someone currently working in a media or creative agency, or even client side for a Telco or similar vertical. § §If you like working in a small team in a fast-paced, fast-growth environment where you can truly impact the strategy of the business, this could be a good fit for you. § §We want someone who:§ § § §Has exceptional attention to detail§ § § §Can multi-task competing priorities and clients deftly and diplomatically§ § § §Loves discovering new opportunities in the data§ § § §Can contribute ideas to our various new initiatives§ § § §Is able to use analysis to drive improvements§ § § §Has strong presentation and interpersonal skills§ § § §Has strong financial acumen and is results driven § § §We can offer you:§ § § §A genuinely positive, friendly work environment where good ideas are recognised. We’re low on hierarchy and politics and high on smarts and getting great work done.§ § § §The ability to directly impact a growing business, even if it’s outside your direct role. We are big on sharing skills and knowledge, and open to offering new opportunities to facilitate your professional growth§ § § §Excellent work-life balance, including “half day Fridays” for the rest of 2020!§ § §To stand out from the crowd, please send us a cover letter and tell us more about you (just stick it in the same file as your CV).§ §And to get the conversation started, help us get to know you a little better by responding to the questions below:§ § § §What’s one website you visit every day (and why)?§ § § §What’s a key skill that you can bring to the WhistleOut team?§ § §Our story:§ §WhistleOut is a part of the Clearlink family of 15+ consumer websites, which includes whistleout.com.au, reviews.org/au, whistleout.com, HighSpeedInternet.com and CableTV.com. With offices in Sydney, San Diego, Salt Lake City, Seattle, Amsterdam and Edinburgh, Clearlink currently has over 1700 employees and has been creating marketing content services for Fortune 500 companies for over 13 years. WhistleOut is a fun and friendly workplace with a bias for action. We value personal freedom, openness to frequent change and new ideas.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

They should be able to identify a story in any situation and be able to quickly develop ideas into engaging, interesting and accurate news stories.§ §You will also have excellent organisational skills and the ability to work calmly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.§ §An interest in politics would be an advantage, as would some knowledge of media law and photography.§ §Experience in writing sport would be advantageous as well. § §Applicants need to have a sound working knowledge of  writing for digital and social media platforms as well.§ §If you have sub-editing and page layout skills this will also be looked at favorably.. § §If you are interested in a rewarding and challenging newsroom role, send your CV, a cover letter and at least two samples of published work to:§ §Rob Duffield, Mid-Murray General Manager§ §rduff@theguardian.com.au§ §Phone: 03-§5032 2161§ or §0418-302943§ §Applications close on Friday, October 23, 2020§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a journalist?§How many years' experience do you have in a publishing role?§Have you completed a qualification in journalism?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

See more at - https://www.contentlion.com.au/§ § § §About the role§ §We are currently seeking full-time video editors to join our post production team who are extremely talented with experience in editing high end short form content who have extensive knowledge in after effects and premier pro. jobTitle: Melbourne Real Estate Experienced Photographer - Full Time Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50562537.txt	§Melbourne Real Estate Experienced Photographer - Full Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Melbourne Real Estate Experienced Photographer - Full Time§§Advertiser: §Top Snap South Yarra§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§EXPERIENCED (2yrs min) Real Estate Photographer – Full Time§  §Top Snap is a leading international real estate visual marketing franchise group with professional photographers in most major metropolitan areas in Australia and New Zealand.§  §Our clients include real estate professionals, home owners, builders, architects, interior designers and property developers. Through our online cloud platform "Genie Pro" Top Snap has processed over 1,000,000 images for over 93,000 property marketing campaigns.§  §In addition to high quality daylight, dusk, elevated and aerial photography, Top Snap can maximize the impact of all property campaigns with a professional suite of visual marketing tools which include 360degree virtual tours, standard, colored, textured or 3D floor plans, virtual furniture, copywriting and online video tours.§  §But enough about us.§  §We have the rare opportunity available to join our team with this challenging but exciting role.§  §This exciting and challenging job will involve servicing regular clients with photographs in the rental, sales and commercial property industry, measuring and drawing floor plans ready for our CAD team to create and managing post production photographs and invoicing in this large and up market territory, in the Mornington Peninsula area.§  §Our key objectives are to profile each agency to their specific visual marketing requirements to deliver stand out results.§  §The successful applicant will have an education in professional photography, a strong background within the real estate sector and be extremely organized, outgoing and a self starter. The successful applicant will have the opportunity to grow with this rapidly expanding company and will ideally be a part of the Top Snaps future expansion and innovation.§  §You must have a full frame DSLR and a range of specific lenses. You will be required to work at various locations from your home or our office in Windsor. You will also need to have an ABN and public liability insurance and police check. You will need excellent communication/comprehension skills, be a team player, have a friendly professional attitude and be willing and interested to learn new skills and techniques.§ § §MUST have real estate or architectural photography experience§ §Excellent knowledge of all photographic principles and lighting§ §Excellent presentation, customer service skills and a high degree of professionalism§ §Drivers license and full police check and valid Australian visa§ §you must be residing in Melbourne, preferably Mornington Area§ §If you think you have what it takes to be a Top Snap Team member please apply with your CV, cover letter and link to your real estate portfolio.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a photographer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§What's your preferred work type?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50548513.txt	§Now Casting! New and Experienced Models and Social Media Influencers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Now Casting! New and Experienced Models and Social Media Influencers§§Advertiser: §MGM Media Model Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$100 - $100+ per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Performing Arts§§§§§§Are you looking to get your foot in the door of the Modelling industry and launch your career? Do you have experience in Modelling, Fashion or Social Influencing and want to further your career? Perhaps you are the parent of a teen who has potential as a Model. If so, we need your help! MGM Media Model Management (https://www.mgmmediamodelmanagement.com.au) is currently seeking enthusiastic, passionate, new and experienced Models and Influencers to join our team.§ §MGM Media Model Management is a Sydney-based Modelling agency that represents female, male, and teen models from across Australia in a broad range of campaigns including print, runway, magazines, billboard, television, advertising, social media, and much more! We have an enviable reputation within the industry of having some of the most up-an-coming Modelling talent on our books, and we are renowned internationally due to our team’s years of industry experience.§ §As a Model or Social Media Influencer, MGM Media Model Management will actively work to evaluate your skill set and provide you with opportunities for growth and job placement. We offer well-researched, professional opportunities for those individuals we work with. Our list of clients continues to evolve, so there will always be new opportunities for you! This is your chance to let your talent shine!§ §Highlights of the position:§ § §Training provided!§ Whether you are a new model or one looking to build followers on a social media platform, we are with you every step of the way!§ §Opportunity to advance your career. §Whether you are getting started on the path to becoming a successful Model or a Social Media Influencer, this is a chance to work with a high-quality Modelling agency that will surely boost your career.§ §Ideal Candidates: § § §Demonstrate a pure passion for the Modelling industry§ §Have flexible availability to meet the needs of clients§ §Have a positive and motivated attitude§ §Are dependable and able to follow-through with time commitments§ §Social Media Influencers: Have a passion for social media and a strong desire to succeed§ §If you have worked as a promo model or within promotional work this would be the next step up in your career !§ §We thoroughly vet applications. Please be patient as we work through submissions. If we feel you are a good fit for our clients, we will contact you within seven days. MGM Media Model Management looks forward to hearing from you !§§§§

jobTitle: Real Estate and Corporate Videographer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50607368.txt	§Real Estate and Corporate Videographer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate and Corporate Videographer§§Advertiser: §Shout Out Marketing and Production§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $59,999 + fuel card + equipment§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§Shout Out Marketing is currently looking for a videographer for full time work at a small company based in the North West of Sydney. Most of our clients are in the Real Estate sector but we have a growing number of Corporate videos which is overloading our current capacity.§All our growth has been word of mouth so we are seeking to employ a full time videographer to further enhance the marketing capabilities we can offer. Our aim is to provide our clients with high quality video content with a quick turnaround time.  Initially, you will work closely with our creative director to learn the role before being given your own shoots to run yourself. This may also include drone work, photography and floor plans when the business requires.  § §Our key objectives are to ensure each agency are given their specific visual marketing style to deliver stand out results. We will provide training and can supply camera gear as required. Recent Graduates or juniors will be considered based on the strength of their CV and willingness to learn.§ §The successful applicant will have an education in professional videography, a strong interest within the real estate sector and be extremely organized, outgoing and a self starter. The successful applicant will have the opportunity to grow with this rapidly expanding company and will ideally be a part of future expansion and innovation.§ §You will be required to work at various onsite locations for the shoots and edit from your home. You will need excellent communication/comprehension skills, be a team player, have a friendly professional attitude and be willing and interested to learn new skills and techniques.§ §Requirements: §Excellent knowledge of all things video/editing and a willingness to learn other areas such as photography§Excellent presentation, customer service skills and a high degree of     professionalism§Drivers licence and valid Australian visa§You must be residing in Sydney, preferably Hills area or be willing to travel§Please apply with your CV, cover letter and link to your portfolio.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you have customer service experience?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§§§

jobTitle: Group Account Director Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50693582.txt	§Group Account Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Account Director§§Advertiser: §Trout§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Leadership. Strategic. Collaborative.§ §Using powerful insight and creative thinking, we imagine new brands, business, and ways of working that better the lives of those who construct and maintain living spaces, and those who experience them, to build a better future for all.§ §We think and work differently to most. Maybe all. We focus on ideas with impact. To do this, we believe you have to break down the barriers and get rid of the jumping through hoops to work at pace on the important matters. That's why we've shifted the client/agency paradigm, so our team of strategists, marketers, content creators, designers, and developers collaborate directly with clients as an extension of their team.§ §At Trout, our account team operates in a hybrid style encompassing marketing management, strategy, and project management. We are looking for a leader, and a mentor, someone who can elevate the current team, nurture and develop new account managers, and collaborate with other account directors to drive existing business and grow revenue with new clients.§ §If you love leading a team, brand, project, and campaign strategy, managing client relationships and partnerships with embedded teams, internal and external, to grow an account portfolio, then we're looking for you.§ §Highlight§ §Account management with an inside-out model – day one, you will have an existing portfolio and team within a large retailer and proactively drive business externally with a range of clients across various environments for digital marketing, creative, and brand strategy.§ §Grow§ §You are ambitious and keen to lead teams across multiple accounts, portfolios, and sectors, identifying, cultivating, and delivering existing and new opportunities.§ §Squad§ §Work with an established and growing creative consultancy in a team of account managers, supported by a highly talented team of strategists, marketers, content creators, designers, and developers, backed by a large corporate.§ §What we're after...§ § §Established background from either a brand or creative agency§ §Senior or Group Account Director-level§ §Well-developed leadership, mentoring, and influencing skills§ §Highly developed project management and campaign management experience§ §Exceptional collaborator, communicator, and customer experience-centric§ §Ability to manage multiple accounts, portfolios, and client businesses across various sector§ §Good understanding of strategic planning§ §Passionate and ambitious with a growth mindset§ §Natural curiosity and looks to stay up to date with the latest digital trends, technology, and best practice techniques.§ §If you have what it takes and want to learn more, apply today!§ §No agencies or unsolicited resumes§§§§

Our team operates in a collaborative, professional and positive manner, striving to be the leader in innovative products and methods whilst maintaining the important traditional concepts of school photography.§  §Our business is situated in Malaga and is rapidly expanding due to our growing reputation of excellent quality, superior customer service and most importantly – amazing people! We require a fully experienced Photographer to become part of the Kapture crew. This is a casual position which could lead to full-time employment for the right person.§  §Full training is provided but you need to supply the personality and enthusiasm for working with people - especially children.  This position is ideal for someone who:§ § §Is happy to work on a seasonal basis during school term times only.§ §Is available for at least three consecutive days a week that could vary from week to week according to our photography schedule.§ §Sees this opportunity as a supplemental income, possibly to their own business or other job.§ §Is a "people person" with a "can do" attitude who can communicate effectively with people from school management to children as young as three years of age.§ §Is energetic and able to carry photographic equipment.§ §Is available to start work at our offices in Malaga as early at 6am on some days.§ §Has, or is eligible to possess a "Working with Children Check."§ §Employment and training will commence at the beginning of Term 4 ( Monday 12th October).§  §If this sounds like you, please include a covering letter explaining why you think Kapture is your perfect match to: §photography@kapture.com.au§  §Applications without a covering letter will not be considered.§  §Due to the large number of applicants expected for a position like this, only suitable applicants will be invited for interview.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a photographer?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Communications Advisor Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673361.txt	§Senior Communications Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Communications Advisor§§Advertiser: §Climate Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§THE CLIMATE COUNCIL§ The Climate Council is Australia’s leading climate communications organisation. The Climate Council is seeking a talented, motivated and experienced Senior Communications Advisor preferably with an understanding of climate science and an ability to work across all climate issues.§ §THE ROLE§ The Senior Communications Advisor will be responsible for driving and coordinating the Climate Council’s day-to-day reactive media opportunities. Reporting to the Communications Director, this role requires an understanding of the political context in which the Climate Council operates. The successful candidate must be able to analyse complex problems, help to develop effective cut through messaging and propose innovative and creative solutions.  The Senior Communications Advisor will need to be a strategic thinker who can have an impact across a range of traditional and digital media. § §ABOUT YOU§ § §As a media professional with at least five years’ experience as a journalist or communications specialist in Australia, you will have excellent news judgement. As someone plugged into politics, you also have an ability to think strategically on complex issues and are able to stay one step ahead of the debate.§ §You are a collaborator at heart who enjoys working with a small but high-performing media team to get results.§ §You’ll have demonstrated experience in driving and coordinating media, with an emphasis on impact.§ §You have good media contacts and a proven ability to establish and maintain strong working relationships with a wide variety of individuals and organisations. Key responsibilities include acting as a media liaison for the Climate Council.§ §Ideally, you will have worked in highly political and contested spaces.§You must be able to work to tight deadlines, have lots of initiative and an ability to work without close supervision.§ §You will have experience in distilling complex issues for a lay audience.§ §You thrive in a fast-paced environment where circumstances & priorities can rapidly shift.§ §You must be comfortable with some domestic travel and some early starts.§ § §KEY REQUIREMENTS§ § §Developing and nurturing relationships with Climate Councillors and other spokespeople (e.g. CEO and research team members) and ensuring they are prepared for media interviews with formal briefings, message development and informal support.§ §Staying on top of the news cycle in order to identify reactive media opportunities and mobilise timely and interesting responses for the Climate Council.§ §Creating and executing well-thought-out media strategies and messages that have a big impact across a range of traditional and digital media.§ §Fostering a network of media and industry contacts throughout the country.§ §Launching Climate Council reports including organising and running press conferences.§ §Occasionally Tweeting on behalf of the Climate Council.§ §Upskilling other staff§ § §REWARDS AND BENEFITS§ The Climate Council is an influential not-for-profit organisation and this exciting role will provide the perfect candidate access to some of the best and brightest minds working in climate science and communications, while also providing the opportunity to play a key role in shaping the national narrative on climate change and energy. This is your chance to shape the future for the better.§ §Additional benefits include:§ § §Excellent learning and development opportunities both internally and externally§ §Programs for time off in lieu and flexible working arrangements§ §Brilliant work culture which is results focused but also vibrant, supportive, fun and nimble.§ § §WORK ARRANGEMENTS§ This is a full time, 12-month contract. The position is ideally based in our centrally located Sydney office (would consider Melbourne office location) although Climate Council staff are still currently working from home. The role will involve some domestic travel for media launches and projects.§   § §HOW TO APPLY:§ To apply, please submit a resume and a cover letter of no more than 250 words outlining your relevant experience via the link below.§ If you have any questions regarding the position please email us at §jobs@climatecouncil.org.au§, using the subject line: Senior Communications Advisor enquiry via EthicalTXT.§ Applications close COB Friday 23rd October 2020§§§§

Southern Cross Austereo is all about delivering §absolutely engaging§ entertainment solutions across an unrivalled portfolio of multimedia brands with the biggest shows, best talent and most exciting events across Australia. We engage staff who are the best in the business and want to work for a supportive, exciting and dynamic company with a culture of high performance. We look far and wide to employ a diverse workforce – we all bring something a little bit different – and in return we give you everything you need to bring your best self to work.§Our newest §Group Brand and Promotions Manager§ will take responsibility for the management, design, execution and communication of targeted promotional tactics and campaigns that best position SCA to attract listeners and achieve our client marketing objectives across the Townsville market and across Queensland. This will see you play a key role in delivering promotional activity, client solutions, external branding, web tactics and social media solutions.§§We are looking for the newest member of the SCA Crew who;§§Has established promotions/marketing/branding/PR experience and/or qualifications§Understands consumer and sales promotions and their role in the marketing mix across radio and other brand/media categories§Appreciates the important role of promotions within a media organisation§Is able to develop and build upon relationships with internal and external stakeholders§Solves problems easily and is able to resolve creative and business tensions§§Most of all, SCA is a values driven organisation- If you genuinely live and breathe our values, you’ll be a perfect fit for SCA. We §collaborate,§ take §initiative,§ maximise §creativity,§ have §courage§ and act with §integrity.§§Still not convinced?§The benefits of working for us are countless – to name a few we provide flexible working arrangements, a focus on work-life balance, plenty of opportunity for internal progression, health insurance discounts, workplace banking programs, concert tickets, footy tickets, special client discounts throughout the year, rooftop gigs, social gatherings – the list goes on!§Keen?§ Apply now by submitting your resume and cover letter.§COVID-19§§Please note that the safety of employees, candidates and our communities is of the highest importance to SCA. Therefore, we expect that candidates will first consider existing state government state measures and restrictions before applying for a position within another state and will further consider the impact it may have on your ability to commence employment. §§§§

jobTitle: Head of Scripted TV & Online Content Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50552978.txt	§Head of Scripted TV & Online Content§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Scripted TV & Online Content§§Advertiser: §EP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§EP Australia is recruiting for the Head of Scripted for our client SBS.§SBS Values, Vision and Purpose§The Head of Scripted responsible for undertaking their work in a way that reflects SBS’s Charter, Vision and Values and complies with relevant SBS policies, procedures and practices. At SBS, we expect you to be audience obsessed, be bold and brave, embrace difference, participate fully and ensure that we look out for one another. We are all working together to fulfil SBS’s purpose and create a more cohesive society.§  §Division Purpose  –  TV & Online Content§To make SBS Australia's most distinctive media organisation focused on delivering a clear promise to our audiences, to inspire them to seek out different perspectives, to feel a sense of connection, belonging and empowerment.§  §Role Purpose§The Head of Scripted develops and manages a pipeline of original commissioned Scripted programs for SBS Television and SBS On Demand that supports SBS’s priorities with a particular emphasis on programming reflecting Australia's diverse and multicultural society.§  §The Main responsibilities§  §Commissioning:§ § §Commission scripted programs for SBS Television and SBS ON DEMAND that successfully deliver the SBS content strategy, charter and audience objectives.§ §Identify and develop new content ideas that are original and innovative, consistent with SBS’s charter and which help build SBS’s reputation for distinctiveness.§ §Champion best practice inclusive approaches to scripted storytelling including working with key creatives from under-represented communities.§ §Constructive input into the development of new scripted works including the provision of expert script notes as well as active participation in writers’ rooms and other story development forums.§ §Leverage an extensive and well-established network of key Industry contacts including producers, production companies, casting agents, actors, screenwriters and directors to ensure SBS can create the most ambitious and successful slate of programs.§ §Manage various talent development activities associated with new and emerging creative talent in association with other TV sector organisations.§ §Proactively finance new scripted programs through various means including pitching and negotiating pre-sales, distribution advances, international co-productions, and Australian funding partnerships.§ §Ensure, that productions are delivered to the very highest standards including being delivered on time and on budget whilst also adhering to the SBS Codes and guidelines.§ §Collaborate with other areas of SBS including Newscaff, ALC, SBS Learn and other content genres to create additional complementary programming that adds depth and context to issues explored within scripted programs.§ §Present the SBS scripted strategy at the SBS Roadshow and other Industry events.§ §Leadership § § §Play a key role within the TV & Online Content Team contributing to the Division’s overall strategy§ §Demonstrate the SBS values of ‘One Team’ and Collaboration in all aspects of the role§ §Attract, recruit and retain world class Commissioning talent.§ §Create comprehensive development and training plans for team members.§ §Nurture, mentor and inspire team members.§ §Create and implement long term succession plans for key roles.§ §Minimum requirements § § §A strong understanding of the domestic and international TV marketplace, including knowledge of TV, the digital media landscape, and an awareness of trends in both the linear and streaming content platforms.§ §Proven track record of successfully developing drama series to production§ §A minimum of 10 years relevant work experience in scripted television production at a production company, network or streamer§ §Credits as a Commissioner or Executive Producer on at least three drama series.§ §Proven commitment to creating content that champions diversity§ §Education – BA/BS degree, related field preferred or equivalent work experience§ §Demonstrated knowledge of the scripted development/production processes§ §Strong existing relationships in the creative community with writers, producers, talent, agents, buyers, media platforms, etc.§ §Knowledge of all video offerings across global television/film landscape§ §Demonstrated skills in developing and maintaining effective business relationships§ §Experience across feature film, short form series and prime time series preferred§ §International experience highly regarded and experience in a funding agency desirable§ §The Benefits§  §At SBS you can expect a supportive environment within a dynamic media organisation and benefits such as free onsite parking (subject to availability), free gym access, retail discounts at select stores and many other perks.§  §SBS embrace difference and they welcome applications from people of all backgrounds. They want your vibrancy, language, culture, experiences, and abilities to brighten their halls, light up their screens and strengthen their team.§  §SBS also recognises that everyone is unique, and you may require some adjustments to ensure you have the best opportunity to apply and put your skills forward for consideration. If they can make some adjustments to the SBS recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, please let us know.§  §How to Apply:§  §Applications are being accepted now. Please send a current CV and a cover letter outlining your suitability.§A full position description is available.§Inquiries to EP Australia §info@epaustralia.com.au§ or call + §61 2 9383 4520§.§  § §§§§

You will have an eye for the little details about a character that bring a profile piece to life.  § §You will be an excellent communicator and able to balance listening with strong, persuasive and clearly articulated points of view. You must possess the capacity to multi-task and take direction from others with the ability to work under pressure and to deadlines.§ §The position reports to Sales Director.§ §Tasks and Responsibilities:§ §In this role your main responsibilities include:§ § §Directing shoots (documentary, corporate, creative concepts), working with the production team and freelance crew§ §Preparing and operating of camera equipment (Canon C-series, DSLRs, GoPro, etc.)§ §Attending regular meetings with all stakeholders and crew§ §Collaborating with ECA management to synthesize company outcomes on-time, on-budget§ §Sourcing stock footage, graphics, sound effects, music§ §Recording interviews, raw footage of company activities for promotions, Live classes and content creation for online delivery§ §Compiling and sorting or cataloguing footage.§ §Creating engaging motion graphics§ §Assembling, preparing and setting up equipment prior to filming§ §Offering advice on how best to shoot a scene and explaining the visual impact created by particular shots§ §Adhering to strict deadlines while managing multiple projects at once§ §Working collaboratively with the Production Team and provide creative input on video pitches and throughout post-production§ §Delivering final video and still photo product to the required platform specifications§ §Demonstrating a good awareness of Occupational Health and safety issues§ §Collaborating with ECA management to synthesize company outcomes on-time, on-budget.§ §Qualifications§ §Relevant qualification at the level of an AQF Diploma of Cinematography or higher with at least 3 years of relevant work experience.§ §Skills Required§ §You will need to possess the following skills and personal attributes: § § §Knowledge of professional codecs and Digital broadcast requirements.§ §Proficient with various cameras incl DSLR preferably Canon 5D Mark III and IV§ §Green Screen setup, lighting & filming beneficial§ §sound theoretical, practical and technical knowledge of cameras§ §Ability to frame and compose shots§ §Ability to perform camera moves accurately§ §Capacity to multi-task and take direction from others§ §Advanced knowledge of Canon 5Ds and other cameras incl. Go Pro§ §Ability to work under pressure and to deadlines§ §Also, you must have work rights in Australia. To apply for this position, email your resume to §seemaguptafc@gmail.com§ § §Please note only short listed candidates will be contacted and your application will be treated as strictly confidential.§§§§

We support charities such as Dress for Success and ASX Thomson Reuters Charity Foundation.§ §The opportunity to work with a group of extremely talented and dedicated professionals§ §A collaborative and friendly corporate culture with a management team with vision and passion for growth§ § § §"CTS is more like a family to me." § §"I actually enjoy coming in every day to work." § §"Even junior staff feel included in the bigger picture." § §"Great people, clients and opportunities."§ § § §These are examples of fantastic feedback from our staff in our recent HR Survey!§ §We had a total satisfaction rating of §84%§, with highlights being "competency of teammates" (§4.63 out of 5§), relationship with and competency of reporting manager" (§4.56§), and "positive work environment" (§4.48§).§ §We love our people and it's great to see them think so highly of us!§ §Don't just take our word for it, see more of what our staff have to say (Careers tab) and have a look at some of the big events you could lead at our website (www.corptechservices.com.au). Also, don't forget to follow us on Facebook and LinkedIn.§ § § §All candidates must be eligible for full-time work in Australia (hold a valid visa).§ §Due to the anticipated high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. § §We are an Equal Opportunity employer§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§What's your highest level of education?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Media and Marketing Coordinator  Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50545991.txt	§Media and Marketing Coordinator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media and Marketing Coordinator §§Advertiser: §Dynamic Staffing Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§A flexible remuneration package is negotiable§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§The role of the Media and Marketing Coordinator is considered critical to the effective operation of this league. You will be directly be responsible to produce the League’s on-line activities and all printed material. The expansion of the league’s digital media activities is considered to be of particular priority. You will work collaboratively to produce radio and video programs, whilst supporting the league’s Commercial and Operations Manager, Football Managers and sponsors. § §Job Functions§ § §Ensure that the website is operable, functional and that information obtained within is relevant and up to date.§ §Identify and implement initiatives that provide commercial opportunities emerging through digital media.§ §Produce and upload compelling relevant video and audio content.§ §Manage the external communications while assisting the RGM in developing and maintaining relationships § §Recruit and manage a team of media volunteers to provide a broad coverage of all football§ §Support the producer of the radio programs,  the production of  major events, clubs in the promotion of their club activities§ §Manage the production of video coverage of matches.§ §Produce the written publications such as the football record, newsletters and the league’s annual reports.§ §Identify the key interest groups and manage appropriate communications.§ §Manage the commercial aspects of the media operations through the sale of advertising and sponsorship properties.§ §Manage the regular online update of scores, results and ladders for all grades of AFL OE football.§ §Nurture the relationships of all media partners while manageing incoming enquiries from media outlets and support clubs§ §Meet the revenue budgets associated with media activities§ §Operate the league’s media activities within the required expenditure budgets§ §Complete an annual media plan and deliver on all defined outcomes of the plan§ §Identifying Marketing and Sponsorship opportunities § §Be able to identify new sponsorship and marketing opportunities § §Play a key role in assisting the RGM in ensuring a budget is met on an annual basis § § § § §Mandatory:§ § §Tertiary qualifications in journalism or suitable work experience in related field/s§ §Well-developed writing and editing skills§ §Current knowledge of website and social media account management § §Developed IT skills relevant to the Media industry§ §Ability and willingness to work outside of normal business hours§ § §Desirable:§ § §Demonstrated knowledge of the community football structure in the region and the role it plays in the community§ §Video editing and production skills§ §Presentation, MC and commentary skills§ § § § § § § §A flexible remuneration package will be negotiated with the right applicant.§ §NOTE:  This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50538201.txt	§Digitalredakteur (m/w/d) in Sydney§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digitalredakteur (m/w/d) in Sydney§§Advertiser: §dpa English Services GmbH§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$65,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§About us§ §Die Deutsche Presse-Agentur gehört zu den international führenden unabhängigen Nachrichtenagenturen. Ein weltumspannendes Netz von Journalist:innen garantiert die eigene Nachrichtenbeschaffung nach im dpa-Statut festgelegten Grundsätzen: unparteiisch und unabhängig von Weltanschauungsfragen, Wirtschafts- und Finanzgruppen oder Regierungen. Über alle Mediengrenzen hinweg, rund um die Uhr. Auf diese Qualität verlassen sich Printmedien, Rundfunksender oder Online- und Mobilfunkanbieter in mehr als 100 Ländern. Auch Parlamente, Verbände und Unternehmen gehören zu den Kunden.§ §Qualifications & experience§ § § §Austrialian citizen oder vorhandene, gültige Arbeitserlaubnis für Australien§Deutschkenntnisse auf Muttersprachenniveau§Fundierte journalistische Erfahrung, idealerweise in Nachrichtenredaktionen§Breite Allgemeinbildung, hervorragende Kenntnisse über das gesellschaftliche und politische System in Deutschland§Interesse an aktuellen Themen aus allen Bereichen, inklusive Sport§Eigenständigkeit, Selbstdisziplin und Kommunikationsstärke§Sicherheit beim Schreiben von Nachrichten§Demonstrierte Kenntnisse in der Fotoselektion und -bearbeitung§Beherrschung deutscher presserechtlicher Standards§Teamfähigkeit über Redaktions- und Ressortgrenzen hinweg§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §Publikation der digitalen dpa-Nachrichtenangebote, wenn es in Deutschland Nacht ist§Schreiben von Live-Blogs bei großen Nachrichtenlagen oder besonderen Ereignissen§Auswahl, Bearbeitung und Publikation von Foto in hohem Tempo§Vorbereitung und Produktion eines täglichen Newsblogs§Umfassende und verlässliche Übergaben an die Frühbesetzung in Berlin§Beobachtung von Online-Portalen und sozialen Medien§ § § §Benefits§ § § §Eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeiten in einer unabhängigen, internationalen Nachrichtenagentur§30 Tage Urlaub pro Jahr§Eine intensive Einarbeitung sowie zukünftige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten#§Ein Arbeitsplatz in einem internationalen Newsroom zentral in Sydney§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a publishing role?§§§

and logistics related to Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property in the Museum?s custody and care.§ §Day to day you will:§        §          §In consultation with senior executives, manage the
