jobText: TXT/50614955.txt	§Planning Director (Part Time) §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Planning Director (Part Time) §§Advertiser: §Omnicom Media Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Planning Director (Part Time) §      §        §Planning Director §        §Part-Time (3 days a week)§        §Hearts is a full-service data driven marketing and communications agency, and the third global agency pillar of the Omnicom Media Group. Launched in New York in 2016, after the successful appointment by Proctor & Gamble and AT&T shortly thereafter, Hearts offers a differentiated people, process and technology-driven approach to clients, challenging existing agency models to drive greater ROI and leveraging the OMNI audience platform.§        §Since launch, Hearts has continued to grow, innovate and deliver, extending its network to 24 markets around the world, including London, Tokyo, Toronto and Dubai. §        §Hearts is in the business of capturing hearts. The hearts of our people, our clients and our clients' customers. To do this requires the alignment of ambition, teams, innovation, creativity, audiences and media to deliver a disproportionate share of ROI. This means rethinking traditional ways of working, questioning everything and using data and technology to empower smarter decisions, to ultimately deliver better business results, not just cost savings.§        §Hearts' focus§        §At Hearts, we're defining the future of media, using data to sharpen our understanding of consumers and the media's impact on business outcomes. This approach requires rethinking traditional ways of working, questioning everything and using data and technology to empower smarter decisions, to ultimately deliver better business results, not just cost savings.§        §What are we looking for?§        §This is a unique opportunity that is embedded and integrated with creative. We are looking for an experienced media operator to lead all media planning, working with the broader Hearts & Science team for media specific capability.§        §As a Planning Director you are responsible for the effective day-to-day management of your clients and your team, focusing on delivering highly innovative and effective media solutions, building strong client relationships and ensuring absolute accuracy and efficiency in campaign management.§        §You will act as a strategic thought leader and trusted advisor to client counterparts and represent the voice of the client within Hearts & Science.§        §The day to day§        §          §Demonstrate creativity and active participation in client workshops; lead brainstorming sessions§          §Lead negotiations planning strategies across client's briefs, ensuring the best outcome and performance based on specific KPIs§          §Empower, lead and guide all team members, ensuring agency processes are understood and that appropriate check-ins occur§          §Monitor quality of presentations/plans and ensure that strategies are single minded, and work is accurate§          §Ensure in-depth assessment of all communication options, using media research tools to deliver innovative insights§          §Lead by example, be an expert at knowing when to step back and let the team take the reins§          §Know nothing can exist in a vacuum§          §Be an expert at bringing people together, at knowing when to make the call to get the right people involved in the right way at the right time§          §Always highlight to the junior members of the team the power of collaboration and the benefits of diversity§          §Know that a good idea can come from anywhere and you nurture all relationships for that reason§        §        §Who are you?§        §The people who will flourish at Hearts are fluent in digital, interested in using data to inform and technology platforms to enable. More specifically:§        §          §At least 7 years of relevant media and client management experience§          §Exceptional understanding of media fundamentals and strategic planning capabilities§          §Exceptional client facing communication & presentation skills§          §People leadership experience§          §Strong negotiation & consulting skills§          §Fully conversant in the role of each channel and ability to provide justification / rationale.§          §Knowledge and understanding of client business/current issues and marketplace trends/emerging trends§        §        §For more information, please apply with an up to date version of your resume or email fraser.rix@omnicommediagroup.com with any questions.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Planning Director §§Part-Time (3 days a week)§Hearts is a full-service data driven marketing and communications agency, and the third global agency pillar of the Omnicom Media Group. The hearts of our people, our clients and our clients' customers. To do this requires the alignment of ambition, teams, innovation, creativity, audiences and media to deliver a disproportionate share of ROI. This means rethinking traditional ways of working, questioning everything and using data and technology to empower smarter decisions, to ultimately deliver better business results, not just cost savings.§Hearts' focus§At Hearts, we're defining the future of media, using data to sharpen our understanding of consumers and the media's impact on business outcomes. This approach requires rethinking traditional ways of working, questioning everything and using data and technology to empower smarter decisions, to ultimately deliver better business results, not just cost savings.§What are we looking for?§This is a unique opportunity that is embedded and integrated with creative. We are looking for an experienced media operator to lead all media planning, working with the broader Hearts & Science team for media specific capability.§As a Planning Director you are responsible for the effective day-to-day management of your clients and your team, focusing on delivering highly innovative and effective media solutions, building strong client relationships and ensuring absolute accuracy and efficiency in campaign management.§You will act as a strategic thought leader and trusted advisor to client counterparts and represent the voice of the client within Hearts & Science.§The day to day§§Demonstrate creativity and active participation in client workshops; lead brainstorming sessions§Lead negotiations planning strategies across client's briefs, ensuring the best outcome and performance based on specific KPIs§Empower, lead and guide all team members, ensuring agency processes are understood and that appropriate check-ins occur§Monitor quality of presentations/plans and ensure that strategies are single minded, and work is accurate§Ensure in-depth assessment of all communication options, using media research tools to deliver innovative insights§Lead by example, be an expert at knowing when to step back and let the team take the reins§Know nothing can exist in a vacuum§Be an expert at bringing people together, at knowing when to make the call to get the right people involved in the right way at the right time§Always highlight to the junior members of the team the power of collaboration and the benefits of diversity§Know that a good idea can come from anywhere and you nurture all relationships for that reason§§Who are you?§The people who will flourish at Hearts are fluent in digital, interested in using data to inform and technology platforms to enable. More specifically:§§At least 7 years of relevant media and client management experience§Exceptional understanding of media fundamentals and strategic planning capabilities§Exceptional client facing communication & presentation skills§People leadership experience§Strong negotiation & consulting skills§Fully conversant in the role of each channel and ability to provide justification / rationale.§Knowledge and understanding of client business/current issues and marketplace trends/emerging trends§§For more information, please apply with an up to date version of your resume or email fraser.rix@omnicommediagroup.com with any questions.§§§§

We’re on a mission to create more than our fair share of positive change for people and planet and have fun while we're at it.§        §What do we want?§        §We’re looking for a senior conceptual/creative copywriter to join our tight-knit marketing team & develop disruptive, challenging creative that nudges coffee forward. drop us a note to let us know why you think you’re the one to get growing with Single O and be sure to include examples of your work. §      §    §    §www.singleo.com.au§  §§§Please note this is a 4-day per week opportunity that will initially be offered as a 3-month contract, with the potential to go permanent.§We’ve got a killer new role up for grabs – assuming you want to work in a humble but hard-working team, on a brand that gives a damn, in a business where you won’t be tangled up in red tape or suffer death by powerpoint. Still with us? They'll know how to deliver insight-driven creative across channels and be highly attuned to the nuances of current & emerging social platforms. A passion for coffee and an appreciation of craft is a must. In return we can offer a flexible working environment, a respected, creative brand, an engaged and energetic team, and the potential to grow!§  §We'll love you, if you have:§ § §A creative mind, with a penchant for big ideas that challenge the norm§ §A history of result-driven success via earned media§ §Demonstrated achievements in the art (& science) of storytelling§ §A strong collaborative approach to creative development§ §The ability to deliver creative projects to short deadlines§ §A track record of growing social audiences§ §A fearless command of the English language, with experience crafting copy for product-driven or craft-focused brands§ §Experience in adapting & refining a brand voice to suit any situation or platform§ §The ability to simplify complex information into customer facing copy & concepts§ §You'll love us if your ideal role involves:§ § §A strong focus on KPIs & ROI§ §Always going above and beyond to deliver something out-of-the ordinary§ §Developing creative ideas that support the marketing and broader business strategy§ §Working collaboratively to develop concepts & messaging § §Taking ownership of creative & copy briefs§ §Owning the copywriting for all Single O marketing assets (social, EDM, website, blog)§ §Providing expertise in social & marketing across all platforms§ §Leading complex projects from start to finish, working with other departments, contributors & teams to ensure smooth objectives driven delivery§ §Providing expertise on PR activities & strategy§ §Think you might love us too?§ §Don’t be shy - jobTitle: Account Director Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50667993.txt	§Account Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Director§§Advertiser: §BCM Group (Australia) Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Poncho Productions Pty Ltd are on the hunt for an experienced Account Director with extensive digital project management and implementation abilities to join our Account Service team. You'll hold accountability for managing client relationships and client communication, and most importantly, ensure that we're exceeding client expectations and delivering on their business objectives.§ §In particular, we are seeking a candidate with extensive digital expertise and experience to focus on and grow our digital offering by managing the Digital & Technical teams in the design and development of mobile app and website projects. Experience in gamification for learning and behaviour change is essential.§ §To qualify for this role, you need to be flexible, efficient, digital-savvy and always up for a challenge. You will work with the Creative, Digital and Media teams to manage and deliver a wide range of projects from digital design and development, business & brand strategy, campaign management, video production and media strategy & planning. This is an excellent opportunity to work on a wide range of clients; from FMCG, Property and Travel, to Government and Retail, and so demonstrable experience in these areas is preferred. Additionally, you would be expected to work on new business development, actively seeking new clients and opportunities and able to write and respond to tenders with a proven track record of success.§ §About you§ §You have been at Account Director level for at least 2 years and can demonstrate extensive digital experience and a deep understanding of technical process and implementation, having worked directly with Software Developers and DevOps Engineers. You possess a genuine drive to provide a world-class client experience and feel at home within a fast-paced agency environment.§ § §Have a confident and can-do attitude - be persuasive, able to sell work and ideas, and respond positively to feedback.§ §Be able to nurture client relationships and ensure that everyone comes out feeling like they have been heard, are valued, and have what they need.§ §Be resilient and positive in difficult situations.§ §Be able to juggle competing demands from clients and the agency.§ §Genuinely care - about the project, the client, our work, and our team.  Have a strong work ethic and go the extra mile to get the project across the line.§ §Be organised, with strong attention to detail and time management skills.§ §Be a team player - collaborate with our team and the client, and be willing to work together to get the best outcomes. § §Be an effective communicator, both verbally and in writing.§ §Responsibilities include: § §Account & Project Management:§ § §Build and maintain relationships with clients through regular meetings, phone calls and emails§ §Be the first point of contact for client questions and requests§ §Receive client briefs, large and small - fill in the gaps, read between the lines, and ensure they are faithfully communicated with our team§ §Conduct meetings with clients and keep them informed about the current work status of their projects§ §Manage and organise client feedback to ensure it is actioned accurately and in a timely manner§ §Use your knowledge and skills to push clients, the team and the agency in the most productive direction§ §Ensure the creative or digital solution remains faithful to the brief - advocate for the client and our creatives§ §Manage the project budget and achieve deadlines. Where this isn't possible, communicate to the client and your team to ensure any problems are dealt with before they become problems§ § § §Digital expertise§ § §Experience in both waterfall and agile project management methodologies is highly desirable§ §Familiarity with Unity3D - animation, level design and planning, Flutter, and experience using both WordPress and Drupal CMS§ §Understand the website and mobile app development process from UX & UI through to launch§ §A deep understanding of the theory of gamification and how it relates to education and behaviour change§ §Have a sufficient understanding of website and app hosting, architecture, and maintenance requirements to be able to write and support Service Level Agreements§ §Strategy & Branding§ § §Understand what strategic branding is and be able to explain the process and value to others§ §Manage the delivery of a visual identity, from concept through to implementation and rollout§ §Conducting research on clients’ current marketing strategies, customer profile, and market share to develop a strong sense of strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities to improve brand positioning§ §Successfully translate a brand’s strategy or story into marketing collateral and advertising campaigns by successfully collaborating with creative teams including web and graphic designers, copywriters, and video production crews§ §Business Development§ § §Actively seek new clients and opportunities - be able to talk to our capabilities and experience confidently and convincingly§ §Identify accounts that might be decreasing in activity and reach out with new opportunities to ensure that they are retained§ §Scope client requirements and develop robust solutions across brand, media and digital, while balancing the needs of the client against the agency's bottom line§ §Produce compelling proposals that meet the client requirements, and manage the procurement process through to an approved project§ §Write and respond to tenders with a proven track record of success§ §If you’re keen to join a fantastic group of people and work with great clients, please email your cover letter and CV to §hr@bcm.com.au§ §You can find out more about us at bcm.com.au or ponchoproductions.com.au  § §Please note: we will only contact those who have been short-listed for an interview, and thank you for your interest in BCM/Poncho§§§§

Someone who can start to make recommendations to the brief whilst also leading WIP's and PCR's… this is a great client and media facing opportunity.§        §The role encompasses: §        §          §Meticulous implementation of campaigns across all media with a heavy emphasis on digital.§          §Assisting in the development of recommendations to client briefs. jobTitle: Creative Director (Video) Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50581932.txt	§Creative Director (Video)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Creative Director (Video)§§Advertiser: §Loup§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Attractive Salary plus super and benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Loup is a global leader in on-demand digital health and fitness products with Centr by Chris Hemsworth and Emily Skye FIT and scope to launch more§.§  § §  §The Opportunity:§  §The world of advertising and content creation is constantly changing and we’re looking for a next generation Creative Director - one that is able to craft unique stories for our brands with a digital first, video-centric skillset. §  § §  §We’re looking for the perfect blend of practitioner: an expert on the tools to create world-class video content, a leader to mentor and inspire a team of highly capable creatives, and an innovator with a reputation for delivering captivating ideas. §  § §  §Naturally you will be as obsessed with the customer as we are, with extensive experience in uncovering customer insights to drive great strategy and create aspirational content that engages and compels our current and future users. §  § §  §Key Responsibilities:§ § § §Developing and maintaining the connection between customer insights, business strategy and creative execution.§  § § §Delivering creative that cuts through - compelling stories, innovative content, world-class execution.§  § § §Pro-actively leading video innovation - bringing to the table insights, techniques and trends to push creative boundaries, and deliver cutting-edge digital content. §  § § §Hands-on involvement in the post-production and editing process to ensure creative concepts are fully realised. §  § § §Leading and mentoring the creative team to deliver high quality, on brand creative outputs§  § § §Collaborating across all areas of the business on the development and execution of campaigns, marketing plans, and business initiatives.§  § § §  §Skills and experience:§ § § §Creative advertising agency or  in-house creative production/music video background.§  § § §Expert video production skills - able to be hands-on as well as coach and build team capability.§  § § §Extensive experience in a comparable Creative Director role, working with aspirational, consumer focussed brands.§  § § §Experience with concept development, storyboarding and pitching creative ideas.§  § § §Proven performance in leading and mentoring a high performing creative team with a particular focus on video production.§  § § §  §What we offer in return:§ § § §Autonomy and flexibility to create world-class,  leading edge creative on a global scale. §  § § §A collaborative and dynamic team environment.§  § § §An opportunity to inspire a team of highly capable creatives whilst leading them to success. §  § § §Competitive salary with industry leading benefits. §  § § §  §Loup§ is part of §Fitness and Lifestyle Group (FLG)§, Asia-Pacific’s leading health and wellness group headquartered in Australia. FLG’s portfolio of globally recognized brands includes Fitness First Australia, Goodlife Health Clubs Australia, Barry’s Bootcamp Asia Pacific, Jetts Fitness and Zap Fitness 24/7.§  § §  §Please apply with your §resume§, a §cover letter§ and a §link to your portfolio of work§. Closing date: 8th October 2020. §Please note, short-listing an interviews may commence prior to this date. §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have experience as a creative lead in the development of video concepts, including storyboarding? §Do you have experience in the post-production of video content?§Do you have experience in leading and mentoring a creative team, with a particular focus on video production?§§§

jobText: TXT/50473172.txt	§Editorial Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Editorial Manager§§Advertiser: §Morningstar Australasia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [bgcolor="#ffffff"] { background-color: #ffffff; }§.job-template__wrapper [border="4"] { border-width: 4px; border-style: solid; }§.job-template__wrapper [bordercolor="#EF4A4E"] { border-color: #EF4A4E; }§§  §    §      §        § §          § §          §Editorial Manager§          §            §Morningstar is committed to empowering investor success. One way we accomplish this is by offering independent research and great software products to financial advisers and individual investors. We believe that when the investor wins, we all win.§            § §            §At Morningstar, your contributions have meaning and can drive change. We offer a place where talented, driven people can grow. Our differences are our strength; the fact that we don’t all think the same way and encourage unique perspectives helps create great products and services for our clients.§            § §            §The Opportunity: §As §Editorial Manager §you will oversee the team responsible for the creation, organization, and publication of articles, videos and other content that appears across our principal media sites as well as email, newsletter, and social media audiences. Currently, the team consists of two content editors.§            § §            §The Editorial Manager will effectively be the team leader but will also contribute to the editorial output of the group.§            § §            §You are motivated by a passion for helping solve problems and establishing a clear and independent ‘voice of reason’ in the crowded space of advice on financial matters. You will be charged with planning, commissioning and editing articles, features, videos, podcasts, etc. on a strategic set of themes and topics that impact investors today.§            § §            §You will lead a small team of editors and freelancers who cover topics such as ESG, manager selection, personal finance, investing education, and stocks. These editors curate, write, promote, and resurface content every day. You will work with team members to help them achieve their objectives and develop the skills they need to achieve their career goals.§            § §            §This position reports to the Chief Content Strategist in our Chicago office, but also has a close working relationship with the product manager for our individual offerings in Australia. Your peers will be the senior editor in Canada and the senior editor in India.§            § §            §What you’ll do:§            §              §Work closely with the editorial leadership team and individual product manager for Australia to craft and execute the editorial strategy.§              §Lead the Sydney editorial team in ideating, assigning, planning, producing, and editing original stories and curating and adapting content from throughout the Morningstar ecosystem.§              §Collaborate closely with Morningstar research and investment management teams to surface insights and highlight the firm’s point of view on timely and timeless topics. While researchers are subject matter experts, the senior editor should be perceived as the audience expert.§              §Monitor important developments in investing, markets, personal finance and broader topics that impact investors with a view to imparting Morningstar’s advocacy and empowering investor success.§              §Develop expertise and contacts in various asset classes, asset management firms, and the overall industry and investing sphere.§              §On a limited basis, write articles and conduct video interviews with internal and external experts.§              §Engage with investors through social media to grow our audience.§              §Become the primary point of contact for Morningstar Sydney’s media team on Australian investing topics.§              §Track performance of content and provide feedback to authors and stakeholders to help boost engagement and traffic. Establish KPIs and work with performance measurement specialists to establish a repeatable, transparent, robust performance measurement system.§              §With the assistance of other editorial leaders, establish an editorial performance evaluation framework, and measure team members against it.§              §Be a key contributor or leader in designing and developing the agendas for Morningstar events in Australia.§              §Perform other duties as necessary §            §            § §            §What we’d expect you’d have on day 1:§            §              §A plan to establish and operationalize an editorial agenda that expresses a work plan that stretches out four weeks.§              §Begin to establish relationships with stakeholders and collaborators by organizing an internal listening tour.§              §Begin to establish yourself as the audience expert for Morningstar in Australia: individuals as well as professionals.§              §Demonstrate that we seek to shift our mindset from delivering content to a certain place (our website) to one where we want to reach our audiences where they consume content anywhere on the Internet.§            §            § §            §Qualifications & experience required: §            §              §A bachelor's degree§              §Proven skill in writing and editing content for individual audiences.§              §Proven ability to identify topics that are relevant to an audience and execute content that engages and satisfies them.§              §3+ years of experience§            §            § §            §Human skills:§            §              §Superior oral and written communication skills in both English§              §A team player attitude§              §A high threshold for quality.§              §Empathy and the maturity to own and learn from challenges.§              §Almost-insatiable curiosity. “Almost,” because research must ultimately be turned into tangible results from which our audiences can benefit.§            §            § §            §What you need to enjoy and be good at for this role:§            §              §A passion for “pursuing the impossible” through a commitment to testing, learning, and iterating.§            §            §Please attach a resume and cover letter to your online application.§            §Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer.§            §*No recruitment agencies, please*§            §§          §          § §          §Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§        §      §    §  §§§Morningstar is committed to empowering investor success. One way we accomplish this is by offering independent research and great software products to financial advisers and individual investors. We believe that when the investor wins, we all win.§  § §  §At Morningstar, your contributions have meaning and can drive change. We offer a place where talented, driven people can grow. This would suit a photographer who already has a photography business and wants additional work, or a photographer who can only work on weekends.§This role will not suit wedding photographers as it requires you to commit to jobs in advance, not just accepting jobs around your other bookings.§Required skills/experience§:§- Proven advanced photography skills are essential (ideally formal qualifications, shooting experience and Adobe editing skills) - at least 2 years of experience§- Must own a professional SLR camera and lenses§- A professional portfolio showing your family photography work§- Punctuality and reliability - you must be able to commit for regular work for at least 6 months and be available on weekends§- Excellent communication skills, and a sociable, friendly manner and be happy to work with children of all ages (and the occasional family pet)§- Local knowledge of Canberra and suitable locations for outdoor sessions§- Comfortable working in Adobe Photoshop and/or Lightroom, Pixieset, Dropbox and Adobe Camera RAW§- A Working with Children check or be willing to quickly undergo a check§- Must have a current drivers license and own car§Desirable but not essential skills§:§- Styling ability for themed session days§- Experience with newborns/Willing to be immunised for whooping cough and the flu§Additional Requirements§Employees should not be working at the same time for another family portrait photography company, unless agreed upon with management, although they can continue shooting for their own business. This can be further discussed further during the interview process.§We are looking for someone who is available to undergo training in the next 3 weeks and then start working as the lead photographer in Canberra from October onwards.§A CV with example shots or more ideally a link to your online portfolio and a cover letter, must be attached when you apply. No job agencies please.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50656320.txt	§Account Manager- SUDDENLY§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager- SUDDENLY§§Advertiser: §News Corp Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§§What’s the role? §Support the Account Service team’s contribution to develop strategic responses against briefs.§Management of all campaign budgets and quotes, together with the profit analysis to support agency ROI analysis.§Support with pitch decks and presentations including writing, compiling and delivering. §End-to-end campaign management, from briefing and strategy to creative and execution.§Forecast and track key account metrics, reporting on progress to both internal and external stakeholders. §Promote the expansion of business with existing clients.§Support the Business Development Team and other senior managers to identify and build new business. §Who are you?§Five years or more of relevant experience as an account manager and looking for your next challenge. §Significant agency experience in professional-client relationship management working with medium and large companies.§Strong production knowledge.§Has proven relationship management skills with global companies and agencies.§Strong interpersonal & communication skills, both written and verbal.§Demonstrated ability to take initiative and to work independently and within a team§What’s in it for you? §§Collaborative environment§Opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward§Variety of work where no two days are the same§Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands§Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation§Who are we? §SUDDENLY is a content marketing solutions business focussed on helping today’s busiest marketers solve their content challenges and tell their stories in compelling ways. Our team consists of world-class journalists, video editors, writers, animators, designers, audio editors, content strategists and photographers and we work with some of Australia’sbiggest brands to deliver world-class content and ideas for their owned channels. You will be part of an energetic and diverse business that is customer focussed and outcome-driven.§What’s next? §§Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50660218.txt	§Content Creator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Creator§§Advertiser: §Maison de Sabre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§MAISON de SABRÉ embodies the art of personalised leather goods with a timeless spirit. Our signature collection of cases, wallets, clutches and pocket accessories are the expression of premium craftsmanship and design innovation within the contemporary luxury sphere. Choosing to bypass fast-fashion and runway trends, our pieces are the ultimate lifestyle companion, accompanying our customer from day to night, no matter where their journey takes them. Further empowering our customers to celebrate their individuality through the process of personalisation, every piece becomes a unique invitation to stand up for who you are, and what you believe in.§ §We started MAISON de SABRÉ in 2017 to honour our commitment to translating self-empowerment into a personalised creative outlet. Since then, we have created a global community united by a holistic mission to transform the world through positive actions and words.  Constantly pushing design boundaries, our products inspire our community to realise the potential within themselves, and those around them. §We have built a team of dynamic professionals who are well on their way to becoming global leaders. Do you have what it takes to join our movement?§ §The Role: §MAISON de SABRE is looking for an experienced content creator with knowledge in E-commerce/ Ad Creation. The successful applicant will be required to have 2+ years experience with shooting campaigns, photos and videos of various products. You will be responsible to take lead and initiative as a content creator. §As a content creator, you will be responsible for designing and planning EDMs, video and photo campaigns, advertising strategy. Experience in the following areas is required:   §After Effects§Premier Pro§Photoshop§Indesign§Lightroom§Illustrator§Apple Suite and IOS programs§Microsoft Office§2D animations§The successful applicant will need to be confident with working in a fast-paced environment and will be required to push content out by the end of the day. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Senior video producer and videographer - Part-Time 20 hrs/wk Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50678400.txt	§Senior video producer and videographer - Part-Time 20 hrs/wk§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior video producer and videographer - Part-Time 20 hrs/wk§§Advertiser: §Breathe Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§$90,000+ super pro rata§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§At Breathe Education, we help people transform into confident, fearless and scientifically literate movement teachers. We guide them along the path to success and hold them to high standards along the way.§ §We don’t just say that, we mean it and we do it every day; we work damn hard at it, and you will too if you join us. There will be long days and incredible challenges, but the reward will be contributing to something that is larger than yourself. We want you to bring the hustle, grit, and passion to everything you do here. You will be expected to take high ownership and improve yourself constantly.§ §You will be held accountable to our 7 Core Values and will be expected to hold your teammates accountable as well. Our values are what unify us and allow us to make the impact that we do. They are crucial on our mission to becoming the undisputed world champion of online science-based movement education.§ §A great company gives their customers both the results AND the experience they want.§ §We believe the quality of our product, as represented by our video and audio production, is at the very tip of the spear of customer experience. We need the quality to be so good it becomes invisible, and the student can totally focus on the content and their own transformational journey.§ §Our students interact with us, with each other, and with pre-recorded learning materials every day, from watching lectures to attending live tutorials, engaging with pre-recorded content in our student portal and Zoom calls with their student success coach.§ §All of these touchpoints provide opportunities to communicate our values and professionalism, build trust and solidify the relationship we have with our future, current and past students, and to reinforce our shared commitment to those values within our team.§ §A rock-solid, on-time and high quality of audio and video across the entire student experience contributes to a coherent, uplifting and authentic learning experience not only for students but also for team members. Our video and audio are the very voice of our business and we need to speak clearly and beautifully every time.§ §As an online training company fast, reliable and pristine video and audio are crucial to our mission and are at the core of our students’ experience of our product. In a very real sense, they ARE our product.§ §We need you to take ownership of delivering a beautiful product to our students, quickly and reliably.§ § § §Our values§ §These are our seven core values. We hold them dear and place a high emphasis on embodying each of them on a daily basis. Living these values forms an equal part of employee performance appraisal along with role related KPIs.§ § §We prioritise self-care§ §We exercise or move daily, we take time for ourselves, we manage our time and energy so that we bring our best self to each interaction and each task.§ § §We face challenge with optimism§ §We take ownership of our emotions. We don’t complain, instead we generate solutions and act to implement them. When we are faced with a setback or obstacle we proactively and cheerfully look for opportunities to adjust, persevere, innovate a solution or take advantage.§ § §We use science and data§ §When we make decisions or discuss options, we come with data to back up our opinions, and we change our minds when presented with compelling new information. We act quickly and decisively to address student feedback BUT first we carefully differentiate between a small number of very vocal people and an actual trend in student behaviour.§ § §We foster people to reach high standards§ §We expect hard work, optimism and respectful behaviour from our colleagues, our students and ourselves. We don’t buy into people’s stories about why they can’t succeed; instead we coach our students and our colleagues to do the things they need to do in order to become what they want to become.§ § §We innovate and improve constantly§ §We change our minds and behaviours quickly when presented with compelling new data. We work constantly to improve our own skills and intelligence through reading, self-education, mentoring and formal training. We constantly review our processes and ask the question “what would this look like if it was easy?”§ § §We are radically candid§ §We give each other and our students completely frank, unvarnished, and timely feedback on behaviours and the effects of those behaviours. We give feedback with love and respect. We focus our feedback on the behaviour not the person. We do not complain about people when they are not present, or roll our eyes, instead we simply address the problem behaviour directly, respectfully and candidly.§ § §We strive for simplicity§ §We employ 80/20 thinking in all things by focussing on our Big Three and the Mission.  We prioritise tasks that will either move these forward the most, or that will make many other tasks redundant. We strive to design processes, policies and technology whose purpose and use are self-evident to the user, so they don’t need instructions. We remove unnecessary information, steps, clicks and visual clutter from everything we do.§ § § §About the Role§ §We are looking for a senior, experienced producer and videographer for a hands-on role in a small fast-growing online education company. You will lead a small team of offshore editors for routine work plus manage and support all end-to-end production of video content, streaming live and recorded, across multiple platforms.§ §We deliver 20+ live training sessions each week over Zoom, each 60-90 minutes long. The sessions are also recorded on a local drive in HD for upload to Vimeo, AWS and YouTube.§ §We do not have a recording studio; all sessions are delivered and recorded by trainers in their homes using equipment provided, supported, and maintained by us.§ §The sessions are recorded live and need to be quickly edited and distributed to our various platforms (Vimeo, YouTube, AWS) within 2 hours of the end of each session.§ §You will be responsible for end-to-end production to meet these deadlines: making sure trainers have the right equipment and that it is working, and they feel confident using it; leading our offshore editors to achieve quick turnaround and a high-quality end-product.§ §For this you’ll need excellent organisation and planning, clear leadership with attention to detail and accountability.§ §We have trainers located right across Australia who need to be self-sufficient in delivering and recording video-based training. Trainers are non-techies (they are Pilates instructors) and they each need to operate mics, cameras, lights, laptops and software. You’ll be responsible for purchasing, maintaining, training, supporting and troubleshooting the equipment to ensure 100% uptime.§ §You will liaise closely with the IT team to co-troubleshoot software/hardware issues and build a bulletproof system that just works, first time every time, with virtually no technical skill required to operate it.§ §This will form a significant component of your role comprising a combination of simple, high quality, redundant A/V system design, quick and responsive troubleshooting, often in collaboration with IT support; and patient teaching of non-techies. And we mean true non-techies. Like “what’s the difference between a camera and a microphone?”.§ §For this you’ll need strong technical understanding of entry level pro A/V cameras, switchers, microphones, streaming and recording, and the ability to train a group of non-technical people to successfully (and stress-free) operate the equipment themselves. You’ll need to do all of this plus also work through supporting processes where you will not be physically present.§ §As you will be responsible for 100% uptime, you will need to design a simple system with multiple redundancies. We have such a system currently in place, but it will need ongoing upgrades and adaptation as we grow. You’ll personally implement the purchasing and maintenance of the equipment and troubleshoot, setup and support trainers remotely via Zoom.§ §You will also be responsible for ideating, filming, editing and distributing promotional and educational videos of higher quality and complexity. This means you’ll be personally storyboarding, filming & editing these flagship pieces, so you will need high level videography and editing skills. This will also include leading in the repurpose of content for YouTube, Facebook and Instagram, all of which you have worked with in previous roles.§ §You will be the sole person in our company with high level skills in any aspect of video or audio - so although you are a senior and highly experienced producer and videographer, you will also be implementing on a daily basis - this isn’t a “corner office” job, it is very hands-on the tools.§ §This role is initially part-time 20 hours per week and will increase to full-time within 6 months.§ § § §Key employment conditions§ §This is a part-time role 20 hours per week, commencing immediately, and increasing to full-time within 6 months§ §Our team are fully distributed – everyone works from home. There is no “office”§ §You will report to the Product Manager§ §You will be solely responsible for all aspects of video and audio production across our business§ §You will have input into strategy§ § § §Big Three Responsibilities (aka KPIs)§ §You will have many and varied tasks and projects, but these three things will form your primary focus and guide you in prioritising your time.§ §If you get these three things right, you win.§ § §A/V 100% uptime§ §High quality live session recordings edited and uploaded to Vimeo within 2 hours§ §Produce, film & edit promotional and educational videos§ § § §A typical week includes:§ §Weekly 1:1 session with your leader (Product manager)§ §Spend time auditing our video output, and thinking about simple, reliable ways to improve speed and quality§ §Leading a trainer through manually setting the white balance and autofocus setup on their Sony A6400§ §Coaching call with the Student Success team to improve their lighting and camera placement when giving Zoom webinars§ §Spend time on Zoom troubleshooting an audio signal chain problem with a trainer, in collaboration with IT support§ §Daily check-ins with your offshore editors and giving feedback to improve their output speed and quality§ §Liaise with the Marketing team on any new or upcoming projects§ §Liaise with the Training team on any new or updated content projects§ §Perform basic post-production and upload 4 x 45-minute audio podcast episodes§ §Re-edit a short snippet of previously recorded video for distribution on social media§ §Storyboard, coordinate film and edit a 2-minute welcome video for a new course with the founder or Training Manager§ §Collage video testimonials into a 3-minute promotional video for our website§ §Spend time reading, learning, watching educational or self-development videos§ § § §About You§ §You live life with the motto “Two is one, and one is none”. You have backups of your backups§ §You lead proactively, you get it done§ §When you read our values listed above, you thought “that’s me”§ §You are a natural teacher and enjoy guiding non-techies to build tech confidence§ §You derive great satisfaction from producing creative and compelling video content§ §You love keeping up to date with emerging tech in your field§ §You work best when you’re responsible for results, not tasks§ §You can work to tight deadlines. We stream 20+ x 60-minute sessions each week and they all need to be available on Vimeo in HD within 120 minutes of the session ending. We have offshore editors who you’ll be responsible to lead§ §You thrive in a culture of radically candid communication where the norm is giving and receiving well-structured feedback on a daily basis§ §You are intrinsically motivated to learn and grow both professionally and personally§ §You assume good intent, and discuss the issue or behaviour, not the person§ §You change your mind easily when presented with new and compelling data§ § § §Experience, skills & qualifications§ §Live streaming with Zoom§ §Solid leadership skills; you know how to provide your direct reports with a clear vision of the team’s goals, and what “done” looks like§ §You know how to communicate and give ownership in a way that brings out the best in people§ §Experience in a high-growth company of 10-50 employees§ §Experience leading and working in a distributed team a bonus§ §Solid experience recording livestreams using local hardware - we use ATEM mini pro into SSD§ §Ability to troubleshoot remotely§ §The patience of a saint and experience teaching people new skills, to explain simply and inspire confidence in non-techies§ §Live sound recording, signal chain management and troubleshooting, syncing with video and basic audio post-production. We use RODECaster Pro and Sennheiser AVX systems§ §Highly skilled at using studio lighting, 1, 2, and 3-point setups, ability to use and work with natural light and combinations of natural with artificial lighting§ §Expert level set up of mirrorless cameras (we film lectures and exercise classes without an operator using Sony Alpha A6400 cameras) including lens selection, white balance, auto focus settings, ISO, composition, and framing§ §Highly skilled in pro editing software e.g. DaVinci Resolve or PremierPro (Camtasia a bonus)§ §Experience with music libraries and how to use music in an edit for powerful effect§ §Ability to generate original ideas and produce them from start to finish§ §Digital Asset Management§ §Adobe After Effects§ §Using YouTube analytics to plan content and build an audience§ §Degree or similar qualification in videography or video production§ § § §How to apply:§ §Please film a short 5-minute video of yourself addressing these questions:§ § §Why is it important for you to work in a team that practices open, honest communication?§ §In your view what are the attributes of a great producer and videographer?§ §What do you think will be the key factors to achieve and maintain 100% uptime for the system we have described above?§ §Upload your video to YouTube set to unlisted. § §Please also link to your show-reel or other relevant examples of your work.§ §Email a cover letter, your resume and video link to §renee.t@breathe.edu.au§ Cc §nicole.m@breathe.edu.au§ and §raphael.b@breathe.edu.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Production Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50588826.txt	§Production Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Production Manager§§Advertiser: §Standards Australia Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Production Manager §      §        §§Who is Standards Australia?§ We are an independent not-for-profit organisation, recognised by the Australian Government as the peak non-government Standards body.  We develop internationally aligned Australian Standards in the national interest and work closely with government, industry, consumer and stakeholder groups.§ §We are a team of 170+ employees based in a great Sydney CBD location close to various forms of public transport.  We have a collaborative, friendly and professional working environment where we encourage self-growth and career development.§ §About the Role§ The Production Manager is responsible for the leadership of Publishing Services departments and SD publication production.  The primary duty is to manage team performance for the delivery of publication services in a range of media, ensuring that Standards Australia’s content is published in ways that supports the brand’s identity.§ This role is also responsible for taking the lead on how the organisation uses XML and other digital formats to produce content and fostering strong relationships with content developers and the sales, distribution & licensing functions.§ The Production Manager also plays a critical role in the management of change and upskilling of team members,  and will have substantial experience in change management leadership. This role oversees the production, testing and finalising of products using a range of software and media.§ §It is essential that the Production Manager: §        §          §Develops an excellent understanding of the business, its objectives, strategies and challenges§          §Champions the development of technology to streamline activity and improve efficiency §          §Demonstrates strong leadership and cross-departmental collaboration skills §          §Is an exemplar of the organisation’s iCARE values§          §Is extremely experienced in terms of business and process improvement§        § §Key Responsibilities§ §Management, Coaching and Development §        §          §Mentoring, coaching and leadership of direct reports at an expert level§          §In this role, you will manage 2 direct reports and a wider team of up to 17 indirect reports§          §Drive team performance to ensure the effective delivery of services§          §Manage allocation of work and drive improvements in document turn-around times§          §Lead regular team meetings and monthly KPI and performance discussions with direct reports§          §Actively participate in recruitment and selection for the business unit§        § §Publishing Production Work§        §          §Manage the work performed by the department to ensure the customer facing formats publications meet SA’s requirements and customer needs§          §Ensure the team works effectively with stakeholders, including meeting communication benchmarks§          §Provide coaching to implement strategies for stakeholders when projects exceed agreed timelines§          §Ensure the team has the skills to work across multiple formats of drafts and media for end users§          §Manage operational efficiencies, setting goals and process/system improvements§          §Accountable for service delivery and deadlines including KPIs§          §Provide regular reporting and conducts department analysis§        § §Digital Transformation Leadership§        §          §Prepare and train direct reports to be capable of navigating the publishing value chain§          §Ensure that publications and services improve on discoverability and usability benchmarks year on year§          §Tailor production processes to meet end user needs§          §Contribution to new product development initiatives from market and technology perspectives§          §Capability to conduct UAT and system development release/upgrades§          §Identify skills required to support publishing and increase the knowledge of the team towards multi-media outputs using new tools and platforms to support broader services§          §Deliver project plans and project requirements§          §Lead and drive developments to refine the XML publishing process§        § §What are we looking for?§        §          §Digital Transformation Leadership experience§          §15 years of people management/leadership experience§          §Demonstrated Project Management & Operations Management capabilities, with demonstrated business/process improvement implementation§          §Drive the up and cross skilling of the team§          §Strong understanding of digital publishing from a systems and content perspective§          §Possess professional-level expertise with electronic publishing What's up?§ §JOB DESCRIPTION§ §As an Account Manager at Identity Marketing, you will be responsible for fostering authentic relationships with our clients, working to deliver the best of the agency's integrated service offering and ensuring positive project outcomes are consistently delivered. The Account Manager is the essential conduit between client and studio. You will brief the studio and manage workflow – ensuring a happy and well-utilised creative team.§ §This is a consultative role requiring a positive, high energy personality coupled with exceptional verbal and written communication skills. The ability to build and maintain strong relationships with people at all levels is paramount.§ §Identity Marketing is a creative and marketing agency that favours finding diamonds in the rough. If you feel you’re lacking experience on paper but have a vivacious personality, are self-motivated and know your way around managing expectations - this is the opportunity for you.§ §IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:§ § § §Engage with our existing clients and managing incoming client opportunities§ §Develop a deep understanding of each client's business and tailoring our multidisciplinary service offering to meet their individual objectives§ §Prepare and persuasively present project proposals§ §Prepare project briefs and work collaboratively with our internal project teams§ §Effectively deliver creative and strategic client presentations§ §Identify new opportunities with clients and within the agency§ §Undertake reporting and general administrative duties§ §SKILLS: § § §Excellent communication and telephone skills§ §Self-motivated and an ability to work in a team environment or autonomously § §Must display attention to detail§ §A good negotiator§ §Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines§ §Ability to work under company branding and guidelines§ §Problem solving, planning and organisational skills§ §Work to deadline§ §DESIRABLE BUT NOT ESSENTIAL: § § §Experience with managing social media campaigns and knowledge of the backend programs, ie, ads manager§ §Knowledge of how the real estate industry works§ §OTHER:§ §New items as the business evolves. This document will be reviewed and updated at performance reviews.§ §Other duties as directed by the directors, commensurate with classification and training§§§§

jobTitle: Digital Agency Manager Job in Gosford & Central Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50603136.txt	§Digital Agency Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Agency Manager§§Advertiser: §Menace group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gosford & Central Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§A rare opportunity exists on the beautiful Central Coast, for an experienced Digital Agency Manager or Marketing/Advertising Agency Manager, to not only join a progressive, fast-paced, rapidly growing marketing agency but with a potential to own part of it.§Perhaps you’re an ambitious and established marketing professional, with agency experience who is seeking to make their next move?§Perhaps you’re tired of the commute to Sydney or Newcastle, and want to be closer to your friends/family and enjoy a real lifestyle balance?§Perhaps you don’t want to be limited with your growth potential and want to reap the rewards of owning your own business, without the same level of risk attached to starting it from scratch?§If this is starting to tick a few boxes, then this might be for you?§Menace was founded in 2013 by Kevin Spiteri, a well-known marketer, startup investor, author, entrepreneur and local philanthropist.§After moving back to the Central Coast from Melbourne in 2013 to raise his children, Kevin went looking for the optimal Marketing opportunity here on the coast, and needless to say, was discouraged when he couldn’t find one.§Kevin took the risk, with twins on the way, and finishing his MBA, it was then that Menace was born.§Fast forward 7 years, and a team of 10 later, this role and this opportunity were created with a view of what Kevin would have jumped on if presented with this back in 2013.§ §What this is NOT:§This is NOT a typical “job” (employee/employer) arrangement§This is NOT a “time for money” arrangement§This is NOT an “I just finished Uni so I’m looking for my first gig” opportunity§ §What this IS:§This is a leadership opportunity to enter a fast-growing business with a clear strategy, and all of the systems, processes and procedures in place to deliver for clients nationally and abroad.§It is a chance to take control of a business and grow it accordingly.§And this is a genuine opening to take ownership and equity in a business that is looking to have a series of partners running the operation, people who have a vested interest in the organisation, its clients, and its success.§ §To be successful in this role, you need to have proven Agency Management Experience. You understand the dynamics of a client servicing business, production, operations and delivery.§This is not the role for you if you don’t know how to get “your hands dirty”. You like to be “in it” and ultimately, you’re a career marketer/digital marketer and a hands-on executor that understands the nuances of different clients, deliverables and platforms.§You understand agency operations and multi-client management, you have a strategic mind that loves to be of service to others and to establish smart solutions for the challenges businesses face today.§You’re conversant with modern tech and the platforms which will help you work smarter, not harder.§ §To be considered, §please respond with your resume and a brief cover letter, addressing how your skills, experience and expertise meet the criteria above.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§§§

2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Senior Account Manager§ §We are seeking an experienced Senior Account Manager to join our tight-knit Brisbane team.§ §About Us§ §Based in Fortitude Valley, we are a full-service strategic marketing agency, specialising in property, retail and corporate branding and marketing.  We develop brand design and creative direction, through to photography, videography, digital, social, sales collateral and experiential marketing material.§ §About the Role§ §Responsibilities include developing strategy, overseeing campaign roll out, budgets and trafficking work through the studio as well as liaising with external and remote suppliers.  You will predominantly manage a portfolio of small to large scale residential projects whilst also focusing to expand work with existing clients and generating new business opportunities.§ §The position is fast past and you will be supported by our CEO, Account Director and Creative Director.§ §About You§ §You will be a seasoned agency professional with a minimum of 5 years' experience working in account service.  As this is a client facing role, you will have a talent for communication with strong client service skills and corporate presentation a must.  You will enjoy operating in a team environment with high levels of collaboration and team spirit.§ §Most importantly you are high energy and customer driven and you can focus on what is most important versus what is most urgent.§ §Essential Role Requirements§ §*§ Minimum 5 years' agency experience§ §* Experience working with property (residential, commercial or retail) and/or retail (shopping centre) clients§ §* Exceptional project management and time management skills§ §* Excellent written and verbal communications skills§ §* A strong understanding and appreciation of quality design and copywriting§ §* The ability to operate in a highly collaborative environment while managing a variety of projects and competing interests/tasks simultaneously§ §Role Description§ §* Liaising with clients daily, responding to client requests and keeping clients updated on the progress of their campaigns§ §* Developing quotations and timing plans§ §* Developing and managing project budgets§ §* Developing and managing media schedules§ §* Developing creative, design and production briefs§ §* Supporting management with pitches and proposals§ §* Ensuring jobs are delivered on time and within budget§ §* Liaise effectively with all members of the team and foster a dynamic and high-performance environment§ § § §To apply, please forward your resume to §garyt@totoandco.com.au§ for commencement ASAP.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobTitle: Junior Financial Journalist Job in Gold Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50534427.txt	§Junior Financial Journalist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Financial Journalist§§Advertiser: §The Motley Fool§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Note: Although this role has been advertised with a location, this is a work from home position and as such, applications from outside the listing area will gladly be considered.§The Motley Fool Australia is looking for a superstar financial journalist to break news, build contacts and educate our readers. As a reporter for our publications, you will conduct research and write engaging stories to inform, captivate, and grow our audience. §The Junior Financial Journalist role is being offered as a full-time contract basis. The initial contract term is 6 months; however, the opportunity to extend would be available for the right person.§Requirements§Experience working in a journalism role. Experience in finance journalism would be favourably viewed, but not a requirement.§Tertiary qualifications in journalism, communication, English, or related field a plus, but not necessary§Needless to say, however… exceptional writing skills §are§ necessary§Strong relationship and contact management skills§Must have a personal interest in and passion for investing and finance§Highly organised and deadline driven§The ability to consistently generate original ideas, craft thumb-stopping headlines, and regularly deliver exclusive content§Strong understanding of SEO and ability to write with a SEO focus§The Role§Gather information for newsworthy stories through observation, investigation, and research§Monitoring market movements, ASX releases, fund manager reports and more to inform story opportunities§Supporting other content-driven projects within the business when requested§Publishing between 3 and 8 articles per day, depending on the length and research§About The Motley Fool Australia§Founded over a quarter of a century ago, The Motley Fool’s purpose is to make the world smarter, happier and richer. We value thoroughness and attention to detail, so if you have read this far, please be sure to mention purple tyrannosaurs in your cover letter. The Motley Fool Australia launched in 2011, and our US-based parent, The Motley Fool, was founded in 1993.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a journalist?§§§

jobTitle: Graphic Designer / Finished Artist Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50607388.txt	§Graphic Designer / Finished Artist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer / Finished Artist§§Advertiser: §Engine Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§Our Graphic Designer is having a baby so we are looking for an awesome Graphic Designer / Finished Artist to fill her seriously big shoes.§  §We’re looking for someone who is ready to prove themselves at an exciting and highly-awarded agency with a passion for creating positive change.§  §You’ll be a jet in Adobe suite (specifically InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop), have a proactive outlook and a super keen eye for detail. The ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines is essential – as is proven experience in problem solving and multi-tasking between projects.§  §Your job title will be Finished Artist, but you won’t necessarily be the finished article – you’ll be part of our talented creative team who are here to help you grow and develop.§  §Here’s the must haves:§ § §Ever vigilant that all artwork is produced to spec§ §Deliver finished art across various channels – print and digital§ §Despatch artwork/press ads§ §Ensure brand guidelines are met for every client§ §Build creative presentations, proposals and layouts§ §Ensure quality control like a demon§ §Assist the creative team across the wide variety of jobs we have§ §Assist with graphic design jobs when scheduling permits§ §Undertake some admin and general office duties if we need a hand§ §To be successful, you will be highly organised; confident; at ease with proactively making sure jobs are running smoothly; a self-starter with common sense, passion and patience. You will be a team player and, in an industry based on tight deadlines, you’ll need to demonstrate attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure. Oh, and one more thing to add to the list: you must have the right to live and work in Australia. But we’ll make sure you’re never too busy to have fun. As a positive change agency, we put a big emphasis on happiness and career development.§  §If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, make that great first impression with our General Manager, Kym Vercoe, on §3852 5300§ or at §kym@enginegroup.com.au§ §  §https://enginegroup.com.au/§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a graphic designer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50641113.txt	§Art Director/ Senior Art Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Art Director/ Senior Art Director§§Advertiser: §GrowthOps Services Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§We are looking for a passionate and experienced Art Director / Senior Art Director to join our team in Canberra.§As a senior member of the team you will contribute to the creative team, not only by doing, but with your in-depth knowledge of the best way to communicate an idea.§You are skilled at managing the balance between the commercial requirements of a busy agency while ensuring that the work you produce is the best quality. You can justify your design decisions to your peers and to clients. You are a creative and strategic thinker who uses creativity to solve business problems. Responsible for the creative success of brand, digital and design projects - usually more than one at the same time. §This is a hands-on, truly multidisciplinary role. § §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES§Setting creative direction:§ §Produce creative concepts and solutions (based on briefs and strategy) for a wide spectrum of clients.§ §Set the direction, style and tone of projects in branding, user experience, user interface, and design.§ §Lead projects from concept to completion. Delivering impactful and memorable solutions on time and on budget.§ §Create work that sets an extremely high standard and showcases thinking and creativity.§ §Create strategy-lead brands that are flexible and enduring. Lead the brand rollout to ensure excellent outcomes for clients to meet their growth objectives.§ §Develop brand strategies that support clients to achieve their business goals.§ §Develop information architecture, wireframes and functional specifications. Gather and analyse business requirements for digital products and services.§ §Copywriting for brand development and generation of tag-lines, call-outs and brand names.§Creative leader:§ §Lead other designers through creative projects, and provide insight, encouragement and constructive direction.§ §Help and mentor individual designers to develop their design skills, and grow as a team member and design professional.§ §Motivate and influence other designers to constantly strive for excellence.§ §Review and approve work developed by other designers. Provide clear, objective, constructive and empathetic critiques of creative work.§ §Guide other designers to complete projects within budget and to a standard that meets or exceeds client expectations.§ §Identify opportunities for improving design processes and technologies, and collaborate with team leaders to implement them.§Client communication:§ §Present creative concepts and designs for approval.§ §Communicate with clients in assistance of the Account Manager (when necessary).§Must have:§ §a deep understanding of branding and the user experience.§ §a strong attention to detail.§ §the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.§ §strong organisational and time management skills.§ §strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), and be able to get hands on with other design and prototyping tools including Figma, and After Effects.§ §high expectations of yourself and others.§ §the ability to adapt to new project methodologies, tools, and disciplines.§ §the desire to contribute to our culture of creativity and growth, and team happiness.§ §the drive to continuously improve your professional and design skills.§ §a finger on the pulse of design, branding and creativity.§The perks of joining GrowthOps § §How good are birthdays? They are even better here, as we give you the day off!§ §We believe in giving back and give you a day off to help a community of your choice§ §A generous health allowance§ §Paid Parental Leave and extra Annual leave after 2 years of service§§This position is based in our Canberra office. All applications must include a cover letter, portfolio and CV. §§§§

To be considered for this role, you will have:§A strategic mindset along with a customer-first approach in everything you do.§Demonstrated knowledge of social media strategies and how to use them to solve business problems.§Ability to work with multiple clients and adapt your communication style to different stakeholders.§Strong problem-solving skills and client management experience.§Analytical mindset and knowledge of reporting tools across the social channels. § § §Job Offer§§Work with amazing clients who genuinely respect you and your craft§Be part of an innovative team always keen to push the boundaries§Central location / remote work§Relaxed environment - if wearing a suit every day is not your thing, you’ll be happy there§ §To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Camille Brunet on §+61 2 8292 2174§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Your duties will initially involve a substantial amount of basic office administration but will, over time, become more account service oriented (i.e. where we develop educational and promotional materials for clients). §A university degree and passion for the advertising business are mandatory. It would be a plus if you also have a genuine interest in healthcare as many of our clients manufacture health products.§You will be well organized, personable, and fun.
