jobText: TXT/50601653.txt	§Group Trading Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Trading Director§§Advertiser: §Omnicom Media Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Group Trading Director §      §        §Group Trading Director§        §At our core we're a media agency, but we like to think of ourselves more as an ‘activation' business.  Powerful communication is based on the strength of an idea and acting on it to its full potential. This forms the foundation of our thinking.  We actively seek to create opportunity at every stage of the media planning & buying cycle, adding synergy, impact and economy.  For us, creating opportunities is about finding ways to take advantage of a situation, not be limited by it.  This is a philosophy we stand true to for o§        §We have grown significantly over the last 12-18 months and have welcomed several new clients to Foundation including, LG, HSBC & Diageo. With an increase in media activity towards the back end of this year and into next, we are recruiting a newly created role of ‘Group Trading Director'§        §This role will see you take responsivity for the overall management of media relationships and trading output of the Investment team, ensuring strict adherence to our trading process with effective use of agency resources.§        §Your day to day:§        §          §The overall management and quality control of the buying process, including negotiations, across your portfolio of clients§          §The co-development and management of processes and systems across Trading / Investment.§          §Deployment and up-take by the team of all appropriate PHD trading processes, templates & systems.§          §Active involvement in PHD's core ideas development process within Source.§          §Implementation and delivery of ideas for each of your brands that have been identified within the planning process.§          §Ensuring accurate delivery of all trading KPIs, media goals, reporting.§          §Ensuring all financial and contractual commitments are effectively monitored and managed.§          §Training, development and coaching of team members.§          §Media Landscape education for clients and broader agency teams§        §        §Required skills and experience:§        §          §Around 10+ years of relevant media experience with strong media planning & buying experience§          §Strong negotiation and analytical skills§          §Great interpersonal and communication skills internal and external, written and verbal§          §Media buying experience (ideally across all media)§          §People management experience§          §Strong mathematical knowledge§          §Ability to deliver to deadline§          §A ‘can do' attitude§          §Great interpersonal and communication skills§        §        §Why Foundation and who are we?§        §We hear it all the time. Clients who tell us that their previous agency just didn't care. Our unique, senior-led, boutique-style model ensures our clients' campaigns get the attention they deserve, from people who genuinely care about the craft of media planning and buying.§        §It's not just our client businesses that we care about - we also care implicitly for our staff - the people around us. We put measures in place to ensure we don't burn out our staff, such as monthly ‘no questions asked' wellness leave. We support a healthy, fun and balanced culture through many initiatives: Annual Ski Trip, Wellness Leave Program, Summer days off, Parental Leave & Loyalty Leave.§        §Career progression is at the core of our People agenda, as such we offer a comprehensive development program as well as training for staff at all levels, and a number of tailored learning opportunities.§        §If you are interested in finding our more about this opportunity and any others open across the business, please apply with an up to date version of your resume or email §fraser.rix@omnicommediagroup.com§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Group Trading Director§At our core we're a media agency, but we like to think of ourselves more as an ‘activation' business.  Powerful communication is based on the strength of an idea and acting on it to its full potential. Clients who tell us that their previous agency just didn't care. Our unique, senior-led, boutique-style model ensures our clients' campaigns get the attention they deserve, from people who genuinely care about the craft of media planning and buying.§It's not just our client businesses that we care about - we also care implicitly for our staff - the people around us. We put measures in place to ensure we don't burn out our staff, such as monthly ‘no questions asked' wellness leave. We support a healthy, fun and balanced culture through many initiatives: Annual Ski Trip, Wellness Leave Program, Summer days off, Parental Leave & Loyalty Leave.§Career progression is at the core of our People agenda, as such we offer a comprehensive development program as well as training for staff at all levels, and a number of tailored learning opportunities.§If you are interested in finding our more about this opportunity and any others open across the business, please apply with an up to date version of your resume or email §fraser.rix@omnicommediagroup.com§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50584927.txt	§TV Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§TV Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Foxtel Media Pty Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§We’re searching for a TV Sales Account Manager on a §6  month Contract§ to be responsible for maximizing TV revenue for Foxtel Media partners across a wide portfolio of channels. The TV Sales Account Manager is required to develop and service relationships with Media agencies, and key clients to provide strategic and creative sales opportunities across Foxtel Media channels, platforms and sites.§Your mission§§Achieving revenue targets each month and quarter; including personal targets, team targets and channel targets§Maintain a high level of market presence to build and nurture relationships with clients and media agencies§Proactively develop timely and relevant briefs with new, creative and sellable ideas§Acquire new advertisers and retain existing advertisers§Ensure booking schedules are accurate and oversee campaign delivery and post analysis§Work effectively with digital sale counterparts to maximise cross platform revenue opportunities§Thorough understanding of channel partner products and content and work with client partnerships maximise to maximum revenue opportunities across partner groups.§§§Your capability§§Recent experience working within media industry, with recent experience working in sales§Working knowledge of Microsoft programs§Ability to present to individuals and groups and construct excellent documentation supporting responses to brief and proactive proposals§Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal§Strong analytical and problem solving skills§Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships both externally and internally§Excellent attention to detail and ability to prioritise and time manage§Ability to multi-task and adapt to an ever changing industry§Experience and success within responding to media advertising briefs§§Working for Foxtel Media§At Foxtel Media, we’re part of the Foxtel team bringing home Australia’s most valued entertainment experience. Our mission is to provide Australia’s best value streamed and live sport, movies, drama, news and entertainment experience.§Foxtel Media represents the advertising interests of Foxtel and Fox Sports, with assets spanning subscription TV, websites and apps, catch-up TV services and Digital-Out-Of-Home screens.§Working at Foxtel Media means being part of something different, better, special. We put our customers first, we own it, we’re authentic, we focus on changing the game, and we win together.§What’s in it for you?§We have a benefits program with something for everyone, but we’re in the entertainment business, so what would a Foxtel benefits program be without a free Foxtel subscription and discounted broadband!§Above all, we love entertainment and, if you do too, you’ll love working with us.  So if you’re excited about this opportunity, please click ‘Apply now’.§§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Business (Account) Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50602821.txt	§Business (Account) Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business (Account) Manager§§Advertiser: §CX Lavender§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§About CX Lavender§  §The customer is our true north. We create connected customer experience - a means of unifying digital capabilities and the physical world - so we help our Clients become unified brands. Connected experience elicits emotion because the customer is continuously delighted by fluid experiences, wherever they engage.§  §We’re a creative agency as well as a technology company, and all the important parts in between. This means we can walk the talk. People try and pigeonhole us as one or the other - but we've only ever been about customer experience. We research, design and build distinctive, connected experience to bring it all to life.§  §Our aim is to be a career agency - which means we want you to be proud of the time you’ve spent with us. You’ll be part of a collaborative culture where your voice will be heard, and your skills will be nurtured.§  §The Role§  §As a Business (Account) Manager, you will report to the Senior Business (Account) Manager. You will also work closely with the Senior Business (Account) Director, who will support you in continually improving and refining your skills. You will partner closely and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high performing, creative, insightful work on time, and on budget. You will be responsible for coordinating agency efforts to deliver on client briefs and meet client requirements. You will be a key account contact, assisting the team to deliver a high level of service and output to clients.§  §Goals & Responsibilities§ § §Be a critical and reliable go-to for clients and stakeholders across CX Lavender.§ §Write compelling, customer centric briefs and clear, considered debriefs that inspire our creatives to do amazing work.§ §Effectively manage multiple projects and know exactly where they’re up to and the next action needed at any given time.§ §Scope projects in a logical manner with supporting rationales.§ §Ensure timings are always up to date and manage scope changes effectively.§ §Escalate issues quickly where appropriate, manage expectations internally and externally and work closely with other stakeholders to remove any blockers effectively.§ §Act as a liaison point for the client, a mentor for the Business (Account) Executive, and a solid support for the Senior Business (Account) Manager.§ §Successfully manage and prioritise workload.§ §Manage the end to end creative process with the support of the Senior Business (Account) Manager/Senior Business (Account) Director.§ §Challenge clients when relevant, offering constructive and thoughtful ideas.§ §Confidently deliver presentations to clients and internal stakeholders.§ §Identify opportunities for client growth and innovation.§ §KPIs§ § §Client satisfaction scores of consistently 8 or higher.§ §Quality and performance of work into market.§ §Positive 360 feedback from relevant peers.§ §Qualities§ § §You have high EQ and can ‘read the room’ adapting your behaviour to get the best outcome from others.§ §You are passionate about creating high quality work.§ §You are a customer-centric thinker and look at the work through the eyes of a customer.§ §You thrive working in a team and have a fabulous work ethic.§ §You enjoy a high volume, fast paced working environment.§ §You are dedicated to meeting and exceeding the needs of your clients.§ §You are extremely organised and can manage upwards and delegate downwards.§ §You have acute attention to detail.§ §You appreciate and adhere to process whilst looking to create efficiencies.§ §You confidently, respectfully, build relationships with clients and colleagues.§ §You have highly developed interpersonal skills, with the ability to listen, negotiate and resolve conflict.§ §You live the CX Lavender values and culture.§ §Experience§ § §Degree qualification preferred.§ §1.5+ years’ experience in marketing/advertising agency business management.§ §Basic understanding of print-based marketing would be ideal.§ §Competent with Microsoft Office Suite.§ §If this amazing opportunity has peaked your interest, please apply with a cover letter accompanying your resume detailing why you'd like to join the team here at CX Lavender. We look forward to hearing from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobTitle: Photographer Fashion Portrait Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50559747.txt	§Photographer Fashion Portrait§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Photographer Fashion Portrait§§Advertiser: §The Photo Studio Glebe§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Photography§§§§§§Brisbane’s newest fashion portrait studio is looking for the most creative and talented photographers that Queensland has to offer. This is an exciting opportunity for people who are willing to learn, work hard, and create beautiful and unique images every time they pick up a camera. You will be given creative freedom to produce your best work.§  §About The Photo Studio:§The Photo Studio Australia is an industry leader in innovative magazine style fashion portraits & modelling portfolios, with over 50 staff across our 3 warehouse studios in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. We are a studio that is fast-paced, energetic and passionate about what we do. Our mission is to push boundaries and inspire diversity in the modelling industry, while showing that everybody can look amazing on camera. And that’s where YOU come in.§  §About the Role:§Shooting for The Photo Studio is one of the most unique and rewarding experiences you will ever have as a photographer, as you have complete creative control over every shoot. Each person that walks through our doors is one of a kind and brings something different to the experience, which means you need to bring a fresh approach to every shoot. We don’t follow a formula at The Photo Studio, and we definitely don’t believe in a ‘one size fits all’ attitude.§  §What we are looking for:§This is a freelance role, with the studio open for shoots from Wednesday to Sunday, so good availability is a must. Industry experience and a thorough understanding of studio lighting is vital, although we also shoot in natural light.§  §Having the ability to connect with a diverse range of people is absolutely essential. Our clients come to the studio with different levels of experience and comfort, and it is YOUR job to make them look and feel incredible, to find that spark within each person. You must also be able to work well with a tight knit team of enthusiastic assistants, stylists, makeup artists, and producers. There is no room for egos at The Photo Studio, we work hard to create a fun and positive atmosphere that brings out the best in everyone.§ §How to Apply:§If you’re interested in joining us as a photographer please tell us what you can bring to our studio and why you think you’d be a great fit for our team.§  §Include a portfolio of 15 of your best fashion portrait images, both studio & natural light (in pdf form, or a link to an online portfolio), and a link to your website/Instagram. If you have no images taken with studio lighting you will not be considered for the role.§  §If you applied for this position earlier this year, please don’t reapply unless you have an updated portfolio.§  §Check out our website to get a better idea of who we are and what we do: https://thephotostudio.com.au/§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a photographer?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§§§

location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50582082.txt	§Director of New Business§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Director of New Business§§Advertiser: §White Bay Search§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$150,000 - $250,000 + Comms§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Director of New Business§   § This forward-thinking agency is continually looking over the horizon. Specialising in traditional creative content as well as experiential campaigns, they have made their name by discovering innovative solutions that ultimately deliver experiences that connect consumers and drive results. Part of a wider group of agencies, the group is united by a desire to break free of ideas that talk at people. They create authentic, engaged spaces between brands and consumers, where its people, clients and communities are more enriched for the experience. They're a family-first, Australian owned, independent business.§   § They are looking for a Director of New Business who has an extensive track-record within the industry. The ideal candidate will come from a content/creative driven agency, with bounds of business development experience, an existing network to tap into and a passion for creativity. You will be curious. Authentic. A team player. You will possess a full working knowledge and understanding of environments/experiences; production; integrated technology and creative content. Driving new business across the agency, you will personable, hungry and driven by creative ideas.§   § §Household Tasks: § § §To be the doyenne of EPIC* experiences – responsible for keeping new business strategy on track and on budget.§ §Maintain a professional and positive representation of the company both in-house and out in the field.§ §Be forthcoming with ideas and opinions that challenge the status quo to ensure the best result for all parties.§ §Bond with clients and build a solid relationship of mutual respect.§ §Facilitate meaningful connections with staff and maintain important relationships with C-level Marketers, Marketing Directors, Brand Directors and Procurement.§ §Be a leader that lives and breathes their values as part of their work ethic: - We are§ §Curious; They are Authentic; They are Bold; They are a Team; They have Fun.§ §Champion all thing E.P.I.C. Be abreast of new platforms, advancement in technologies, trends and their effects amongst the current cultural climate – Gather and share.§ §Effective time management, organisational skills and able to work under pressure with humour and multi-task to meet ‘D’ day.§ §Reality sense check champion that understands processes, business pain points, administration and forecasting.§ §Think creatively and maintain sanity and perspective in times of great busyness.§ §   § §Expertise: § § §Minimum 10 years industry experience in client relationships and new busines management of integrated EPIC* projects for Immersive Experiences, Creative Content and Production, Arts + Culture, Architecture + Design or other related industries§ §Listen + Lead – Leadership skills with integrity, a good listener that can take constructive criticism with a smile, digest and re-calibrate to accommodate feedback positively for themselves and the wider team.§ §Culture Vulture that is well connected over a cross section of industries/companies that would benefit from the company's offering.§ §EPIC* ambassador with a full working knowledge and understanding of Environments/Experiences; Production; Integrated Technology and Creative Content as our core offering and legacy.§ §Proficient in Microsoft Suite, Keynote, PowerPoint, budgeting/scheduling programs, Salesforce§ §Precision mind set with experience in leading, conceptualising and delivering to mm detail from small to enormous scale projects.§ §Compelling written, verbal and communication/presentation capabilities. KPIs:§ §Manage + Deliver on TOP LINE KPIs over the next 12 months§ §Progress + Develop your skillset to encompass our EPIC* offering§ §Advance client management and business development skills§ §Evolve business skills across forecasting and stakeholder management.§ §Cultivate New Business skills with intention to lead EPIC* new business relationships with clients from various sectors§ §   § This is a huge opportunity to help grow an established business to new heights. You will have influence over more than just your daily responsibilities. You will influence culture, growth and the future of the business. If this sounds like an exciting challenge to you, don't hesitate to get in touch!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Strategic. Collaborative.§ §Using powerful insight and creative thinking, we imagine new brands, business, and ways of working that better the lives of those who construct and maintain living spaces, and those who experience them, to build a better future for all.§ §We think and work differently to most. Maybe all. We focus on ideas with impact. To do this, we believe you have to break down the barriers and get rid of the jumping through hoops to work at pace on the important matters. That's why we've shifted the client/agency paradigm so our team of strategists, marketers, content creators, designers, and developers collaborate directly with clients as an extension of their team.§ §At Trout, our account team operates in a hybrid style encompassing marketing management, strategy, and project management. We are looking for a Senior Account Manager, someone with several years of experience who can contribute and collaborate with other account managers and group account directors to drive existing business and new client growth.§ §If you love creative or keen to work within a creative environment, as well as brand, project, and campaign strategy, managing client relationships, and partnerships with embedded teams, internal and external, to grow an account portfolio, then we're looking for you.§ §Highlight§ §Account management with an inside-out model – day one, you will have an existing portfolio within a large retailer and new business with a range of existing clients across various environments for digital marketing, creative, and brand strategy.§ §Grow§ §You are ambitious and keen to learn more, working with leaders of teams across multiple accounts, portfolios, and sectors, identifying, cultivating, and delivering existing and new opportunities.§ §Squad§ §Work with an established and growing creative consultancy in a team of brand partners, supported by a highly talented team of strategists, marketers, content creators, designers, and developers, backed by a large corporate.§ §What we're after...§ § §Established creative or brand agency background§ §Mid-to-senior-level Account Management experience§ §Well-developed briefing, project management, and campaign experience§ §Exceptional collaboration, communication, and client management experience§ §Ability to manage multiple accounts, portfolios, and client businesses§ §Understanding of strategic planning§ §Passionate and ambitious with a growth mindset§ §Natural curiosity and stays up to date with the latest digital trends, technology, and best practice techniques.§ §If you have what it takes and want to learn more, apply today!§ §No agencies or unsolicited resumes§§§§

Experience the hustle and bustle of agency life, and gain valuable experience in multiple industries. Our team is now mostly working from home and we look forward to go part time back to our beautiful office in South Melbourne. Our agency are big advocates of work-life balance, and are seeking a team member who want to love their job!§ §We are looking for a team player who loves to add value to clients, whilst also understanding the restrictions of commerciality. You will own a portfolio of diverse clients across multiple industries and deliver web and mobile solutions across the portfolio.§ §You will be happy to take ownership of your work, and always strive to not only exceed expectations, but to help grow our clients. You will be pro-active in understanding your client's business intimately, developing and maintaining strong relationships, critically assess the strategies set in place and adhering to strict deadlines/budgets. Working with the our amazing team, you will plan and deliver client work in a timely manner.§ § §As our new digital account executive, you will:§ § §Be degree qualified (business/marketing would be a bonus)§ §Have some experience in the digital arena management (SEO, SEM, Email Marketing, Social Media, Website development)§ §Strong communication skills – fluency in English is a must!§ §Ability to work autonomously§ §Not let stress get the better of you§ §Have Exceptional organisation skills§ §Have the right to work in Australia§  § §Does this sound like you? Want to work with people who don't take themselves too seriously, but just get the job done? If so, please send your CV and cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50633052.txt	§Senior Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Dentsu Aegis Network§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§$75,000 - $85,000 + super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Senior Account Manager §        §Senior Account Manager§ § § § §Who We Are: §   § BWM started its life from humble beginnings in 1996, initially run out of a boatshed in Sydney’s North Shore. The agency quickly established a reputation for working with Australia’s most iconic brands; a reputation that rings true to this day. Our enviable client list now includes the likes of Qantas, Toyota, Bank of Queensland, nbn and realestate.com.au.§   § In 2016 we became part of Dentsu, thereby becoming ‘BWM Dentsu’. The motivation for this marriage was linking BWM’s brand and creative prowess, with the deep data, technology and 1-to-1 specialisations within the Dentsu.§   § We believe that ‘Creativity Transforms Brands. Brands Transform Business’, an ethos that has helped both market leading and challenger brands transform their fortunes through the power of creative thinking. We do this through a wide range of expressions, including brand strategy and creation, fame generating mass-market campaigns, efficient data-led communications and tech-led experiences.  § § § §Role Overview: § § § We’re looking for a gun Senior Account Manager to join the team on one of our most valued client partners. The role consists of the day-to-day management and execution of integrated campaigns for multiple different client partners and across various business units.§ You’ll work on a full range of campaigns for brand awareness, product news and/or loyalty program communications, delivered across multi-channels from social through TV and everything in between.§ You will be required to attend client briefs, manage the high volume of projects, help to research and prepare proposals, work with the project management team to construct budgets and timelines and manage campaigns end-to-end. You’ll be the client’s day-to-day-contact.§ You’ll work closely with your Client Team; as well as creative, planning and production teams to ensure the successful execution of campaigns within budget and expectations.§ § §Responsibilities:§          §            §Managing multiple BAU projects with account leads support.§            §Support the team across multiple projects from research, briefing, project management, and the activation of integrated campaigns.§            §Contribute ideas for campaign planning, content and creative work.§            §Work with other internal teams and agency partners in coordinating and delivering work.§            §Maintain and manage campaign timelines and provide regular updates to your team and to clients.§            §Support the agency team in compiling research and ongoing campaign performance reports.§            §Build a deep understanding of industry trends, competitive landscape and how they impact our client.§            §Confident in establishing rapport with the client, and establishing trusted relationships with multiple individuals through the workstream internally and externally§          § § § § §To qualify for this role, you must tick the boxes on the following: §          §            §Degree educated with marketing or business qualifications§            §inimum 3 years experience working in a marketing or advertising role§            §Knowledge and/or experience in digital advertising§            §This role is very client facing so a natural ‘people’ person is ideal§            §Have a passion brands and creativity§          § § § § §The salary range for this role is $75,000-85,000 + super§ § § § §At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so.  For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§Senior Account Manager§ § § § §Who We Are: §   § BWM started its life from humble beginnings in 1996, initially run out of a boatshed in Sydney’s North Shore. The agency quickly established a reputation for working with Australia’s most iconic brands; a reputation that rings true to this day. Our enviable client list now includes the likes of Qantas, Toyota, Bank of Queensland, nbn and realestate.com.au.§   § In 2016 we became part of Dentsu, thereby becoming ‘BWM Dentsu’. The motivation for this marriage was linking BWM’s brand and creative prowess, with the deep data, technology and 1-to-1 specialisations within the Dentsu.§   § We believe that ‘Creativity Transforms Brands. Brands Transform Business’, an ethos that has helped both market leading and challenger brands transform their fortunes through the power of creative thinking. We do this through a wide range of expressions, including brand strategy and creation, fame generating mass-market campaigns, efficient data-led communications and tech-led experiences.  § § § §Role Overview: § § § We’re looking for a gun Senior Account Manager to join the team on one of our most valued client partners. The role consists of the day-to-day management and execution of integrated campaigns for multiple different client partners and across various business units.§ You’ll work on a full range of campaigns for brand awareness, product news and/or loyalty program communications, delivered across multi-channels from social through TV and everything in between.§ You will be required to attend client briefs, manage the high volume of projects, help to research and prepare proposals, work with the project management team to construct budgets and timelines and manage campaigns end-to-end. You’ll be the client’s day-to-day-contact.§ You’ll work closely with your Client Team; as well as creative, planning and production teams to ensure the successful execution of campaigns within budget and expectations.§ § §Responsibilities:§ § §Managing multiple BAU projects with account leads support.§ §Support the team across multiple projects from research, briefing, project management, and the activation of integrated campaigns.§ §Contribute ideas for campaign planning, content and creative work.§ §Work with other internal teams and agency partners in coordinating and delivering work.§ §Maintain and manage campaign timelines and provide regular updates to your team and to clients.§ §Support the agency team in compiling research and ongoing campaign performance reports.§ §Build a deep understanding of industry trends, competitive landscape and how they impact our client.§ §Confident in establishing rapport with the client, and establishing trusted relationships with multiple individuals through the workstream internally and externally§ § § § § §To qualify for this role, you must tick the boxes on the following: § § §Degree educated with marketing or business qualifications§ §inimum 3 years experience working in a marketing or advertising role§ §Knowledge and/or experience in digital advertising§ §This role is very client facing so a natural ‘people’ person is ideal§ §Have a passion brands and creativity§ § § § § §The salary range for this role is $75,000-85,000 + super§ § § § §At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so.  For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.§§§§

All very well-known brands with scope of work across creative, digital, strategy and social channels.§   § You must be hungry to learn and develop. Be deadline driven and be motivated to get things done in time.§   § §Role§ § § §Deliver all campaigns within budget and in a timely manner.§ §Able to help formulate structured creative briefs and manage various business leaders, departments (social, strategy, studio, accounts, finance etc) and of course the creatives to get the best work executed.§ §Posses awesome zoom small talk with the clients, manage numbers and sums as well as wrangle the creatives and stick to timelines.§ §  §   § §Experience§ § §Must be a current Account Manager or Account Executive ready to step up § §2-3 years advertising agency experience.§ §A proactive, energetic and detail-oriented attitude§ §Must have experience across creative, social and digital § §Seniority Level Mid-Senior level§ §Industry§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Social Community Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50582313.txt	§Social Community Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Community Manager§§Advertiser: §Menulog Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Menulog is one of Australia and New Zealand's largest online food delivery businesses. With more than 20,000 restaurant partners, we pride ourselves on providing amazing food experiences to over three million active customers each year. § §The newly created Community Management team will be responsible for providing the best customer service for our millions of customers in ANZ across social and digital platforms. We are looking for a digital-savvy Community Manager to take control of our online voice and build brand awareness and loyalty. § §In collaboration with marketing and our external agency, the successful candidate will be responsible for developing and owning Menulog’s community management strategy. § §The successful candidate and their team of 2 will be the first point of contact for online customers and prospects, thus developing an intimate relationship with the online community. This team will actively mitigate financial, reputational and procedural risk by handling escalated enquiries and issues arising from Menulog stakeholders (including but not limited to Customers, Restaurant Partners) primarily focusing on Social Media channels, but also through Voice, Chat, Email if necessary.§ §Critical to success will be a passion for customer service and social media, social community management experience, strategic thinking and experience leading process improvements. This position would suit people coming from a PR/digital agency or online content production/media background with social community management experience. § §Key Responsibilities § § § §Assist with the revamp of Menulog’s social media processes to ensure streamlined messaging and action across all social channels (eg: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, TikTok, App Store, Google Play, online forums)§ § § §Develop and own the community management strategy - including communications frameworks and processes§ § § §Provide real-time customer service across all social channels, including handling high-risk escalations and any escalated complaints§ § § §Manage the team, including shift planning, performance management, personal development, training and onboarding§ § § §Monitor all comments on all social channels, review sites and drive positive engagement across digital and social communities § § § §Work with internal stakeholders like Marketing and Corporate Communications to make the Menulog brand come to life on social channels § § § §Analyse social sentiment and identify trends and opportunities to improve customer service§ § §Skills, Experience & Attributes Required § § § §2-3 years of experience within a customer service focused social  community management position§ § § §Demonstrable experience working on process improvements § § § §Strong passion and knowledge of social media channels and digital communities§ § § §Experience with third-party social media management platforms§ § § §Fantastic consumer-oriented communication skills; strong attention to detail and a high proficiency in the English language§ § § §Experience managing people is a plus but not necessary § § § §Able to work on flexible hours (7 days per week between 010:00 am and midnight)§ § § §Lead by example attitude; positive and solution-focused§ § §If this sounds like you and you want to work for a fast-paced, ever-growing, exciting and fun company please apply via seek. § §Please note that all new hires to Menulog need to undertake a criminal conviction check - however a criminal record does not automatically disqualify you from selection.  § §Recruiters will not be used to fill this position. § §Only candidates selected for the short list will be contacted in relation to this role. § §About Menulog§ §Menulog is one of Australia and New Zealand's largest online ordering and food delivery platforms, with more than 20,000 restaurant partners and over three million active customers. Born in Australia more than 14 years ago, Menulog is now part of Just Eat Takeaway.com, a leading global online food delivery marketplace. § §Menulog ANZ has more than 130 local employees, across marketing, technology, operations, sales, analytics and finance. The Menulog business continues to grow at an impressive rate year on year, and is always on the lookout for energetic, talented and passionate people to join our ever-growing team.§ §We’re a fast-paced, forward-thinking, entrepreneurial business, providing an incredible working environment as well as fantastic opportunities for career development and growth. We provide a flexible work environment and a number of employee benefits, including access to discounted meals, paid maternity leave, Employee Assistance Program and lots more.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Strategy Planner Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50609300.txt	§Senior Strategy Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Strategy Planner§§Advertiser: §GrowthOps Services Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§Welcome to AJF, the partnership agency. We are an expert in using creativity to drive commercial§success for some of Australia's biggest brands. Strategy plays a crucial role in our agency and process§instead of being an afterthought. For us it's all about getting to great work that works.§At the moment we are looking for a senior planner who...§...has a burning desire to create work that really works...§...has a natural affinity for connecting the dots of people, culture and brands§...feels that strategy is the fuel that enables great ideas to exist§Experience & Skills§Must haves§You have been working in strategy departments for at least 5 years.§You write excellent briefs that inspire and guide creative thinking.§You develop strategies for day-to-day projects autonomously.§You're confident in presenting strategic thinking and building strategic arguments.§You have some experience with running positioning projects.§You can design, facilitate and analyse research projects.§You enjoy working with other planners and share your knowledge and experience to mentor junior members of the team§You are calm under pressure, relish the excitement of connecting people to brands and have a general optimistic vibe§You make the difficult simple and the simple insightful.§Nice to haves§You're all over behavioural economics and psychology.§You're skilled in analyzing data.§You understand CX and journey planning inside out.§You're all over social media and know it inside out.§About The Role§A great opportunity for someone really looking to progress their career within one of Melbourne's larger and awarded planning departments. §As a planner you are the brand guardian and voice of the people and the heart of the planning process. §You'll be the driving force behind developing powerful brand and communications ideas for the client and will start getting involved in business development. §You will report into the Head of Strategy, but you need to be able to work autonomously and own projects as well as client relationships independently.§You're keen to help develop junior members of the planning department into fully fledged planning stars.§You're keen to get the best out of people, including creative and clients, so that together, we can make work that really works.§Ultimately your role is to ensure that creativity is originated, deployed, and measured so as to maximize the value of ideas and deliver measurable success for our client's business.§You do this through:§1. BRAND: An in-depth understanding of our client's brand;§2. BUSINESS: A data-led and forward-looking point of view on effectiveness to ensure we create work that works;§3. CONTEXT: Relentless curiosity, and an authoritative knowledge of the consumer, cultural and market context;§4. ENGAGEMENT: Thinking that connects creativity with desired behaviour change;§5. CREATIVE: Active strategic direction of creative output (briefing and reviews);§6. STORYTELLING: Persuasive presentation and storytelling skills.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Account Manager - Marketing Agency Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50677457.txt	§Senior Account Manager - Marketing Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Account Manager - Marketing Agency§§Advertiser: §SALTED STONE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Senior Account Manager§ §Overview§ §You are the client’s key contact - dedicated to establishing and maintaining a sound relationship, built on professionalism, integrity, and trust. As the account gatekeeper,  your primary role is to strive for client success and satisfaction across all agency outputs and services. Clients can expect your undivided support, attention, and knowledge around project-related processes, end to end facilitation, and milestone outcomes. You are the owner of all client communication, concerns & feedback - acting as the primary conduit between the client and agency stakeholders. Your ability to effectively project and time manage, means you remain steps ahead of the client, the team, and all engagements - successfully managing all deliverables, on-time with quality assurance. You have a vested interest in the client’s business, marketing activities, and their products/services, and strive to broaden your knowledge around their industry and their competitor’s market-presence. Your goal is to not only guarantee delivery on what was sold, but to exceed expectations, as well as identify opportunities to further grow the account via additional agency product offerings.§ §Responsibilities § § § §Manage, build and maintain client relationships. This includes taking a genuine interest in your clients, their organisation and their team as well as being across their marketing challenges and goals § § § §Actively look for up-sell and cross-sell opportunities that will solve client challenges and requirements § § § §Manage all client engagements from on-boarding/kick-off sessions, including educating the client on agency processes § § § §Schedule and facilitate recurring client WIP meetings, discussing all project/account activities and assets, keeping the client up to date around all project details and timelines.§ § § §Maintain Project Tracking doc updates for each client project, for internal and client purposes § § § §With the support of the Account Coordinator, write clear, concise, and detailed briefs for all production departments § § § §Provide and maintain optimal communication and regular updates across all client projects/activities  § § § §Ensure complete accountability for all communication and context around the project, in order to effectively translate to all production team members, allowing them to seamlessly deliver the project § § § §Maintain and manage your individual campaign/project management tasks§ § § §Complete weekly planning in partnership with the Account Coordinator § § § §Have a sound understanding of the project/campaign strategic direction, for optimum management and execution. This means working closely with the Marketing Strategist on client engagements § § § §Demonstrate a genuine interest in the profitability of projects for clients, and dedicate the focus of your account management to exceed client expectations § § § §Have excellent attention to detail - being confident to QA all assets completed by production teams, before sending to the client§ § §Skills and Experience:§ § § §Min 3-5  years of experience in an Account/Project Management role (Agency experience essential)§ § § §A track record of consistently meeting and exceeding expectations in the role of Account / Project Manager§ § § §Ability to manage multiple accounts simultaneously - this would include retainer, bucket clients and large website projects § § § §Exceptional interpersonal skills§ § § §Exceptional verbal and written communication skills§ § § §Exceptional time and project management skills with the ability to prioritise effectively§ § § §Budget-management skills and proficiency (preferred) § § § §A basic understanding of website design and usability concepts and associated terminology, so that you can effectively present design work to clients and minimise scope creep§ § § §HubSpot Certification (Highly Recommended) (https://academy.hubspot.com/learning-paths/partner-account-manager) § § § §High-level knowledge of how to best use marketing platforms such as: HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot. Bonus points if you are HubSpot certified!§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50618279.txt	§Chief Sub Editor - taste.com.au§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Sub Editor - taste.com.au§§Advertiser: §News Corp Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§A hallmark of this award-winning team is the energetic and supportive environment, which is friendly, fun, hard-working, cooperative and collaborative.This is your chance to be a driving force within this multi-platform powerhouse brand that also spans the website, books, social media channels and video. §What’s the role? §We’re after a great team player and master wordsmith who is passionate about food and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. You'll be super-organised, able to spot a typo at ten paces, and you’ll know your crème brûlée from your crème caramel.§As Chief sub editor, you will be responsible for all aspects of quality control to ensure we maintain our brand voice across our print platforms. You’ll also be able to turn your hand to digital content just as easily – ensuring recipe titles are optimised for SEO, fast-tracking copy to our website and bringing your best on-trend ideas to drive engagement of our recipes, articles and video content. §This is a maternity leave cover for 12 months. While we are currently working from home, this role will be based in our head office in Surry Hills.§Who are you?§As Chief sub editor you will have:§§A minimum of two years experience in a similar role at a leading magazine§A proven track record managing multiple deadlines, while maintaining the highest editorial standards and creating compelling content for audiences across multiple platforms§A love for food and cooking§Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills§An exceptional eye for detail, style, accuracy and consistency§Top-notch spelling and grammar skills§An impressive ability to manage and work to multiple production deadlines§This is a career-changing role offering a fantastic opportunity to work on the country's biggest food media brand. If this sounds like you, we invite you to submit your cover letter and resume.§What’s in it for you?§§Collaborative environment§Opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward§Variety of work where no two days are the same§Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation §Who are we? §News Corp Australia is evolving in response to the expectations and challenges of the digital world in which we now live. We have an amazing opportunity to reinvent our industry and redefine the future of media in Australia. We are passionate about what we do and proud of our heritage of world-class journalism and entrepreneurial spirit. Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.§What’s next? §For more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit:www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Account Director/BDM Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50667619.txt	§Senior Account Director/BDM§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Account Director/BDM§§Advertiser: §GrowthOps Services Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§As a Senior Account Manager/BDM, no two days are the same. You need to be flexible, efficient and always up for a challenge. Broadly speaking, your role spans from delivering projects, large and small through to business development. You're a suit that can do a lot, a master of many things.  §You will work with the Creative / Digital agency team to manage and deliver a huge range of projects from brand development to design and production, website UX+UI design to digital development. We're looking for someone who really knows their sh!t, expert knowledge in these product/service areas is critical to your success in the role. §Business Development§ §Establish relationships with new clients, and maintain and nurture business relationships with existing clients.§ §Actively seek new clients and opportunities - be able to confidently and convincingly talk to our capabilities and experience. § §Identify accounts that might be decreasing in activity and reach out with new opportunities to ensure that they are retained. § §Scope client requirements and develop robust solutions across brand, print and digital, while balancing the needs of the client against the agency's bottom line. § §Produce compelling proposals that meet the client requirements, and manage the procurement process through to an approved project.§ §Write and respond to tenders with a proven track record of success. § §Proven record hitting sales targets.§Account + Project Management§ §Build and maintain relationships with clients through regular face to face contact, meetings, phone calls and emails.§ §Be the first point of contact for client questions and requests.§ §Receive client briefs, large and small - fill in the gaps, read between the lines, and ensure they are faithfully communicated with our team.§ §Ensure the creative or digital solution remains faithful to the brief - advocate for the client and our creatives.§ §Conduct meetings with clients and keep them informed about the current work status of their projects.§ §Manage and organise client feedback to ensure it is actioned accurately and in a timely manner.§ §Use your knowledge and skills to push clients, the team and the agency in the most productive direction.§ §Manage the project budget and achieve deadlines. Where this isn't possible, communicate to the client and your team to ensure any problems are dealt with before they become problems. §Skills and qualities§A great Account Director / BDM is made up of a combination of soft and hard skills.§Soft skills:§ §Have a confident and can-do attitude - be persuasive, able to sell work and ideas, and respond positively to feedback.§ §Be able to nurture client relationships and ensure that everyone comes out feeling like they have been heard, are valued, and have what they need.§ §Be resilient and positive in difficult situations.§ §Be able to juggle competing demands from clients and the agency.§ §Genuinely care - about the project, the client, our work, and our team.  Have a strong work ethic and go the extra mile to get the project across the line.§ §Be organised, with strong attention to detail and time management skills.§ §Be a team player - collaborate with our team and the client, and be willing to work together to get the best outcomes. § §Be an effective communicator, both verbally and in writing.§Hard skills:§ §Business development§ §Make introductions and connections to new clients.§ §Conduct new business meetings or conversations with confidence.§ §Gather client requirements and develop quality proposals that meet those requirements.§ §Contribute to the solution - look for opportunities to assist the client in achieving their goals and objectives and provide strategic advice.§ §Strong experience in sales, prospecting and networking.§ § §Branding§ §Understand what strategic branding is and be able to explain the process and value to others.§ §Confidently pitch strategy and creative work.§ §Manage the delivery of a visual identity, from concept through to implementation and rollout.§ §Manage the full spectrum of print production - from business cards through to annual reports and promotional items. Understand the nuances of suppliers, and be strategically minded to ensure maximum profit margins. § §Favourable: Develop a compelling brand strategy.§ § §Digital§ §Understand the website development process from UX through to launch. § §Have a sufficient understanding of Search Engine Optimisation to be able to confidently advise clients and be able to work with our SEO team to develop targeted solutions. § §Have a sufficient understanding of Search Engine Marketing to be able to confidently advise clients and be able to work with our SEM team to develop targeted solutions. § §Have a sufficient understanding of website hosting, and be able to advise clients of a suitable hosting solution. § §Have a sufficient understanding of email marketing - platforms, design, development of templates and automation - and be able to advise and assist clients with this. § § §Project Management + Administration§ §Competently create new sales, projects, tickets and retainers in our project management system, ensuring the project structure is logical and not overly complicated.§ §Actively manage sales, projects, tickets and retainers that are assigned to you, ensuring information is up to date and accurate. § §Work with the Studio team to schedule work into workflow. § §Manage client billings, ensuring projects, tickets and retainers are billed accurately and at an appropriate time.§ §Ensure client requests are responded to promptly, pleasantly and accurately.§ §Manage budgets and profitability of projects - think strategically and ensure both the client and the agency get bang for their buck. §§The perks of joining GrowthOps § §How good are birthdays? They are even better here, as we give you the day off!§ §We believe in giving back and give you a day off to help a community of your choice§ §A generous health allowance§ §Paid Parental Leave and extra Annual leave after 2 years of service§§This position is based in our Canberra office. All applications must include a cover letter and CV. §An AGSVA security clearance or the ability to obtain one is favourable. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50583014.txt	§Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Rakuten Marketing Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§The Account Manager will execute the day-to-day required tasks of paid search marketing for Rakuten Marketing clients. §  §The Account Manager will be responsible for implementing proper bid strategies, monitoring client budgets, managing keywords, ad copy changes, support development of testing plans, and report and analyze results to maintain client satisfaction.§  §Job Type: Full-time§  §Pay: From $90,000.00 per year§ § §Responsibilities:§  §· Implement and execute on search marketing bidding – inclusive of automated bid strategies via Google platforms and additional search platforms, as well as manual bid changes§  §· Oversee performance of search campaigns beyond text campaigns, inclusive of shopping ads, YouTube and Gmail ads with media planner approach§  §· Execute composure of search marketing campaigns including development of comprehensive keyword lists, creation/testing of ad copy, submission to search engines, testing of keyword variations, management of daily and monthly budgets.§  §· Monitor and analyze performance reports to ensure client targets are met and exceeded over time. Using performance data analysis, develop action items to maximize return.§  §· Support the development and growth Rakuten Marketing client relationships.§  §· Develop deep understanding of each client’s business in order to help customize search marketing strategy.§  §· Work with search director to establish client target goals while manage budget and expectations.§  §· Help develop content for client presentations focused on campaign performance and strategies for growth. Execute on strategic recommendations that drive revenue and enhance the search marketing efforts of our clients.§  §· Work cross functionally to gather and leverage transactional visibility in optimizing client search campaigns.§  §Skills & Experience:§  §· At least 3 years of paid search marketing experience and at least  2 years in customer service is required.§  §· Complete understanding of automated bidding and the current variety of automated strategies present within the search industry.§  §· Experience with qualitative and quantitative analysis of search campaign results including recommendations for strategic and/or tactical changes§  §· Solid proficiency with Excel for in-depth analysis, client-facing reports and presentations. Proficiency in PowerPoint a plus.§  §· Ability to prioritize and strategize based on client goals. Strong project management and multi-tasking skills are a must.§  §· Strong desire and ability to problem-solve and use professional judgment.§  §· Exemplary written and oral communication skills.§  §· Must be results driven and passionate about being challenged.§  §Work Eligibility:§ § §Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Preferred)§ §· Experience with Google, and MSN paid search management tools, along with Kenshoo, DoubleClick (Search Ads 360) or similar third party tool experience§  §· Experience with text ads, shopping campaign. Prefer experience with YouTube, Gmail Sponsored Promotions and new campaigns like Showcase Shopping and Smart Shopping.§  §· Google AdWords certification and Google Analytics experience a plus.§  §· Bachelor’s degree required. Preferably a focus on advertising or marketing.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§Which of the following online advertising methods do you have experience with?§§§

§Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§The Role§ The opportunity exists for a Pricing & Advertising Inventory Manager to join our Strategy and Business Operations team, on an exciting fixed-term contract.§   § The Pricing & Advertising Inventory Manager will oversee and manage all ANZ advertising monetisation across Ad Product Mix of Native, Display, Video and Programmatic Platforms, whilst providing expertise to our sales team across rate negotiations, changes to pricing frameworks and streamlining operational processes.§   § The Pricing & Advertising Inventory Manager supports commercial business strategies by analysing and reporting how effectively our digital advertising inventory is monetised (i.e. yield), observing strong pricing governance and anticipating market trends.§   § During the tenure of your contract you'll be part of a leading global online ad-tech business, have the opportunity to be challenged and developed, whilst working with some of the best people in the industry!§    §    § §Your Day§ § §Develop Rate Card position, discounts and rebate for all Agency and Advertising trading agreements§ §Manage inventory forecasting and provide accurate inventory availability§ §Liaise with global team for cross border negotiations and annual deals § §Own, develop and set pricing strategy for all Verizon Media Owned and Operated Ad Products including Display, Native, Video, RYOT Studios and Emerging Revenue channels including Ecommerce and Events § §Price setting for all deals across Verizon Media Exchange§ §Analyse and provide buyer Intel across Verizon Media Ad Exchanges§ §Build and develop commercial business cases to the wider business to drive commercial initiatives forward§ §Provide expertise on measurement, brand safety and ad fraud§ §Perform market, customer and competitor analysis§ §Develop over-shore team capability with regard to pricing expertise, research into best practice and competitive strategy§ §   § §A Lot About You § § §Experience in a pricing, ad inventory, yield, ad operations or an analytical role within digital advertising§ §Experience working with cross functional teams§ §Strong leadership and stakeholder management skills§ §Intermediate to advanced experience using Microsoft Excel§ §Experience modelling and analysing data § §Confident negotiation skills and a great communicator§ §Knowledge and experience in the media industry, with natural thought leadership§ § §Why Verizon Media § People enjoy working for Verizon because every individual is empowered to push boundaries and challenge the norm. By combining world-class technologies and premium content, we create kickass experiences that shape the digital world.  Together we deliver - for each other, our clients, our users and as individuals and as one, we enrich people's daily lives. Our globally known brands include Yahoo, TechCrunch, HuffPost, RYOT plus more. §     § Collaboration is reflected in our culture. We work together and play together…community days, ping-pong tournaments, boat parties, trivia nights, whole company lunches, sports teams and more!§    § If this sounds like you, please apply now and one of our recruiters will contact you if your application is successful.§   § ________________________________________________§Verizon Media is in partnership with Talent International for their end to end recruitment needs.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50582008.txt	§Account Manager - Work from home or office§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager - Work from home or office§§Advertiser: §The Digital Pipeline§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$40 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Overview§We are looking for someone who loves managing projects and stakeholders to join our rapidly growing digital marketing agency. We’re a tight knit team with a very supportive and fun culture (daggy dad jokes are also welcome!)§So, if you are a people person with a track record in Project Management &/or Account Management (it's a 50/50 mix of both) this could be the role you’ve been looking for!§About us§We are a digital marketing agency (§www.thedigitalpipeline.com§) focused on lead generation in the Property space. Our clients include Builders, Property Developers and Sales teams. §We are a small team, who enjoy the fast changing nature of digital advertising (primarily Facebook/Instagram). We work hard but also value work/life balance with flexible working conditions.§Work Scenarios§Most of the team is remote and we collaborate on Asana, Zoom and Slack. We are more interested in experience and having a great attitude and work ethic over location and there are different work options (we are super flexible):§Work from home/your own office§Work from the Sunshine Coast Office (slated to open start of 2021) §About the role§You are the link between the client and our team ensuring that campaigns are delivering on objectives and clients are feeling the love.§You will work with clients to ensure that the internal team receives all the information and assets required for their campaigns. Then, working with the internal team to effectively plan, communicate, organise and execute projects, going above and beyond to ensure the client is blown away by our account service and lead quality each and every time.§Your stakeholder management skills will also be top-notch, both working with the clients and internally with the Ad Buyer, Appointment Setters and Community Manager. You are essentially managing a small team.§You will also get the opportunity to be mentored and work directly with the CEO. The CEO has over 15 years digital marketing experience from large corporates, startups and marketing agencies.§You will get exposure and input into all aspects of digital lead generation: Facebook ad buying, ad creative strategy, content writing, email marketing, sms marketing, bot marketing and everything in between!§We are looking for someone who can grow with the business (we have tripled in size in the last 12 months!) and who isn't afraid to step up in times of high volume. You should also be proactive in making suggestions on how things could be done better .§About you§You are a self-starter who can manage time, resources and budget.§As the contact point with the client you are confident talking to business owners as well as marketers. You also love improving systems and processes to make things more efficient. §You are an excellent communicator and a quick learner, organised, professional and detail-oriented. You thrive working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. §As we are a small team, there is the need to be comfortable wearing many hats and going above and beyond for both the team and our clients.§The ideal candidate will have a track record of:§At least 2 years experience working as a Project Manager or Account Manager§At least 2 years experience working in a marketing related role§Intermediate understanding of Facebook advertising  §Managing projects and keeping to deadlines§Creating and implementing processes and systems§Excellent customer service skills and attitude§Demonstrate stellar writing skills and be a confident speaker - ability to run a meeting§Incredible attention to detail§Tech savvy, ability to pick up new systems fast§A love of copywriting would be highly desirable§Hours§This is a freelance casual role with flexible working hours (you will bill us on an hourly rate). However, availability between 10am - 4pm, 5 days a week is preferred (we expect approximately 30-40 hours per week). §We can be flexible for parents who need to drop off and pick up kids.§Hourly rate: $40 per hour (incl. GST).§What you would need to supply:§High speed, reliable internet§Mobile phone§Fast, reliable computer§A smile 😄§§§§
