jobText: TXT/50578932.txt	§Media Investment Manager/Trader §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media Investment Manager/Trader §§Advertiser: §Omnicom Media Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Media Investment Manager/Trader §      §        §Media Investment Manager/Trader§        §Remote/Flexible working opportunity§        §At our core we're a media agency, but we like to think of ourselves more as an ‘activation' business.  Powerful communication is based on the strength of an idea and acting on it to its full potential. This forms the foundation of our thinking.  We actively seek to create opportunity at every stage of the media planning & buying cycle, adding synergy, impact and economy.  For us, creating opportunities is about finding ways to take advantage of a situation, not be limited by it.  This is a philosophy we stand true to for o§        §We have grown significantly over the last 12 months and have welcomed several new clients to Foundation including, LG, HSBC & Diageo. With an increase in media activity towards the back end of this year and into next, we are looking for some additional support in our offline media investment/trading function. This is a role that can be worked remotely/flexibly alongside your current commitments§        §Your day to day:§        §          §Meticulous implementation of campaigns and reporting process while delivering on the communication and investment objectives.§          §Buy media and manage campaign delivery tracking (offline)§          §Assisting the Investment Managers and Directors to grow the usage of the different media channels.§          §Maintaining relationships with key media owners and the broader Foundation team.§          §Day to day management of agreed initiatives and implementation of campaigns§          §Ensure brief is delivered/bought to plan within appropriate criteria (budget, targets etc.)§          §Negotiations (i.e. Discounts, makegoods and added value)§          §Budget control, data entry and checking§          §Work closely with the Group Trading Director to ensure that auditing deliverables are met§        §        §Required skills and experience:§        §          §Media Investment experience is a must as this will be a role where you are given autonomy to deliver results§          §Inside out knowledge of all buying tools§          §Relevant local marketing experience§          §Works effectively as part of a team§          §Committed to training and mentoring team members§        §        §Why Foundation and who are we?§ §        §We hear it all the time. Clients who tell us that their previous agency just didn't care. Our unique, senior-led, boutique-style model ensures our clients' campaigns get the attention they deserve, from people who genuinely care about the craft of media planning and buying.§        §It's not just our client businesses that we care about - we also care implicitly for our staff - the people around us. We put measures in place to ensure we don't burn out our staff, such as monthly ‘no questions asked' wellness leave. We support a healthy, fun and balanced culture through many initiatives: Annual Ski Trip, Wellness Leave Program, Summer days off, Parental Leave & Loyalty Leave.§        §Career progression is at the core of our People agenda, as such we offer a comprehensive development program as well as training for staff at all levels, and a number of tailored learning opportunities.§        §If you are interested in finding our more about this opportunity and any others open across the business, please apply with an up to date version of your resume or email §fraser.rix@omnicommediagroup.com§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Media Investment Manager/Trader§§Remote/Flexible working opportunity§At our core we're a media agency, but we like to think of ourselves more as an ‘activation' business.  Powerful communication is based on the strength of an idea and acting on it to its full potential. This forms the foundation of our thinking.  We actively seek to create opportunity at every stage of the media planning & buying cycle, adding synergy, impact and economy.  For us, creating opportunities is about finding ways to take advantage of a situation, not be limited by it.  This is a philosophy we stand true to for o§We have grown significantly over the last 12 months and have welcomed several new clients to Foundation including, LG, HSBC & Diageo. With an increase in media activity towards the back end of this year and into next, we are looking for some additional support in our offline media investment/trading function. This is a role that can be worked remotely/flexibly alongside your current commitments§Your day to day:§§Meticulous implementation of campaigns and reporting process while delivering on the communication and investment objectives.§Buy media and manage campaign delivery tracking (offline)§Assisting the Investment Managers and Directors to grow the usage of the different media channels.§Maintaining relationships with key media owners and the broader Foundation team.§Day to day management of agreed initiatives and implementation of campaigns§Ensure brief is delivered/bought to plan within appropriate criteria (budget, targets etc.)§Negotiations (i.e. Discounts, makegoods and added value)§Budget control, data entry and checking§Work closely with the Group Trading Director to ensure that auditing deliverables are met§§Required skills and experience:§§Media Investment experience is a must as this will be a role where you are given autonomy to deliver results§Inside out knowledge of all buying tools§Relevant local marketing experience§Works effectively as part of a team§Committed to training and mentoring team members§§Why Foundation and who are we?§ §We hear it all the time. Clients who tell us that their previous agency just didn't care. Our unique, senior-led, boutique-style model ensures our clients' campaigns get the attention they deserve, from people who genuinely care about the craft of media planning and buying.§It's not just our client businesses that we care about - we also care implicitly for our staff - the people around us. We put measures in place to ensure we don't burn out our staff, such as monthly ‘no questions asked' wellness leave. We support a healthy, fun and balanced culture through many initiatives: Annual Ski Trip, Wellness Leave Program, Summer days off, Parental Leave & Loyalty Leave.§Career progression is at the core of our People agenda, as such we offer a comprehensive development program as well as training for staff at all levels, and a number of tailored learning opportunities.§If you are interested in finding our more about this opportunity and any others open across the business, please apply with an up to date version of your resume or email §fraser.rix@omnicommediagroup.com§ §§§§

jobTitle: Digital Account Manager Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50537402.txt	§Digital Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Southern Cross Austereo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Southern Cross Austereo is all about delivering absolutely engaging entertainment solutions across an unrivaled portfolio of multimedia brands with the biggest shows, best talent and most exciting events across Australia. We engage staff who are the best in the business and want to work for a supportive, exciting and dynamic company with a culture of high performance. We look far and wide to employ a diverse workforce – we all bring something a little bit different – and in return we give you everything you need to bring your best self to work.§Reporting directly to the Digital Sales Manager, as our newest §Digital Account Manager §you will be responsible for driving Digital Audio revenue through direct & programmatic transactions and ensuring the exceptional implementation of integrated client campaigns by providing first-class customer service and support for all client activity.§It will be your job to find and develop digital relationships with Perth's best agencies, trading desks and direct clients to showcase & evangelize SCA's Digital product suite. This role will require a relationship driven approach and a focus on providing digital audio solutions to briefs.§As an expert in the digital space, you will be supporting the wider sales teams in driving Digital Audio revenue through innovative marketing solutions across Live Radio and Music Streaming as well as video, display and social platforms. You will be comfortable with a data driven approach, and an innovative fast-paced environment. In addition, you will assist in the development of sales strategy, to grow revenue across SCA’s full spectrum of digital platforms.§While comprehensive training will be provided, it is ESSENTIAL that the successful candidate possess:§§Demonstrated previous media sales & programmatic experience§A highly strategic approach to identifying, qualifying and securing new business opportunities§Exceptional influencing skills and a highly consultative and customer-centric approach§Strong analytical skills and experience utilising data to inform your approach§A burning passion for Digital Audio and a keen interest in emerging industry trends§§Most of all, SCA is a §values driven organisation§- If you genuinely live and breathe our values, you’ll be a perfect fit for SCA. We §collaborate§, take §initiative§, maximise §creativity§, have §courage§ and act with §integrity§.§Still not convinced?§The benefits of working for us are countless – to name a few we provide flexible working arrangements, a focus on work-life balance, plenty of opportunity for internal progression, health insurance discounts, workplace banking programs, concert tickets, footy tickets, special client discounts throughout the year, rooftop gigs, social gatherings – the list goes on!§Keen?§ Apply now by submitting your resume and a cover letter, outlining your salary expectations.§COVID-19§§Please note that the health and wellbeing of employees, listeners, stakeholders and prospective candidates is SCA's highest priority. We therefore ask that §candidates located interstate§ carefully consider the relevant state and federal government travel restrictions as a result of COVID-19, and their respective ability to relocate and commence the role, before submitting an application.§ Please note Southern Cross Austereo reserves the right to begin the recruitment process for suitable candidates immediately§ §§§§

We engage staff who are the best in the business and want to work for a supportive, exciting and dynamic company with a culture of high performance. We look far and wide to employ a diverse workforce – we all bring something a little bit different – and in return we give you everything you need to bring your best self to work.§SCA WANTS YOU§ as our newest audio §Journalist§ in Port Macquarie. You will be responsible for identifying, creating and delivering compelling news to a targeted audience, while having a high level of experience and competence. Our successful candidate will be genuinely excited about providing our listeners with the most relevant, up to date news On Air and Online.§SCA expects nothing but the best. We §collaborate,§ take §initiative,§ maximise §creativity,§ have §courage§ and act with §integrity.§§Still not convinced?§The benefits of working for us are countless – to name a few we provide flexible working arrangements, a focus on work-life balance, plenty of opportunity for internal progression, health insurance discounts, workplace banking programs, concert tickets, footy tickets, special client discounts throughout the year, rooftop gigs, social gatherings – the list goes on!§Keen?§ Apply now by submitting your resume, cover letter and an audio demo. §§§§

jobTitle: Junior-Mid Creative Producer Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50664302.txt	§Junior-Mid Creative Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior-Mid Creative Producer§§Advertiser: §GoodChat§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Job Description: Junior-Mid Creative Producer§  §A Bit About Us...§  §GoodChat TV make the best cause-based videos in Australia.§  §Our background is in storytelling. We’re not latching onto the latest buzz word here, it’s where we've come from. Foundations in journalism, advocacy and scriptwriting have made us obsessed with the anatomy of a good story … but we are film geeks too and we love a good cut or the magic of lighting. We fuss over all the little things you feel but might not notice. We choose filmmakers who make sure our stories come to life with natural warmth and humanity.§  §Our emphasis is always on real stories, and on really good storytelling. We find interesting people doing amazing, surprising, intriguing things, and we tell their stories beautifully.§  §We love what we do for the craft, but what gets us out of bed is making a difference. We have the good fortune of working with some of this country’s most forward-thinking organizations making a big impact for the greater social good.§  §If you're keen to be a part of GoodChat TV, read on. (§And check us out at§ goodchat.tv§)§  §So what fun things you get to do…§  §GoodChat TV is a boutique production company, so you'll be wearing a couple of hats§ §Hat 1 – Create§ §More the focus of the Junior-Mid Creative Producer§ §Coming up with original and clever concepts for videos§ §  Advising client on story strategy§ § Writing concepts, treatments and scripts\Leading the creative - making smart story / visual / strategic decisions§ §Hat 2 – Organise§ §Managing deadlines for videos§ §Managing the GoodChat team and contractors to meet those deadlines§ § Managing documentary shoots and productions§ §Hat 3 - Manage Clients§ §Manage clients so they love our videos and working with us§ § Selling the right video products to our clients§ §Basically GoodChat has a 92% net promoter score. Meaning 92% of our clients are our ambassadors. We want to keep that going.§ §Requirements:§  §Any experience is welcome§  §You work hard, will throw yourself into any old task, and are hungry to learn. Your role will initially be more focused on logistics and client liaison, though we will train you up with a view to taking on more senior and creative roles.§  §Bonus points for§ §Understanding the world of progressive campaigning and advertising§ §Marketing and/or sales experience§ §"Getting" social video§ §Experience in an agency or production company§ §Editing skills (not mandatory)§ §What We’re Looking For§  §We're looking for organized, story-smart producers who can woo clients, write great concepts, produce winning videos, organize creatives, and deliver social ready videos. You'll monitor the mood of video trends, come up with winning video ideas, lead the creative on those videos, then work with purpose-driven clients to get those videos out there.§  §You're efficient, savvy, story-smart, and you're ready to learn the "GoodChat" way. You have a great eye for detail, you can take feedback, you're calm under pressure, and you have great organization and planning skills. You're proactive, you can talk with anyone, you work hard and you're super enthusiastic.§  §The Deal§  §Independence, and an opportunity to grow and learn from the best§ §This position is 4 days a week and based wherever you live! The glorious interwebs has freed us from the shackles of geography, so we can choose the best people, wherever they are in Australia (although it would be lovely if you were in or close to Sydney or Thirroul).§  §The salary is commensurate with experience, with a chance to increase earnings through commissions.§  §We also offer a self education budget to help you master that thing you want to improve on (so long as it's job relevant).§  § §  §*One of these will be a 12 month role (replacing our producer on maternity leave). However, there is a high probability the role will be extended beyond 12 months§  §“How to Apply”§  §Upload your CV with references, portfolio of your work and §A §one pager§ on the story behind your favorite piece of work. What was the brief, how did you respond, and what was the result? Show us anything, but we especially want to see §clever, creative §and §strategic §ideas. A video would be really good, but it could also be an ad, an article, a story. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years of digital production experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50670710.txt	§Heritage Collections Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Heritage Collections Officer§§Advertiser: §City of Greater Bendigo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bendigo, Goldfields & Macedon Ranges§§Salary§§$67,319 - $78,442 pro rata + super§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §The City of Greater Bendigo is a proactive and dynamic employer, delivering more than 100 services and working with our community to be Australia's most liveable regional city. The City is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from people with diverse cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, and people of all abilities. §      §Heritage Collections Officer §      §        §          §Part time (0.8 FTE), Temporary§          §Salary Range $67,319 - $78,442 pro rata + super§        §        §In this newly created role, you will support the City’s Heritage collections, including the independent Heritage Collections and Societies, by providing advise on the successful care and maintenance of their collections and providing expert conservation and collection management advice.§        §The role also supports the development of policies and procedures across collection management, digitisation and succession planning.§        §You will have current knowledge of national and international collection management practices and comparative contemporary international museum practices and visual culture as well as knowledge of conservation requirements for heritage objects.§        §You will have knowledge of digitisation policies and procedures regarding public collections,§        §highly developed communication and negotiation skills and the ability to liaise with a variety of stakeholders, effective time management skills with the ability to prioritise tasks and meet deadlines and excellent written and verbal communication skills in a policy environment.§        §If you hold tertiary qualifications in Conservation, Collections Management, Museum Studies or Heritage Studies or similar discipline, we welcome your application.§        §A satisfactory police check is required for this position.§        §Applications addressing the key selection criteria must be received by close of business Monday 19 October, 2020.§        §§      §      §If you require any further information regarding this position, please contact Sarah Brown, Senior Registrar – Collections and Loans on §(03) 5434 6317§.​​​​​​​ §    §    §  §§§ §Part time (0.8 FTE), Temporary§ §Salary Range $67,319 - $78,442 pro rata + super§ §In this newly created role, you will support the City’s Heritage collections, including the independent Heritage Collections and Societies, by providing advise on the successful care and maintenance of their collections and providing expert conservation and collection management advice.§  §The role also supports the development of policies and procedures across collection management, digitisation and succession planning.§  §You will have current knowledge of national and international collection management practices and comparative contemporary international museum practices and visual culture as well as knowledge of conservation requirements for heritage objects.§  §You will have knowledge of digitisation policies and procedures regarding public collections,§  §highly developed communication and negotiation skills and the ability to liaise with a variety of stakeholders, effective time management skills with the ability to prioritise tasks and meet deadlines and excellent written and verbal communication skills in a policy environment.§  §If you hold tertiary qualifications in Conservation, Collections Management, Museum Studies or Heritage Studies or similar discipline, we welcome your application.§  §A satisfactory police check is required for this position.§  §Applications addressing the key selection criteria must be received by close of business Monday 19 October, 2020.§§§§§

jobTitle: Be You Content Editor Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709156.txt	§Be You Content Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Be You Content Editor§§Advertiser: §Beyond Blue§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§Beyond Blue's vision is that all people in Australia achieve their best possible mental health. Our mission is to promote good mental health. We create change to protect everyone's mental health and improve the lives of individuals, families and communities affected by anxiety, depression and suicide. We value collaboration, respect, enthusiasm, excellence, innovation and integrity. § §The Be You program is a national initiative for educators, aimed at promoting and protecting positive mental health in children and young people. Our vision is that every learning community is positive, inclusive, and resilient – a place where every child, young person, educator, and family can achieve their best possible mental health. Be You helps educators develop their mental health skills and knowledge through online learning, fact sheets, webinars and other resources.§  §Accountabilities include but are not limited to:§§Content editing and development§§Write, edit, proofread, and review new and existing Be You content, with a focus on maintaining a consistent voice, tone and brand across all resources.§ §Use analytics, research insights and feedback to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement across content.§ §Upload content to website via content management system.§ §Participate in process improvement activities to support the delivery of the Content Activity Plan.§ §§Project Management§§Provide high quality written documents as requested.§ §Commission and develop innovative print and digital content.§ §Ensure any participation in project management activities is undertaken in accordance with Beyond Blue processes.§ §§Stakeholder management (internal and external)§§Work collaboratively with other teams across Be You and Beyond Blue as necessary to deliver content work.§ §Build strong relationships and actively participate in all meetings with stakeholders, including Taskforces as necessary, ensuring clear communication regarding expectations associated with projects and associated activities.§ §Consult with subject matter experts and key stakeholders to ensure Be You reflects community and stakeholder needs whilst complying with relevant clinical, educational, evaluative and compliance professional standards.§ §The successful candidate will have: §§Proven relevant experience in a similar role, preferably within education, mental or public health and/or similar community-based programs.§ §Relevant experience in creating and developing content for educators.§ §Advanced written and verbal communication skills with ability to readily adapt to communicating effectively to any given audience.§ §Beyond Blue is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age. §We strongly encourage people from all cultural backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. §Applicants are welcome to access the Beyond Blue Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan §2020-2022§. [link removed] www.beyondblue.org.au/about-us/about-our-work/aboriginal-and-torres-strait-islander-people-program/our-reconciliation-action-plan§ §§To apply§, please click the 'Apply' button below. Applications should include a current CV with a cover letter that addresses why you would consider yourself to be a cultural addition to Beyond Blue and how your skills and experience would be attributes to the position. Applications close on §Friday 16 October 2020,§ if you're viewing this advertisement on another website, a current position description [link removed] can be found on our careers page. §Preferred candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening, including a National Police Check and where required a Working With Children Check.§§§§

Based in our Sydney office, you’ll be working with a dynamic team of likeminded individuals who innovate on a daily basis and know how to have fun.§ §Who You Are§ §You’ll be a passionate content creator with previous experience in the fast-paced world of digital. To be successful in this role, ideally, you’ll have:§ § §Three years’ experience producing video content§ §Digital experience within radio or a similar media environment§ §Experience in promoting content other forms of content (such as podcasts) using video§ §Experience with Premiere Pro and After Effects§ §Tertiary qualifications in a relevant media or journalistic field§ §Demonstrated usage of web CMS platforms§ §Demonstrated usage of analytics platforms and SEO§ §Be willing to work breakfast hours.§ § §What's On Offer?§ § §A fun and vibrant workplace culture with the genuine prospects of internal promotions, lateral moves and secondments.§ §Workplace flexibility and the ability to work efficiently to achieve a genuine work-life balance§ §An additional day of leave each year on your work anniversary and bonus week of leave at 3 and 6 years of service.§ §Unlimited access to our Life+ Wellbeing program and Glue+Perks benefits program§ § §What We Need From You§ §Along with your CV and cover letter, please include your show reel and examples of video content you’ve created which reflect the Nova style.§ §Please note: as part of the application process you will need to be willing to showcase your skills practically if required.§ §If this sounds like the perfect job for you, apply now!§ § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50712289.txt	§Digital Social Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Social Specialist§§Advertiser: §Surf Life Saving Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital Social Specialist §      §        §Surf Life Saving Australia (SLSA) exists to save lives, create great Australians and build better communities. As one of Australia's most respected community organisations and a world leader in lifesaving, coastal public safety, rescue and education services, SLSA provides many ways to get involved as a volunteer or employee. The Brisbane based Surf Lifesaving Foundation is the national fundraising body for Surf Life Saving in Australia. We rely heavily on the support of the community to continue to provide this vital service that helps keep our beaches safe and protect our Australian way of life.§        §        §Our Bowen Hills office is looking for a motivated and proactive §Digital Performance Marketing Specialist §to join their Community Fundraising team.§        §        §The Digital Performance Marketing Specialist works within the Community Fundraising department on the development and implementation of the digital marketing strategy for all fundraising campaigns and projects.§        §The Digital Performance Marketing Specialist contributes to community fundraising goals and activities through managing digital marketing strategy. §        §Key Responsibilities§        §          §Digital campaign management, planning and implementation, stakeholder management, including relevant agencies§          §Manage website development through analysing customer behaviour and optimising sites to suit unique customer journeys, whilst contributing to digital communications strategy to improve visitation to both of our websites §          §Manage lottery and donor's social media accounts and implement social advertising strategy with agency vendors §          §Liaise with the ICT function and other key development and operational roles to build the required digital platforms and portals to meet organisational objectives§          §Develop and implement effective lead generation programs for community fundraising§          §Prepare the SEO and SEM strategy for community fundraising, and implement in conjunction with agency vendors and the lottery and donor team §          §Plan, manage and execute digital campaigns (SEO, SEM, pay-per-click marketing, re-targeting, social media, email and web conversion) in collaboration with the lottery and donor team§          §Maintain a strong understanding of digital customer trends, in order to present business cases and apply new developments in website, plug in, app and other digital functionality that benefits our customers and the organisation's goals§          §Develop and implement effective digital customer journeys for donor and lottery §          §Research and analyse charity competitors to continually improve community fundraising results in addition to tracking and reporting on the overall customer satisfaction of the donor and lottery digital offering, and suggesting improvements and issues as they are identified  §          §Development and management of donor and lottery digital personas, including ongoing research, segmentation and targeting strategy as part of the wider campaign plan§          §Utilise your skills and experience to regularly research and report on keyword discovery, expansion and optimisation§          § Develop and implement effective digital performance analytics, reporting, dashboards and data sources, to deliver valuable management reporting on digital performance, and inclusion and use of relevant digital data, in conjunction with the foundation data analysts and ICT§          §Develop and own the implementation of the community fundraising digital roadmap strategy, that steers SLSA towards a future-ready digital technology platform, and ensures that it is realising possible opportunities in the eCommerce and digital environment for fundraising §        §        §Qualifications§        §          §Tertiary qualifications and/or equivalent relevant experience in digital marketing§        §        §Knowledge and experience §        §          §Significant experience in a digital eCommerce and acquisition role§          §Strong digital and interactive marketing experience§          §Project management participation and/or ownership in an IT environment§          §Digital media planning and buying§          §Primarily a combination of campaign strategy, project management, analytics, technical digital skills and consumer insight§        §        §Skills and attributes§        §          §Professional and articulate communicator, both written and verbal§          §Ability to liaise, mediate and negotiate with all levels of staff and management§          §Engaging and collaborative team member §          §Ability to show initiative, prioritise competing work demands and meet deadlines§        §        §How to apply:§        §If you can demonstrate your capabilities and attributes in the above areas and have the motivation, desire, and skill set to be challenged in this role and further your career with one of Australia's most iconic brands, §APPLY NOW!§        §This is a full-time position, working 38 hours per week and is based at our offices in Bowen Hills.§        §Applications close 5pm on Friday 30 October 2020.§        §Please note:§ only applicants with the eligibility to work in Australia will be considered. §        §SLSA is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to safeguarding children and young people. All candidates may be required to undertake a working with children check.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Surf Life Saving Australia (SLSA) exists to save lives, create great Australians and build better communities. As one of Australia's most respected community organisations and a world leader in lifesaving, coastal public safety, rescue and education services, SLSA provides many ways to get involved as a volunteer or employee. This is why we tell urgent contemporary stories with diverse artists, for diverse audiences, in unconventional places.§ §We are looking for a §Creative Producer§ to contribute to the conception and oversee the delivery of various projects within UTP’s Artistic and Education Programs. This role has a particular focus on educational and community facing programs and projects.§ § This includes managing key relationships with artists, participants, project partners and community. This role includes working with the Artistic Director and Senior Producer to ensure projects are adequately resourced, delivered on budget and meet desired outcomes.§ § The §Creative Producer§ contributes to the overall curatorial framework of the organisation. They are also hands on liaising with artists, venues and partners in order to produce high quality artistic and community driven projects.§ §Inclusion and diversity are priorities for UTP. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander individuals, as well as applicants from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse backgrounds. Disabled candidates are also strongly encouraged to apply. § §POSITION DESCRIPTION - CREATIVE PRODUCER§ §Basis of employment: §Part time (4 days) in 2020 to full time in 2021§ §Salary Package: §$72,100 per annum (pro rata), plus superannuation§ §Employment Conditions: §4 weeks annual leave (pro rata)§ §Contract: §Through until the end of 2021 with potential for renewal§ §Location: §Currently working from home, normally based at Bankstown Arts Centre§ §Closing Date: §Monday 19 October§ §Contact: §Bronwyn@urbantheatre.com.au§ §RESPONSIBILITIES§ §Producing§ § §Contribute to artistic program and education program planning.§ §Oversee and assist with the delivery of UTP’s artistic program working closely with the Senior Producer and Artistic Director/CEO.§ §Liaise with the artistic teams, partners and project staff to deliver UTP projects to a high quality.§ §Lead producer on projects, determined in collaboration with the Artistic Director/CEO.§ §Manage project budgets and contribute to UTP’s annual program budget.§ §Administration of projects and contract management.§ §Brief the Marketing Manager to ensure all projects marketing copy; imagery and documentation are fulfilled.§ §Facilitate project debriefs.§ §Keep across industry trends in the arts community nationally and internationally.§ §SELECTION CRITERIA§ §Essential§ § §A strong track record of producing projects of varying scale in the theatre/ performance/ visual arts.§ §Extensive budget, contracting and project management experience.§ §Experience producing performance and/or community-based works of scale.§ §Self-motivated and ability to work in a small team.§ §Passion for the Western Sydney arts and cultural sector.§ §Ability to provide opportunities for young people to engage in creative life.§ §Demonstrated ability to work with artists and communities with different backgrounds/ sensitivities/ needs (First Nations communities and artists/ artists and communities with diverse cultural backgrounds/ the LGBITQA+ community/ artists and communities who live with disability etc).§ § §Desirable§ § §Experience developing and delivering educational offerings that generate revenue.§ §Experience writing successful grant applications.§ §Experience developing pitches to philanthropic foundations.§ §Experience delivering arts programs within an education setting (museums / institutions / schools / universities).§ §Experience working with/in communities in Western Sydney.§ §Experience working on projects delivered using digital technologies.§ §APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS§ § § §CV/Resume no more than three pages.§ §A cover letter addressing the key responsibilities and selection criteria.§ §Contact details for two referees.§ §Shortlisted applications will be contacted by Friday 23 October.§ §Interviews will take place the week of Monday 26 October.§ §Contact§: §Bronwyn@urbantheatre.com.au§§§§

jobText: TXT/50537424.txt	§Digital Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Southern Cross Austereo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Southern Cross Austereo is all about delivering absolutely engaging entertainment solutions across an unrivalled portfolio of multimedia brands with the biggest shows, best talent and most exciting events across Australia. We engage staff who are the best in the business and want to work for a supportive, exciting and dynamic company with a culture of high performance. We look far and wide to employ a diverse workforce – we all bring something a little bit different – and in return we give you everything you need to bring your best self to work.§Reporting directly to the Digital Sales Manager, as our newest §Digital Account Manager §you will be responsible for driving Digital Audio revenue through direct & programmatic transactions and ensuring the exceptional implementation of integrated client campaigns by providing first-class customer service and support for all client activity.§It will be your job to find and develop digital relationships with Sydney's best agencies, trading desks and direct clients to showcase & evangelize SCA's Digital product suite. This role will require a relationship driven approach and a focus on providing digital audio solutions to briefs.§As an expert in the digital space, you will be supporting the wider sales teams in driving Digital Audio revenue through innovative marketing solutions across Live Radio and Music Streaming as well as video, display and social platforms. You will be comfortable with a data driven approach, and an innovative fast-paced environment. In addition, you will assist in the development of sales strategy, to grow revenue across SCA’s full spectrum of digital platforms.§While comprehensive training will be provided, it is ESSENTIAL that the successful candidate possess:§§Demonstrated previous media sales & programmatic experience§A highly strategic approach to identifying, qualifying and securing new business opportunities§Exceptional influencing skills and a highly consultative and customer-centric approach§Strong analytical skills and experience utilising data to inform your approach§A burning passion for Digital Audio and a keen interest in emerging industry trends§§Most of all, SCA is a §values driven organisation§- If you genuinely live and breathe our values, you’ll be a perfect fit for SCA. We §collaborate§, take §initiative§, maximise §creativity§, have §courage§ and act with §integrity§.§Still not convinced?§The benefits of working for us are countless – to name a few we provide flexible working arrangements, a focus on work-life balance, plenty of opportunity for internal progression, health insurance discounts, workplace banking programs, concert tickets, footy tickets, special client discounts throughout the year, rooftop gigs, social gatherings – the list goes on!§Keen?§ Apply now by submitting your resume and a cover letter, outlining your salary expectations. §COVID-19§§Please note that the health and wellbeing of employees, listeners, stakeholders and prospective candidates is SCA's highest priority. We therefore ask that §candidates located interstate§ carefully consider the relevant state and federal government travel restrictions as a result of COVID-19, and their respective ability to relocate and commence the role, before submitting an application.§Please note Southern Cross Austereo reserves the right to begin the recruitment process for suitable candidates immediately§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50555354.txt	§Senior Creative English Copywriter (Mandarin Speaking)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Creative English Copywriter (Mandarin Speaking)§§Advertiser: §Access Corporate Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§About the Company§ §Founded in Australia in 2017, Access Corporate Group (Access) is an innovative cross-border brand management group with offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Hangzhou, China and more than 1,000 employees globally. At present, Access manages more than 20 brands and is committed to building a bridge for direct communications between quality brands and consumers around the world. Access is devoted to bringing global leading brands in health, beauty, and lifestyle to consumers to lead a better life every day.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Exceptional all round writing skills§ §Experience engaging with clients directly§ §Ability to think strategically & plan§ §Solid research and info gathering skills§ §Corporate branding communications and brand advertising § §Adhere to brand tone of voice guides§ §Ability to edit and proof§ §Hunger to work hard & do what's needed§ §Passion for the industry and our business§ §Fast - you are efficient & practical§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Desire to learn and grow professionally§ §Can time manage & juggle multiple deadlines§ §Initiative to find solutions proactively§ §Lead by example & team player§ §Manage agency to ensure good quality of deliverables§ § § §Key Requirements§ § §We are looking for someone who is intelligent, has the creative flair and a curious mind that can channel a brand voice accurately. Ideally, you would have 3-6 years’ experience in the industry, preferably with a strong understanding of creative writing as well as understand both Australian and Chinese cultural context.§ §The right candidate will have previous experience with creative agency for online and offline advertising.  Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks to the deadline is a must. § §While your skills and experience are important, a positive attitude and problem solving, glass-half-full attitude is what we are looking for.§ §You will have experience identify and develop interesting story angles as well as interpreting data to inform your content development and track performance content online (web/social).§ §While this role is an English native copywriter, this candidate must speak Mandarin as well.§ §Preferred:§ § §Other digital marketing experience§ §Exposure to health beauty and lifestyle industry§ §Set up of ad campaigns§ § § §To apply, please don't hesitate to click on "Apply Now" and submit your updated resume. §§§§

following skills are desirable and will be highly regarded:§ § §Extensive Wine, Spirits, Beer or other relatable Hospitality industry experience§ §Demonstrated experience in FMCG branding and packaging§ §Marketing skills and/or qualifications§ §Design skills and/or qualifications§ §Global project and client experience§ §Suitable applicants are encouraged to supply a cover letter and tailored CV to careers@co-partnership.com with the subject : FULL NAME_Account Director§ §Depending on the volume of applications received, we will endeavour to respond to all applicants. Keep reading. §        § §        §This role has a LONG list of perks, including:§        §          §5 weeks paid annual leave§          §Lunch, fancy coffee, and snacks on the company every day you're in the office§          §Ingrained diversity in the team as a cultural strength§          §Health insurance for both you AND the fam§          §Working remotely, but comfortable in the knowledge that if/when an office is on the cards, it's dog friendly :)§          §A family-friendly business, including flexibility with pick up & drop off should you need§          §A solid commitment to personal development and growth.§        §        § §        §Role remit:§        §          §Excellent campaign performance across end to end campaign ownership and performance monitoring§          §Use data to enhance buying decisions, resulting in over-achievement vs. client- stated KPIs and internal profit objectives§          §Use insights to build client rapport to up-sell and earn incremental opportunity§        §        § §        §Here's what we'd love to see in your background:§        §          §Experience trading digital programmatic campaigns§          §Commercial experience§          §Experience working in client-facing environment would be an advantage§        §        § §        §A little on your skills:§        §          §Strong mathematical and analytical skills §          §Technically and analytically astute within the field of digital programmatic trading§          §The ability to work with large data sets in Excel files and BI internal tools§          §Working knowledge of statistical models§          §Strong working knowledge of SQL, R, Python, or Bonsai (especially) is an advantage§          §Strong troubleshooting ability, clear systematic approach to problem-solving§          §A passion for AdTech - you're on top of industry trends and actively stay abreast of new innovations & solutions§          §Energy and a high degree of self-motivation §        §        § §        §Want in? Apply today, or for further Q's contact Emily Haydon via §emily@thetalentconnective.com§      §      §The Talent Connective is a profit-for-purpose recruitment firm and certified B Corporation. In partnership with The Hunger Project Australia, every placement we make helps communities in India, Africa & Bangladesh. §    §  §§§This is a role for someone with AdTech in their blood.  You've got a passion for programmatic and digital technologies and could talk marketing intelligence in your sleep.  Want to work with the experts in data science, analytics, and programmatic trading? Keep reading. § § § §This role has a LONG list of perks, including:§ § §5 weeks paid annual leave§ §Lunch, fancy coffee, and snacks on the company every day you're in the office§ §Ingrained diversity in the team as a cultural strength§ §Health insurance for both you AND the fam§ §Working remotely, but comfortable in the knowledge that if/when an office is on the cards, it's dog friendly :)§ §A family-friendly business, including flexibility with pick up & drop off should you need§ §A solid commitment to personal development and growth.§ § § §Role remit:§ § §Excellent campaign performance across end to end campaign ownership and performance monitoring§ §Use data to enhance buying decisions, resulting in over-achievement vs. client- stated KPIs and internal profit objectives§ §Use insights to build client rapport to up-sell and earn incremental opportunity§ § § §Here's what we'd love to see in your background:§ § §Experience trading digital programmatic campaigns§ §Commercial experience§ §Experience working in client-facing environment would be an advantage§ § § §A little on your skills:§ § §Strong mathematical and analytical skills § §Technically and analytically astute within the field of digital programmatic trading§ §The ability to work with large data sets in Excel files and BI internal tools§ §Working knowledge of statistical models§ §Strong working knowledge of SQL, R, Python, or Bonsai (especially) is an advantage§ §Strong troubleshooting ability, clear systematic approach to problem-solving§ §A passion for AdTech - you're on top of industry trends and actively stay abreast of new innovations & solutions§ §Energy and a high degree of self-motivation § § § §Want in? Apply today, or for further Q's contact Emily Haydon via §emily@thetalentconnective.com§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Visual Designer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50555351.txt	§Senior Visual Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Visual Designer§§Advertiser: §Access Corporate Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§About the Company§ §Founded in Australia in 2017, Access Corporate Group (Access) is an innovative cross-border brand management group with offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Hangzhou, China and more than 1,000 employees globally. At present, Access manages more than 20 brands and is committed to building a bridge for direct communications between quality brands and consumers around the world. Access is devoted to bringing global leading brands in health, beauty, and lifestyle to consumers to lead a better life every day.§ § § §Key Responsibilities§ § §Create compelling visual identities that meet a defined brief§ §Creative and have an understanding on marketing strategy§ §Design a distinct visual language through strong concept development and art direction§ §Integrated graphic design skills, online and offline. § §Idea generation and implementation of all marketing collateral across KV, digital and social channels§ §Corporate and brand video production and editing§ §Key drive for all creative innovative design deliverable based on brand value proposition,§ §Manage agency to ensure good quality of deliverables§ § § §Key Requirements§ § §5 years of related experience +§ §Experience of interpreting a brief and designing campaign materials to successfully drive acquisition or retention.§ §Strong knowledge and experience using Adobes suite of visual design products: Indesign, Photoshop, Illustrator etc§ §Experience designing and creating printed marketing materials including; flyers, brochures etc.§ §Basic video editing skill using premiere.§ §Experience creating HTML templates for email marketing and web content management skills§ §Good working knowledge of HTML and CSS browser standards§ §Knowledge of optimising imagery for digital use.§ §Experience in providing ready to print assets§ §Basic video editing skill using Premiere Pro.§ §Strong verbal and written communication, stakeholder management and interpersonal skills;§ § § §To apply, please don't hesitate to click on "Apply Now" and submit your updated resume. §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Project Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50536595.txt	§Senior Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Project Manager§§Advertiser: §FBI Talent Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$100,000 - $120,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Independent Design studio who specialise in brand identity, packaging and corporate communications for global clients are looking for a senior client-facing Project Manager.§ §Applicants should be experienced in account and project management, with good communication and organisational skills, a knowledge of print and production with an eye for detail. Also, be able to handle pressure, to juggle a number of projects at once in a fast paced design studio, relate to all staff in the same way and all projects $1K/$25K/$100K (small/mid/large) with the same professionalism. Above all, an ability to engage with clients and creatives alike and a desire to work on a global stage with international brands.§ § § §Tasks include:§ §– Manage FMCG packaging projects of varying sizes across different clients with a flexible approach to project management.§ §– Work with the studio manager and fellow project managers to determine the scope of the work and manage the projects effectively across the design, retouching and finished art departments.§ §– Prioritise and delegate projects on a daily basis, utilising the studio resources effectively.§ §– Client liaison - meetings, presentations and briefings. Managing client expectations effectively. Sensitive to the balancing act of giving the client what they want and when they want it vs capacity of the studio to deliver.§ §– Managing, sourcing and contracting of photography, illustration and other external creative services related to their projects.§ §– Liaison with bookkeeper in efficient preparation of invoices and monitoring of payments from clients.§ §– Preparation of budgets, internal and external reporting, monitoring the profitability of projects.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Designer / Art Director Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50549131.txt	§Senior Designer / Art Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Designer / Art Director§§Advertiser: §Movember§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Designer / Art Director §      §        §          §Your creativity and design expertise can help change the face of men’s health§          §Fun and collaborative culture§          §14-month fixed term contract§        §        §Movember is the leading charity changing the face of men’s health globally, tackling mental health and suicide prevention, prostate cancer, testicular cancer. In our mission to stop men dying too young, we’re seeking a Senior Designer to join our Melbourne team on a maternity leave contract.§        §Reporting to the Creative Services Manager, you’ll work hands-on with all departments to support their diverse design needs. This is a lead design role that partners closely with our in-house Senior Copywriter from concepting through to execution. As the custodian of Movember’s visual identity, you’ll deliver high quality, visually compelling outcomes that help fuel the Movember brand.  You’ll receive briefs from teams in our four major markets and your work will cross borders around the globe.§        §This role is suited to someone who’s keen to work in a unique, fast-paced and collaborative environment, preferably with previous agency experience.§        §Responsibilities§        §          §Lead the development and creation of all design requirements in line with the Movember brand and strategy.§          §Demonstrate a clear understanding of project objectives, responding to briefs with a fresh and innovative approach, pushing boundaries whilst remaining on brand. §          §Sell ideas internally, preparing presentations that articulate a compelling design rationale.§          §Draw on archived and new material to design original pieces across a range of integrated outputs such as digital, social, print and OOH.§          §Work closely with the Creative Services Manager to appropriately manage stakeholder expectations.§          §Review and approve artwork developed by our internal and freelance teams, providing clear, constructive and empathetic critiques.§          §Motivate and influence the team to constantly strive for excellence.§          §Stay immersed design industry developments and tools.§        §        §For this role, you’ll need§        §          §A relevant degree in Graphic Design, Communication Design or Media and Communication  related field.§          §8+ years of experience, ideally some of this in an agency environment.§          §Proficiency with the Adobe creative suite, Adobe After Effects & Sketch.§          §Experience in designing across all platforms (eg: print, digital, social and multi-media).§          §A strong sense of visual design and in-depth knowledge of graphic design, styles and layout techniques§          §Experience producing and art directing digital ad campaigns.§          §The ability to take ideas from concept through to implementation and execution.§          §The ability to communicate ideas clearly and confidently.§          §A resourceful and proactive approach, the ability to work on concurrent tasks and to tight deadlines.§        §        § §        §Does this role sound up your alley? If so, we’d love to hear from you.§        § §        §Click ‘§Apply for this Job’§ to send through your CV and portfolio, with a cover letter that responds to the following questions:§        §          §What will your background and experience bring to our organisation and this role? §          §The Movember Values sit at the heart of our organisation and we want to attract candidates who are motivated by these. Please let us know which of our Values resonate most with you, and why§?§        §        § §        §Movember is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community and workplace - a place where we can all be ourselves, and each have the equal opportunity to succeed and be recognised for our unique contribution. We value the experiences, skills and perspectives of all individuals and actively encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds. We make recruitment decisions based on applicants’ skills, experience and knowledge, ensuring all applicants are treated fairly.§        §Details on our privacy policy can be found on our website.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ §Your creativity and design expertise can help change the face of men’s health§ §Fun and collaborative culture§ §14-month fixed term contract§ §Movember is the leading charity changing the face of men’s health globally, tackling mental health and suicide prevention, prostate cancer, testicular cancer. In our mission to stop men dying too young, we’re seeking a Senior Designer to join our Melbourne team on a maternity leave contract.§ §Reporting to the Creative Services Manager, you’ll work hands-on with all departments to support their diverse design needs. This is a lead design role that partners closely with our in-house Senior Copywriter from concepting through to execution. As the custodian of Movember’s visual identity, you’ll deliver high quality, visually compelling outcomes that help fuel the Movember brand.  You’ll receive briefs from teams in our four major markets and your work will cross borders around the globe.§ §This role is suited to someone who’s keen to work in a unique, fast-paced and collaborative environment, preferably with previous agency experience.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Lead the development and creation of all design requirements in line with the Movember brand and strategy.§ §Demonstrate a clear understanding of project objectives, responding to briefs with a fresh and innovative approach, pushing boundaries whilst remaining on brand. § §Sell ideas internally, preparing presentations that articulate a compelling design rationale.§ §Draw on archived and new material to design original pieces across a range of integrated outputs such as digital, social, print and OOH.§ §Work closely with the Creative Services Manager to appropriately manage stakeholder expectations.§ §Review and approve artwork developed by our internal and freelance teams, providing clear, constructive and empathetic critiques.§ §Motivate and influence the team to constantly strive for excellence.§ §Stay immersed design industry developments and tools.§ §For this role, you’ll need§ § §A relevant degree in Graphic Design, Communication Design or Media and Communication  related field.§ §8+ years of experience, ideally some of this in an agency environment.§ §Proficiency with the Adobe creative suite, Adobe After Effects & Sketch.§ §Experience in designing across all platforms (eg: print, digital, social and multi-media).§ §A strong sense of visual design and in-depth knowledge of graphic design, styles and layout techniques§ §Experience producing and art directing digital ad campaigns.§ §The ability to take ideas from concept through to implementation and execution.§ §The ability to communicate ideas clearly and confidently.§ §A resourceful and proactive approach, the ability to work on concurrent tasks and to tight deadlines.§ § § §Does this role sound up your alley? If so, we’d love to hear from you.§ § § §Click ‘§Apply for this Job’§ to send through your CV and portfolio, with a cover letter that responds to the following questions:§ § §What will your background and experience bring to our organisation and this role? § §The Movember Values sit at the heart of our organisation and we want to attract candidates who are motivated by these. jobTitle: Gallery & Museum Program Officer Job in Far West & North Central NSW - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50553472.txt	§Gallery & Museum Program Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Gallery & Museum Program Officer§§Advertiser: §Broken Hill City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Far West & North Central NSW§§Salary§§$68,950 - $73,717 plus super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Gallery & Museum Program Officer §        §          §GALLERY & MUSEUM PROGRAM OFFICER§          §Base salary $68,950 to $73,717 §plus super §          §Broken Hill City Council has entered an exciting new era with a number of challenges to meet and opportunities to grasp. We have an exciting career opportunity working within our Corporate & Cultural Services team as a Gallery & Museum Program Officer.§          § §          §Reporting directly to the Gallery & Museum Manager, you will support Broken Hill City Council in delivering valued services to the community. The position will plan, develop, implement and market innovative audience development strategies, group and education programs; to ensure a high level of community and visitor involvement in the Broken Hill Regional Art Gallery and the Albert Kersten Minerals and Mining Museum.§          §We are seeking a highly motivated employee that has well developed customer relations and administration skills. As an outstanding communicator you will be adept at developing relationships with a range of stakeholders within the organisation, as well as local and tourist communities. To do this you will draw from your knowledge and/or experience in program planning, public presentations, project management and public gallery experience.§          § A key component of the position will be to enhance Council’s public image through responsive and effective liaison and communication with the community, businesses and other stakeholders.§          §As Council facilities are open 7 days per week and operates on a rotating roster; you may need to be available for work Sunday to Saturday. Penalty rates apply for Saturday and Sunday work as per the Broken Hill City Council Consent Award. All other conditions are as per the Award.§          §The ideal candidate will possess and be able to demonstrate the following:§          §            §A ‘can do’ attitude focused on delivering outcomes.§            §Commitment to a values and behaviours leadership model and a preparedness to ‘Play your Role’.§            §Building a culture where the ‘organisation wide’ adopted values and behaviours of the organisation are championed.§            §Commitment to embracing Councils customer service framework and to ‘Think like the Customer’.§            §Commitment to continuous improvement and embracing change.§            §Have a commitment to the liveability of our community.§          §          §Benefits working for Council include:§          §            §Generous Award Conditions including 5 weeks annual leave§            §Paid long Service Leave after 5 years continuous service§            §Corporate Health and Wellbeing programs§            §Employee growth and career development opportunities§            §Salary packaging options§            §Social Clubs§          §          §Job reference: DGM-EDC-02.02§          §Any questions about the role can be directed to Ms Tara Callaghan, Gallery & Museum Manager §(08) 8080 3442§ or §tara.callaghan@brokenhill.nsw.gov.au§          §Full Position Description can be found on our website....click §apply now§ to find out more.§          §Applications close Friday 9th October 2020 at 5pm (ACST)§          §Broken Hill City Council promotes a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and value unique contributions of all people. People from indigenous backgrounds, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.§          §If you require any adjustments to assist you with your application or would like to discuss the position further, please contact Council’s HR Department on §(08) 8080 3342§ or §8080 3351§.§          §Please note that the selection process can commence before the closing date and that the preferred candidate can be selected based on application and referee checks only.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§GALLERY & MUSEUM PROGRAM OFFICER§ §Base salary $68,950 to $73,717 §plus super § §Broken Hill City Council has entered an exciting new era with a number of challenges to meet and opportunities to grasp. We have an exciting career opportunity working within our Corporate & Cultural Services team as a Gallery & Museum Program Officer.§ § § §Reporting directly to the Gallery & Museum Manager, you will support Broken Hill City Council in delivering valued services to the community. The position will plan, develop, implement and market innovative audience development strategies, group and education programs; to ensure a high level of community and visitor involvement in the Broken Hill Regional Art Gallery and the Albert Kersten Minerals and Mining Museum.§ §We are seeking a highly motivated employee that has well developed customer relations and administration skills. As an outstanding communicator you will be adept at developing relationships with a range of stakeholders within the organisation, as well as local and tourist communities. To do this you will draw from your knowledge and/or experience in program planning, public presentations, project management and public gallery experience.§ § A key component of the position will be to enhance Council’s public image through responsive and effective liaison and communication with the community, businesses and other stakeholders.§ §As Council facilities are open 7 days per week and operates on a rotating roster; you may need to be available for work Sunday to Saturday. jobTitle: Events Producer Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50627585.txt	§Events Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Events Producer§§Advertiser: §Darlinghurst Theatre Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$65,000 plus Super§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§Role Description: §Events Producer§ §Employment:   Short Term Contract§ §Salary:   $1,250 / 40 hours per week, plus super§ §Contract Dates:  Start ASAP - 29 November, 2020        § §Scope to extend beyond contract end date by mutual agreement§ §DTC has committed to securing representation in leadership roles. First Nations People and Peoples of Colour are strongly encouraged to apply.§ §About BLOOM § §An Everyday Festival of Gaiety, Cabaret and Art § §Themes: §Buoyancy // Joy // Renewal§ §COVID-19 forced the closure of our venue in March 2020 and the suspension of our 2020 season. We remain committed to our 2020 artists and will reschedule the productions when government restrictions are lifted and it is financially viable.§ §BLOOM§ is our company adapting our business model to ensure our doors can reopen to our community and our space is reactivated whilst performances spaces remain subject to COVID safety restrictions and guide lines. § §It will be a festival model, programmed across multiple spaces of the Eternity Playhouse including our Cabaret/Restaurant space, the auditorium and exterior roaming performers. We will look for interesting dining and bar activities and intend to expand our hospitality experience to include the footpath area. § §We will be looking to partner with independent companies, festivals and collectives in the form of residencies, ensuring the venue remains a vibrant shared space for the community.§ §Job Description§ §This role works in close collaboration with our company producing team to effectively engage artists and deliver welcoming and inspiring experiences for our audiences. The Events Producer will have highly developed interpersonal and communication skills, a passion for live performance and hospitality and a belief in Darlinghurst Theatre Company’s mission and mandate. They will develop the company’s event and hospitality offerings for the BLOOM festival and help to make our foyer a vibrant and popular Sydney hub and destination known for its hospitality, food, bar and live performances this Spring.§ §The successful applicant will have experience managing arists and event teams, excellent  people skills, live performance event experience and the passion and drive to activate our foyer. They must be able to work exceptionally well with the general public, be motivated, energetic, highly efficient and have creative flair.§ §The Events Producer will have excellent leadership skills and will lead a team including FOH Supervisors, casual FOH and technical staff, artists and volunteers. The Events Producer will work with artists in residence ensuring the venue ixs a safe space and all artistic visions are realised to the best of our ability. They will be resourceful with the production budget allocated and prioritise all health guidelines and safety procedures at all times.§ §The Events Producer will collaborate and work closely with our in house caterers Two Trout Catering to deliver excellent and unique food for our events, pre show dining and bar food offerings.§ §We are looking to surround ourselves with radical thinkers as we create the new normal of Darlo.§ §Reporting Line: §Co-Artistic Director & Creative Producer / Co-Artistic Director and CEO§ §Direct Reports: §Front of House Supervisor / Contracted Artists / Casual Hospitality and Technical staff§ §Duties and Responsibilities § §Create Event Concepts§ §During the initial stages of the Festival, the Events Producer participates in ideation, collaborating with the Artistic Director and Producing team in order to generate concepts and brainstorm ideas. The Event Producer then utilises extensive experience and event knowledge in order to help develop a plan for the execution of these ideas.§ §Develop and Lead Restaurant and Bar§ §Before and during the event, the Events Producer will oversee hospitality and venue management logistics. Developing bar and restaurant set up and offerings.§ §Scheduling & Rostering § §Events Producer will generate daily and weekly running festival schedules and roster hospitality and technical staff in consultation with Head of Production.§ §Coordinate Production Needs§ §The Events Producer must oversee all production and technical aspects of any programmed event. Including the management of any on-site technical crew and pre-production artist requirements.§ §Front Facing Producing§ §In order to ensure the event runs as it should, the Event Producer will be on site to greet artists, attend technical rehearsal and be on hand to creative problem solve any problems that may present.§ §Collaborate with Artists§ §Event Producer is the primary point of contact for artists and festival partners and are responsible for answering questions and resolving issues that arise over the course of the event.§ §Safety§ §Prioritise safety procedures throughout all elements of the festival. This may be physical, cultural, emotional or mental health, as well as COVID-19 mitigation. § §Essential Skills§ § §Excellent understanding of hospitality and venue management§ §Experience in event management§ §Experience in producing theatrical productions§ §Knowledge of the Sydney theatrical scene§ §Clear communication§ §Strong leadership skills§ §Applications § §Sent to Co Artistic Director & Creative Producer, Amylia Harris§ §amylia@darlinghursttheatre.com§ §Please include:§ § §Resume§ §Any links or references to previous events/productions produced§ §Cover letter with 100 words on what you hope Bloom festival might bring to Sydney in a post Covid world.§ §Please include 5 References for bar and/or restaurant ideas (set up, menu, program, etc) which would inspire your work at DTC.§ § §§§§
