jobTitle: Tour Coordinator (Maternity Leave Cover) Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665530.txt	§Tour Coordinator (Maternity Leave Cover)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tour Coordinator (Maternity Leave Cover)§§Advertiser: §CircuitWest Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$67,000 to $70,000 pro rata§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Performing Arts§§§§§§About the business§ §CircuitWest brings together a sector that builds and reflects community and cultural life. First and foremost, CircuitWest stands for inclusive, thriving communities, enlivened with rich cultural expression and engagement. CircuitWest makes a difference through its leadership – articulating the value of the performing arts and its role in increasing wellbeing at individual, local, regional and State levels. CircuitWest is also a 'critical friend' to the professionals in the sector – enabling them to continuously strive and grow in their understanding and application of best practice. Last but not least, CircuitWest has a pathfinder role – identifying and addressing systemic issues to ensure the sector is moving forward as a whole. CircuitWest is the service organisation for the performing arts in Western Australia and amongst many roles convenes WA Showcase, TechWest and provides Tour Coordination services for Western Australian artists and companies within WA. CircuitWest represents Presenters, Producers and Artists and has strong ties with Local and State Government.§ §About the role§ §ABOUT THE ROLE§ §CircuitWest seeks a self-motivated individual who can provide a tour coordination service for Western Australian artists and organisations. To this end, the role will also undertake the following functions to provide:§ §·     Advice and support for producers and presenters to access tour funding through the Regional and Remote Touring Fund and other funding opportunities § §·     Fee for service tour management § §·     Touring advice and support for producers and presenters § §The role will also undertake the work associated with a very busy, small not-for profit arts organisation, delivering two annual conferences and numerous services and projects.§ §JOB OVERVIEW§ §This position has an integral role in supporting the Performing Arts Sector through the provision of tour coordination and producing services for the independent performing arts sector and in Western Australia. § §The principal duties will be to work with organisations and independents to deliver tours in Western Australia including logistics, planning and funding.  § §The position will also work on specific programs that are also delivered by CircuitWest. CircuitWest services the state and so experience with regional areas is desired but not essential. The successful applicant will be highly motivated with an ability to problem solve and innovate, have the ability to multi-task and manage competing deadlines, have well-developed communication and interpersonal skills, and will work well as part of a team. The role requires experience both in producing, tour coordination, and relationship building. The applicant will need to align with CircuitWest's values – Creativity, Courage, Generosity, Authenticity and Diversity.§ §Dependent on funding, the position may provide producing services with the intention of offering professional development and capacity building to the 'mentee' artist or producer.§ §Benefits and perks§ §POSITION DESCRIPTION § §Position Title    §                      Tour Coordinator § §Basis of Employment§            9-month contract - full time [37.5 hours/week] (maternity leave cover)§ §Commencing 2 November 2020 and inclusive of Annual Leave (pro rata)§ §Location§                              180 Hamersley Road, Subiaco [some travel required]§ §Reports to§                                Executive Director § §Salary§                                       $67-70k per annum [plus superannuation] (pro rata)§ §Conditions§                                2-month probationary period§ §Skills and experience§ §RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES§ §·       Work with presenters and artists to scope the interest of performance work and feasibility of tours;§ §·       In consultation with presenters and artists, develop detailed itineraries, budgets, technical requirements§ §·       Provide advice to artists and presenters about all aspects of touring, production management and logistics;§ §·       Source and apply for funding; for potential tours identified through WA Showcase.§ §·       Oversee project and event planning and develop detailed planning schedules to ensure timely progress;§ §·       Manage tour logistics, contract management, reporting components, and prepare tour packs;§ §·       Prepare and manage project and event budgets, ensuring that all necessary production equipment, materials and wages along with any other expenses are within allocated budget and actual expenditure does not exceed the allocated budget;§ §·       Collate, create and share resources and touring knowledge on the CircuitWest website for use by presenters and artists;§ §·       Establish strategic alliances and partnerships with tour logistics/ production/ travel suppliers and maximise the participation and support of all identified stakeholders;§ §·       Provide information as required for annual reports, board reports, financial reports, grant applications and acquittals;§ §SELECTION CRITERIA§ §Essential Criteria§ § §3+ years previous experience working with in the performing arts sector;§ §Considerable experience producing performing arts productions, presentations and tours;§ §Impeccable organisational and time management skills, displaying confidence and efficiency when working to tight and/or competing deadlines;§ §Proven ability to manage budgets and to apply cost-saving mechanisms where required§ §Demonstrated ability to write successful grant and funding applications;§ §Proven strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills; excellent communication and interpersonal skills; demonstrated ability to develop and manage strong relationships;§ §Computer efficiency – MS Office, Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook and social media.§ §Desirable Criteria§ § §An understanding of WordPress and e-marketing;§ §A full driver's license;§ § §§§§

flexibility to respond to deadlines; a strong team orientation; and the ability to work effectively under deadline pressure.  § §You will have excellent inter-personal skills and be comfortable working closely with a multi-national staff and senior advisor base scattered throughout the Asia Pacific, some of which for whom English is a second or even a third language.  § §You will be skilled in the use of MS Word and Powerpoint, along with at minimum a basic working knowledge of MS Excel, and experience working within MS Teams would be beneficial.   § §This is a full-time role based in our small office in Perth.  You should also have the ability and mindset to be able to work remotely from home if required.  While our standard office hours are 9:00am – 6:00pm, there is scope to set the base of hours for this role to later in the day (for example, 11:00am – 8:00pm).§§§§

jobText: TXT/50674454.txt	§Executive Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Producer§§Advertiser: §NORPA Inc (Northern Rivers Performing Arts Inc)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Lismore & Far North Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§Help steer the future of one of Australia’s most dynamic, regionally based theatre companies.§  §Nationally recognised and respected, NORPA (Northern Rivers Performing Arts) is seeking applications for the position of Executive Producer.§  §This is a new executive position that will play a key role in the strategic development and delivery of NORPA’s artistic programs within Lismore City Hall, and across the region. With responsibility for producing and programming, and technical production arms of the company, the Executive Producer will work closely with our Artistic Director and CEO to create new adventurous theatre, public programs and sector development initiatives.  The position will work alongside the Business and Development Manager, who oversees the marketing, development, front of house and box office teams.§  §We embrace the good fortune of being based on Bundjalung Country in Northern NSW. Taking inspiration from the country and culture around us, we are renowned for bringing homegrown stories to life through our distinct process of devised, and place based theatre making. Our works and programs take us from the coastal beauty of Byron Bay and the rolling hills of the hinterland, to the rich diversity and creative heart of Lismore, where we manage Lismore City Hall, the region’s largest performing arts venue. We couldn’t do what we do anywhere else.§  §This is an exciting time for NORPA, as the company has secured multi-year funding from Create NSW and from the Australia Council for the Arts. As Executive Producer, you will help steer NORPA into this new chapter as we activate our bold new Strategic Plan for 2021 – 2024.§  §If you are an experienced producer or arts worker, passionate about making theatre and keen to bring your skills to to our organisation, we want to hear from you!§  §To receive a copy of the position description, please contact us via info@norpa.org.au§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Videographer/editor and AV Techie Job in Gold Coast - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50646050.txt	§Videographer/editor and AV Techie§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Videographer/editor and AV Techie§§Advertiser: §Pragmatic Thinking§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Salary§§$50,000 - $64,999 plus phone allowance§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§PTV is the premier virtual training facilitation studio in Australia (and possibly up there with anything of it’s kind internationally) offered up by Pragmatic Thinking, a 3 X AFR Fast 100 company.The main reasons people choose to work at Pragmatic Thinking are the great culture, live on the Goldie, cool client projects, and a cutting edge approach to tech.§ §This role requires someone who can:§ § §        Set up, operate, maintain and troubleshoot our in-house studio/camera/livestreaming system. Requires knowledge of industry standard streaming equipment e.g. BirdDog PTZ200 cameras Blackmagic capture equipment, PC switching software (Wirecast)§ §        Use and understand pro video connection standards, e.g. SDI, NDI (network video), capturing from laptop feeds etc§ §        Record, livestream, edit and publish (e.g. Client conferences, training sessions etc) in our studio and at remote locations when required§ §        Be willing to learn, operate and troubleshoot and be responsible for the AV system throughout both of our streaming studios§ §        Shoot field video and then edit to produce content for social media as well as client projects§ §You will be working with our facilitators (within the studios) and our content marketing manager, to help conceptualise exciting video projects.§ §You will have:§ § § A love for tech, AV and the desire to stay up-to-date on both hardware and software§ §Approx. 2-3 years' experience§ §A strong portfolio that demonstrates a passion for creating highly effective video content with a keen eye for detail§ § A professional & disciplined approach to production workflows and adoption of best practices, and a willingness to put forward new and better practices§ §The ability to converse and interact professionally and comfortably with clients and colleagues, including the ability communicate your creative ideas and explain the reasoning behind these recommendations to multiple stakeholders§ §Hunger to learn and ability to figure out and recommend solutions and improvements§ §Production-bias - you'll be the person who obsesses about delivering content quickly§ §Excellent Teamwork skills§ §Can-do attitude§ §Essential Skills:§ §Capability working with:§ § §Live streaming, e.g. using Livestream Studio software, WireCast etc§ §Audio: Live sound recording and basic audio post-production§ §Lighting: Studio lighting, 3-point interview setup, location scenes, ability to use and work with natural light and combinations of natural with artificial lighting§ §Camera: Lighting, lensing, exposure, composition, and framing§ §Adobe Premiere Pro, Camtasia§ §Experience with music libraries and how to use music in an edit for powerful effect§ §Ability to generate original ideas and produce them from start to finish§ §Digital Asset Management§ §Adobe After Effects§ §It's a cracking job for the right person.§ § § §About Pragmatic Thinking§ §Pragmatic Thinking is a three-time AFR fast-growth company with a blue-chip client book including the likes of Suncorp, Virgin, Siemens, McCormicks, and Heritage Bank. § §We deliver a host of programs in the areas of leadership, culture and feedback. Our core focus for this role is to elevate virtual learning experiences through our TV quality PTV studio’s (https://youtu.be/NBmqif9Km3k). § §Snoop around at the places we hang out: § §www.pragmaticthinking.com§ §https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLETmnrC26QpQ7SD2kssIag§ §https://vimeo.com/pragmaticthinking§ §https://www.linkedin.com/company/pragmatic-thinking-pty-ltd/§ §https://www.facebook.com/PragmaticThinking/§ §https://www.instagram.com/pragmaticthinking/?hl=en§ § § § § §What to do next?§ §If this role is a hell-yes then you'll be scrolling to the bottom with a 'how do I apply?' question buzzing. § §Well, we're keen to hear from you. § §The following are the tasks for your application: § §1. Send an email to §tracy@pragmatichinking.com§ with a copy of a cover letter in how you'll smash this role, your latest resume.§ §2. Send us three examples of your videography work, one of these should be a social media style promo video.§ § § §Look forward to hearing from you. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50649134.txt	§Producer Radio - Brisbane§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Producer Radio - Brisbane§§Advertiser: §ABC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Producer Radio - Brisbane §    §      §        §          §Be a part of Australia's independent national broadcaster§          §$76K - $81K (pro rata) plus 15.4% Nominated Super§          §Contract Vacancy for Approximately 7 Months§ §          §Create authentic and high-quality content across multiple platforms§        §        §About ABC Regional & Local§        §The ABC’s Regional & Local team is all about Australian communities and their conversations. Our teams create unique and distinctive content that connect communities and shape lives in metropolitan, regional and remote Australia. From our eight capital city radio stations, our forty four regional bureaux, through to screen, live events and sport, Regional & Local is about real people, real places and real life.§        §About the Role§        §ABC Radio Brisbane is seeking a Content Maker/Producer to join the team on a full-time contract basis.§        §This is a key role producing programs which involves the creation of content across multiple platforms that aligns with ABC strategy and supports the achievement of Regional & Local’s objectives. You will also;§        §          §Prepare distinctive and compelling content that engages local audiences.§          §Provide in-studio production, support & manage talk-back callers and guests.§          §Contribute to the implementation of the Local Emergency Coverage plan.§          §Cross promote ABC content to increase audience engagement.§        §        §About You§        §You are a natural news breaker, can spot a story and turn it around in multiple platform content. With your extensive contact book and knowledge of Brisbane and it’s local issues, you will create multiple platform content appealing to a wide audience. With strong program making and broad skills in producing, you are eager to develop and make original and engaging audio and cross-platform content for target audiences. To be a success in this role you will bring:§        §          §Sound editorial skills including the ability to source and analyse information and exercise sound judgement.§          §Demonstrated understanding and passion to source and create authentic content which represents the broad diversity of the Australian community.§          §Relevant tertiary qualifications or demonstrated equivalent skills and experience.§        §        §For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:  §30005919 PRODUCER.pdf§        §We would love to see your work.§ Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).§        §For further information on this position please contact Matthew Connors, Content Director on §(07) 3377 5568§        §We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.§        §For more information on working at the ABC visit §abc.net.au/careers§        §Applications Close: 11:55 pm, Sunday 18 October§        §The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. With your extensive contact book and knowledge of Brisbane and it’s local issues, you will create multiple platform content appealing to a wide audience. With strong program making and broad skills in producing, you are eager to develop and make original and engaging audio and cross-platform content for target audiences. To be a success in this role you will bring:§§Sound editorial skills including the ability to source and analyse information and exercise sound judgement.§Demonstrated understanding and passion to source and create authentic content which represents the broad diversity of the Australian community.§Relevant tertiary qualifications or demonstrated equivalent skills and experience.§§For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:  §30005919 PRODUCER.pdf§§We would love to see your work.§ Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).§For further information on this position please contact Matthew Connors, Content Director on §(07) 3377 5568§§We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.§For more information on working at the ABC visit §abc.net.au/careers§§Applications Close: 11:55 pm, Sunday 18 October§§The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.§§For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to §ABC LinkedIn§ and §Life Page§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Publishing§§§§§§Daily Mail Australia is looking for an experienced journalist to join our team in Sydney as homepage editor.§ §The role is crucial to Daily Mail Australia’s success as it involves jobText: TXT/50664276.txt	§Coordinator Theatre Operations§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coordinator Theatre Operations§§Advertiser: §Wellington Shire Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bairnsdale & Gippsland§§Salary§§$66,701 - $76,669§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Performing Arts§§§§§§Coordinator Theatre Operations§ §Position No. 568§ §Permanent Full-Time§ §Band 5 - $66,701 - $76,669 per annum plus 9.5% superannuation§ §We are seeking to appoint a dynamic and experienced individual to join our Arts and Culture team on a full-time basis.  § §The Wedge is an exciting cultural facility that delivers exceptional entertainment choice for Wellington Shire’s community and visitors. The Centre presents in excess of 150 events each year of very diverse local, professional and community programming, with an attendance of over 50,000 annually.§ §The Coordinator Theatre Operations is responsible for developing and delivering presenter services at The Wedge. You will provide outstanding service to presenters whilst actively building business and coordinating the provision of event based technical services. In addition, you will assist presenters to plan and produce in house productions for events including conferences, functions and meetings.§ §To be successful in this position, you will have significant entertainment industry experience, particularly in the provision of technical services and client management.§ §If you have a passion in the performing arts industry with technical expertise, then we want to hear from you!§ §The successful candidate will need to demonstrate how they meet the criteria below:§ § §Demonstrated experience in a technical position in a performing arts centre or theatre environment.§ §Well-developed organisational and effective time management skills.§ §Specialist knowledge and experience in the Entertainment and/or Events Industry.§ §Excellent communication skills with the ability to liaise with clients on their technical requirements and explain services and standards.§ §A collaborative and dynamic working style with an ability to work alone with hands-on capacity.§ § §Why Wellington?§ §Wellington Shire Council uses award-winning technologies to seek and implement innovative improvements across the organisation. We work hard to position ourselves as a leader in local government, continuously improving our diverse range of services for the betterment of our community.§ §We offer a rewarding culture of innovation, flexibility and continued learning in a collaborative, supportive environment.§ §Wellington Shire Council is committed to upholding the Child Safe Standards and associated legislative requirements.§ §Wellington Shire Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to encourage applications from people of different backgrounds, abilities, ages, genders and/or sexual orientations and gender identities.§ §About Wellington§ §Wellington Shire is Victoria’s third largest municipality. Its 10,924m2 extends from the High Country through the Gippsland Plains to the famous Ninety Mile Beach. Sale is less than 3 hours drive east of Melbourne and the region boasts excellent sporting, educational, and recreational facilities. Visit §http://www.centralgippsland.com.au§ to find out why the Wellington Shire is a great place to live and work.§ §How to Apply:§ §Applications must address the Key Selection Criteria as outlined in this advertisement and will be accepted no later than§ midnight Sunday 18 October 2020. § §A Position Description can be obtained from this §link.§§§§

jobTitle: Art Director / Studio Manager Job in Gold Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697804.txt	§Art Director / Studio Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Art Director / Studio Manager§§Advertiser: §ark:media Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§ART DIRECTOR/STUDIO MANAGER§  §ARK Media specialises in the development of media, marketing and communication strategies for leading associations across multiple industry sectors. Based on the Gold Coast, the company’s expertise lies in content production, creative design, sponsorship acquisition, publishing and distribution across print, digital and social media channels. §  §The role:§  §ARK Media seeks an experienced Art Director/Studio Manager to join their fast-growing creative team working across various publications in mobile, web and print formats.§  §More information:§  §The candidate is required to have several years of experience in a busy art/production department developing, coordinating and supervising all elements of the design studio and production process including concepts; creating and pre-flighting PDFs; printer online approval systems and production processes.§  §Required skills:§  §The role requires attention to detail, excellent communication skills and a high level of expertise in the organisation and management of all aspects of production including; liaising with clients, marketing, editorial teams and printers; supervising graphic designers; delegating projects to staff; following clients’ briefs; troubleshooting; meeting strict deadlines, print buying and various other production jobs.§  §Previous experience in social media platforms and digital publications would be an advantage.§  §If you are highly organised and creative, and you are an excellent planner with a high level of proficiency in Microsoft Office, InDesign and Adobe, we welcome your application.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: St Kilda Film Festival Director Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696925.txt	§St Kilda Film Festival Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§St Kilda Film Festival Director§§Advertiser: §City of Port Phillip§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Art Direction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §The City of Port Phillip is committed to a culture of ethical leadership, openness, respect and integrity and provides a great work-life balance. §      §St Kilda Film Festival Director §      §      §      §      §      §        §§        §• Band 7 - $96,794 – $108,318 plus 9.5% Super§        §• Temporary Part-time position  - 12 months. 0.7 FTE (3-4 days per week) §        §• St Kilda or work from home during COVID-19 Pandemic, with Council/DHHS direction,§        §About the Organisation §        §The City of Port Phillip is an inner-city council with around 1000 employees who deliver more than 100 programs and services to our residents, businesses and visitors. These range from childcare and immunisations, to libraries, management of parks and open space, rubbish collection, road maintenance and more.  §        §About the Role§        §The position leads programming and special events for the St Kilda Film Festival, including public representation of the event. In addition, the successful candidate will work with internal and external Creative Industries stakeholders to seek and execute opportunities with annual programming in other festivals, events and gatherings in the municipality. The position will contribute film sector knowledge and networks to Council’s broader screen and creative industries strategies.§        §Duties:§        §• Coordinate selection of participants in the short film competition, including panel and jurors§        §• Lead programming of special events for the Festival§        §• Publicly represent the St Kilda Film Festival§        §• Develop other Film and Creative Industries programming for Council events§        §• Support the applications and acquittals for Government and non-Government funding§        §Skills and Experience §        §• Minimum ten years’ experience within the Australian film industry and film programming§        §• Experience in working with all aspects of media §        §• Knowledge, networks and experience with other Creative Industries (Games, VR, AR, Galleries)§        §• Experience with cultural policy in the public sector  §        §• Experience creating projects and presenting inclusive and immersive programs in an online format §        §Culture §        §People enjoy working at the City of Port Phillip because we are a welcoming, healthy and inclusive workplace.  We offer a vibrant and diverse work environment where our employees can develop both professionally and personally whilst planning and delivering a range of important services and programs to the community.§        §Benefits§        §• We offer a workplace which accommodates your working style and needs. §        §• Be supported and empowered by a leadership team that is community focused, with a strong desire for change and a culture that encourages teamwork and innovation.§        §• Training and development opportunities, study assistance, flexible working conditions, paid parental leave, an active social club, a health and wellbeing program, and a well- regarded Employee Assistance Program (EAP).§        §How to Apply§        §Click APPLY.§        §All applicants must provide a Cover Letter in response to the key selection criteria located on the last page of the position description. The Cover Letter should be no longer than 2 pages and include each heading in the Key Selection Criteria.§        §Note: Only applications submitted via the online Recruitment Portal will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be provided feedback.§        §Further information can be obtained by contacting §FILMFEST@portphillip.vic.gov.au§        §Applications close midnight §Wednesday 14 October 2020§        §The City of Port Phillip is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive and accessible environment where diversity is valued.§        §If you have accessibility requirements or require an adjustment to participate in our recruitment and selection process, please contact Gia Tran (HR Business Partner) on email: §helppc@portphillip.vic.gov.au§        §City of Port Phillip has zero tolerance for child abuse and is a committed Child Safe organisation, so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse. §      §      § Applications close  §        § At City of Port Phillip we value and encourage diversity in our workplace.§      §    §    §  §§§• Band 7 - $96,794 – $108,318 plus 9.5% Super§ §• Temporary Part-time position  - 12 months. 0.7 FTE (3-4 days per week) § §• St Kilda or work from home during COVID-19 Pandemic, with Council/DHHS direction,§ §About the Organisation § §The City of Port Phillip is an inner-city council with around 1000 employees who deliver more than 100 programs and services to our residents, businesses and visitors. These range from childcare and immunisations, to libraries, management of parks and open space, rubbish collection, road maintenance and more.  § §About the Role§ §The position leads programming and special events for the St Kilda Film Festival, including public representation of the event. In addition, the successful candidate will work with internal and external Creative Industries stakeholders to seek and execute opportunities with annual programming in other festivals, events and gatherings in the municipality. The position will contribute film sector knowledge and networks to Council’s broader screen and creative industries strategies.§ §Duties:§ §• Coordinate selection of participants in the short film competition, including panel and jurors§ §• Lead programming of special events for the Festival§ §• Publicly represent the St Kilda Film Festival§ §• Develop other Film and Creative Industries programming for Council events§ §• Support the applications and acquittals for Government and non-Government funding§ §Skills and Experience § §• Minimum ten years’ experience within the Australian film industry and film programming§ §• Experience in working with all aspects of media § §• Knowledge, networks and experience with other Creative Industries (Games, VR, AR, Galleries)§ §• Experience with cultural policy in the public sector  § §• Experience creating projects and presenting inclusive and immersive programs in an online format § §Culture § §People enjoy working at the City of Port Phillip because we are a welcoming, healthy and inclusive workplace.  We offer a vibrant and diverse work environment where our employees can develop both professionally and personally whilst planning and delivering a range of important services and programs to the community.§ §Benefits§ §• We offer a workplace which accommodates your working style and needs. § §• Be supported and empowered by a leadership team that is community focused, with a strong desire for change and a culture that encourages teamwork and innovation.§ §• Training and development opportunities, study assistance, flexible working conditions, paid parental leave, an active social club, a health and wellbeing program, and a well- regarded Employee Assistance Program (EAP).§ §How to Apply§ §Click APPLY.§ §All applicants must provide a Cover Letter in response to the key selection criteria located on the last page of the position description. The Cover Letter should be no longer than 2 pages and include each heading in the Key Selection Criteria.§ §Note: Only applications submitted via the online Recruitment Portal will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be provided feedback.§ §Further information can be obtained by contacting §FILMFEST@portphillip.vic.gov.au§ §Applications close midnight §Wednesday 14 October 2020§ §The City of Port Phillip is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive and accessible environment where diversity is valued.§ §If you have accessibility requirements or require an adjustment to participate in our recruitment and selection process, please contact Gia Tran (HR Business Partner) on email: §helppc@portphillip.vic.gov.au§ §City of Port Phillip has zero tolerance for child abuse and is a committed Child Safe organisation, so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse. §§§§

jobTitle: Economic Growth and Activation Officer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50659515.txt	§Economic Growth and Activation Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic Growth and Activation Officer§§Advertiser: §City of Port Phillip§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §The City of Port Phillip is committed to a culture of ethical leadership, openness, respect and integrity and provides a great work-life balance. §      §Economic Growth and Activation Officer §      §      §      §      §      §        §§        §• Permanent – Full time§        §• Band 6 $86,199 to $93,960 plus 9.5% Super§        §• Based in the St Kilda Town Hall and during COVID-19 Pandemic, with Executive Leadership Team/DHHS direction, this role is able to work from home and is predominantly based online, except on Sundays when you will be based on the Upper Esplanade   §        §About the Organisation §        §The City of Port Phillip is an inner-city Council with around 900 employees who deliver more than 100 programs and services to our residents, businesses and visitors. These range from events and festivals, markets, childcare and immunisations, to libraries, management of parks and open space, rubbish collection, road maintenance and more.  §        §About the Role§        §Do you have strong vision to deliver a sustainable market, support businesses and reactivate public space for Port Phillip’s communities? We seek a confident, enthusiastic communicator with the ability to work at pace to deliver a large program of work with huge success. You will be a strong team player who supports the Head of Economic Growth and Activation, St Kilda Esplanade Market Manager, Business Concierge, Senior Public Space Coordinator and Industry Development Coordinator.§        §The primary objective of the City Growth and Culture Department is to support economic growth through business support and the reactivation of public space, and promotion of the many unique neighbourhoods in the City of Port Phillip. §        §This is important at all times but even more so post-COVID-19, as our local community, spaces and businesses will be important as our community recovers from COVID-19, culturally, socially, environmentally and economically. As the Economic Growth and Activation Officer you will participate in and manage the planning and delivery of strategic initiatives with the Economic Growth and Activation team within the City of Port Phillip. §        §Duties§        §• Serve as a single point of contact for businesses who have enquiries on how Council could support them and triage these to other Economic Growth and Activation team members and other areas of Council such as Footpath Trading and Events, if needed §        §• Play your part to advocate within the Organisation for the needs of business in terms of policies, process and their development, to remove red tape§        §• St Kilda Esplanade Market administration including Pathway, Market inbox, chasing debtors etc two weekdays per week§        §• Managing the Market on site every second Sunday (one less weekday will be worked each fortnight and this will be slightly flexible regarding which tasks you complete on which weekday)§        §• Business Support and Activation administration three weekdays per week including raising Purchase Orders, completing the Team’s budget tracker, InfoCouncil uploads, managing the businesses@ inbox, managing all CRM requests for the team, administration for Love My Place grants program§        §• Weekly website updates to lovemyplace.com.au and Market website §        §Skills and Experience §        §• Experience in: an administrative, facility management, property maintenance, market, events, hospitality or retail role;§        §• Computer programs such as Pathway; Social Media platforms and websites.§        §• Building strong stakeholder relationships; ability to function as a member of a small team in a high pressure, service-based environment; and the ability to manage challenging stakeholders.§        §• Delivering exceptional customer service will be a driving factor in your professional life.§        §• Flexibility to work 38 hours/week including weekends and irregular weekday hours due to the nature of the role and meeting the needs of our communities§        §Culture §        §We are a welcoming Team who work hard, celebrate our achievements and are supportive of each other. Port Phillip offers a vibrant and diverse work environment where our employees can develop both professionally and personally whilst planning and delivering a range of important services and programs for the community. §        §How to Apply§        §Click APPLY.§        §Applicants must respond to each of the key selection criteria contained in the Position Description in the same document as their 1-2 page cover letter, and submit a CV on the City of Port Phillip system. Applications that do not address the selection criteria, will not be considered. §        §Note: Only applications submitted via the online Recruitment Portal will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be provided feedback.§        §Further information can be obtained by contacting §Marlo Pretty, St Kilda Esplanade Market Manager §marlo.pretty@portphillip.vic.gov.au§ §        §Applications close at midnight on §11 October 2020.§ Interviews will be conducted in the week commencing 12 October. §        §The City of Port Phillip is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive and accessible environment where diversity is valued.If you have accessibility requirements or require an adjustment to participate in our recruitment and selection process, please contact Gia Tran (HR Business Partner) on §03 8563 7657§ or email: §helppc@portphillip.vic.gov.au§        §The City of Port Phillip has zero tolerance for child abuse and is a committed Child Safe organisation, so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse. A successful application is subject to a satisfactory police record and Working with Children Check.§      §      § Applications close  §        § At City of Port Phillip we value and encourage diversity in our workplace.§      §    §    §  §§§• Permanent – Full time§ §• Band 6 $86,199 to $93,960 plus 9.5% Super§ §• Based in the St Kilda Town Hall and during COVID-19 Pandemic, with Executive Leadership Team/DHHS direction, this role is able to work from home and is predominantly based online, except on Sundays when you will be based on the Upper Esplanade   § §About the Organisation § §The City of Port Phillip is an inner-city Council with around 900 employees who deliver more than 100 programs and services to our residents, businesses and visitors. These range from events and festivals, markets, childcare and immunisations, to libraries, management of parks and open space, rubbish collection, road maintenance and more.  § §About the Role§ §Do you have strong vision to deliver a sustainable market, support businesses and reactivate public space for Port Phillip’s communities? We seek a confident, enthusiastic communicator with the ability to work at pace to deliver a large program of work with huge success. You will be a strong team player who supports the Head of Economic Growth and Activation, St Kilda Esplanade Market Manager, Business Concierge, Senior Public Space Coordinator and Industry Development Coordinator.§ §The primary objective of the City Growth and Culture Department is to support economic growth through business support and the reactivation of public space, and promotion of the many unique neighbourhoods in the City of Port Phillip. § §This is important at all times but even more so post-COVID-19, as our local community, spaces and businesses will be important as our community recovers from COVID-19, culturally, socially, environmentally and economically. As the Economic Growth and Activation Officer you will participate in and manage the planning and delivery of strategic initiatives with the Economic Growth and Activation team within the City of Port Phillip. § §Duties§ §• Serve as a single point of contact for businesses who have enquiries on how Council could support them and triage these to other Economic Growth and Activation team members and other areas of Council such as Footpath Trading and Events, if needed § §• Play your part to advocate within the Organisation for the needs of business in terms of policies, process and their development, to remove red tape§ §• St Kilda Esplanade Market administration including Pathway, Market inbox, chasing debtors etc two weekdays per week§ §• Managing the Market on site every second Sunday (one less weekday will be worked each fortnight and this will be slightly flexible regarding which tasks you complete on which weekday)§ §• Business Support and Activation administration three weekdays per week including raising Purchase Orders, completing the Team’s budget tracker, InfoCouncil uploads, managing the businesses@ inbox, managing all CRM requests for the team, administration for Love My Place grants program§ §• Weekly website updates to lovemyplace.com.au and Market website § §Skills and Experience § §• Experience in: an administrative, facility management, property maintenance, market, events, hospitality or retail role;§ §• Computer programs such as Pathway; Social Media platforms and websites.§ §• Building strong stakeholder relationships; ability to function as a member of a small team in a high pressure, service-based environment; and the ability to manage challenging stakeholders.§ §• Delivering exceptional customer service will be a driving factor in your professional life.§ §• Flexibility to work 38 hours/week including weekends and irregular weekday hours due to the nature of the role and meeting the needs of our communities§ §Culture § §We are a welcoming Team who work hard, celebrate our achievements and are supportive of each other. Port Phillip offers a vibrant and diverse work environment where our employees can develop both professionally and personally whilst planning and delivering a range of important services and programs for the community. § §How to Apply§ §Click APPLY.§ §Applicants must respond to each of the key selection criteria contained in the Position Description in the same document as their 1-2 page cover letter, and submit a CV on the City of Port Phillip system. Applications that do not address the selection criteria, will not be considered. § §Note: Only applications submitted via the online Recruitment Portal will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be provided feedback.§ §Further information can be obtained by contacting §Marlo Pretty, St Kilda Esplanade Market Manager §marlo.pretty@portphillip.vic.gov.au§ § §Applications close at midnight on §11 October 2020.§ Interviews will be conducted in the week commencing 12 October. § §The City of Port Phillip is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive and accessible environment where diversity is valued.If you have accessibility requirements or require an adjustment to participate in our recruitment and selection process, please contact Gia Tran (HR Business Partner) on §03 8563 7657§ or email: §helppc@portphillip.vic.gov.au§ §The City of Port Phillip has zero tolerance for child abuse and is a committed Child Safe organisation, so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse. jobTitle: Editor Intern (Identified) Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50645679.txt	§Editor Intern (Identified)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Editor Intern (Identified)§§Advertiser: §State Library of Queensland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Editor Intern (Identified) §      §      §      §        §2 x positions §        §Identified Indigenous §        §Part Time §      §      §        §The black&write! project was established in 2010 in response to the significant and well recognised under-representation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in the writing and publishing industry. black&write! was designed to address this imbalance through a program that supports the development of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander writers and editors.§black&write! is comprised of a training model for editors alongside an annual writing competition: the black&write! Writing Fellowship competition. To date ten books have been published with many receiving significant critical acclaim. For further information please see the website at http://www.slq.qld.gov.au/whats-on/awards/blackwrite.§Two Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander editing interns will take part in a training program that includes:§• prescribed reading in contemporary literature, to be used as the basis for critical assessment, discourse, and written reports§• editing skills development§• reading manuscripts received through the Writing Fellowship competition§• contributing to the development of the winning manuscripts, working under mentorship of the black&write! team.§The Editor Intern roles will provide administration and support to meet team objectives, including the Writing Fellowship competition. Social media skills will be useful to promote opportunities and create connections.§This opportunity to join the black&write! team is meant for people with no previous experience in editing, however skills in organisation and working as part of a team, as well as experience using office software such as Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook will be highly regarded.§        §If you are interested in this job we encourage you to read the attached role description, get in touch if you have any questions, and apply!§Please note: this role is designated as Indigenous Identified. Under s.25 of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1991 (Qld), it is a genuine occupational requirement for the incumbent to be an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander person.§        §***APPLICANTS ARE REQUESTED TO APPLY ONLINE – scroll down and click the ‘APPLY ONLINE' button***§        §Please note any documents attached to Smart TXT should be in Microsoft Word or PDF format.  Please do not upload zipped files. §      §      §      §    §  §§§The black&write! project was established in 2010 in response to the significant and well recognised under-representation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in the writing and publishing industry. black&write! was designed to address this imbalance through a program that supports the development of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander writers and editors.§black&write! is comprised of a training model for editors alongside an annual writing competition: the black&write! Writing Fellowship competition. To date ten books have been published with many receiving significant critical acclaim. For further information please see the website at http://www.slq.qld.gov.au/whats-on/awards/blackwrite.§Two Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander editing interns will take part in a training program that includes:§• prescribed reading in contemporary literature, to be used as the basis for critical assessment, discourse, and written reports§• editing skills development§• reading manuscripts received through the Writing Fellowship competition§• contributing to the development of the winning manuscripts, working under mentorship of the black&write! team.§The Editor Intern roles will provide administration and support to meet team objectives, including the Writing Fellowship competition. Social media skills will be useful to promote opportunities and create connections.§This opportunity to join the black&write! team is meant for people with no previous experience in editing, however skills in organisation and working as part of a team, as well as experience using office software such as Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook will be highly regarded.§If you are interested in this job we encourage you to read the attached role description, get in touch if you have any questions, and apply!§Please note: this role is designated as Indigenous Identified. Under s.25 of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1991 (Qld), it is a genuine occupational requirement for the incumbent to be an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander person.§***APPLICANTS ARE REQUESTED TO APPLY ONLINE – scroll down and click the ‘APPLY ONLINE' button***§§Please note any documents attached to Smart TXT should be in Microsoft Word or PDF format.  Please do not upload zipped files. §§§§

jobTitle: Producer Events Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50662510.txt	§Producer Events§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Producer Events§§Advertiser: §Randwick City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$112,744 - $124,033 pa + 9.5% super + vehicle§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Producer Events §      §        §Position Number: F2020/00573§        §Salary: $112,744 - $124,033 pa + 9.5% super§ + leaseback vehicle§        §Permanent full-time (70 hour fortnight)§        § §        §          §Innovative and vibrant Eastern Suburbs Council§          §Good work/life balance with 1 day off a fortnight§          §Flexible wor§king conditions, family friendly policies and other great employee benefits§        §        § §        §Be a part of the major events that attract thousands of people to the Eastern Suburbs every year. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Events Producer to join the team at Randwick to manage the delivery of major public events in an iconic location with beautiful landscapes. Council is currently reviewing its events program and developing a strategy and we need a dynamic person to lead the change to deliver the outcomes of the strategy. Randwick is a unique place to hold events with renowned and diverse locations and sites such as Coogee Beach, La Perouse, The Spot and Kingsford.§        §Randwick Council aims to deliver world class community events to engage our local residents, celebrate our beautiful beaches, coastline and town centres and develop tourism opportunities. The team sits within the Economic Development and Placemaking Department which incorporates business relations, La Perouse Museum, venues and arts & culture. We have a diverse community and celebrate our history and multiculturalism. We embrace our sporting facilities, outdoor lifestyle and are in an exciting phase developing the arts and culture opportunities in Randwick.   §        §We are looking for an experienced event producer who has the creativity, determination and drive to engage the community and lead the team to create an amazing experiences incorporating festivals, events, programs, workshops and activations.§What we value:§        §We have a high performance culture fostered through our values of Integrity, Customer Focus, Accountability, Respect and Excellence. This culture encourages and supports equity, diversity and inclusion for our employees and our community.§        § §        §Working collaboratively, you will:§        §          §Create a sense of community across Randwick City through the delivery of diverse and dynamic events in iconic locations.§          §Deliver on outcomes of the Events Strategy and use creativity to realise the potential of existing and new events.§          §Manage and lead a team§          §Manage competing projects and priorities and to solve complex problems.§          §Build and maintain key stakeholder relationships with local businesses, community organisations and individuals.§          §Ensure the safety of our community with emergency management plans and awareness of public safety.§          §Consider the environment and implement the Council’s Green Events policy.§  §        §        §Employment in this position is subject to the successful completion of a Working with Children Check and Criminal History Check with a result of no relevant adverse findings.§        § §        §Further Information:§ Visit § www.randwick.nsw.gov.au§ to view the §position description§ online or contact Katie Anderson, Manager Cultural Events and Venues on §02 9093 6856§.§        §Applicants must include a statement demonstrating how they meet the essential knowledge, skills and abilities criteria listed in the position description, to be considered for this role.§      §      §How to Apply:§ Online at §www.randwick.nsw.gov.au§    §    §  §§§Position Number: F2020/00573§ §Salary: $112,744 - $124,033 pa + 9.5% super§ + leaseback vehicle§ §Permanent full-time (70 hour fortnight)§ § § § §Innovative and vibrant Eastern Suburbs Council§ §Good work/life balance with 1 day off a fortnight§ §Flexible wor§king conditions, family friendly policies and other great employee benefits§ § § §Be a part of the major events that attract thousands of people to the Eastern Suburbs every year. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Events Producer to join the team at Randwick to manage the delivery of major public events in an iconic location with beautiful landscapes. Council is currently reviewing its events program and developing a strategy and we need a dynamic person to lead the change to deliver the outcomes of the strategy. Randwick is a unique place to hold events with renowned and diverse locations and sites such as Coogee Beach, La Perouse, The Spot and Kingsford.§ §Randwick Council aims to deliver world class community events to engage our local residents, celebrate our beautiful beaches, coastline and town centres and develop tourism opportunities. The team sits within the Economic Development and Placemaking Department which incorporates business relations, La Perouse Museum, venues and arts & culture. We have a diverse community and celebrate our history and multiculturalism. We embrace our sporting facilities, outdoor lifestyle and are in an exciting phase developing the arts and culture opportunities in Randwick.   § §We are looking for an experienced event producer who has the creativity, determination and drive to engage the community and lead the team to create an amazing experiences incorporating festivals, events, programs, workshops and activations.§What we value:§ §We have a high performance culture fostered through our values of Integrity, Customer Focus, Accountability, Respect and Excellence. This culture encourages and supports equity, diversity and inclusion for our employees and our community.§ § § §Working collaboratively, you will:§ § §Create a sense of community across Randwick City through the delivery of diverse and dynamic events in iconic locations.§ §Deliver on outcomes of the Events Strategy and use creativity to realise the potential of existing and new events.§ §Manage and lead a team§ §Manage competing projects and priorities and to solve complex problems.§ §Build and maintain key stakeholder relationships with local businesses, community organisations and individuals.§ §Ensure the safety of our community with emergency management plans and awareness of public safety.§ §Consider the environment and implement the Council’s Green Events policy.§  § §Employment in this position is subject to the successful completion of a Working with Children Check and Criminal History Check with a result of no relevant adverse findings.§ § § §Further Information:§ Visit § www.randwick.nsw.gov.au§ to view the §position description§ online or contact Katie Anderson, Manager Cultural Events and Venues on §02 9093 6856§.§ §Applicants must include a statement demonstrating how they meet the essential knowledge, skills and abilities criteria listed in the position description, to be considered for this role.§§§§

jobTitle: Programming Traineeship Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50612555.txt	§Programming Traineeship§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programming Traineeship§§Advertiser: §AFL SportsReady Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§National Training Wage§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Only Indigenous Australians are eligible to apply as this position is exempt under the Special Measure Provision, Section 12 (1) of the Equal Opportunity Act 2011 (Vic).§  §The First Peoples Creative Industries Traineeships Program seeks to launch the careers of 18-24 year-old First Peoples by opening doors to exciting roles in the creative industries – spanning arts, culture, screen, design, music, digital games and more.§  §Your 12-month Traineeship, with a full-time wage, will include support and mentoring every step of the way as well as access to a network of First Peoples working in the creative industries – plus, you’ll study on the job for a nationally recognised business qualification.§  §Supported by the Victorian Government, the program is designed to encourage young people to develop the skills to run their own business, go onto further study or be employed in roles in the creative industries.§  §ABOUT US§  §ArtsReady is a program of AFL SportsReady, specifically designed to provide opportunities for creative jobseekers to start their careers with confidence, qualifications and skills.§  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  §Established in 1952, the Melbourne International Film Festival (MIFF) is one of the oldest film festivals in the world and the Southern Hemisphere’s largest. An iconic Melbourne event, the festival usually takes place each August in the heart of the city, presenting an acclaimed screening program that showcases the best in current cinema from around the world as well as retrospectives, tributes and discussion programs. Since its inception, MIFF has been strongly committed to local film with Australia's largest showcase of new Australian cinema.  MIFF has a distinguished track record in supporting and promoting First Peoples film making. Owing to the impact of COVID 19, MIFF 2020 was delivered digitally by a small team working from home.   §  §MIFF is looking for an enthusiastic and organised Programming Trainee to support the Programming Team. This is an entry level position which will develop a range of practical skills useful to a career in a film festival setting.§  §Working in consultation with your supervisor, the successful applicant will:§ § §Be employed by AFL SportsReady, as part of our ArtsReady program§ §Work with Melbourne International Film Festival (MIFF)§ §Get paid while studying for a nationally recognised qualification§ §Receive one-on-one mentoring support and networking opportunities§ §DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES§  §This role will give you invaluable experience and understanding in the area of film festival programming, content management, event planning and festival delivery.  You will be supported every step of the way while you develop your skills and learn how to undertake tasks such as:§ § §Supporting the Shorts Programmer in tracking information of films submitted for consideration for the 2021 program§ §Supporting the Programmers in liaising with filmmakers, sales agents, national film bodies or distributors regarding potential presentation of their films within the festival.§ §Updating and maintaining MIFF’s database§ §Assist in administering program data relevant to films, guests, screening fees, as applicable.§ §Supporting the programming team with research, coordination and outreach activities geared around the delivery of program elements, including MIFF Talks, MIFF VR, and MIFF guest attendances.§ §Viewing films (shorts/features/VR) and assisting with providing opinions and explanation as to the suitability of potential films for programming within the festival.§ §During the festival, work with your supervisor and team to support the hosting of festival guests and events.  § §Assisting the team with onsite event support for MIFF film screenings and special events, MIFF Talks and MIFF VR as required.§ §Learning to communicate key elements of the program with relevant MIFF departments – operations, marketing, systems, publicity, as required.  § §Under instruction, develop and distribute statistical or reporting information pre, during and post festival as needed, including an exit report at the end of contract.§ §Other general support to the Programming team as required§ §ELIGIBILITY§  §Applicants must not be currently studying towards or have completed a post-school qualification higher than a Certificate IV.§  §In addition, to be eligible for this program, you must be a First Peoples of Australia currently living in Victoria aged 18-24 years§  §SELECTION CRITERIA§ § §Commitment to learning, attention to detail and problem solving§ §Literacy, numeracy, research and IT skills§ §Positive attitude and commitment to upholding MIFF’s mission and values § §An interest in film and festival management§ §If not based in Melbourne, the trainee must be able to be based in the MIFF office May – August 2021§ §Confident communication skills – oral and written§ §Enjoy working in high energy, creative team§ §Ability to work to strict multiple deadlines§ §Demonstrate willingness to assist other staff when necessary§ §Display respectful behaviour towards other staff members§ §Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander – This action constitutes a measure intended to achieve equality as per the Special Measure Provision, Section 12 (1) of the Equal Opportunity Act 2011 (Vic).§ §WHY SHOULD YOU WORK WITH US?§  §Our Traineeships are the best way to fast-track your career into employment or business. We will provide you with the real skills and experience needed to succeed when first starting your career.§  §HOW TO APPLY§                                                                                                                                                                §Please submit an application via our jobs board by following this link: https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/programming-traineeship/§  §Please note that applications through our jobs board are processed as a first priority.  To ensure your success, please apply through the link above.§Applications close Sunday, October 18 at 5pm, unless filled sooner.§For further queries, please contact the ArtsReady Recruitment Team on §8413 3500§.§  §To ensure the safety of ArtsReady’s Victorian trainees, the commencement of this position will be subject to the guidance of the Department of Health and Human Services, State Government of Victoria, for remote and onsite workplaces.§  §This program is an initiative of the Victorian Government’s §Tharamba Bugheen: Victorian Aboriginal Business Strategy §2017-2021§ with support from Creative Victoria, TXT Victoria and the Aboriginal Economic Development Branch at TXT, Precincts and Regions.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Executive Producer, Cabaret and Commercial Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697932.txt	§Executive Producer, Cabaret and Commercial§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Producer, Cabaret and Commercial§§Advertiser: §Adelaide Festival Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Executive Producer, Cabaret and Commercial § § §Full time vacancy on a 3 year fixed term contract § §Based in Adelaide CBD§ §Experienced in producing in festival and commercial context§ §Develop your career at heart of the arts in South Australia§ §About the Adelaide Festival Centre Trust§ §Established in 1973, Adelaide Festival Centre Trust (AFCT) is the creative hub of South Australia and leading Asia Pacific cultural centre. The AFCT produces a bold, exciting and extensive program of festivals, events and performances all year round to inspire educate and entertain audiences from a variety of ages, experience and cultures. The AFCT prides itself on providing constant support, development and maintaining a positive work environment for all employees whilst upholding exceptional customer service to external organisations and patrons, as the home of performing arts in South Australia.§ §About the vacancy§ §Adelaide Festival Centre is seeking an innovative and experienced Executive Producer to take the lead in the curation, management and delivery of Adelaide’s iconic Cabaret Festival and also manage the attraction and coordination of Adelaide Festival Centre’s commercial programming.§ §In consultation with the Adelaide Cabaret Festival Artistic Director, the Director, Programming, Development and Venue Sales and the CEO & Artistic Director, the successful applicant will be responsible for the management and delivery of the Adelaide Cabaret Festival on an annual basis incorporating artistic excellence, niche market interest, box office viability and inclusion of local, national and international artists.§ §This role will also be responsible for identifying opportunities for improvement, including systems and practices, for all programming activities that fall within the incumbent’s brief and implementing or recommending appropriate responsive action.§ §In addition, this role will work closely with senior management and venue sales to ensure Adelaide Festival Centre venues are filled with commercial product including but not limited to touring musicals, and for making Adelaide a destination of choice for producers, promotors and artists alike.  Adelaide Festival Centre has two lyric theatres in operation, with the completion of the redevelopment of Her Majesty’s Theatre in addition to the Festival Theatre. This role (in conjunction with venue sales) will ensure both fulfil their potential.§ §The successful applicant will have:§ § §Experience in programming and producing in both a festival and commercial context;§ §A well-established network in the commercial theatre community locally, nationally and internationally;§ §Significant experience in the planning, presentation and production of performing arts events, specifically in the management of large scale projects and development of new work;§ §Experience with assessing the audience and box office potential of a wide range of arts events;§ §The ability to effectively manage large volumes of information and achieve multiple, often competing deadlines;§ §Experience in managing a team;§ §Experience with budgets and financial management;§ §Demonstrated high level project management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities and generate relevant reports for tracking purposes;§ §Sound contemporary understanding of the arts/entertainment/music industry.§ §This employment opportunity will initially be offered as a 3 year full time contract. Significant intrastate, interstate and international travel is required.§ §Benefits and Culture§ §The Adelaide Festival Centre Trust offer a range of benefits to its employees including salary packaging, flexible working arrangements and staff price tickets to shows, festivals and productions.§ §The South Australian public sector supports flexible ways of working including part-time working arrangements wherever reasonably possible. The sector is diverse and desires to increase in diversity and to create opportunities for more South Australians.§ §Applications§ §All applications will be treated in strict confidence and must include a cover letter stating your potential contribution to this role, the relevant skills and experience you can offer Adelaide Festival Centre, together with a current resume identifying relevant career, personal and educational achievements.§ §For more information about the Adelaide Festival Centre and a copy of the position description, please visit the Employment page on our website: www.adelaidefestivalcentre.com.au. Enquires can be directed to Elizabeth Hawkins, §Elizabeth.Hawkins@adelaidefestivalcentre.com.au§ or on §8216 8846§.§ §Please submit all applications via SEEK by 5:00pm ACDT 25 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

SCA is dedicated to delivering firsts in entertainment solutions with the ability to reach 95% of Australian's through our Radio, TV and Digital channels.  Working at SCA is far more than a job – it's an opportunity to be associated with one of the world's leaders in media entertainment.§Southern Cross Austereo – one of Australia’s most progressive and exciting entertainment-based media companies is looking for an experienced and motivated §Group Brand & Promotions Manager§ to join the Gosford team. This is a vibrant role, no two days will be the same! You will be leading the SCA Brand & Promotions strategy for the NSW regional market, as well as driving Gosford's local Brand & Promotions Strategy.  §Leading the Hit & Triple M Brand & Promotions Central Coast teams, as well as the Regional NSW teams, you will work closely with the 2DayFM & 2MMM Brand & Promotions Directors to be ultimately responsible for the successful management & implementation of the promotions strategy, to maximise revenue and ratings.§As the successful candidate, you have:§§Consolidated experience within Radio & Brand Promotions within the Media industry§Experience working alongside Radio Content and Sales teams to deliver exceptional results§Successful track record leading, motivating and inspiring teams§Experience in the strategic planning of promotional concepts and creative solutions for clients and brands§Experience in managing brand and client events and activations§A demonstrated ability to multitask and work to deadlines under pressure§Experience in managing and maximising budgets§Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence and engage your target audience§Strong organisational skills and attention to detail§A passion for radio and the media industry in general§§The opportunities are endless when you're working for one of Australia's leading media companies. jobTitle: Multimedia Specialist Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682848.txt	§Multimedia Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Multimedia Specialist§§Advertiser: §Route 59§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$65,000 - $75,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§Reports To: The Multimedia Specialist will report to the Art Director, who will direct them in fortnightly sprints.§ §Job Overview: We are looking for an full-time Multimedia Specialist to act as the main 3D artist within our studio, Route 59. As part of the full-time team, they will be expected to work onsite from 9am-5pm Monday to Friday. They will be the primary asset developer in the 3D pipeline, working alongside the 2D and programming artists to bring the visuals of our games to life. They will also require a competent knowledge of Mandarin Chinese.§ §Responsibilities and Duties:§ §The applicant will be the lead 3D artist in the studio, with their primary job being 3D modeling. Specific tasks include: low and high poly modelling, vertex normal editing, blendshapes, rigging, and basic animation.§They will be required to produce assets from start to finish, with tasks including shader development, texture map generation and editing.§They will be required to implement their assets in our Unity pipeline. Tasks include scene design/composition within Unity, basic lighting, particle effects, and optimization (light baking, LoD, etc.)§As the studio is working with a third party publisher in Shanghai, the applicant will be required to have a competent understanding of Mandarin Chinese in order to correspond with our partners.§ §Qualifications:§ §Bachelors Degree in relevant field (games, animation, 3D modeling etc.)§Valid Australian visa/PR§Minimum 3 years industry experience§Mandarin as first language or Chinese language certification equal or above HSK 6,  TOCFL B2§Punctual, professional attitude§As part of your application, please send us a portfolio showcasing samples of your work.§ §Software skills required:§ §Maya§Blender§Zbrush§Photoshop§Unity§ §Bonus:§ §Diverse candidates (women and PoC) encouraged§Knowledge/experience working in non-photorealistic rendering styles (anime, toon shaders)§Visual-based shader program such as Shader Forge and/or shader language programming§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§
