jobTitle: Associate Digital News Producer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50604482.txt	§Associate Digital News Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Digital News Producer§§Advertiser: §Nine§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Associate Digital News Producer §      §        § §        §Company Description§        §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. As the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want, while celebrating our ability to give the shared experiences to audiences, the ones which connect us together. Living at the intersection of Australia’s best content, conversation and culture, Nine is where Australia connects.   §        §Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, and CarAdvice, subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain and Macquarie Media. Our business operates in the following four divisions: Printing and Stuff (NZ); Publishing (including the Metro Mastheads, Nine Digital and Events), Stan, and Television.§        §Department/Team Overview§        §The Product team is responsible for shaping the digital product experience for Nine Digital and Publishing's wealth of properties including subscription mastheads The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, and Australia's leading broadcast video-on-demand destination, 9Now.§        §To do this, Product collaborates with partners from every part of Nine to understand audiences and create meaningful experiences that power Nine’s ambitious growth goals. §        §The product portfolio also includes nine.com.au, 9News.com.au, Wide World of Sports, 9Honey, Essential Parenting, Brisbane Times and WAToday.§        § §        §Job Description§        §Nine.com.au, Australia’s largest news, sport and entertainment network, is looking for an associate digital news producer to help drive the digital output for 9news.com.au. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of one of the biggest news sites in Australia and would suit someone looking for their first role in the media.§        §We're in the business of captivating audiences through powerful storytelling and quality journalism.  With this in mind, we 're looking for someone who is energetic and innovative, passionate about news, and excited about the future of media.§        §Position Overview§        §The associate digital news producer is based out of Sydney, working alongside the digital news, video and social media teams. The role involves covering breaking news, updating developing stories and generating content ideas across all media platforms for nine.com.au and 9news.com.au. News is a 24/7 operation and weekend work will be required. You’ll also be expected to implement bet SEO best practice for all content.§        § §        §Qualifications§        §Our ideal candidate will be energetic, engaged and keen to prove themselves in a busy newsroom environment.  This position will suit someone looking for their first job in media or with a year or two’s worth of experience looking to take that next step in your career.§        §With this in mind, some of the things we are looking for will be:§        §          §            §Demonstrated writing skills essential, with proven ability to produce clear compelling copy§          §          §            §Ability to source original news and feature stories§          §          §            §Excellent knowledge of the English language, grammar and syntax§          §          §            §Strong digital platform skills and a working understanding of all social media platforms  §          §          §            §An understanding of legal best practice, including defamation laws§          §          §            §Knowledge of Adobe Photoshop preferable§          §        §        § §        §Additional Information§        §All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia permanently.§        §Aside from working for the top news organisation in Australia and the ability to build your career, there are plenty of benefits to working at Nine.com,au.  These include a range of corporate discounts including NRL tickets, health insurance and free digital newspaper subscriptions plus, a complimentary one-year membership to Future Women, a club dedicated to helping women connect, learn and lead.§        §If you’re looking for your next challenge in a fun, rewarding environment, then this could be the role for you.  Our people move fast and act smart: if this sounds like you, then let’s talk!§        §Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ § §Company Description§ §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. As the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want, while celebrating our ability to give the shared experiences to audiences, the ones which connect us together. Living at the intersection of Australia’s best content, conversation and culture, Nine is where Australia connects.   § §Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, and CarAdvice, subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain and Macquarie Media. Our business operates in the following four divisions: Printing and Stuff (NZ); Publishing (including the Metro Mastheads, Nine Digital and Events), Stan, and Television.§ §Department/Team Overview§ §The Product team is responsible for shaping the digital product experience for Nine Digital and Publishing's wealth of properties including subscription mastheads The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, and Australia's leading broadcast video-on-demand destination, 9Now.§ §To do this, Product collaborates with partners from every part of Nine to understand audiences and create meaningful experiences that power Nine’s ambitious growth goals. § §The product portfolio also includes nine.com.au, 9News.com.au, Wide World of Sports, 9Honey, Essential Parenting, Brisbane Times and WAToday.§ § § §Job Description§ §Nine.com.au, Australia’s largest news, sport and entertainment network, is looking for an associate digital news producer to help drive the digital output for 9news.com.au. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of one of the biggest news sites in Australia and would suit someone looking for their first role in the media.§ §We're in the business of captivating audiences through powerful storytelling and quality journalism.  With this in mind, we 're looking for someone who is energetic and innovative, passionate about news, and excited about the future of media.§ §Position Overview§ §The associate digital news producer is based out of Sydney, working alongside the digital news, video and social media teams. The role involves covering breaking news, updating developing stories and generating content ideas across all media platforms for nine.com.au and 9news.com.au. News is a 24/7 operation and weekend work will be required. You’ll also be expected to implement bet SEO best practice for all content.§ § § §Qualifications§ §Our ideal candidate will be energetic, engaged and keen to prove themselves in a busy newsroom environment.  This position will suit someone looking for their first job in media or with a year or two’s worth of experience looking to take that next step in your career.§ §With this in mind, some of the things we are looking for will be:§ § § §Demonstrated writing skills essential, with proven ability to produce clear compelling copy§ § § §Ability to source original news and feature stories§ § § §Excellent knowledge of the English language, grammar and syntax§ § § §Strong digital platform skills and a working understanding of all social media platforms  § § § §An understanding of legal best practice, including defamation laws§ § § §Knowledge of Adobe Photoshop preferable§ § § § §Additional Information§ §All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia permanently.§ §Aside from working for the top news organisation in Australia and the ability to build your career, there are plenty of benefits to working at Nine.com,au.  These include a range of corporate discounts including NRL tickets, health insurance and free digital newspaper subscriptions plus, a complimentary one-year membership to Future Women, a club dedicated to helping women connect, learn and lead.§ §If you’re looking for your next challenge in a fun, rewarding environment, then this could be the role for you.  Our people move fast and act smart: if this sounds like you, then let’s talk!§ §Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50597949.txt	§Assistant Curator (Projects)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Curator (Projects)§§Advertiser: §Historic Houses Trust of New South Wales§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Assistant Curator (Projects) §      §        §We are looking for a passionate and authentic§ Assistant Curator (Projects)§ who is interested in joining a leading NSW Government agency focused on creating a living future for the past so that our visitors can experience Sydney's past as if they had lived it themselves.§        § §        §This is a targeted recruitment activity is conducted in accordance with Rule 26 of the Government Sector Employment Rules 2014 in relation to the employment of eligible persons. This role is targeted for Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people. This role is open to all applicants; however, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander are strongly encouraged to apply.§        § §        §What the opportunity is:§        §          §Employment with Sydney Living Museums, NSW Department of Premier & Cabinet§          §Assistant Curator Grade 2 - $94,763. Package includes salary ($76,931 - $85,488), employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.§          §Temporary full-time employment (for period up to January 2022).§          §The will be based at The Mint, Sydney CBD but will also be required to work across other locations as directed.§        §        §What we do§ Sydney Living Museums (SLM) cares for a group of 12 of the most important historic houses, gardens and museums in NSW on behalf of the people of NSW.§        §Our commitment to our audience is to maintain the museums, landscapes and collections with integrity whilst presenting the narrative of each in contemporary, compelling and relevant ways.§        § §        §Our purpose is to enrich and revitalise people?s lives with Sydney?s living history, and to hand the precious places in our care and their collections on to future generations to enjoy.§        § §        §What you?ll do with us§ This role provides assistant curatorial services to interpret, document, promote, develop, inform the care of, and advocate for, collections - §encompassing physical objects, digital assets, information, sites, museums and properties§ - and create informative, compelling and engaging curatorial content that ensures the objectives of the §Historic Houses Trust Act 1980§ and Sydney Living Museum?s strategic and business goals are met.§        § §        §For more information on the role §contact §Penny Stannard on §0439 183 921§.§        § §        §Click here for the §role description§ and §candidate information guide§.§        § §        §What you need to do to apply§ To apply you will need to submit the following:§        §          §A current resume with two referees§          §A covering letter 1-2 pages in length, this should include how your skills and experience meet the role's essential requirements as outlined in the role description.§          §And respond to the 2 targeted questions (no more than 20 lines per answer). Your responses to the targeted questions should be submitted online during your application and not included in the covering letter.§        §        §Submit your application before the §closing date§: 11.59pm Sunday 4 October 2020§        § §        §What else you need to know§ Sydney Living Museums (SLM) is committed to providing a flexible and inclusive workplace culture that values and supports diversity and inclusion. We believe everyone has the right to feel safe, respected, valued and heard regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, ethnic background or ability. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, the LGBTIQ+ communities, from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, and, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§        § §        §To be eligible for an ongoing role in the NSW Public Sector you need to be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident. For temporary and casual roles, you need to hold a valid visa giving you permission to work in Australia as required by the role. All successful candidates will be required to undergo a criminal record check with NSW Police.§        § §        §If you are speech or hearing impaired, have access requirements that require reasonable adjustment in the assessment process, or require access to information about this vacancy in a different format, please call the Head of Human Resources on §02 8239 2366§.§        § §        §A talent pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months.§        § §        §What the essential requirements of the role are§        §          §Tertiary qualifications in history/museums studies/heritage interpretation or related field and experience working in a cultural, museums or heritage environment.§          §Experience in conducting research, analysing and communicating information about social/cultural and/or public history, historic buildings, sites and collections.§          §Excellent communication skills with experience working in multidisciplinary teams.§          §Strong organisational skills with strong attention to details and the ability to prioritise and meet competing deadlines.§          §Current NSW driver?s licence§        §        §What you need to tell us - targeted questions:§        §          §Please give an example of a work program where you had to provide a range of assistant curatorial services simultaneously incorporating, for example, research, interpretation, content creation, collection documentation and public inquiries.  What strategies did you put in place to successfully complete the required deliverables on time?§          §Provide an example of a curatorial project that required you to collaborate within a multidisciplinary team environment to contribute towards a whole-of-organisation objective or outcome. jobTitle: Videographer, Video Editor, Content Creator, Digital Media Job in Toowoomba & Darling Downs - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50583147.txt	§Videographer, Video Editor, Content Creator, Digital Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Videographer, Video Editor, Content Creator, Digital Media§§Advertiser: §Little Pig Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Toowoomba & Darling Downs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§Little Pig Consulting is a growing small business with big ambitions.§ §We are seeking a DYNAMIC & CREATIVE to join our FUN, ENERGETIC and EVOLVING business in a part-time capacity with the opportunity to grow into a full-time role for the right person very quickly!§  §The person who will be successful is someone who is:§ § §innovative;§ §efficient,§ §adaptable;§ §able to think outside the box;§ §a problem solver;§ §a creative;§ §able to work independently and as part of a team; and§ §a sound communicator.§ §The individual will be responsible for:§ § §Creating and managing video content marketing strategies, and social media presences§ §Innovating and presenting new video marketing strategies & techniques§ §Developing engaging online content including videos, graphics, animations§ §Monitoring and analysing the content success§ §General admin duties§ §Video Production Skills§ §We are looking for someone with that creative eye, who keeps up with the latest trends & technology. They can produce epic video content from the planning stages (ideation, storyboard, copywriting) right through to the finished product. Skills in gimbal operation and audio recording is a must. You must also have the ability to create logo animations, experience with green screens, multi-camera editing, small camera & field audio experience. And if you love 360 videos and know what you are doing - that's a real advantage.§  §You will also possess the ability to plan, organise your time and communicate with all parties involved (the Client, our Creative Director, on-screen talent etc.) is required. Experience with drone videography & photography will be highly regarded. We are looking for a creative person who has a can-do attitude. You will likely have a marketing background, live & breathe video content,  social media & be keen to learn new skills as required. You will be loyal, dependable & resilient. §  §Software§ §You will be highly experienced in operating the full Adobe Suite (After Effects, Premiere Pro) & Final Cut, MS Office, basic web knowledge.§  §Pay§ §Above award wages, though the hourly rate may be negotiated with the right candidate.§  §Please apply with your cover letter of at least 250 words explaining why you are the perfect fit for this role and a copy of your resume.§  §If you possess these qualities and can undertake these tasks, we’d love to hear from you!§  §Please forward a cover letter and a resume to §emma@littlepigconsulting.com§  §Job closes 3/09/2020 unless otherwise stated.§  §Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§  § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§How would you rate your English language skills?§How many years' experience do you have in digital marketing?§§§

jobTitle: DIGITAL JOURNALIST - 2 YEAR FIXED TERM CONTRACT Job in Mackay & Coalfields - SEEK
advertiser: Try the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.
jobText: TXT/50665537.txt	§DIGITAL JOURNALIST - 2 YEAR FIXED TERM CONTRACT§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§DIGITAL JOURNALIST - 2 YEAR FIXED TERM CONTRACT§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Mackay & Coalfields§§Salary§§$60,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Employment§ §This position is a 2-year fixed term employment contract§ §The Applicant§ §We are looking for a dedicated full-time digital journalist who will be responsible for contributing editorial content for our 24-hour online news service in Qld and NT. Based in Mackay, you will work closely with our broadcast journalists in other regions and share stories, interviews and ideas. The loss of many regional newspapers has meant so many stories in our local regions are not getting told.  We want to change that. If you are passionate about storytelling in a fair and accurate way, we want to hear from you. The ideal candidate is a graded print journalist with a positive attitude, looking to work alongside a dynamic radio team in Australia’s largest regional radio network.§ §The Wage§ §$60,000 - $74,999 based on experience§ §Job Description§ §Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:§ § §Research, gather and prepare original daily online news stories§ §Interview, record, write content and provide audio for both online and on-air§ §Develop and maintain contacts in several regional communities§ §Confidently cover court, council and crime stories§ §Report accurate and balanced news stories at all times§ §Create a respectful rapport with peers and external stakeholders§ §Be able to work independently and make excellent editorial decisions§ §Required Experience§ §To be considered for this position, you will need the following skills and experience:§ § §You must have a tertiary qualification in journalism or communications§ §Proven experience covering court, local government and crime stories§ §A minimum of two years’ experience in print media§ §Excellent communication and written skills§ §The ability to work to precise deadlines§ §Be highly motivated and willing to work in a new and changing role§ §Have a deep understanding of print and broadcast law guidelines§ §Basic audio editing and photography skills preferred but not essential§ §To Apply§ §A full driver’s licence and transport is necessary. Please send your resume and a cover letter to the Qld/NT News Director at §hayley.turner@grantbroadcasters.com.au§ by October 31.§§§§

jobTitle: Commissioning Editor Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703744.txt	§Commissioning Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commissioning Editor§§Advertiser: §Starts at 60 Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$75,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§Overview of the role:§ §Starts at 60 is an online membership platform that carefully curates a selection of media, retirement information, products and services for tech-savvy Aussie Baby Boomers – and we need an experienced commissioning editor to ensure our content supports and enhances all parts of our business. § §If you’re experienced in commissioning and editing internal and external content contributors (including opinion-shaping columnists) on a range of topics from lifestyle to finance, driving editorial and commercial content from conception to publication and collaborating with news, marketing and sales teams in a fast-paced environment, we want you!§ § § §Key Responsibilities§ §You’ll manage a roster of external content contributors to ensure Starts at 60 is publishing content that:§ § §Shapes opinion on key over-60s issues§ §Reflects the interests of the Starts at 60 audience§ §Is timely and drives engagement in email newsletters, on social media and on site§ §Supports Starts at 60’s businesses in travel, insurance and e-commerce with content marketing § §Meets Starts at 60’s media clients’ content marketing requirements§ §Ensures Starts at 60 is an influential must-read for Aussie Baby Boomers.§ §This requires a strong knowledge of current affairs and the national conversation and a great understanding of what matters to older Australians, plus experience in conceiving, commissioning and editing content that talks to those issues in engaging, thought-provoking way. § §As per the above, you’ll work closely with Starts at 60’s marketing team to create content marketing, affiliate content, sponsored content and other types of commercial content that meets the business’ and our clients’ marketing requirements. § §This requires a high level of comfort with commercial content requirements and an understanding of how external contributors can influence purchasing behaviours. Knowledge of financial/personal finance topics would be highly advantageous. § §You’ll be tasked with growing Starts at 60’s roster of opinion-shaping contributors across a range of topics to drive both editorial and commercial outcomes.§ §This requires a good knowledge of Australian media commentators, an eye for spotting potential commentators/opinion-shaping opportunities and a high level of comfort with communicating directly with columnists when commissioning and editing content to ensure the published product is as conceived. § § § §Key skills and attributes§ § §Strong attention to detail, particularly where related to editing written content (grammar, spelling, content construction, etc.).§ §Great communications skills that facilitate smooth collaboration with internal teams and external stakeholders, including media clients and content contributors of varying levels of experience.§ §Strong planning skills, including the creation of content calendars and management of content delivery.§ §Excellent time-management skills that enable efficient handling of multiple deliverables, some to tight deadlines.§ §Comfort in managing a content commissioning budget that is aligned with broader business/client outcomes.§ §A keen interest in the role editorial and commercial content can play in a broader business strategy, including an understanding of marketing and sales revenue drivers.§ § § §Mandatory requirements§ § §Minimum of five years’ experience in writing/commissioning/editing a wide range of content styles, including content marketing and features. Experience in handling commentary/opinion/influencer content is desirable, as is an existing ‘contact book’ of potential columnists.§ §Minimum two years’ experience in use of Facebook as a content-publishing channel.§ §Proficiency in WordPress is advantageous.§ §A strong understanding of financial/personal finance content is highly advantageous.§ §Ability to work in Australia.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50666887.txt	§Magazine Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Magazine Editor§§Advertiser: §Coeliac Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§Title:                            Editor – §The Australian Coeliac§ §Location§:                     Sydney / negotiable§ § §Opportunity to take ownership of a publication and shape its future direction§ §Flexible location, hours, days of work§ §Health, wellbeing & lifestyle space§ §Make a difference!§ §Coeliac Australia is currently looking for a multi-skilled, hands-on Editor to join our team on a part-time or contractual basis. This position would ideally be based in Sydney, however we invite candidates from other locations to apply due to the potential for work-from-home arrangements. § §Coeliac Australia is a national registered charity offering membership, support and information services to Australians with coeliac disease and associated conditions requiring a gluten free diet. Our health and lifestyle member magazine, §The Australian Coeliac,§ has a proud heritage spanning multiple decades with a loyal and engaged readership. The magazine is produced and delivered to members on a quarterly basis.§ §Reporting to the Manager - Marketing & Communications, the Editor will spearhead the magazine, being responsible for all aspects of the magazine's production, including content planning, liaising with internal and external content contributors, writing features and general content, content collation, proofing & editing, coordinating member content submissions, overseeing the magazine’s graphic design, liaising with the advertising sales team, through to ensuring the magazine is printed and delivered on time and within budget.§ §This role represents a great opportunity to take ownership of all facets of a publication and make your mark on the future creative direction of our magazine!§ §Skills & Experience:§ § §You should be a master wordsmith with excellent editorial skills§ §5 years+ editorial/journalistic experience§ §A tertiary degree in Communications/ Journalism or similar (or proven track record of extensive practical experience)§ §A proven track record of creating compelling content§ §An excellent eye for detail, accuracy, tonality, style and consistency§ §Ability to create and upload digital magazine versions to digital platforms (currently Joomag)§ §A background in health, wellbeing or medical writing would be advantageous, as would an understanding of coeliac disease and the gluten free diet.§ §Proficiency in publishing tools such as InDesign, InCopy and Content Station.§ §Graphic Design skills would be advantageous§ §Proficient with key Microsoft packages (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)§ §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal§ §Self-manager of your time across multiple tasks to meet deadlines and within budget.§ §High interpersonal skills and ability to work both autonomously and as part of a wider team, engaging numerous stakeholders each quarter in the magazine's development.§ §Ability to conceptualise the future strategy for the magazine, ensuring member needs are at the forefront of the publication's purpose. §  § §WHAT’S ON OFFER§ § §Ideal opportunity to take ownership of all facets of a magazine§ §Flexible working structure regarding hours, location and days of work§ §Would also suit a freelance or self-employed operator§ §Potential access to tax-effective salary packaging options due to Coeliac Australia’s non-for-profit status§ §Rewarding role in a supportive team§ § § §TO APPLY§ §Please submit your CV and a detailed cover letter that outlines your suitability for this role to Sue Black at Coeliac Australia: §sue.black@coeliac.org.au§, by October 14th.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a publishing role?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§§§

You'll liaise with editors and camera operators to ensure our bulletins meet deadline and are of the highest standards.§Skills/Qualifications§§University qualification majoring in journalism with at least §two years experience§Excellent oral and written communication skills§Demonstrated understanding of how to compile a ratings winning bulletin§Knowledge of local, national and international news stories affecting the community.§Demonstrated understanding and working knowledge of media law§Accuracy and excellent attention to detail§Ability to meet deadlines through effective time management§Capacity to operate in a team environment, contributing positively to working relationships§Ability to identify story opportunities, and operate with initiative and flexibility§Positive work ethic, and the ability and willingness to learn new systems and processes§Demonstrated problem-solving skills§Experience working with and mentoring junior staff§Must hold the right to work in Australia§§If you are passionate about your work and want to be a member of an outstanding new team, please apply.§All applications must include a Cover Letter, Resume and Demo Reel.§§The WIN Network reserves the right to commence and/or conclude the recruitment process of this position, prior to the closing date of this advertisement.§§All staff employed by the WIN Network must hold permanent residency and the right to work in Australia.§§WIN Network is an equal opportunity employer.§ § §§§§

corridor.§A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.§ Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be jobText: TXT/50690792.txt	§Campaign Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Campaign Executive§§Advertiser: §Global Media Solutions Group Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§DIGITAL CAMPAIGN EXECUTIVE§ § §Work in Australia’s leading and most sophisticated Chinese and multicultural marketing agency  § §Assist some of Australia’s most exciting and biggest brands § §Become a media expert with on-job training and support working across leading Chinese and western digital media § §Global Media Solutions Group has built a reputation as an innovative leader in media planning and advertising to international and multicultural Australian markets launching campaigns on behalf of an enviable list of global and national advertisers. We provide our clients with deep and intelligent insights into the consumer behaviour of their target markets before planning and implementing clever media advertising across the world’s most exciting and dynamic markets and mediums.  § §We are now looking for an energetic and organised executive to assist in building these campaigns which will run across Australia’s Chinese and other diverse ethnic communities, China’s mainland and multi-market campaigns particularly throughout Asia.   As a campaign executive you will work in team environments for every project to research markets and new media and design strategies for clients to make real connections that will effect change.  You will need to be comfortable contacting Australian or overseas media to obtain information and negotiate before producing detailed media plans and intelligent based rationale.  In all of this, you’re never be alone.  You can then imagine that this is an environment that suits those with an insatiable appetite for constant learning as is the case for all of us at GMS. § §We work across all media including online, mobile, print, outdoor, TV and radio for Australian and offshore clients however our work, unsurprisingly, slews to digital and social media platforms including content creation and management and Influencer marketing especially in the Chinese markets.  Testament to our capabilities is evident in Tencent (WeChat) asking GMS to be their first Australian advertising Premium partner almost 2 years ago.  In addition, we have preferred supplier status and licensing agreements with the hottest Chinese media groups.   § §To be successful in this application§ you would ideally have at least a year of experience in advertising especially social and digital media, content management, planning or a related discipline.  A second language will be highly regarded especially Mandarin.  § §Importantly, you will demonstrate a genuine passion for all media and advertising and an ability to multi-task with strong analytical and communication skills as you will be researching foreign markets, consumer behaviour and dealing with multiple media suppliers and clients.  § §This is a full-time role, however a part-time position may be considered for certain candidates.  Beyond COVID you will conduct this from our office in the business precinct of St Kilda Road, Melbourne, Victoria.§ §We are a small company with big clients and we really know media.   § §If you've read this far, you probably should take one more simple step...forward your CV to GMS, immediately.  § § _____________________________________________ § §Key attributes and skills:  § § §Intermediate to Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel & Power Point  § §Some media and advertising knowledge is essential,  § §Researching foreign media landscapes and niche communities in Australia,  § §Able to work in a deadline driven environment  § §A Bachelor’s degree in any discipline will be considered highly.   § §Ability to work in Australia § § § §Please send CV and cover letter to:§  § §Jane Omond (Group Business Manager)  § §admin@mediasolutions.global§ § §APPLICATION CLOSE 19/10/2020 5pm § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing jobTitle: Theatre Technician Job in Gladstone & Central QLD - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640649.txt	§Theatre Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Theatre Technician§§Advertiser: §Gladstone Regional Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gladstone & Central QLD§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Theatre Technician 11099§The Gladstone Region is a dynamic Central Queensland coastal region that provides an enviable lifestyle and economic stability for more than 63,000 residents. Gladstone Regional Council is committed to a dynamic, proud and diverse future for the Gladstone Region that focuses on working together to balance our region’s lifestyle and opportunity. Our success is built on a foundation of safe, engaged, high performing talent and teams and a values-based culture centred around our SERVICE principles.§Council is seeking to appoint a Casual Theatre Technician to contribute to Council’s success.§About the Role§The purpose of this position is to provide excellent customer service whilst providing effective and efficient technical, operations and maintenance support and advice to venue hirers and theatre management, in order to deliver quality productions for hirers and patrons, organisations and residents of the Gladstone region.§About you§§Demonstrated high level of customer service, interpersonal and communication skills, to engage with a diverse client base.§Problem solving skills to effectively address technical matters prior to escalating to the Supervisor.§Previous relevant experience working in a Theatre or Convention Centre or demonstrable skills operating lighting, sound and audio visual equipment for stage productions.§Must be eligible and willing to obtain a positive notice Working with Children Blue Card on appointment. §Legally able to drive a manual motor vehicle in Queensland.§Proficient keyboard skills and experience using Microsoft Office Suite and operating corporate business systems.§Must be eligible and willing to obtain on appointment, a positive notice Working with Children Blue Card.§Legally able to drive a motor vehicle in Queensland.§§Why work for GRC?§§We are fortunate to live in an attractive, growing region and proud to provide opportunity for personal growth and career development for our employees.§We offer opportunities to grow your career within a progressive local government organisation and work in a high performing team that values your contribution.§You will be rewarded with a competitive salary including generous superannuation and a flexible roster that supports a generous work-life balance.§We offer a range of employee benefits including free physiotherapy, support services and discounted health cover and fitness memberships. §§Please be advised that the preferred candidate for this position, as a condition of employment, may be required to complete a criminal history check, a pre-employment medical or a skills assessment.§Council is committed to connecting with the Gladstone Regional community which values diversity and inclusion and encourages you to bring your whole self to work. Aboriginal, Torres Strait and South Sea Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.§Position Closes 12 noon Monday 12 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Head of Publishing  Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50704248.txt	§Head of Publishing §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Publishing §§Advertiser: §Save the Children Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§+ Full PBI Salary Packaging§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§ § §This is no ordinary opportunity.§ § Our Head of Publishing has the power to change the lives of millions of children around the world.§ § Playing a pivotal role in our ambitious growth and reach targets, you will be instrumental in leading our publishing, distribution and sales activities to provide culturally diverse and age appropriate content to readers around the world.§ § We’ve already changed the lives of more than 250,000 children, and with your help we can grow that to 20 million before the end of this decade.§ § §Library For All is no ordinary Not-for-Profit.§ § As a not for profit enterprise of Save the Children Australia, our mission is to make knowledge accessible to all equally. We have a proud history of using technology to disrupt traditional publishing models, and leverage innovation in our everyday work to deliver meaningful change for children’s education around the world. As a trusted partner to many of the world’s leading development agencies, we’re laser-focused on scaling our impact to create measurable change for millions more children.§ § §Where you come in:§ § In this newly-created full-time, permanent position, based in your choice of Melbourne, Brisbane or Sydney, you will enable the scaling of our impact through careful management of a globally dispersed team of publishing specialists for digital and print format publications. Reporting to our Chief Operating Officer, you will leverage your strong networks in the publishing world to increase our list and overall sales, improve our return on investment and, ultimately, drive impact of our vision.§ § §You will make an impact by:§Identifying, negotiating and securing high-value relationships with key partners§Creating new products, improving existing products and digitising and scaling systems and processes§Working cross-functionally to achieve and exceed production, revenue and beneficiary impact targets, and§Developing and managing commercially sound budgets.§Does this sound like you?§ § You are a driven and passionate publishing professional with a depth of experience that spans both print and digital publications. You thrive in an environment where technology enables vision and where the innovation is palpable. You’re a natural leader and easily develop meaningful relationships, finding a common ground and enthusiasm in shared vision and ambition. Critically, you’re determined to deliver better educational outcomes for children all around the globe.§ § §This role requires:§A highly experienced commercial publishing sector lead, who thrives in a disruptive role and organisation with a mandate for delivering ambitious goals and far-reaching impact§Experience managing publishing operations in international contexts (or similar complexity)§Proven ability to set and achieve bold goals in a fast-growing organization§Experience with a digital-first approach to publishing, including distribution and licensing§An understanding of educational content and programming in a low-literacy environment, and§(Ideally) Tertiary qualifications in the field of Creative Industries, Editing, Publishing or Business.§Working at Library For All is more than just a job.§ § It’s the feeling of knowing that your work is contributing to making the world a better place for children and working with others who feel the same.§ § In addition to working at the leading edge of education technology alongside a team of highly engaged professionals you will have access to:§Opportunity to work on additional projects alongside business as usual§Individual learning plans to assist in your career development§Internal employment and development opportunities within Library For All and Save the Children Australia§Friendly and highly flexible work environment§Agile work environment including working from home and flexible hours§Competitive salary + superannuation§Full salary packaging benefits§Additional annual leave options available§Sound interesting?§ § We’d love to hear from you. Submit your cover letter and resume by clicking on one of the buttons in the ‘Apply’ section.§ § Applications close §4pm Thursday 22 October 2020.§ § Position Description - §Head of Publishing§ § §At Library For All, we seek a workforce that is as diverse as our society - in race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexuality, cultures and beliefs - and reflects the communities we work in. We believe diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our culture and core values and we demonstrate this commitment through all our employment practices. Our inclusive workplace culture contributes to making Save the Children a great place to work.§ §We encourage people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander backgrounds to apply.§ § §Library For All is a child-safe organisation. All employees are required to undergo a National Police Check, a Working with Children Check where necessary, and sign our Child Safeguarding Policy and Code of Conduct.§ § §Library For All supports the Inter-Agency Misconduct Disclosure Scheme. If you are successful in your application, we will request consent to access HR held information§ §pertaining to your last 5 years of employment. You can read about the Scheme and our commitment to Safeguarding§ §here§§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50664365.txt	§Festival Creative Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Festival Creative Director§§Advertiser: §PeopleStart HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Festival Creative Director §      §        §In October 2019, Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras successfully won the rights to host WorldPride in Sydney in 2023.§        §WorldPride is an event that promotes lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and intersex (LGBTQI) issues on an international level through parades, festivals and other cultural activities.§        §Sydney WorldPride 2023 will take place over two weeks in February 2023 and will coincide with the 50th anniversary of the first Australian Gay Pride Week; the 45th anniversary of the first SGLMG; and the fifth anniversary of Marriage Equality in Australia. SWP 2023 will be the first WorldPride to be held in the Asia Pacific, and our programs will shine a light on LQBTQI+ human rights across the region.§        §In addition, First Nations peoples were an integral part of the bid, and will be front and centre to our WorldPride program.§        §SWP 2023 will build on the success of Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras and provide opportunities to engage more broadly with LGBTQI+ community groups, bringing new ways of engaging, sharing and working with audiences and participants.§        §We are looking for an experienced §Festival Creative Director§ to join the organisation to ensure SWP2023 engages and excites audiences, creates memorable experiences and provides significant benefits to the LGBTQI+ community and WorldPride.  §        §Position Purpose§        §The Festival Creative Director plays a lead role in developing the artistic and creative vision for SWP and ensuring this is delivered across Sydney WorldPride 2023 events. The ideal candidate will be able to form concepts and pilot creative and innovative ideas, inspire stakeholders and the team, and will be able to visualise the finished product before it’s been created.§        §The role is critical in executing the artistic direction for SWP 2023 and realising SWP 2023 as a landmark, international LGBTQI+ event, hosted for the first time in the Asia Pacific, with a focus on giving a voice to First Nations LGBTQI+ communities in the region. The Festival Creative Director will work closely with the First Nations Creative Director to ensure the First Nations vision is also successfully delivered.§        §Key Accountabilities include but not limited to:§        §          §Lead the creative process for SWP vision to execution, including engaging with relevant stakeholders and leading brainstorming/creative sessions to generate ideas§          §Lead and curate SWP arts, performing arts and music program, with a focus on LGBTQI+ artists within Australia and the Asia Pacific region more broadly§          §Conceive and implement concepts for SWP events with the creative team and collaborate with the broader SWP team on creative projects, overseeing them to completion§          §Pitch ideas effectively to stakeholders (internal and/or external), including writing and designing unique and well-crafted copy to clearly articulate an executable vision, revising content and presentations, approving/rejecting ideas and providing feedback to the team§          §Maintain up to date knowledge of LGBTQI+ global issues to ensure the creative output is current and relevant§          §Oversee the Festival Creative Program budget and ensure compliance with financial policies and manage the deliver of work programs against approved budgets§        §        §This role will initially commence as “Part Time” (3 days per week) with a view to moving into a fulltime role next year.§        §For the full position details please go to§        §https://www.sydneyworldpride.com/news/now-hiring-creative-director-roles§        §Please send your cover letter and application to:§        §Rob Gallacher, PeopleStart§mail: §rob@peoplestart.com.au§        §For any queries contact§Rob Gallacher on §+61478 760 714§        §Applications close 22 October 2020 §      §      §      §    §  §§§In October 2019, Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras successfully won the rights to host WorldPride in Sydney in 2023.§  §WorldPride The ideal candidate will be able to form concepts and pilot creative and innovative ideas, inspire stakeholders and the team, and will be able to visualise the finished product before it’s been created.§  §The role is critical in executing the artistic direction for SWP 2023 and realising SWP 2023 as a landmark, international LGBTQI+ event, hosted for the first time in the Asia Pacific, with a focus on giving a voice to First Nations LGBTQI+ communities in the region. jobTitle: Orchestral Operations Manager Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633644.txt	§Orchestral Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Orchestral Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §Canberra Symphony Orchestra§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$72,000 - $82,000 pro rata (incl. super)§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Based in Canberra§Initially part-time (three days – negotiable), with hours to increase as orchestral work resumes§$72,000–$82,000 pro rata§ (including superannuation)§  §ABOUT US§  §The Canberra Symphony Orchestra (CSO) is dedicated to reaching and enriching a broad audience through artistically vibrant musical experiences. §  §The CSO programs symphonic masterworks alongside compelling Australian compositions, championing Australian voices and stories. The CSO is proudly grounded in the arts ecosystem of the Canberra region, with a global outlook. §  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  §The Orchestra Operations Manager will manage the scheduling and production of all CSO orchestral and ensemble performances to a high standard, including musical services for commercial and community activities.§  §The Orchestral Operations Manager will report directly to the CEO and work collaboratively with the CSO administrative team, in line with the CSO’s artistic vision and annual programming.§  §Key areas of responsibility§  §(Full duty statement available at cso.org.au/employment.)§ § §Coordinate and deliver regular live music performances on stage, considering venues, logistics, engagement of musicians, budget, workplace conditions and related factors.§ §Model costs, resources, musical and technical requirements and timelines for programs, events and activities, including forward planning across multiple seasons.§ §Advise on logistics, venues and CSO operational capacity to deliver programs, Supervise operational requirements and manage end-to-end processes for rehearsals and performances, including coordinating outdoor orchestral events, adhering to best practice  workplace conditions. § §Act as a first point of contact for CSO musicians, representing musicians’ interests at the administrative level of the organisation and proactively identifying improvements to the musician experience.§ §Engage a range of high-quality musicians across local and national networks, including coordinating auditions and player rosters.§ §Collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to implement CSO’s artistic vision, objectives and strategies, always exercising discretion and sound judgement.§ §Conditions§  §The Orchestral Operations Manager will be required to engage with stakeholders and oversee production requirements at CSO events and performances and therefore cannot hold a performing position with the CSO.§  §ABOUT YOU§  §This role requires strong organisational skills, a solutions-focused attitude and passion for delivering high quality music experiences.§  §Our ideal candidate will demonstrate experience in and knowledge of the orchestral environment, and the ability to build relationships, model performance requirements and manage resources efficiently.§  §The role requires sound and nuanced practical judgement and the ability to work cooperatively in a small team and manage dynamic priorities, in a fast-paced environment.§  §Other desirable attributes:§ § §A compelling view of the impact that orchestral and ensemble performance has on its community and audiences§ §A functional knowledge of and respect for the business and administrative operations of a large performing arts organisation, including governance, event management, philanthropy, and external relations and marketing§ §Awareness of the particular musical resources and conditions in Canberra that affect the orchestra’s capacity to deliver its programs at a standard of excellence § §To apply, provide a CV and one-page cover letter outlining your experience and suitability to the role to Rachel Thomas, CEO, via §recruitment@cso.org.au§ by 9 October 2020.§§§§

People who can help us create a wide variety of content from quick-turn around short news items to longer form films. § §We will consider applicants who either can work in our in-house edit suite or use their own external facilities.§ §Required Skills§ § §Experience in filming (camera operations, lighting, sound and production setup)§ §Experience in editing footage to produce high quality videos, including the design and production of creative motion graphics and slide transitions§ §Ability to project manage media production and video content delivery in a timely manner§ §Able to produce jobs from concept through to viewer-ready videos on various web, social media, and other online platforms.§ §Able to interpret and develop briefs into strong video communication solutions and manage numerous projects simultaneously§ §Strong and proactive communication skills with a real appreciation for working as part of a small, hard-working team§ §High problem-solving skills and ability to lead§ §Immediate projects are available to the right contractors.§ §Please send a brief summary of your background and experience relevant to the above, an indication of your hourly rate and a link to the best examples of your recent work to DLaing@Riviera.com.au§ §Previous applicants need not apply. Thank you.§ §To discover more about Riviera, visit RivieraAustralia.com§ § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Technical AdOps Specialist - Digital Advertising Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50713034.txt	§Technical AdOps Specialist - Digital Advertising§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical AdOps Specialist - Digital Advertising§§Advertiser: §carsales.com Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§Got drive? You’ll fit right in§   § Our Advertising Operations (AdOps) are responsible for the day to day operations of advertising campaigns. The team is currently on the hunt for a §Technical AdOps Specialist§ who will be the “technical champion” and go-to person for all things regarding technical advertising campaigns. As our Advertising Tech Stack continues to evolve, this person will have ownership of our Audiences and maintenance of our Data Management Platform (DMP).§   § The Technical Operations Specialist will have ownership and management of a portfolio of digital campaigns – testing, delivery, optimisation and deep dive reporting.§   § §What you’ll do§ § §Define, build, activate and maintain audience segments in DMP. As well ongoing DMP management and maintenance.§ §Work on our Ad-server migration and integration of our native products from the CMS into the ad-server. Own and champion all technical aspects of new and existing ad-server and native products.§ §Use data and insights to ensure we are adhering to client needs and optimise audience and platforms.§ §Improve efficiencies for products, regular WIPs to troubleshoot technical issues, educate on new releases and on-going project work.  § §Set up of integrations with data visualisation platforms and dashboards such as Tableau, Datorama along with other tech platforms.§ §Ongoing optimisation and troubleshooting of audience segments in our DMP.§ §   § §What we’re looking for§ § §Experience in working with digital media products. You’ll know the industry, understand client needs and have experience in building case studies.§ §Hands on experience in creating, managing, optimising and reporting on digital advertising campaigns. Ideally across display, video and native. Experience in in the Activation of audiences across various platforms – CRM, LiveRamp, Google Ad Manager, Xandr, Amobee, DV360, Facebook, Xandr is also a bonus.§ §Any experience across using Nielsen, Google Analytics, Hitwise, Tableau, Datorama, Facebook Ad Manager and Data Manage Platforms such as Salesforce DMP, Lotame or anything similar will be highly regarded.  § §Someone who gets numbers, you’ll have a passion for data with natural analytic skills. You’ll have the ability to take complex data sourced from multiple sources and insights to create compelling stories whilst ensuring we are aligning to client needs and industry trends.§ §Experience working with ad-servers or similar technology.§ § § §Why apply?§When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career. carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage everyone of all ages and background to apply. We know how important keeping that balance between work/life is and have a range of flexible working options on offer. We are open to this conversation during our recruitment process so if you want to know more just ask! §  -- §And just a quick one… § §We are continuing to recruit for talent during to COVID-19 pandemic. With a majority of our people are working remotely, all interviewing and onboarding will be done virtually. Health and safety is our number one priority, so anyone who joins will work remotely until it is appropriate an safe for us to open our offices.§Successful candidates joining carsales are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Commissioning Editor Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50651839.txt	§Commissioning Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commissioning Editor§§Advertiser: §Cambridge University Press§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§At Cambridge University Press we are committed to advancing learning, knowledge and research worldwide.  We exist to unlock people’s potential with the very best learning and research solutions.§  §We currently have an exciting opportunity for a talented publisher to join our award winning higher education publishing team.  This role is responsible for commissioning and developing innovative print and digital teaching and learning materials for use in university courses throughout Australia and New Zealand.   The role works with authors, editors and contributors to deliver excellent learning materials for a range of university courses.  Internally the role works closely with friendly and talented colleagues in sales, marketing, publishing and production.§  §The ideal candidate will be passionate about educational publishing, and have at least two to three years’ direct experience in a similar role.  We are looking for someone with great energy and enthusiasm, who takes a pro-active, problem solving approach to all manner of publishing challenges and opportunities.  Most of all we are looking for someone who is highly skilled in identifying new publishing opportunities, based on thorough market research, and taking them from concept through to published product.  You will enjoy working with colleagues in sales and marketing to ensure your published products are widely used.   You will possess excellent communication, organisational, project management and team skills, and will be someone who pays great attention to detail, particularly in relation to customers. You will be tenacious in approach, ensuring that your products achieve success.§  §In return we offer flexible working arrangements, career development, and the opportunity to work for the world’s oldest and among the most respected academic publishers.§  §A full position description will be made available upon request.  Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.§  §To apply for this role, please send your cover letter and resume via the APPLY button below by COB Wednesday 28 October.  §  §For a copy of the position description please email Laura Knipe (§lknipe@cambridge.org§), with the subject line Commissioning Editor. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a publishing role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How would you rate your English language skills?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50615056.txt	§Multiplatform Producer Network Desk§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Multiplatform Producer Network Desk§§Advertiser: §ABC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Multiplatform Producer Network Desk §    §      §        §          §Be a part of Australia's independent national broadcaster§          §Ultimo, Sydney§: Convenient CBD location (near Central Station)§          §Create authentic and high-quality content across multiple news platforms§        §        §About ABC§ §News§        §ABC NEWS§ is the nation’s leading independent news service on broadcast, digital and social media platforms. It has newsrooms in each state and territory, a presence in 48 suburban and regional newsrooms, 11 foreign bureaux, and includes ABC NEWS online, the 24-hour ABC NEWS TV channel and ABC NewsRadio. Our leading TV and audio programs include 7pm News, 7.30, Australian Story, Four Corners, Insiders, News Breakfast, Behind the News, The Drum, Foreign Correspondent, Q&A, AM, Background Briefing, PM, RN Breakfast and RN Drive. Our teams include many of Australia’s best-known and most respected journalists.§        §About the Role§        §You will take a leading role in providing efficient daily production support to ensure ABC News Network Desk is an agenda-setting unit, maintaining consistently high standards of original, creative and relevant output across platforms.§        §Under general direction of the Newsgathering Editor and liaising with relevant program, news online and network teams, you will:§        §          §Produce high-quality and engaging news video content for 7pm, News Channel and Digital Platforms using multi-media editing and production systems.§          §Work independently and alongside reporters to research, produce and deliver accurate, concise and clear multiplatform network stories for a broad audience.§          §Help drive the growth of video on demand, by generating and developing stories that are compelling for the audience, using the latest news graphics and digital video techniques.§          §Be aware of audience, digital and social media trends and their influence on news consumption and delivery.§          §Be flexible and take a collaborative approach within the team.§          §Contribute to daily editorial meetings and conference calls.§        §        §About You§        §You are a talented producer with excellent organisational, problem solving and troubleshooting skills to manage multiple and complex projects simultaneously, under stringent timeframes. You will also bring:§        §          §Accomplished editorial and production skills to produce video, audio and digital stories to a standard ready to publish.§          §Presentation skills suitable for radio/audio reporting and television/video reporting.§          §Proven story telling capability for television and radio.§          §Developed field production skills.§          §Strong track record writing and producing digital stories with text, graphics, and photos/video to a high production level.§          §Sophisticated understanding of user behaviours on digital platforms/mobile and ideas on how to grow new audiences.§        §        §For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:  §50059586 MULTIPLATFORM PRODUCER NETWORK .pdf§        §How to Apply§        §We would love to see your work.§ Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).§        §For further information on this position please contact Tracey Kirkland, Senior Newsgathering Editor on §02 8333 4765§ or §kirkland.tracey@abc.net.au§. §We are unable to accept email applications, please ensure that you submit your application via the online portal.§        §We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.§        §For more information on working at the ABC visit §abc.net.au/careers§        §Applications Close: 11:55 pm, 20 October.§        §The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.§        §For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to §ABC LinkedIn§ and §Life Page§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Be a part of Australia's independent national broadcaster§§Ultimo, Sydney§: Convenient CBD location (near Central Station)§§Create authentic and high-quality content across multiple news platforms§§About ABC§ §News§§ABC NEWS§ is the nation’s leading independent news service on broadcast, digital and social media platforms. It has newsrooms in each state and territory, a presence in 48 suburban and regional newsrooms, 11 foreign bureaux, and includes ABC NEWS online, the 24-hour ABC NEWS TV channel and ABC NewsRadio. Our leading TV and audio programs include 7pm News, 7.30, Australian Story, Four Corners, Insiders, News Breakfast, Behind the News, The Drum, Foreign Correspondent, Q&A, AM, Background Briefing, PM, RN Breakfast and RN Drive. Our teams include many of Australia’s best-known and most respected journalists.§About the Role§You will take a leading role in providing efficient daily production support to ensure ABC News Network Desk is an agenda-setting unit, maintaining consistently high standards of original, creative and relevant output across platforms.§Under general direction of the Newsgathering Editor and liaising with relevant program, news online and network teams, you will:§§Produce high-quality and engaging news video content for 7pm, News Channel and Digital Platforms using multi-media editing and production systems.§Work independently and alongside reporters to research, produce and deliver accurate, concise and clear multiplatform network stories for a broad audience.§Help drive the growth of video on demand, by generating and developing stories that are compelling for the audience, using the latest news graphics and digital video techniques.§Be aware of audience, digital and social media trends and their influence on news consumption and delivery.§Be flexible and take a collaborative approach within the team.§Contribute to daily editorial meetings and conference calls.§§About You§You are a talented producer with excellent organisational, problem solving and troubleshooting skills to manage multiple and complex projects simultaneously, under stringent timeframes. You will also bring:§§Accomplished editorial and production skills to produce video, audio and digital stories to a standard ready to publish.§Presentation skills suitable for radio/audio reporting and television/video reporting.§Proven story telling capability for television and radio.§Developed field production skills.§Strong track record writing and producing digital stories with text, graphics, and photos/video to a high production level.§Sophisticated understanding of user behaviours on digital platforms/mobile and ideas on how to grow new audiences.§§For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:  §50059586 MULTIPLATFORM PRODUCER NETWORK .pdf§§How to Apply§§We would love to see your work.§ Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).§For further information on this position please contact Tracey Kirkland, Senior Newsgathering Editor on §02 8333 4765§ or §kirkland.tracey@abc.net.au§. §We are unable to accept email applications, please ensure that you submit your application via the online portal.§We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position.§For more information on working at the ABC visit §abc.net.au/careers§§Applications Close: 11:55 pm, 20 October.§§The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.§§For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to §ABC LinkedIn§ and §Life Page§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Brand Ambassadors / Promotional Staff Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640086.txt	§Brand Ambassadors / Promotional Staff§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Brand Ambassadors / Promotional Staff§§Advertiser: §Activ8 Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Promotions§§§§§§WA's largest provider of promotional sampling and experiential marketing staff is looking to expand its team. We are on the hunt for additional Brand Ambassadors as WA's restrictions ease and our workload returns. We are looking for personality over experience.§ §We want you to take our client's products to the people.  Our work is largely demonstrating inside supermarkets and liquor stores, however we also work at major events, shopping centres, sporting venues, airports, train stations and outdoors.§ §You will be responsible for representing our clients and communicating the benefits and features of their products. You will be provided with all necessary training/information on the product to then convey these messages. More often than not, you will be required to conduct this work autonomously in supermarkets.§ §What can we offer you?§ § §Some flexibility on when and where you work§ §Opportunities to represent large national and international brands§ §A chance to meet many other like-minded individuals with huge personalities and positive attitudes.§ §An immediate or non-immediate start§ §Fun – a job that is always varied.§ §Do you fit the following requirements?§ § §Positive attitude at all times§ §CONFIDENCE§ §Willingness to travel to different suburbs and locations around Perth§ §Outgoing yet professional personality§ §Well-presented and well-groomed§ §No visible tattoos in a t-shirt and no facial piercings§ §Self-motivated and punctual. Ability to work without supervision.§ §High level of attention to detail.§ §Availability of at least three days per week (12 hours between Wednesday – Sunday)§ §Play well with others§ §This job is well suited to University students. Travellers on Working Holiday Visas with §high-level §English are encouraged to apply. § §PLEASE NOTE§: A reliable car, current driver's licence and smartphone are vital to perform well in this role.§ §If this sounds like you, apply now with a resume, current photo (does not need to be a professional headshot) and as much information about yourself as possible.  § §Please include your availabilities.§ §Please note - Group interview invitations will be emailed to suitable candidates. Please check your email regularly.§§§§
