Want the chance to be part of our dynamic and exciting industry,§2. Think you have what it takes to be part of our team,§3. Have always wondered what it would be like to be a part of film & TV production,§4. Are looking for paid involvement on a casual basis,§5. Or you're looking for an entry-point to a career in the entertainment industry in front of - or behind - the camera,§ §Do something special and exciting for yourself! § §Who knows where it might lead?§           Join us for a Free Information Session !§ §                           Reserve Your Seat at § §       www.oncuetalent.com.au/information-sessions/§ §                   §  or check us out on Facebook !§§§§

jobTitle: Curator, International Art Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653478.txt	§Curator, International Art§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Curator, International Art§§Advertiser: §Queensland Art Gallery§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Curator, International Art §      §        §At QAGOMA, International Art are responsible for the development of exhibitions that range from vast to intimate in scale, as well as caring for and developing the gallery's International collection.§        §The Curator, International Art plays a vital role across all of these areas, working in a small team under the Curatorial Manager International Art.§        §Art and artists are at the centre of this role, and all that we care for. Equally, we strive to welcome, captivate, challenge and energise our audiences.§        §We are seeking an experienced curator, ready to dream of new worlds whilst also being capable and patient, able to navigate the processes of a large institution. We are looking for a colleague who is an excellent communicator and cares about their working relationships, near and far.§        §The Curator, International Art will have the capacity to understand the collection as it stands, and join us in looking towards the future - planning how the collection might best be developed to reflect the world (and worlds) we live in as well as the communities we serve.§        §We are seeking a flexible, inspiring and creative thinker, to contribute to the research, development and delivery of exhibitions. As examples of major exhibitions, International Art are currently working towards §European Masterpieces from the Metropolitan Museum of Art§, recent major exhibitions include §Water§; §Gerhard Richter: The Life of Images§ and §Sugar Spin: You, me, art and everything§. Exhibitions drawn primarily from the collection include §Revelations§; §Work, Work, Work§; §Measures of Distance§; §Limitless Horizon: Vertical Perspective§; §Sublime§ and §Harvest§. The role requires a team player, keen to contribute to shared and scheduled projects; as well as offering opportunities to develop your own curatorial and creative voice.§        §To find out more about the Art Gallery please visit our website at www.qagoma.qld.gov.au.§How to apply:§If you are interested in this job we encourage you to read the attached Role Description and talk to Geraldine Kirrihi Barlow, Curatorial Manager, International Art at §Geraldine.Barlow@qagoma.qld.gov.au§ if required.§        §To be successful in this role you must possess tertiary qualifications in art history, the visuals arts or museum studies from a recognised institution/s. A demonstrated strong and broad working knowledge of international art and its history, and experience with multilingual and/or diverse cultures is desirable.§        § §        § §***APPLICANTS ARE REQUESTED TO APPLY ONLINE – scroll down and click the ‘APPLY ONLINE' button***§        §Please note any documents attached to Smart TXT should be in Microsoft Word or PDF format.  Please do not upload zipped files. §      §      §      §      §    §  §§§At QAGOMA, International Art are responsible for the development of exhibitions that range from vast to intimate in scale, as well as caring for and developing the gallery's International collection.§The Curator, International Art plays a vital role across all of these areas, working in a small team under the Curatorial Manager International Art.§Art and artists are at the centre of this role, and all that we care for. Equally, we strive to welcome, captivate, challenge and energise our audiences.§We are seeking an experienced curator, ready to dream of new worlds whilst also being capable and patient, able to navigate the processes of a large institution. We are looking for a colleague who is an excellent communicator and cares about their working relationships, near and far.§The Curator, International Art will have the capacity to understand the collection as it stands, and join us in looking towards the future - planning how the collection might best be developed to reflect the world (and worlds) we live in as well as the communities we serve.§We are seeking a flexible, inspiring and creative thinker, to contribute to the research, development and delivery of exhibitions. As examples of major exhibitions, International Art are currently working towards §European Masterpieces from the Metropolitan Museum of Art§, recent major exhibitions include §Water§; §Gerhard Richter: The Life of Images§ and §Sugar Spin: You, me, art and everything§. Exhibitions drawn primarily from the collection include §Revelations§; §Work, Work, Work§; §Measures of Distance§; §Limitless Horizon: Vertical Perspective§; §Sublime§ and §Harvest§. The role requires a team player, keen to contribute to shared and scheduled projects; as well as offering opportunities to develop your own curatorial and creative voice.§To find out more about the Art Gallery please visit our website at www.qagoma.qld.gov.au.§How to apply:§If you are interested in this job we encourage you to read the attached Role Description and talk to Geraldine Kirrihi Barlow, Curatorial Manager, International Art at §Geraldine.Barlow@qagoma.qld.gov.au§ if required.§To be successful in this role you must possess tertiary qualifications in art history, the visuals arts or museum studies from a recognised institution/s. A demonstrated strong and broad working knowledge of international art and its history, and experience with multilingual and/or diverse cultures is desirable.§ § §***APPLICANTS ARE REQUESTED TO APPLY ONLINE – scroll down and click the ‘APPLY ONLINE' button***§§Please note any documents attached to Smart TXT should be in Microsoft Word or PDF format.  Please do not upload zipped files. §§§§

jobTitle: Content Writer - 3 days per week Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50623686.txt	§Content Writer - 3 days per week§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Content Writer - 3 days per week§§Advertiser: §Catalyst Technologies§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$80k pro-rated for 3 days per week§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Catalyst Technologies is an up-and-coming Australian tech start-up, fresh from a capital raise, and now ready to take on the world. We empower many of the world’s leading organisations to thrive when faced with adversity, providing our market leading Critical Event Management and Disaster Resilience software CQ,§Building on the momentum already secured across both enterprise and mid-market sectors, we are looking for highly skilled content creator for 3 days per week who is passionate about communication, language and attention to detail. The role will work collaboratively across a dynamic and cross-functional team and engage with industry experts to write copy and edit content across multiple channels and platforms.§Key responsibilities in this role include:§Work with the sales and marketing team to research, conceptualize and workshop content ideas that are aligned with the brand’s overall marketing and communications strategy§Produce high quality copy for EDM’s, blogs, articles, media releases, surveys, short-form whitepapers, playbooks and other digital content§Work with our marketing manager to ensure SEO best practice is factored into content creation§Be a champion for the brand, ensuring all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality, and tone of voice§Evolve our tone of voice in line with our brand personality and values, and build out our brand book over time§Actively present new initiatives that enhance the customer experience and business performance§We’re looking for people who have:§3-5 years of experience in a journalist or copywriting role, either in-house or at an agency§Proactive approach to seeking content from thought leaders in the resilience industry both in-house and externally§Exceptional writing capabilities with the ability to articulate a compelling point of view with a “so what” that creates light bulb moments for the audience§Ability to write content for a range of formats such as website, social, eDM, and advertising and adapt writing style to suit different audiences and objectives§Have the capability to deliver storytelling content including strong production, writing, and editing skills§Knowledge of SEO best practice and content structure§The ability to work independently, are highly organised and able to manage your own workload while maintaining high standards of work§Flexibility to work from the office and home.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a writer?§Are you experienced with copy writing and content creation?§§§

jobTitle: Digital Content Producer - 6PR Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50604512.txt	§Digital Content Producer - 6PR§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Content Producer - 6PR§§Advertiser: §Nine§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital Content Producer - 6PR §      §        § §        §Company Description§        §About Nine §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. We are Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want.§        §Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and Australian Financial Review, radio stations 2GB, 3AW, 4BC and 6PR, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Now, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, subscription video platform Stan and a majority investments in Domain Group and CarAdvice.§        § §        §Job Description§        §The Digital Content Producer will amplify the best of 6PR online.§        §Liaising with on-air teams and the newsroom, your online expertise will engage new and current audiences across digital platforms, including social media, podcasting and 6PR.com.au.§        §With a focus on news, sport and current affairs, the Digital Content Producer will work with the Content Manager and Head of Digital to identify opportunities to showcase the station's agenda-setting coverage of everything that gets Perth talking.§        §You will also liaise with the rest of the Nine Radio network to execute and create content and commercial opportunities and act as a brand ambassador in the digital space§.§        § §        §Qualifications§        §          §A journalism degree, or related qualification§          §Excellent writing skills§          §An eye and ears for a news story§          §Something bordering on an obsession with social media§          §The ability to work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment§          §You should have some experience with online publishing.§          §Photo and video production skills will be highly regarded, but not essential. §        §        § §        §Additional Information§        §We embrace all aspects of diversity & inclusion and are committed to creating a workplace which The successful applicant will naturally be as obsessed with the customer as we are, with extensive experience in uncovering customer insights to drive great ideas and create inspirational photography.§ §This role is casual (10-24hrs/wk) at an hourly rate of $25p/h. You will be photographing on Tuesday and Saturdays plus assisting our other photographers on Wednesday and Fridays. Our studio is extremely busy and we envision this role becoming a fulltime role in the future meaning it’s a fabulous opportunity for a long term career. § §The Role will include: §Creating an Photography folio (people portraits ONLY) §A cover letter explaining why you would be the perfect candidate for this role§… and APPLY NOW!§ §To see more about our company, check us out at questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a photographer?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have experience working with children?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664339.txt	§First Nations Creative Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§First Nations Creative Director§§Advertiser: §PeopleStart HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §First Nations Creative Director §      §        §In October 2019, Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras successfully won the rights to host WorldPride in Sydney in 2023.§        §WorldPride is an event that promotes lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and intersex (LGBTQI) issues on an international level through parades, festivals and other cultural activities.§        §Sydney WorldPride 2023 will take place over two weeks in February 2023 and will coincide with the 50th anniversary of the first Australian Gay Pride Week; the 45th anniversary of the first SGLMG; and the fifth anniversary of Marriage Equality in Australia. SWP 2023 will be the first WorldPride to be held in the Asia Pacific, and our programs will shine a light on LQBTQI+ human rights across the region.§        §In addition, First Nations peoples were an integral part of the bid, and will be front and centre to our WorldPride program.§        §SWP 2023 will build on the success of Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras and provide opportunities to engage more broadly with LGBTQI+ community groups, bringing new ways of engaging, sharing and working with audiences and participants.§        §We are looking for an experienced §FIRST NATIONS CREATIVE DIRECTOR§ to join the organisation and lead the creative process for SWP’s First Nation’s vision, and to ensure SWP2023 engages and excites audiences, creates memorable experiences and provides significant benefits to the LGBTQI+ community and WorldPride. §        §Position Purpose§        §The First Nations Creative Director plays a lead role in ensuring that First Nations voices, stories and experiences are appropriately represented across all SWP events, in particular the curation of the First Nations Hub.§        §The First Nations Creative Director will work closely with the SWP Festival Creative Director to ensure the artistic direction for SWP 2023 is successfully achieved.§        §Key Accountabilities include but not limited to:§        §          §Lead the creative process for SWP’s First Nation’s vision to execution, including working with the First Nations Engagement Officer to engage with relevant stakeholders, leading brainstorming/creative sessions to generate ideas§          §Lead and curate SWP performing arts/music program, with a focus on First Nations LGBTQI+ artists within Australia and the Asia Pacific region more broadly§          §Conceive and implement First Nation’s concepts for SWP events with the creative team and collaborate with the broader SWP team on creative projects§          §Pitch ideas effectively to clients (internal and/or external), including writing and designing unique and well-crafted copy to clearly articulate an executable vision, revising content and presentations, approving/rejecting ideas and providing feedback to the team.§          §Maintain up to date knowledge of LGBTQI+ global issues to ensure the creative output is current and relevant§          §Provide specialist advice on culturally aware and culturally competent approaches for First Nations participants and audiences§          §Provide specialist advice on inclusion of First Nations perspectives, protocols, content, histories and knowledge for all SWP events§        §        §For the full position details please go to§        §https://www.sydneyworldpride.com/news/now-hiring-creative-director-roles§        §This role will initially commence as “Part Time” (3 days per week) with a view to moving into a fulltime role next year.§        §Please send your cover letter and application to:§        §Rob Gallacher, PeopleStart§mail: rob@peoplestart.com.au§        §For any queries contact§Rob Gallacher on §+61478 760 714§§        §Applications close 22 October 2020 §      §      §      §    §  §§§In October 2019, broadly with LGBTQI+ community groups, bringing new ways of engaging, sharing and working with audiences and participants.§  §We are looking for an experienced §FIRST NATIONS CREATIVE DIRECTOR§ to join the organisation and lead the creative process for SWP’s First Nation’s vision, and to ensure SWP2023 engages and excites audiences, creates memorable experiences and provides significant benefits to the LGBTQI+ community and WorldPride. §  §Position Purpose§  §The First Nations Creative Director plays a lead role in ensuring that First Nations voices, stories and experiences are appropriately represented across all SWP events, in particular the curation of the First Nations Hub.§  §The First Nations Creative Director will work closely with the SWP Festival Creative Director to ensure the artistic direction for SWP 2023 is successfully achieved.§  §Key Accountabilities include but not limited to:§ § §Lead the creative process for SWP’s First Nation’s vision to execution, Your duties will include, but are not limited to the following tasks:§ § §Prepare content, contribute ideas and organise interviews for the 6PR Mornings program both on air and through social media and online.§ §Contribute on air as a program reporter§ §Manage stakeholder relationships with on-line content, sales, integration, news, production and the audience.§ § § §Qualifications§ §We are looking for someone with the energy and enthusiasm to embrace our audience and promptly attend to the needs of our most valuable assets: our listeners.  We want a candidate with the following attributes and experience:§ § §an excellent knowledge of news and current affairs;§ §experience in radio or other news media;§ §ability to recognise a good story when you hear it;§ §strong verbal and broadcast-writing skills;§ §capacity to thrive under pressure in a fast-paced, deadline-focused environment; and§ §have an excellent understanding of media and broadcast law.§ §Desirable experience & skills§ § §Familiarity with Newsboss and Wordpress§ §Social and Digital media skills§ § § §Additional Information§ §We embrace all aspects of diversity & inclusion and are committed to creating a workplace which reflects the incredibly diverse customers, audiences and communities we serve.§Disclaimer§: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes§§§§

jobTitle: Creative Producer (Outdoor Projects) Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50593570.txt	§Creative Producer (Outdoor Projects)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Creative Producer (Outdoor Projects)§§Advertiser: §RISING Melbourne§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$80,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§RISING is a surge of art, music and ceremony in the heart of Melbourne.§  §Taking the place of the Melbourne International Arts Festival and White Night Melbourne, RISING is a major cultural event for the Asia Pacific Region created by a diverse team of local, national and international artists and curators.§  §RISING will begin on the evening of the total lunar eclipse in May 2021. Interlocking circles of experience and connection will radiate through the night, as the city re-synchronises and is re-energised with public art, performance and music spanning the emerging and iconic, the epic and intimate.§  § §  §The inaugural festival will take place 26 May – 6 June 2021.§  §https://rising.melbourne/§  §THE ROLE§  §RISING is seeking a Creative Producer to join our team to help realise our ambitious inaugural program. This role will work specifically on outdoor projects of scale and is suited to someone with excellent communication skills and no less than 3-5 years’ experience as an arts and/or entertainment Producer.§  §As Creative Producer, you'll scope and manage the planning and delivery components for specified outdoor projects for RISING. You will support and report to RISING's Executive Producer (EP) and the Deputy Executive Producer (DEP).§  §You're masterful at communication and keeping all stakeholders in the loop and on the same page. You're a team player who understands other producers' and departments' competing needs, spanning the organisation, from production to marketing. Managing relationships with artists, landowners, sector peers and Government bodies is also second nature to you.§  §You don't flinch at the site of multiple spreadsheets–instead, prepping budgets and submitting delivery plans is where you enter your flow state. A diligent researcher, you have a talent for digging up important, nitty gritty details about artists and projects, and you know how to use those to details to plan and align specific outdoor projects with the festival's artistic vision.§  §You're supportive to the EP and DEP in the development of artistic elements of the projects and festival program; and are able to keep one eye on the artistic vision, and one eye on the planning, delivery and reconciliation required to make it happen. You're practical and pragmatic, but have a firm, uncompromising commitment to artistic outcomes. You're experienced in balancing assigned projects financial and logistical needs and are a friendly but firm negotiator.§  § §  §How to Apply§  §Submit your application and see the full position description at our website: §https://rising.melbourne/jobs#C-PRODUCER§  §The closing date for applications is §5pm§ §Monday 5 October.§  §Please include your resume and cover letter addressing the key selection criteria in your application.§  §RISING welcomes applications from people of all abilities, cultures and backgrounds. We encourage First Nations people, those who are culturally and linguistically diverse, and people who have a disability or who are d/Deaf to apply.§  §If you have access requirements that will cause difficulty applying online and you need assistance, please call §03 9662 4242§, Monday to Thursday, between 9AM–5PM. We are only able to respond to accessibility enquiries at this number, for all other queries please email jobs@rising.melbourne.§§§§

jobTitle: Activism Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701275.txt	§Activism Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Activism Manager§§Advertiser: §Unilever Australasia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Activism Manager §    §    §      §        §Ben & Jerry's Homemade Inc., started in 1978 in a renovated gas station in Burlington, Vermont, USA, founded by childhood friends and dedicated activists Ben Cohen and Jerry Greenfield. In 2000 Ben & Jerry’s became a wholly owned subsidiary of Unilever whilst maintaining an independent Board of Directors to provide leadership focused on preserving and expanding Ben & Jerry's social mission, brand integrity, and product quality.§        §At Ben & Jerry’s we have an inspiring ambition. We aim to pioneer our ‘linked prosperity business model’ to advance movements for social and economic justice. This translates into a fast-paced environment where we aspire to bring our grassroots and activist spirit into everything we do.§        §The Role §        §The primary role of the Activism Manager is to lead the strategy development and execution of the company’s issue advocacy / activism campaigns in ANZ that align with Ben & Jerry’s progressive values under the direction of the Global Activism Manager. The Activism Manager is a critical part of bringing Ben & Jerry’s impactful activism campaigns to life and requires close coordination across functions internally while also managing a diverse set of external stakeholders and campaign partners. Given Ben & Jerry’s unique position within Unilever, the ability to build excellent relationships within both Unilever and Ben & Jerry’s will be essential. Building networks and relationships across our company as well as with external civil society groups are critical for success.§        §Responsibilities§        §You will work with a cross functional team of Ben & Jerry’s staff to develop and execute progressive, innovative, and strategic winning campaigns that support progressive social change:§        §          §In collaboration with our civil society partners, you’ll support the development of key messages and creative communications of these campaigns inciting Ben & Jerry’s Australian fan-base and extended stakeholder network to take action by using compelling content through our key channels. §          §Build upon already laid groundwork scoping advocacy opportunities in New Zealand to develop and implement an activism strategy within available resources based on market capacity and development.§          §Ensure our activism campaigns come to life across scoop stores network in Australia through working with the internal and external stakeholders.§          §Work with several key stakeholders (both internal and external) to organise and mobilise to deliver on our activism campaign strategies.§          §Develop and nurture NGO and other partnerships that advance public policies that foster a vibrant, just and sustainable economy and society.§          §Work with Ben & Jerry’s teams in Singapore and South Korea to champion local impact through sourcing decisions, seek opportunities for community action and support global/regional activism campaigns.§        §        §Skills & Experience§        §          §Three to five years of previous campaign experience and a proven track of campaign strategy development.§          §Minimum degree or equivalent practical experiences in Political Science, Sociology, Community Organising or related fields relevant to this work; Marketing, Communications, or a Business degree is a plus.§          §A strong knowledge of public policy and the political process in Australia and New Zealand. §          §A strong working knowledge of Climate Change issues.§          §Experience and understanding of how to use a diverse set of tools and channels, including physical stores, digital and social media, to inspire people to action in support of progressive social change.§          §Values ethical brands, with experience working directly in or with business a plus.§          §Experience working across multi-cultural and diverse communities.§          §Strong interpersonal, leadership, communication, and diplomacy skills.§          §Excellent public speaking and presentation skills and comfortable talking to the media. §          §Will work independently, with limited oversight, while defining the role.§        §        §Does this role sound like your dream job? Apply now! In your application please include a over letter where you should highlight two recent social or environmental justice campaigns that have caught your eye in recent times, outlining:§        §          §Why they have been successful in bringing about social or environmental change?§          §How the campaign developed an effective theory of change?§          §How they effectively engaged with people power?§          §What you believe could have been improved in the campaign?§          §Did the campaign tell a good story? Could the communications have been improved?§        §        §Considering Ben & Jerry’s Social Mission goals, we’d also love to hear your thoughts on the following: What do you see as the main climate issue facing Australia and what should be done to help?§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application so that we can support you through the process. If you require reasonable adjustments for the recruitment process, please contact us on §ANZ.talent@unilever.com§      §    §    §  §§§Ben & Jerry's Homemade Inc., started in 1978 in a renovated gas station in Burlington, Vermont, USA, founded by childhood friends and dedicated activists Ben Cohen and Jerry Greenfield. In 2000 Ben & Jerry’s became a wholly owned subsidiary of Unilever whilst maintaining an independent Board of Directors to provide leadership focused on preserving and expanding Ben & Jerry's social mission, brand integrity, and product quality.§ §At Ben & Jerry’s we have an inspiring ambition. We aim to pioneer our ‘linked prosperity business model’ to advance movements for social and economic justice. This translates into a fast-paced environment where we aspire to bring our grassroots and activist spirit into everything we do.§ §The Role § §The primary role of the Activism Manager is to lead the strategy development and execution of the company’s issue advocacy / activism campaigns in ANZ that align with Ben & Jerry’s progressive values under the direction of the Global Activism Manager. The Activism Manager is a critical part of bringing Ben & Jerry’s impactful activism campaigns to life and requires close coordination across functions internally while also managing a diverse set of external stakeholders and campaign partners. Given Ben & Jerry’s unique position within Unilever, the ability to build excellent relationships within both Unilever and Ben & Jerry’s will be essential. Building networks and relationships across our company as well as with external civil society groups are critical for success.§ §Responsibilities§ §You will work with a cross functional team of Ben & Jerry’s staff to develop and execute progressive, innovative, and strategic winning campaigns that support progressive social change:§ § §In collaboration with our civil society partners, you’ll support the development of key messages and creative communications of these campaigns inciting Ben & Jerry’s Australian fan-base and extended stakeholder network to take action by using compelling content through our key channels. § §Build upon already laid groundwork scoping advocacy opportunities in New Zealand to develop and implement an activism strategy within available resources based on market capacity and development.§ §Ensure our activism campaigns come to life across scoop stores network in Australia through working with the internal and external stakeholders.§ §Work with several key stakeholders (both internal and external) to organise and mobilise to deliver on our activism campaign strategies.§ §Develop and nurture NGO and other partnerships that advance public policies that foster a vibrant, just and sustainable economy and society.§ §Work with Ben & Jerry’s teams in Singapore and South Korea to champion local impact through sourcing decisions, seek opportunities for community action and support global/regional activism campaigns.§ §Skills & Experience§ § §Three to five years of previous campaign experience and a proven track of campaign strategy development.§ §Minimum degree or equivalent practical experiences in Political Science, Sociology, Community Organising or related fields relevant to this work; Marketing, Communications, or a Business degree is a plus.§ §A strong knowledge of public policy and the political process in Australia and New Zealand. § §A strong working knowledge of Climate Change issues.§ §Experience and understanding of how to use a diverse set of tools and channels, including physical stores, digital and social media, to inspire people to action in support of progressive social change.§ §Values ethical brands, with experience working directly in or with business a plus.§ §Experience working across multi-cultural and diverse communities.§ §Strong interpersonal, leadership, communication, and diplomacy skills.§ §Excellent public speaking and presentation skills and comfortable talking to the media. § §Will work independently, with limited oversight, while defining the role.§ §Does this role sound like your dream job? Apply now! In your application please include a over letter where you should highlight two recent social or environmental justice campaigns that have caught your eye in recent times, outlining:§ § §Why they have been successful in bringing about social or environmental change?§ §How the campaign developed an effective theory of change?§ §How they effectively engaged with people power?§ §What you believe could have been improved in the campaign?§ §Did the campaign tell a good story? Could the communications have been improved?§ §Considering Ben & Jerry’s Social Mission goals, we’d also love to hear your thoughts on the following: What do you see as the main climate issue facing Australia and what should be done to help?§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application so that we can support you through the process. If you require reasonable adjustments for the recruitment process, please contact us on §ANZ.talent@unilever.com§§§§

jobTitle: Producer - Television Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50631744.txt	§Producer - Television§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Producer - Television§§Advertiser: §Eye Candy Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Abode Entertaiment is an Emmy Award winning Television Producer with offices in the Untied States and Melbourne Australia. We are searching for an exceptional Television Producer to work across multiple programs. Abode Entertainment USA has recently set up a studio in Melbourne Australia. The role will require the producer to work from our South Yarra office to oversee programs both here in Australia and in Los Angeles.§ §The applicant must have at least three years experience in TV production. Must understand all aspects of production. From research, shooting, pre production, postproduction right through to delivery and distribution.§ §Someone who has a strong background and general interest in lifestyle content will thrive in this role. Most of our TV shows are in the home and food space. We are looking for someone who can quickly learn the processes and culture of the company with a view to fast track to a leadership role. We are looking for a dynamic person with a can do attitude and a drive to succeed.§ § § §Your Role§ § § §Manage pre-production stage through to post production and marketing and distribution.§ § § §Find and develop stories that excite and engage viewers.§ § § §This is an active feet on the ground role.§ § § § §About You§ § § §3+ years experience in TV production.§ § § §Have excellent story telling skills.§ § § §An interest in lifestyle content such as food and home.§ § § §A positive and can do attitude.§ § § §A very strong work ethic.§ § § §Strong decision making skills and the ability to work autonomously.§ § § §Exceptional communication and relationship building skills.§ § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50688091.txt	§Accompanist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Accompanist§§Advertiser: §St Catherine's School Waverley§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Performing Arts§§§§§§Position: Accompanist§ §Responsible to:  Headmistress§  §Reporting to:      Director of Music §  §Effective date:    January 2021 - December 2021 §  §Details:               Full time temporary contract (maternity leave cover)§  §Primary purpose of the position:§ §This is a full-time 12-month maternity leave position consisting of accompaniment of soloists and ensembles from K-12. The position also includes organisation of rehearsals, concerts, performance assessments, and management of piano tutors. HSC Music Extension, Music 2 and Music 1 experience is essential. The successful applicant will be an outstanding musician with proven record of excellence in teaching and performance, who is committed to our school's Christian mission of educating young women. §  §Major Responsibilities:§ §• Liaise with the Director of Music and Head of Junior School Music to promote and organise regular term performances for soloists, K – 12§  §• Liaise with the Director of Music and classroom teachers to organise performance-related class workshops, rehearsals and assessment tasks§  §• Organise regular rehearsals and performance opportunities for HSC students§  §• Ensure that the individual educational needs and interests of students are recognised and met§  §• Ensure performances meet the curriculum requirements in elective music classes, in particular, HSC classes§  §• Ability to work with students from beginner to advanced levels, encompassing a wide range of musical styles§  §• In consultation with the Director of Music, monitor the induction, development & practice, and conduct of all piano tutors§  §• Oversee and monitor progress of all piano students§  §• Work closely with all instrumental tutors §  §• Organise Junior and Senior lunch time concerts & studio concerts §  §• Participate in school concerts and musicals§  §• Provide accompaniment for various school events§  §• Assist in the awarding of music scholarships§  §Other main duties:§ §• Support of the Christion ethos of the school and at all times provide a model for learning and living;§  §• Abide by the school’s Staff Code of Conduct and other policies and procedures§  §• Communicate necessary information regularly to students, staff and parents regarding student progress and student needs§  §• Keep up to date with developments in subject area, teaching resources and methods through regular professional development, and make relevant changes to instructional methods within the school§  §Undertake appropriate teaching duties and associated activities § §• Perform pastoral duties as required by the school§  §• Participate in regular department, school, and parent meetings§  §Undertake any other duties as required by the Headmistress§ §Please § click here§ to view full role description§  §Resume and letter of application should be addressed to Human Resources and submitted by Friday 23 October 2020.§  §Active support for the Christian ethos of the school is essential. §  §This position requires the successful applicant to have a Working with Children Check in accordance with the Child Protection (Working with Children) Act 2012.  Details of how to apply are available on §http://www.kids.nsw.gov.au§.§§§§

jobTitle: Global Producer, Media Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629986.txt	§Global Producer, Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Global Producer, Media§§Advertiser: §Xero§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. § §At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.§ §How you’ll make an impact§ §We are looking for a talented mid - senior level producer to join our Global Media team, who create captivating video, photo and motion graphics projects as part of Xero’s internal creative Hub.§ §In this role, you will primarily focus on digital-based projects for our Global Media team and will take ownership of production, work closely with internal partners to create compelling briefs and then plan, execute and deliver leading digital campaigns that promote Xero products, services, the company and the brand.§ §What you'll bring§ § §You’ll be a great team player with the ability to independently§ §3+ years experience in a media production role require§ §Proven ability to drive and manage profitability on every project§ §A high level of digital production or other media production knowledge and proven expertise§ §Experience working with project management applications to track workflow and time§ §Experience in managing multiple complex projects with multiple stakeholders and team members§ §Experience in managing communications across cross-functional teams§ §Experience working in a global/multi-regional environment is desired§ §Why Xero?§ §At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology.  § §Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50686279.txt	§Advertising Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advertising Manager§§Advertiser: §Good Reading Magazine§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§About our Company§Good Reading Magazine is a niche publishing company based in the inner west of Sydney. We produce three magazines, with the flagship publication being §Good Reading§, produced in both print and digital editions. The magazine is widely distributed across various platforms including individual subscriptions, municipal and school libraries, Booktopia and Angus & Robertson online. We also produce fun and informative online magazines, which are mainly book focused, for young adults and for primary kids. §The Role§The core objective of the role is to generate revenue. You will be responsible for sourcing, maintaining and growing our advertising base and to achieve budgets. Your KPIs will be heavily weighted against meeting set budgets. Your package will be made up of a base salary + super + uncapped commission structure. Earning potential is only limited by you, your sales and your commitment to the job.§The ideal candidate is someone who wants to take the bull by horns and carve out a role for themselves. We are looking for someone with a high level of initiative, the ability to work alone, is self-driven and enthusiastic to break new ground, enjoys hitting sales targets on a monthly basis and being part of a small team.§A love of books and reading is an advantage.§Only those that fulfill the above criteria will be considered for an interview. Please send your resume with a covering letter and tell us in one page why you are the right person to represent §Good Reading Magazine§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Social Media Editor Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50627067.txt	§Social Media Editor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Editor§§Advertiser: §Nine§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Social Media Editor §      §        § §        §Company Description§        §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. As the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want, while celebrating our ability to give the shared experiences to audiences, the ones which connect us together. Living at the intersection of Australia’s best content, conversation and culture, Nine is where Australia connects.   §        §Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, and CarAdvice, subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain and Macquarie Media. Our business operates in the following four divisions: Printing and Stuff (NZ); Publishing (including the Metro Mastheads, Nine Digital and Events), Stan, and Television.§        § §        §Job Description§        §The Sydney Morning Herald is seeking expressions of interest for a full-time social media editor to join the team in Sydney. The person will report directly to the Herald's digital editor.§        §We are looking for someone with a sharp eye for detail and fresh ideas about digital storytelling to help coordinate and distribute SMH content through our social media channels.§        §The successful candidate will also work closely with the company's head of audience engagement on strategies and how to best distribute our journalism with the aim of acquiring new subscribers.§        §The ability to work at a fast pace is essential and some weekend work will be required.§        §Experience as a reporter/editor/producer would be an advantage, as would experience training staff in social media protocols and digital best practice§        § §        §Qualifications§        §The successful applicant will have:§        §          §            §A strong understanding of social media, including trends and platforms and the ability to reach a target audience.§          §          §            §Advanced digital production skills including copy editing, headline writing and story packaging.§          §          §            §Refined editorial judgement with an ability to identify digital trends and spot a trending news story.§          §        §        § §        §Additional Information§        §All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia permanently.§        §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. Living at the intersection of Australia’s best content, conversation and culture, Nine is where Australia connects.§        §We embrace all aspects of diversity & inclusion and are committed to creating a workplace which reflects the incredibly diverse customers, audiences and communities we serve.§        §If you’re looking for your next challenge in a fun, rewarding environment, then this could be the role for you.  Our people move fast and act smart: if this sounds like you, then let’s talk!§        §Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§      §      §      §    §  §§§ § §Company Description§ §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. As the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want, while celebrating our ability to give the shared experiences to audiences, the ones which connect us together. Living at the intersection of Australia’s best content, conversation and culture, Nine is where Australia connects.   § §Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, and CarAdvice, subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain and Macquarie Media. Our business operates in the following four divisions: Printing and Stuff (NZ); Publishing (including the Metro Mastheads, Nine Digital and Events), Stan, and Television.§ § § §Job Description§ §The Sydney Morning Herald is seeking expressions of interest for a full-time social media editor to join the team in Sydney. The person will report directly to the Herald's digital editor.§ §We are looking for someone with a sharp eye for detail and fresh ideas about digital storytelling to help coordinate and distribute SMH content through our social media channels.§ §The successful candidate will also work closely with the company's head of audience engagement on strategies and how to best distribute our journalism with the aim of acquiring new subscribers.§ §The ability to work at a fast pace is essential and some weekend work will be required.§ §Experience as a reporter/editor/producer would be an advantage, as would experience training staff in social media protocols and digital best practice§ § § §Qualifications§ §The successful applicant will have:§ § § §A strong understanding of social media, including trends and platforms and the ability to reach a target audience.§ § § §Advanced digital production skills including copy editing, headline writing and story packaging.§ § § §Refined editorial judgement with an ability to identify digital trends and spot a trending news story.§ § § § §Additional Information§ §All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia permanently.§ §Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. Living at the intersection of Australia’s best content, conversation and culture, Nine is where Australia connects.§ §We embrace all aspects of diversity & inclusion and are committed to creating a workplace which reflects the incredibly diverse customers, audiences and communities we serve.§ §If you’re looking for your next challenge in a fun, rewarding environment, then this could be the role for you.  Our people move fast and act smart: if this sounds like you, then let’s talk!§ §Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50622029.txt	§JOURNALIST - LAUNCESTON§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§JOURNALIST - LAUNCESTON§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Launceston & North East§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Grant Broadcasters is looking for a journalist to be based in our Launceston newsroom.§  §Grant Broadcasters is Australia's largest family owned radio network - and we pride ourselves on being live and local and providing relevant up to the minute information to our target audiences.§  §Launceston offers the successful applicant an enviable lifestyle including great shops, restaurants, art and cultural scene, first-class sporting and health facilities. Tasmania is enjoying a population surge with our more liveable climate, less congestion and easy access to some of Australia’s most picturesque landscapes, coastlines and waterways.   §  §You will be responsible for creating and delivering unique and compelling local content for our northern markets including Launceston, Scottsdale, Devonport and Burnie as well as developing some state content for our newsroom in Hobart.§  §Requirements we are looking for:§  §+ At least one year of full-time commercial radio experience as a journalist.§  §+ An ability to not only write and read a bulletin for our radio stations but develop content for our digital platforms.§  §+ A knowledge of the north of Tasmania would be an advantage.§  §+ The ability to work to tight deadlines is a must.§  §+ Experience with News Boss and Zetta is preferred.§  §Apply now with your resume, cover letter, a demo of a news bulletin you have written and read from the last six months and an example of a unique on-line story you have written for a digital platform.§  §Send your applications to mark.johnson@tasmanianbroadcasters.com.au§  §Applications close 17th October 2020§  § §§§§

jobTitle: Graphic Designer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703698.txt	§Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Asylum Seeker Resource Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§About the Asylum Seeker Resource Centre  § § Founded 19 years ago, the Asylum Seeker Resource Centre (ASRC) is Australia’s largest human rights organisation providing support to people seeking asylum. We are an independent not-for-profit organisation whose programs support and empower people seeking asylum to maximise their own physical, mental and social well being. We champion the rights of people seeking asylum and mobilise a community of compassion to create lasting social and policy change. § § We are a value-driven organisation that strives to be part of a change movement that supports people seeking asylum by providing critical services such as assistance with accommodation, food provisions, casework and legal services. § § The ASRC movement is proudly supported by a community of committed volunteers and supporters who embrace the organisation’s vision that people seeking asylum can live safely, sustainably, independently and equally.§ §About The Role § The ASRC is seeking an experienced and passionate Graphic Designer to join the Marketing Program. This is a new position and the incumbent will report directly to the Marketing Coordinator to meet the graphic design needs of the marketing team and organisation at large. The main objective will be to develop creative concepts and produce exceptional design work across digital, print and branding projects that deliver exceptional outcomes. § § The purpose of this position is to work collaboratively with stakeholders across the organisation to deliver the conceptual development, design, production and implementation of quality work to support the needs of the organisation. § § The Graphic Designer is tasked with upholding and championing the ASRC visual brand across all mediums, ensuring consistency of brand is maintained at all times.§ §About You§ The successful candidate will be an all-rounder (print and digital) with a keen eye for detail, a strategic and commercial design mindset and someone who takes pride in their finished product. The individual will enjoy working in a busy and collaborative work environment as well as possess the following skills and experience:§ § §Formal tertiary qualifications in graphic design and a genuine passion for all facets of design with a desire to make a difference§ §Experience in an in-house position with a commercial or not-for-profit environment designing for a broad range of mediums (print and digital). Candidates with agency experience would also be considered.§ §Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (especially Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop)§ §Sound knowledge of the print process§ §Exceptional project management skills with an ability to work across competing priorities§ §Confident, positive, flexible and a “can-do” mindset§ §Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills§ §Exceptional stakeholder and relationship management skills, with proven ability to collaborate and create partnerships to influence positive learning outcomes§ § §Employee Benefits   §Be a part of the largest human rights organisation for refugees and people seeking asylum. We recognise and appreciate our incredible staff for their contribution, dedication and passion to support and empower people seeking asylum by providing the following conditions above the relevant modern award:§ § §The ASRC offers Flexible Working Arrangements, including the ability to work remotely§ §Generous Leave (annual Leave Loading of 17.5%)§ §Additional discretionary leave provisions including:§ § § § §Bonus Paid Leave over the December-January Holiday Season§ §Paid Pandemic Leave§ §Leave due to Cultural or Religiously Significant Events§ §Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander Leave§ §Leave for Staff Seeking Asylum§ §Gender Affirmation Leave§ § §Free onsite parking§ §Salary packaging (up to $15,900 per year tax free)§ §Entertainment Packaging (up to $2,650 per year tax free)§ §Discounts via HR systems provider at grocery and retail outlets§ §100 metres from Footscray station and buses§ § §Position Description§Please find the Position Description here to address the Selection Criteria (please copy and paste the link into your browser):§https://www.asrc.org.au/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/Graphic-Designer-PD.pdf§Application Process§Only applications that include a §CV and cover letter addressing the Selection Criteria,§ will be considered.§Applications close 21st October 2020 at 9:00am§All offers of employment are subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Check and provision of a valid Working with Children Check prior to commencement.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50642862.txt	§COVID-19 Safety Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§COVID-19 Safety Officer§§Advertiser: §The Walt Disney Company (Australia) Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Event Management§§§§§§Disney Theatrical Productions Australia is seeking an enthusiastic and detailed orientated theatre or events professional for the role of COVID-19 Safety Officer, working on Frozen the Musical. The successful candidate must be willing to learn, have an approachable manner, a positive can do attitude and be willing to work afternoons, evenings and weekends.§The COVID-19 Safety Officer will ensure that COVID-19 requirements and guidelines are implemented in rehearsal and the theatre, working in conjunction with the Company Manager and Production Stage Manager, and an Occupational Health and Safety Advisor, as required. The individual will receive training and technical guidance from the Occupational Health and Safety Advisor, and it will report directly to the Company Manager.§​-Fixed term contract with immediate start finishing May 2021.§ §Responsibilities:§ § §Lead COVID-19 health and safety planning in the workplace according to legal guidelines§ §Evaluate practices, procedures and facilities to assess risk and adherence to company COVID Guidelines§ §Order and distribute supplies (PPE, disinfectants, etc.)§ §Establishing plans to distribute and dispose of PPE throughout the production;§ §Post and maintain approved signage and awareness campaigns;§ §Draft plans for cleaning/sanitation schedules for all areas of the theatre and rehearsal venue;§ §Enforce the company COVID Safety policies and protocols in conjunction with production management;§ §Manage supplies for cleaning and disinfecting;§ §Provide reports to the Company Manager regarding concerns, violations, and compliance;§ §Work closely with production management to ensure social distancing, density, PPE procedures are in line with company COVID Guidelines and Safety Plan;§ §Ensure required COVID Guideline and health compliance training briefing for all new employees and contractors is provided;§ §Research new trends, technology, and best practices in production health and wellness.§ §Basic Qualifications:§ § §Experience in live entertainment, events and/or health care is required§ §Ability to adapt to varying work environments, possesses a strong pro-active work ethic and quickly adapt to new responsibilities§ §Ability to escalate issues to the Company Manager§ §Ability to work well in a team environment§ §Good oral and written communication skills§ §Proven strong organizational skills including logistics, time management and scheduling§ §Must be a people person who can manage with confidence and maintain policy/protocol with the company§ §Must be comfortable speaking to groups and providing training§ §Highly creative and driven to problem solve§ §Preferred Qualifications:§ § §Basic knowledge of safety and health standards and regulations§ §Proficiency with Microsoft Office jobTitle: News Reporter Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633967.txt	§News Reporter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§News Reporter§§Advertiser: §Macquarie Publishing Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§"CityNews" is looking to immediately appoint an energetic, self-motivated general reporter.§ §It's a full-time contract position for a reporter with at least two years' experience to write for our independent, quality news magazine and website.§ § §Duties include: § § §Working to deadlines and responding to breaking news.§ §Writing accurate, balanced and fair copy for the "CityNews" magazine and website§ §Updating social media§ §Creating online newsletters § §Do you have?§ § §Minimum of two years' experience.  § §Strong written and verbal communication skills. § §Self-motivation, confidence and energy. § §A sound knowledge of the Canberra region.§ §Weekend work will be required on a rostered basis. The role is a full-time contract until June next year. Beyond then will be by negotiation. § §To Apply§ §Email Kate Meikle, Director, Macquarie Publishing with a cover letter, CV and examples of your work to kate@citynews.com.au§ §About Us§ §For more than 27 years, "CityNews" has proudly been an independent, family-owned news magazine, serving the national capital with quality, integrity and authority.§ §We write to a primary audience of affluent, politically conscious, community focused, articulate readers who turn to the trusted "CityNews" for its weekly news, opinion, arts and lifestyle pages.§ §www.citynews.com.au§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Journalist Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50640465.txt	§Journalist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Journalist§§Advertiser: §The Intermedia Group Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§Journalist – Liquor Titles§ §Sydney-based (Glebe)§ § § §The Intermedia Group has an outstanding opportunity for a talented journalist to generate content across a number of its B2B titles serving Australia’s dynamic liquor and hospitality sectors.§ § § §The role§ §You’ll be responsible for contributing editorial content to three key publications, §National Liquor News, Australian Hotelier §and§ Bars & Clubs§. You’ll be writing for both print and digital media and will produce news articles and longer-form features. You’ll also act as an ambassador for the titles, attending events and posting on each publication’s social channels.§ § § §To be successful, you will already have some editorial experience and understand how to create lively, engaging content for your readers. You will have an eye for detail and the nose for a great story. You will be highly organised and able to manage multiple projects; and since you’ll be dealing with a variety of stakeholders across several industries, you’ll need excellent interpersonal skills.§ § § §Duties and responsibilities include:§ § §Planning and writing news articles and features.§ §Sourcing images for articles.§ §Organising in-house tastings.§ §Interviewing and transcribing.§ §Contributing regular posts to the titles’ social media channels while adhering to the company’s social media policy.§ §Liaising with the digital team at Intermedia to support growth and increased engagement of the titles’ online readerships.§ §Liaising with the studio to discuss page design and to ensure production deadlines are met.§ §Proofing pages, making corrections and ensuring all output is accurate and polished and meets production deadlines.§ §Acting as an ambassador for the title, attending relevant functions and press events to boost the profile of the title, source material for news and features and support the sales team as required.§ §Supporting/attending any face-to-face events organised by the publications.§ §Contributing ideas for articles.§ §Some interstate and international travel may be required from time to time.§ § § §Knowledge, skills and abilities required:§ § §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §An understanding of writing for digital platforms§ §Strong organizational skills and ability to manage a wide variety of tasks§ §Ability to work among a team as well as independently§ §Willingness to attend some events outside standard working hours§ §Ability to use a personal computer and related software applications§ §Willingness to travel on occasion§ §Knowledge of the hospitality sector would be advantageous§ §Knowledge of InDesign publishing software would be advantageous but is not essential§ § § §Other information:§ §Working hours for this full-time role are 8.30am-5.00pm Monday to Friday, although some evening hours will be required to attend events and to ensure publications hit deadlines.§ § § §In return, the successful candidate will benefit from being part of one of the leading independent publishers in Australia and can expect a competitive remuneration package, a friendly, supportive environment in which to work and excellent opportunities for professional development.§ § § §To apply for the role§, please send a cover letter referring to the above criteria, along with your CV§, to Andy Young via email: §mail@intermedia.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a journalist?§Have you worked in a role where your duties included proof reading and sub-editing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50639603.txt	§Chief of Staff - Kalgoorlie§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief of Staff - Kalgoorlie§§Advertiser: §ABC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Kalgoorlie, Goldfields & Esperance§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Chief of Staff - Kalgoorlie §    §      §        §          §Be a part of Australia's independent national broadcaster§          §Location -  Kalgoorlie §          §Working in isolated locations attracts allowances above the base salary rate§          §Create authentic and high-quality content across multiple platforms§          §Generate original story ideas for your relevant target audience§        §        §About ABC Regional & Local§        §The ABC’s Regional & Local team is all about Australian communities and their conversations. Our teams create unique and distinctive content that connect communities and shape lives in metropolitan, regional and remote Australia. From our eight capital city radio stations, our forty four regional bureaux, through to screen, live events and sport, Regional & Local is about real people, real places and real life. §        §Kalgoorlie-Boulder was once renowned for its rich mining resources however, is developing a more diversified economy. No longer 'just a mining town', Kalgoorlie is becoming a  welcoming, sustainable and inclusive regional town.§        §But this is not ordinary town. This is a town full of breaking news and stories that will surprise and interest even the most seasoned journalists. You will also feel at home at ABC Kalgoorlie with an easy going team that has a reputation for producing high quality content. across multiple platforms, to create content that aligns with ABC strategy and supports the achievement of Regional & Local’s objectives. §        § Reporting to the Regional Editor WA, this role will see you:§        §          §Provide editorial leadership in planning and production to create distinctive and compelling content across all platforms, that aligns with ABC strategy. §          §Lead and develop the team to achieve a shared understanding and commitment to team objectives, and to build and maintain a collaborative and high performance culture whilst providing constructive feedback.§          §Under broad direction of the Regional Editor, identify local content that can be shared with other content teams in R&L and across the ABC on multiple platforms.   §        § communicate effectively and build relationships with people from a range of diverse backgrounds. §          §Tertiary qualifications in journalism or demonstrated equivalent skills, knowledge and experience.  §        §        §For further details on the role and requirements, please refer to the full position description:  §50046539 CHIEF OF STAFF.pdf§        §How to Apply§        §We would love to see your work.§ Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).§        §For further information on this jobTitle: Promotions Talent Job in Blue Mountains & Central West - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50611776.txt	§Promotions Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Promotions Talent§§Advertiser: §Springwood Sports Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Blue Mountains & Central West§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Promotions§§§§§§Hang on to your hat! You’ve just stumbled across what could be the most enjoyable, exciting and memorable role of your career. § §Would it be great to be part of a reliable, progressive, safe and unified team working together to create memorable experiences for the local community? Your enthusiasm and energy will contribute to our great team of innovative, talented people who help each other succeed across all our areas. § §Join our team and you’ll have great personal and professional opportunities! Our scholarship program will keep you learning; our training will provide you with a variety of new skills to promote your career; a discount on food and coffee will keep you happy; a fitness incentive will help keep you well; and a great team culture will keep you motivated and inspired.  § §It sounds pretty good, right?§ §It gets better…you’d be based at Springwood, in the beautiful Blue Mountains, but our organisation also makes life great on the Central coast, in Sydney and in Port Macquarie. Our vision is ‘to make a significant contribution to the quality of community life’.§ §A great opportunity § §We are looking for a talented, enthusiastic and dynamic Promotions presenter to join our promo team, working mostly promotions shifts on a Part time basis. § §The Purpose of this role is to:§ § §Generate interest and excitement in all Club activities and promotions § §Present our promotions with drive, passion, and loads of fun, bringing your own personality and a bit of pizzazz to them§ §Be a brand representative, working in collaboration with the leadership team on different events and promotions§ §Comfortably and confidently operate a microphone with a clear, warm and engaging style § §Work with the leadership team to build our social media presence by posting pics on socials (facebook/insta)§ §Educate our members about our promotions, weekly activities, product offerings and special events § §Educate and promote Springwood Sports clubs rewards programme and help other team members to do the same § §Create memorable experiences for customers§ §Be open to training and development opportunities and willing to learn and work in different areas of the club§ §Help the club to continuously improve and strive for a constructive culture, embracing our Vision and Values§ §Comply with the Club’s policies and procedures (e.g RSA/RCG, safe food handling, hygiene standards)§ §Requirements§ §We are looking for someone who is dynamic, flexible, approachable and able to adapt to any situation that might occur when running live promotions. The promotions team work with limited supervision so you'll need to be able to think on your feet, show initiative and take any challenges in your stride § § §Excellent communication and public speaking skills§ §High standard of personal grooming in line with the club's dress and grooming standards § §Thirst for knowledge! You'll be learning everything there is to know about the clubs products, offerings, promotions and members rewards programme§ §RSA and RCG (must be willing to obtain this if you do not yet have one).§ §Willing and able to work hours required in hospitality. We are operate 7 days a week with shifts between the hours of 08:30am - 02:00am§§§§

jobText: TXT/50707422.txt	§Head of Audience Intelligence§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Audience Intelligence§§Advertiser: §News Corp Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Management§§§§§§Reporting directly to the General Manager, Growth Intelligence, this is a newly created role within our Growth Intelligence Centre. A role that you can own, you will work closely with cross-functional leaders to develop and steward an industry leading understanding of our audiences and where they’re headed. We are empowered and driven to deliver compelling research that directly drives growth and will underpin the strategic direction of News Corp. For a commercial minded analytics leader this is truly a once in a lifetime career opportunity. §What’s the role§§Consistently champion and drive world class work - Lead the design and delivery of the audience insights program to inform the company wide executive of growth opportunities.§Forward-thinking collaboration - Transition insights activities from tactical support to strategic partnerships, proactively informing, and influencing with a focus on forward looking, insights-based decision making.§Drive audience growth through fewer, bigger intelligence outputs relevant across business units, complemented by targeted bespoke work§Build a high performance, highly motivated team with an empowered culture at the core.§Insatiably challenge the status quo, bring a passion for continuous business improvement.§Simplify & remove duplication. Standardise process and outputs wherever possible to have a comprehensive and consistent perspective. §Manage multiple work streams, own decisions, handle big budgets and communicate clearly at every level of the business. §Who are you?§Significant experience in Customer Strategy, Customer Insights, Research, or Equivalent.§As leader you are deeply passionate about building capabilities and turning good people into great. You have a deep understanding that all roads lead to culture. §Industry-leading understanding of advanced and novel quantitative research methodologies.§Exceptional ability to dissect and interpret the underlying commercial needs of insights requests, assess the expected outcomes of an engagement, and manage research needs based on the underlying return on investment.§Ability to architect advanced audience models and connect disparate informationsources. §Exceptional internal and external stakeholder management.§Passionate about contemporary data platforms and technology, insights platforms, and emerging quantitative methodologies that can improve our insight capabilities.§Proven track record in navigating change and ambiguity.§§What’s in it for you?§ §Attractive remuneration package§An opportunity to innovate, challenge the norm and pioneer the way forward§A truly collaborative environment§Variety of work where no two days are the same§Work with some of Australia's most recognised and prestigious brands §Make a difference as part of Australia’s most influential media organisation§Who are we? §We are Australia’s number one and most influential media organisation with more than 150 prestige brands across news, sport and lifestyle. Each month more than 17 million Australians choose to consume news and information from our digital and print products – more than any other media group in Australia.§What’s next? §Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
