jobText: TXT/50705822.txt	§Digital Media Planning Lead - ANZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Media Planning Lead - ANZ§§Advertiser: §Cognizant Technology Solutions Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$120,000 - $149,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Digital Media Planning Lead - ANZ §      §        §Media Planning Lead§        §About Cognizant:§        §Cognizant is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. We combine a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work.§        §Our Culture:§        §Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people focused on innovation and ideas.§        §Lets talk about the role:§        §The Media Planning Lead is a key player in transforming Cognizant’s marketing to become an audience-first, digital-first engine. This role is responsible for optimizing our media investments while achieving ambitious awareness and audience engagement goals. You will lead the translation of our go-to-market plans into a media strategy that by campaign defines reach and engagement goals, identifies suitable audiences, defines audience profiles and preferences, determines optimal media mix, creates detailed channel plans and incorporates testing and optimization tactics. As each global campaign aims to create awareness and prompt audience engagement, you will apply best practices in the use of media channels including SEM, display, retargeting, social media, syndication, TV, and OOH.§        §As the Media Leader in a multi-disciplinary team of marketers and agencies assigned to a campaign, you will influence the direction of campaign strategy by guiding on the role of media to achieve campaign goals and by instilling an evidence-based culture. This role requires knowledge and passion for media and advertising technologies that will allow us to scale our media efforts and obtain contextual intent insights for better planning and decision making.§        §Upstream in the campaign process, you will be in lockstep with campaign planners and business partners to rationalize our GTM plans and provide audience identification and goal-setting guidance. Downstream, you will seamlessly hand-off to internal execution teams and agencies, and lead measurement and optimization.§        §Core Competencies to be successful:§        §          §Understand the role of media within the customer journey from building awareness, driving engagement, nurturing and converting into leads and pipeline.§          §Ability to inform media strategy, media planning and budget allocation with data and insights (internal and external)§          §Manage the end-to-end media campaign planning process from strategy to planning, execution, optimization and reporting across a variety of tactics including display, retargeting, dynamic display, search and social as well as programmatic and ABM targeting.§          §Ad tools mastery of key channels including Google Ads (search and network), Facebook, YouTube and LinkedIn§          §Knowledge of privacy and permission marketing guidelines§        §        §Next Steps:§If you would like to express interest in role, please follow the required links on the page. Due to a high number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a further discussion within 3-5 business days.§        §We thank you for taking interest in this opportunity with us. For a complete list of opportunities with Cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers §Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Media Planning Lead§ §About Cognizant:§ §Cognizant is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people focused on innovation and ideas.§ §Lets talk about the role:§ §The Media Planning Lead is a key player in transforming Cognizant’s marketing to become an audience-first, digital-first engine. You will lead the translation of our go-to-market plans into a media strategy that by campaign defines reach and engagement goals, identifies suitable audiences, defines audience profiles and preferences, determines optimal media mix, creates detailed channel plans and incorporates testing and optimization tactics. As each global campaign aims to create awareness and prompt audience engagement, you will apply best practices in the use of media channels including SEM, display, retargeting, social media, syndication, TV, and OOH.§ §As the Media Leader in a multi-disciplinary team of marketers and agencies assigned to a campaign, you will influence the direction of campaign strategy by guiding on the role of media to achieve campaign goals and by instilling an evidence-based culture. This role requires knowledge and passion for media and advertising technologies that will allow us to scale our media efforts and obtain contextual intent insights for better planning and decision making.§ §Upstream in the campaign process, you will be in lockstep with campaign planners and business partners to rationalize our GTM plans and provide audience identification and goal-setting guidance. Downstream, you will seamlessly hand-off to internal execution teams and agencies, and lead measurement and optimization.§ §Core Competencies to be successful:§ § §Understand the role of media within the customer journey from building awareness, driving engagement, nurturing and converting into leads and pipeline.§ §Ability to inform media strategy, media planning and budget allocation with data and insights (internal and external)§ §Manage the end-to-end media campaign planning process from strategy to planning, execution, optimization and reporting across a variety of tactics including display, retargeting, dynamic display, search and social as well as programmatic and ABM targeting.§ §Ad tools mastery of key channels including Google Ads (search and network), Facebook, YouTube and LinkedIn§ §Knowledge of privacy and permission marketing guidelines§ §Next Steps:§If you would like to express interest in role, please follow the required links on the page. jobTitle: Sky Racing Producer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50614532.txt	§Sky Racing Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sky Racing Producer§§Advertiser: §TABCORP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§From nation-defining races to world-class media that transports our customers trackside, creating amazing experiences is what we live for. As part of our media team, you’ll help create excitement in the contest like no one else. §We broadcast live multi-channel entertainment to millions of customers, wherever they are in the world. That is 130,000 races a year, in 60+ countries and 4,500+ venue partners across Australia. And what we deliver today, we’re on track to doubling tomorrow. So, if you’re passionate about creating moments that matter for our customers, our industry and your career — we’ll back you all the way.§What you’ll do§As a Sky Producer, your role will be to deliver live racing and program coverage for both racing and programs.§§Daily line production of racing & programs (including any pre/postproduction) for Sky Racing to ensure consistently high-quality coverage.§Direct, and at times edit, pre/postproduction elements required for race day preview programs and live racing.§Plan race day requirements such as live trackside hosting, news crosses and stories.§Work with the Channel Managers regarding TAB crosses into live racing and rosters for producers and presenters.§Liaise with graphic designers, presenters, and studio crews to ensure an effective, efficient, accurate and entertaining on-air production.§§What you’ll bring§To be successful in this role, you will have demonstrated television production experience, particularly in live television.§§Building effective relationships§Leading innovation and change§Making sound decisions§Influencing others§Sports, Racing and wagering knowledge is highly desirable§§About Tabcorp§We’re Australia’s largest gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.§Our 5,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing, Sky Sports Radio and MAX. As an ASX Top 50 company we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.§Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact §tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au§§ Tabcorp supports the Department of Health COVIDsafe App and encourages all employees to download whilst at work. Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Desktop Publisher, Technical Documentation Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50651845.txt	§Desktop Publisher, Technical Documentation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Desktop Publisher, Technical Documentation§§Advertiser: §Minelab Electronics§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§About us§ §At Minelab Electronics, performance is everything.§ §Since its origins in 1985, Minelab Electronics, an Australian Company headquartered in Adelaide, is the market leader in the design of metal detecting technologies for consumer (gold and treasure), humanitarian demining and military needs. Through a strong commitment to research and development and innovative design, Minelab is a major manufacturer of hand held metal detector products, exporting to over 150 countries globally§ §At Minelab, performance means delivering innovative technology and exceptional support to all detectorists the world over.§ §Part of the Codan group, Minelab has earned a worldwide reputation for innovation, exceptional product design, quality and reliability.§ §What will you be doing?§ §The successful applicant will be able to edit, update and publish technical documentation such as product manuals, field guides, packaging, and compliance labels.§ §As a key member of the team, you must be able to:§ § §Edit and format technical documentations including manuals, guides, packaging, labels and print specification sheets§ §Import copy and graphics into existing InDesign and Illustrator templates§ §Format copy and graphics within InDesign and Illustrator programs§ §Edit copy and graphics within InDesign and Illustrator programs§ §Generate press-ready document packages according to print specifications and guidelines§ §Proofread final copy and review layout to ensure quality standards§ §Trouble-shoot and problem-solve document or file issues§ §What makes a successful Desktop Publisher, Technical Documentation?§ § §High attention to detail§ §Excellent organisation and time management skills§ §Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite of products specifically Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop§ §Understanding of long-document software principles such as character and paragraph styles, cross-references, and hyperlinks§ §Knowledge of pre-press printing process§ §Knowledge of design and layout principles§ §Benefits and Culture§ §Our culture encompasses high performing people who work hard but also enjoy each other’s company and share ideas.  We are looking for someone to join our team who values team work and has a genuine passion and can-do attitude for what they do. Our Head Office is located in the leafy suburbs of Mawson Lakes. We offer many staff benefits from an onsite subsidised café, gym, tennis courts, secure onsite parking and weekly happy hour nights as well as modern offices that showcase our culture and team work.§ §Interested in a career with us?§ §Simply click on ‘APPLY” and we’ll be in contact shortly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Videographer/Production Coordinator Job in Cairns & Far North - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50582575.txt	§Videographer/Production Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Videographer/Production Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Mediapower Plus Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Cairns & Far North§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§Videographer/Production Coordinator § §A new exciting Part-Time role is available at local Cairns Advertising Agency, Mediapower.§ §About Mediapower§ §We used to call ourselves a multi-award-winning, full-service, accredited advertising and media-buying agency. That was until we realised, no one really cared.§ §These days we like to keep it simple. We tell people (the right people) about products and services in a way that will encourage them to buy your products and services. We do that through graphics design, videography, web design, events and media buying.§ §About You and The Role§ §You’re itching to get your start in the advertising industry! Maybe you’ve just graduated uni, maybe in your last year, maybe you’re just an awesome self-taught videographer/editor. We don’t mind.§ §You’re interested in a part-time role that offers flexible hours and the potential to go full time. While you have a passion for videography and editing, you want to learn more about what makes an agency tick and keen to jump in and learn new skills.§ §You’ll be out of the office (sometimes out of Cairns) capturing footage before returning to edit creative video content for a wide range of clients. You’ll also love working with everyone from our the production coordinator to our lead account manager, and will also assist with planning/booking media and day to day production coordination.§ §Skills/Experience:§ § §Relevant university degree/studies in videography/media/advertising or industry experience § §A killer video portfolio showing off your skills§ §Experience using Adobe CC Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro§ §InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop skills preferred but not essential § §Great people skills and a willingness to learn§ §Send your cover letter and resume along with a link to your portfolio to: §macey@mediapower.com.au§ §Applications close: 9th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobTitle: Social Media Producer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657900.txt	§Social Media Producer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Social Media Producer§§Advertiser: §Endemol Shine Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Programming & Production§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Social Media Producer §      §        §We are looking for an experienced Senior Social Media Producer to deliver a world class strategy and manage content output across two major entertainment studio formats, commencing §January 2021§.§        §If you are passionate about creating innovative, engaging content for social media platforms, then we want to hear from you! §        §Reporting to the Supervising Producer, Digital and Social Media, the successful candidate will be a brilliant writer, able to identify a good story and shareable meme, meet tight deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced office environment. §        §You must have demonstratable experience managing Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Tik Tok accounts in a professional capacity and be across the latest trends and developments on the platforms.§        §You will know how to grow an audience online, have experience reporting on performance and be confident working with production, Executive Producers and networks.  §        §A working knowledge of Photoshop and Premiere Pro is essential. §        §Please §only§ apply if you have 4-5 years relevant experience. This is not an entry level position and require some evening work.§        §Successful applicants must drive and have own vehicle.§      §      §      §    §  §§§We are looking for an experienced Senior Social Media Producer to deliver a world class strategy and manage content output across two major entertainment studio formats, commencing §January 2021§.§ §If you are passionate about creating innovative, engaging content for social media platforms, then we want to hear from you! § §Reporting to the Supervising Producer, Digital and Social Media, the successful candidate will be a brilliant writer, able to identify a good story and shareable meme, meet tight deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced office environment. § §You must have demonstratable experience managing Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Tik Tok accounts in a professional capacity and be across the latest trends and developments on the platforms.§ §You will know how to grow an audience online, have experience reporting on performance and be confident working with production, Executive Producers and networks.  § §A working knowledge of Photoshop and Premiere Pro is essential. § §Please §only§ apply if you have 4-5 years relevant experience. This is not an entry level position and require some evening work.§ §Successful applicants must drive and have own vehicle.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Videographer / Editor / Creative (WA Based) Job in Perth - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50568824.txt	§Videographer / Editor / Creative (WA Based)§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Videographer / Editor / Creative (WA Based)§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Editing & Publishing§§§§§§About the business§ § § §We are a fast-growing underground drilling company based in Perth, Western Australia, with numerous projects across Australia. We are a media focused Company! We hold our talent to the highest standard our Code of Conduct is to be honoured at all times, as culture is King!§ § § §About the role§ § § §Are you looking for an opportunity to pursue your creative passion with a media focussed Company?§ §Are you interested in joining an elite team within a Company which respects its talent and treats them like family?§ §Would you like to join an innovative Company which allows you work/life balance and creative flexibility?§ §Do you love editing, 3D animation and graphic design?§ §If you have answered YES to all of the above, then we want YOU!§ § § §Due to our continued and exciting growth, we are looking to hire a second Creative Videographer/Editor to join our amazing team who are focused on taking the company's mission Australia wide.§This role is pivotal in our expansion plans; reporting into our Marketing Manager and Lead Videographer, you will be responsible for our office based content, editing footage from the field, working and supporting our lead Videographer on projects, creating videos that educate, inspire and entertain a large online audience and deliver impactful messages that would be worth watching and sharing.§ §We are looking for a junior creative, who is a driven and ambitious candidate who can grow with us in our Marketing Department.  We would love someone who has 3D animation experience, graphics expertise and loves editing. Whilst an outline of various key projects will be provided, you will be given the opportunity to add your creative contribution to our brand.§ § § §Your purpose is to:§ §Produce and edit videos that meet company standards according to what the plan looks like at any given time approximately 5 x 1/2min pillar videos a week.(Most footage provided from site).§Create 5/10 micro videos from the pillar videos for use on social media platforms.§Create/capture 10 stills/photographs a week at office and various other locations.§Have the ability to edit, add voice overs, graphics, 3D animation, subtitles and background music.§Have your own basic equipment.§Have confidence, independence, and ability to adapt to different filming environments. Opportunity for site-based work as well for specific projects.§Ability to work with others in the creative space§A good eye for composition and high attention to detail.§Media File management§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Flexible working arrangements§A focus on work-life balance§Competitive renumeration§A working environment that values innovation and creativity§4 weeks annual leave per year§EAP Support§Discounts with FLIGHT CENTRE§Content support with GoPros at all sites filming 24/7§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Prior experience in a similar role§Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Premiere Pro, After Effects and Photoshop), Microsoft Planner, DaVinci Resolve§Efficient storytelling: Ability to deliver the video message in the most efficient way, catered to the attention span of internet users in 2020 onwards.§C Class (or above) manual drivers licence§National Police Clearance (obtained within the last 6 months)§First Aid Certificate§Must be physically and mentally fit and will be required to pass a medical assessment§ §We are interviewing immediately for this role, so please apply with clear examples of the work you have done previously and/or your portfolio.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Account Coordinator Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697260.txt	§Account Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Coordinator§§Advertiser: §PHD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Account Coordinator §      §        §Media Account Coordinator§        §PHD Media§        §PHD is a leading global communications planning and buying media agency. We are one of the most acclaimed networks globally, most recently winning Cristal's Media Network of the year, Employer of Choice 2019, Australia's fastest growing media network and ranked Australia's 2nd most innovative company by the Australian Financial Review.§        §We are now looking for an §Account Coordinator§ to join one of our new team.§        §What does a Media Agency do?§        §Simply put, we manage the strategy, planning and buying of media for some of the world's largest advertisers and most iconic brands. We work with some of the best creative minds in the world to deliver media solutions that span across all offline and online channels (television, radio, cinema, press, OOH, digital) and continents. Sounds cool, right? It is…§        §What does an Account Coordinator do?§        §An Account Coordinator position is the gateway to a career in media and will enable you to gain a solid foundation into any career in Marketing/Advertising. The commitment and investment that we will make towards your training now, and throughout your career is significant as you will not only learn media skills but also benefit from our extensive professional development program.§        §Over the first 12-18 months, whilst you learn as much as you can about the industry & tools (there are a few!) you will play a key role in your client team supporting the administrative & buying process for your designated client portfolio. Your contribution to the team and the broader business will never be underestimated!§        §As your knowledge increases you will interact with clients & media owners more and more and gradually, under guidance, you will take on planning and buying responsibilities. §        §Key day to day tasks§        §          §Turn up with a positive attitude and apply yourself to become indispensable to the team§          §Support the team with a range of administrative tasks - Check/manage/implement media bookings, compile competitive analysis and research, track campaign performance and manage reporting§          §Stay updated on any program changes / launches, audience viewing figures (screen & OOH), circulation / readership figures (print), listener numbers (radio), new media developments§          §Build strong and successful working relationships with your team, other internal teams, media representatives and creative agencies§          §Weekly monitoring of all campaigns to identify any discrepancies§          §Attend training sessions, workshops and strategy sessions. Continually seek to learn and develop§        §        §The role and ultimately your career, will centre around data as we report on every cent of media spend, track every campaign and as every day goes by, we use data more frequently and in more sophisticated ways. Whilst having a strong mathematical background isn't necessary (excel does the maths for us nowadays!) a strong attention to detail and an understanding of the importance or reporting and finances ismust. a §        §Who are you?§        §At this stage of your career, there is little experience required, it's all about attitude… the tools and training programs are there to help you succeed.§        §Some key attributes that we look for are:§        §          §Good work ethic, enthusiasm and keen to learn§          §Strong attention to detail, numeracy and literacy§          §A good understanding of Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook§          §Interpersonal and communication skills§          §Planning and organisational skills§          §Proactivity and problem solving§        §        §We strongly believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences enrich our work life and quality of work produced. We welcome people of all backgrounds and warmly encourage Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples to apply.§        §Curious to know more? Apply with an up to date version of your resume and let's take it from there…§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Media Account Coordinator§§PHD Media§PHD is a leading global communications planning and buying media agency. We are one of the most acclaimed networks globally, most recently winning Cristal's Media Network of the year, Employer of Choice 2019, Australia's fastest growing media network and ranked Australia's 2nd most innovative company by the Australian Financial Review.§We are now looking for an §Account Coordinator§ to join one of our new team.§What does a Media Agency do?§Simply put, we manage the strategy, planning and buying of media for some of the world's largest advertisers and most iconic brands. We work with some of the best creative minds in the world to deliver media solutions that span across all offline and online channels (television, radio, cinema, press, OOH, digital) and continents. Sounds cool, right? It is…§What does an Account Coordinator do?§An Account Coordinator position is the gateway to a career in media and will enable you to gain a solid foundation into any career in Marketing/Advertising. The commitment and investment that we will make towards your training now, and throughout your career is significant as you will not only learn media skills but also benefit from our extensive professional development program.§Over the first 12-18 months, whilst you learn as much as you can about the industry & tools (there are a few!) you will play a key role in your client team supporting the administrative & buying process for your designated client portfolio. Your contribution to the team and the broader business will never be underestimated!§As your knowledge increases you will interact with clients & media owners more and more and gradually, under guidance, you will take on planning and buying responsibilities. §Key day to day tasks§§Turn up with a positive attitude and apply yourself to become indispensable to the team§Support the team with a range of administrative tasks - Check/manage/implement media bookings, compile competitive analysis and research, track campaign performance and manage reporting§Stay updated on any program changes / launches, audience viewing figures (screen & OOH), circulation / readership figures (print), listener numbers (radio), new media developments§Build strong and successful working relationships with your team, other internal teams, media representatives and creative agencies§Weekly monitoring of all campaigns to identify any discrepancies§Attend training sessions, workshops and strategy sessions. Continually seek to learn and develop§§The role and ultimately your career, will centre around data as we report on every cent of media spend, track every campaign and as every day goes by, we use data more frequently and in more sophisticated ways. Whilst having a strong mathematical background isn't necessary (excel does the maths for us nowadays!) a strong attention to detail and an understanding of the importance or reporting and finances ismust. a §Who are you?§At this stage of your career, there is little experience required, it's all about attitude… the tools and training programs are there to help you succeed.§Some key attributes that we look for are:§§Good work ethic, enthusiasm and keen to learn§Strong attention to detail, numeracy and literacy§A good understanding of Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook§Interpersonal and communication skills§Planning and organisational skills§Proactivity and problem solving§§We strongly believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences enrich our work life and quality of work produced. We welcome people of all backgrounds and warmly encourage Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples to apply.§Curious to know more? jobTitle: Interactive Director Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50698490.txt	§Interactive Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Interactive Director§§Advertiser: §OMD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Interactive Director §      §        §OMD Sydney§ is looking for an §Interactive Director§ to be an integral part of our 'We Got This' culture. §        §The §Interactive Director§ is responsible for the delivery of the digital roadmap that will help unlock the client's business and advertising ambitions. Supporting the client as they navigate this complex process and assisting in managing both internal and external stakeholders.§        §This role is responsible for setting the digital strategic direction and the ownership of key briefs and planning. Providing executive oversight to the team responsible for delivering the day to day digital media planning and execution, ensuring the work being created ties to business outcomes.§        §The perfect candidate will need to have a strong knowledge of digital media and related digital channels, with the ability to debate and improve strategic approaches and execution opportunities.§        §Key Responsibilities:§        §          §Contribution to development and ownership of the client's digital roadmap created to unlock the client's business ambitions encompassing data, technology and media.§          §Ensure the client digital strategy leads the market and provide oversight and direction to the implementation teams to convert these strategies into campaign initiatives.§          §Creating and delivering sustainable testing and innovation roadmaps aligned with the client business priorities§          §Ensuring OMD's digital governance including our viewability, transparency and brand safety standards are applied and upheld by all internal teams, including the specialist business units.§          §Working alongside the trading director to lead the negotiation approach with all partners, leveraging the client's entire spend to unlock data and technology benefits.§          §Be a client point of contact for all digital channels and platforms, working with all internal stakeholders to deliver the client a seamless digital media, data and technology product§          §Build and maintain the strongest personal and professional relationships with clients. As part of the Omnicom Media Group, we provide services to over 5,000 clients in more than 100 countries and employ 11,000+ staff.§        §Since launching in 2000, OMD Australia has grown to become Australia's largest media and communications agency, consistently winning awards including:§        §          §#4 Great Places to Work in Australia 2019 and top 50 for 11 consecutive years§          §2016, 2017, 2019 Mumbrella Culture Award§          §Adweek's Global Media Agency of the Year 2019§          §B&T Women Awards Employer of the Year 2019§          §2015 & 2016 B&T Employer of The Year§          §Campaign Asia-Pacific ANZ Media Agency of the Year 2015 & 2017§          §Cannes Global Media Agency of the Year 2018§        §        §OMD is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander and people of all backgrounds to apply.§        §We work flexibly at OMD and also support charities and environmental initiatives.§        §If there is one thing that defines OMD, it is the philosophy that nothing is more important than our people. If you are interested in finding out more about this opportunity, please apply now.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§OMD Sydney§ is looking for an §Interactive Director§ to be an integral part of our 'We Got This' culture. §The §Interactive Director§ is responsible for the delivery of the digital roadmap that will help unlock the client's business and advertising ambitions. With a specific focus to the senior marketeers Client side and the digital leads.§§Skills & Experience:§§7+ years of relevant digital and communications experience §Experience in leading the digital strategy encompassing media, data and technology for large advertisers.§Detailed understanding of digital marketing technology including ad-servers, DSP, DMPs and other relevant tools§§Key Competencies:§At OMD, we live by our five core competencies:§§Client Engagement - §whether its dealing with our clients, media partners or suppliers, we deliver best in class service and always done with integrity§Product & Innovation§ - We think creatively, critically and strategically to deliver innovative marketing solutions for the complex world we live in§Commercial - §we are commercially savvy and deeply understand our business, and our clients, enabling better decisions and innovative thinking§People Management/Leadership - §we care about our people and have a commitment to their development and growth§Personal Growth -§ an on-going commitment to invest 10% of your time to personal development§§These competencies are the key to developing and enhancing our people's skills as media professionals and humans and are embedded into our performance processes and training programs.§Who are we?§OMD Australia is a proud part of the OMD global network, the world's leading marketing and communications agency. jobTitle: Journalist Job in Sydney - SEEK
location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50663517.txt	§Journalist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Journalist§§Advertiser: §Private Media§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§SmartCompany Business Journalist§ §SmartCompany is looking for an energetic, passionate business journalist to join its editorial team to produce original and high-quality news and special interest stories for its audience of small and medium business operators and entrepreneurs. § §Journalists who write for SmartCompany are in tune with the issues affecting Australia’s small business community, they can generate ideas, research stories, conduct interviews, and write and edit stories, all to the lightning-fast pace of online news. If this sounds like you, read on.§ §Reporting to the SmartCompany editor, this person is well-versed in social media and interested in using those channels and other digital marketing practices to connect with the SmartCompany audience and increase the number of people who see our stories. § § §The ideal candidate is:§ § § §Self-directed as well as receptive to editorial guidance; § § § §Confident and keen to experiment and learn;§ § § §Digital media savvy, including knowledgeable around SEO best-practice and writing-for-the-web;§ § § §A team player comfortable with tight turnarounds and producing multiple stories a day to regular deadlines; § § § §Comfortable with working to traffic and engagement targets; and most importantly § § § §Excited about finding new ways to deliver great content to SmartCompany’s engaged audience of business owners and entrepreneurs.§ § §This role would suit a journalist with some experience in a newsroom. For the right person with particularly good skills, this role could also suit a recent graduate who is ambitious and keen to forge a path in business journalism. The role is equivalent to a nine-day fortnight. § §The person we are looking for has knowledge of Google Analytics and key social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn. Experience with Wordpress would be highly desirable.§ § § §Location§: our team is based in Melbourne (currently from home) but we’re happy to meet with people from elsewhere in Australia. § § § §Benefits & Culture:§ §SmartCompany is part of the Private Media network - home of sister publications Crikey and The Mandarin. We’re a small, digital-first business that’s been around for 20 years, and we punch above our weight. § §People love working here because we’re studiously attentive and responsive to changes in the media, highly collaborative, flexible when it comes to working arrangements, and deeply supportive of our fellow colleagues. We’re prepared to step in to help solve problems no matter how big or small. We’re accountable for our actions, and fiercely independent when it comes to the journalism we create. § §It’s an excellent environment to grow and learn for people who love to have their ideas vigorously contested, as well as happy to see them followed through with, and fast. If you’re not engaged and passionate about digital media and journalism, or someone who thrives when improvising and making the most out of every opportunity, then we’re not for you.§ §Please submit an expression of interest responding to the criteria above, along with your resume and examples of prior work, to §hr@privatemedia.com.au§.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Podcast & Digital Ad Ops Lead Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50706898.txt	§Podcast & Digital Ad Ops Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Podcast & Digital Ad Ops Lead§§Advertiser: §Australian Radio Network Pty Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Ryde & Macquarie Park§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§We’re delivering Australia’s most COMPLETE audio offering. Exciting right? Want to be part of it? Read on…§ §Australian Radio Network (ARN) is one of Australia’s leading Broadcast and On-demand audio companies, ‘Defining Audio’, with ownership or investments in 12 radio stations nationwide in addition to digital entertainment platform, iHeartRadio. ARN’s vision is to deliver the most complete audio offering for audiences and advertisers, and its network brands.  KIIS and Pure Gold, along with iHeartRadio and The Edge, entertain and influence over five million listeners each week across Australia. § § § § §We currently have an exciting role available for a Podcast & Digital Ad Ops Lead.§ You would be responsible for the management of the day to day optimising and delivery of Podcast across multiple databases and vendors. As well as supporting the Digital Ad Ops team on the management of all digital campaigns, both direct iO and Programmatic.§ § § § §Key Responsibilities include: § § §Day to day management of the Podcast workflow and processes§ §Ensure the accurate delivery of all campaigns (direct and programmatic) as booked§ §Produce, distribute and monitor performance reporting§ §Become our Podcast subject matter expert§ §Work collaboratively with Podcast and Sales teams§ §Upskill Digital Ad Ops team§ § § § § §The successful candidate will have:§ § §2 years relevant podcast experience in a Digital Ad Operations team§ §Keen eye for detail§ §Date and solutions driven§ §Worked with ad serving technology§ §Workflow and team lead experience§ § § § § §Benefits & Culture§ People enjoy working at ARN because we are a fun and fast paced place to work, embracing our values of Energy, Authenticity, Creativity and Action. You’ll be part of a dynamic and supportive team who are passionate about §Defining Audio §for our listeners, clients and shareholders. Working here gives you access to great benefits like: §Paid parental leave, annual learning and development program including study leave and an Employee Assistance Program§ § § § If you would like to make a significant contribution to our continuing success, please press the §APPLY button §and upload your cover letter and resume by close of business§ 16 October 2020§. § §ARN is a HT&E company. For more details, head to §www.arn.com.au§ and connect with us via Twitter §(@ausradionetwork§) and LinkedIn (§Linkedin /australianradionetwork§)§ § § § §EEO Statement§ §ARN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.§ § § § §Disability Accommodation§ §For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please contact the People & Culture team at the relevant state office: §https://www.arn.com.au/contact-us/§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

It has newsrooms in each state and territory, a presence in 48 suburban and regional newsrooms, 11 foreign bureaux, and includes ABC NEWS online, the 24-hour ABC NEWS TV channel and ABC NewsRadio. Our leading TV and audio programs include 7pm News, 7.30, Australian Story, Four Corners, Insiders, News Breakfast, Behind the News, The Drum, Foreign Correspondent, Q&A, AM, Background Briefing, PM, RN Breakfast and RN Drive. Our teams include many of Australia’s best-known and most respected journalists.§        §About the Role§        §The National Business Team is seeking a highly experienced video and television producer with a strong background in news and current affairs and an innovative approach to visual story telling on traditional, digital and social media platforms.§        §You will:§        §          §Work with the Editor and other teams to commission and produce stories that provide context, depth and understanding for audiences.§          §Lead video coverage for digital, mobile and TV platforms, including sub editing video content for all platforms.§          §Actively anticipate national coverage requirements and engage with national desks and teams to ensure output of high-quality video content.§          §Oversee editorial processes, ensuring newsroom output meets ABC Editorial Policy and community expectations.§          §Apply creative production skills to build depth and understanding for audiences.§          §Use live production skills to manage key broadcast, digital and mobile output.§          §Actively provide direction and constructive feedback to content makers to empower them to achieve high standards of journalistic and production craft.§        §        §About You§        §You are a highly motivated self-starter with a solid background in news and current affairs, highly skilled in television reporting and with experience providing content to digital and platforms. Our online store started in 2010 and has now grown to service over 100,000 customers worldwide. §      §Fashion Photographer §      §        §Established as an online force in the Australian retail scene in 2010, Princess Polly has been delivering fashion-forward, trend-driven apparel and accessories for over 10 years. §We are obsessed with creating the best customer experience available online§ and are committed to ensuring a speedy delivery so our customers can wear their picks this weekend!§        §As a global player with offices located in Los Angeles and Australia’s Gold Coast, we are now looking for the best and brightest to join our global team in order to grow the Princess Polly brand around the world!§        §Princess Polly are searching for a §Fashion Photographer and Post Production Editor§ who has a creative eye, and is looking for a career defining role within a company undergoing rapid growth. Located in beautiful Burleigh Heads, this is that dream job you have been searching for!.§        §As the §Fashion Photographer and Post Production Editor §you will be responsible for capturing our products in our studio and through our creative imagery. Reporting into the Creative Director, you will prioritise which items to photograph and edit, manage the studio space, plan editing workload and bring your creative flair to our photography. We are looking for someone with experience in portrait fashion photography, who is efficient at what they do, and willing to share new concepts and bring ideas to life in a digital space. You will have the opportunity to travel in some of the most unique locations. §        §Get in and work for Australia's #1 online womens fashion retailer. See your work spread throughout the fashion world. This is a huge opportunity to work within a large in-house marketing department, Working in a fast-paced creative environment where you can be innovative and creative every day.§        §PRINCESS POLLY§ is an innovative disruptive tech online retailer providing super-fast fashion, introducing new products daily and stocking a wide variety of on-trend and designer brands for the millennial girl.§        §At §PRINCESS POLLY§ to be successful we are looking for a fast worker, creative flair, who can maintain and improve brand image across all channels to position Princess Polly as the leader in women’s online fashion. You will balance creativity with business, have fun while fostering the individual strengths and aspirations of all our people. The right candidate will be able to adapt to change, work collaboratively, able to understand our brand and the industry whilst being willing to learn from a talented and fast growing business. Be a leader, not a follower. Be a thinker, an innovator, and a doer. Use technology and innovation to get your hustle on! It’s the sum of all our motivation that has seen the company succeed as you will too.§        §Desired Skills & Experience:§        §          §2 years experience in fashion photography §          §Monitor shoot days and ensure the model, apparel, lighting, video and editing is up to standard§          §Oversee editing staff, ongoing training and development and performance§          §Improve editing tools and systems§          §Consistently deliver all tasks to a high standard and meet deliverables and deadlines§          §Can do attitude, ready to jump in to meet product launch deadlines §          §Be productive and resourceful in your approach to all aspects of the role§          §Excellent attention to detail and communication skills §          §Enjoy a fast pace, constant change environment, where you are comfortable with often exploring new ideas of how we can make the site look better from a visual perspective§          §A passion for fashion, and a love for the Polly Brand §          §Work is fun, so someone who will contribute and work hard whilst keeping a smile on their dial is critical!§        §        §While this is the required outcome in year one, day one is pretty good too. These things include, great perks like amazing team member discounts on clothes ;), fab social gatherings and company events.§        §The opportunity to mingle with trending influencers and fashion celebs. If this sounds like your dream job, we'd love to hear from you! Apply online with your CV, portfolio and instagram link.§        §Aside from the amazing array of tangible benefits and perks, Princess Polly offers you the chance to make a daily impact on a global business. You have the opportunity to pursue your passion and plan your own future as part of our team!§        §Princess Polly is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) We're committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applicants from all walks of life. Come join us, different makes us better.§        §#PrincessPolly #PursueYourPassion #PollySays #PrincessPollyCareers§      §      §      §    §    §      §To apply online, please click on the apply button.§      § Due to the large volume of applications, only those shortlisted will be contacted for an interview.§      § §You can check us out at: www.princesspolly.com§    §  §§§Established as an online force in the Australian retail scene in 2010, Princess Polly has been delivering fashion-forward, trend-driven apparel and accessories for over 10 years. §We are obsessed with creating the best customer experience available online§ and are committed to ensuring a speedy delivery so our customers can wear their picks this weekend!§ §As a global player with offices located in Los Angeles and Australia’s Gold Coast, we are now looking for the best and brightest to join our global team in order to grow the Princess Polly brand around the world!§ §Princess Polly are searching for a §Fashion Photographer and Post Production Editor§ who has a creative eye, and is looking for a career defining role within a company undergoing rapid growth. Located in beautiful Burleigh Heads, this is that dream job you have been searching for!.§ §As the §Fashion Photographer and Post Production Editor §you will be responsible for capturing our products in our studio and through our creative imagery. Reporting into the Creative Director, you will prioritise which items to photograph and edit, manage the studio space, plan editing workload and bring your creative flair to our photography. We are looking for someone with experience in portrait fashion photography, who is efficient at what they do, and willing to share new concepts and bring ideas to life in a digital space. You will have the opportunity to travel in some of the most unique locations. § §Get in and work for Australia's #1 online womens fashion retailer. See your work spread throughout the fashion world. This is a huge opportunity to work within a large in-house marketing department, Working in a fast-paced creative environment where you can be innovative and creative every day.§ §PRINCESS POLLY§ is an innovative disruptive tech online retailer providing super-fast fashion, introducing new products daily and stocking a wide variety of on-trend and designer brands for the millennial girl.§ §At §PRINCESS POLLY§ to be successful we are looking for a fast worker, creative flair, who can maintain and improve brand image across all channels to position Princess Polly as the leader in women’s online fashion. You will balance creativity with business, have fun while fostering the individual strengths and aspirations of all our people. The right candidate will be able to adapt to change, work collaboratively, able to understand our brand and the industry whilst being willing to learn from a talented and fast growing business. Be a leader, not a follower. Be a thinker, an innovator, and a doer. Use technology and innovation to get your hustle on! It’s the sum of all our motivation that has seen the company succeed as you will too.§ §Desired Skills & Experience:§ § §2 years experience in fashion photography § §Monitor shoot days and ensure the model, apparel, lighting, video and editing is up to standard§ §Oversee editing staff, ongoing training and development and performance§ §Improve editing tools and systems§ §Consistently deliver all tasks to a high standard and meet deliverables and deadlines§ §Can do attitude, ready to jump in to meet product launch deadlines § §Be productive and resourceful in your approach to all aspects of the role§ §Excellent attention to detail and communication skills § §Enjoy a fast pace, constant change environment, where you are comfortable with often exploring new ideas of how we can make the site look better from a visual perspective§ §A passion for fashion, and a love for the Polly Brand § §Work is fun, so someone who will contribute and work hard whilst keeping a smile on their dial is critical!§ §While this is the required outcome in year one, day one is pretty good too. These things include, great perks like amazing team member discounts on clothes ;), fab social gatherings and company events.§ §The opportunity to mingle with trending influencers and fashion celebs. If this sounds like your dream job, we'd love to hear from you! Apply online with your CV, portfolio and instagram link.§ §Aside from the amazing array of tangible benefits and perks, Princess Polly offers you the chance to make a daily impact on a global business. You have the opportunity to pursue your passion and plan your own future as part of our team!§ §Princess Polly is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) We're committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applicants from all walks of life. Come join us, different makes us better.§ §#PrincessPolly #PursueYourPassion #PollySays #PrincessPollyCareers§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a photographer?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50634834.txt	§Production/Traffic Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Production/Traffic Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Cheil Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Production/Traffic Coordinator §      §        §About Us§        §Cheil Australia is a data-informed creative agency with the customer at the heart of everything we do, with 52 offices operating in 44 countries worldwide and over 7,100 employees globally.§        §Your New Opportunity §        §Due to ongoing growth in our business, we are now seeking a highly motivated individual with solid agency experience to join our Creative Services team for an initial 3-month contract (with the potential for longer), working on one of the World's largest most loved brands by millennials.§        §Reporting to the Creative Services Manager, the successful candidate will assist in overseeing the flow of projects through internal departments from conception to final delivery. This is an integral role to the business and will involve working with our offshore team to seamlessly execute projects through to completion. In your new role you will be assigned incoming jobs to establish and maintain timelines, tracking progress, and ensuring a smooth workflow working with the client, accounts, project and digital teams.§        §Duties and Responsibilities §        §          §Assisting in managing the flow of projects through the agency§          §Manage timelines and project plans§          §Develop and build strong relationships with key stakeholders in the business§          §Work closely with the Creative Services Manager and Traffic Manager to ensure deliverables are met§          §Obtain quotes, document handling, record keeping across projects§          §Project Coordinating across a variety of multi-channel projects§        §        §Qualifications and Experience §        §          §1-2+ years min. experience in a similar role within an agency environment§          §Preferably degree qualified§          §Demonstrated experience in developing, managing and executing projects§          §Proven experience managing project resources and key stakeholders§          §Experience in managing deadlines and time estimates§        §        §About You§        §          §High attention to detail, organised, with the ability to handle high volumes of work maintain quality§          §Resilient and able to take on constructive feedback§          §Adaptable and able to cope in a fast paced, changing environment§          §Agility, flexibility and ability to juggle multiple projects at once§          §Solutions focused, able to think outside the box when challenges arise§          §Strong analytical skills with the ability to evaluate information quickly, identify issues and formulate conclusions based on good judgement, experience and common sense§        §        §What's in it for you?§§        §          §Immediate start available - interviewing now!!§          §Opportunity to work with a Global, multinational company§          §Attractive salary package plus additional employee perks§          §Onsite parking and close to public transport§          §Work in a friendly, supportive team culture and environment§        §        §How you can join us§§        §If this interests you so far, you can now submit your application to us by clicking "Apply."§        §Due to the number of applications we receive, only candidates that meet our criteria will be short-listed and contacted. We thank you for your time.§      §      §      §    §  §§§About Us§Cheil Australia is a data-informed creative agency with the customer at the heart of everything we do, with 52 offices operating in 44 countries worldwide and over 7,100 employees globally.§Your New Opportunity §Due to ongoing growth in our business, we are now seeking a highly motivated individual with solid agency experience to join our Creative Services team for an initial 3-month contract (with the potential for longer), working on one of the World's largest most loved brands by millennials.§Reporting to the Creative Services Manager, the successful candidate will assist in overseeing the flow of projects through internal departments from conception to final delivery. This is an integral role to the business and will involve working with our offshore team to seamlessly execute projects through to completion. In your new role you will be assigned incoming jobs to establish and maintain timelines, tracking progress, and ensuring a smooth workflow working with the client, accounts, project and digital teams.§Duties and Responsibilities § §Assisting in managing the flow of projects through the agency§ §Manage timelines and project plans§ §Develop and build strong relationships with key stakeholders in the business§ §Work closely with the Creative Services Manager and Traffic Manager to ensure deliverables are met§ §Obtain quotes, document handling, record keeping across projects§ §Project Coordinating across a variety of multi-channel projects§Qualifications and Experience § §1-2+ years min. experience in a similar role within an agency environment§ §Preferably degree qualified§ §Demonstrated experience in developing, managing and executing projects§ §Proven experience managing project resources and key stakeholders§ §Experience in managing deadlines and time estimates§About You§ §High attention to detail, organised, with the ability to handle high volumes of work maintain quality§ §Resilient and able to take on constructive feedback§ §Adaptable and able to cope in a fast paced, changing environment§ §Agility, flexibility and ability to juggle multiple projects at once§ §Solutions focused, able to think outside the box when challenges arise§ §Strong analytical skills with the ability to evaluate information quickly, identify issues and formulate conclusions based on good judgement, experience and common sense§What's in it for you?§§ §Immediate start available - interviewing now!!§ §Opportunity to work with a Global, multinational company§ §Attractive salary package plus additional employee perks§ §Onsite parking and close to public transport§ §Work in a friendly, supportive team culture and environment§How you can join us§§If this interests you so far, you can now submit your application to us by clicking "Apply."§Due to the number of applications we receive, only candidates that meet our criteria will be short-listed and contacted. We thank you for your time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§What is your expected annual salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Marketing Coordinator Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50694569.txt	§Recruitment Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Employment Office§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $55,000 plus super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Journalism & Writing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Marketing Coordinator §      §        §Hi! My name's Andrea, I'm the CEO at Scout Talent Group (STG).§ §        §(I know this is an unusual format for a job advertisement … keep reading to find out why I took this approach!)§        §First of all, here’s some info about STG:§        §We’re a services-enabled software company, delivering recruitment and talent solutions to help our clients hire great people in order to grow their organisations. Our Purpose (our ‘Why’) is to§ connect people to grow companies, careers and communities§.§        §It’s also an exciting time to be a part of the team. We’re paving the way when it comes to talent software and recruitment services, and we plan to IPO in 3 years.§        §I’m looking for high performers who align with our company values to jump on board for the ride. Our Recruitment Marketing Coordinators report directly to our Operations Leader, Alexa Littleton, and Recruitment Marketing is a hugely important part of our business.§        §With this in mind, I thought I’d break out of the standard job ad mould, and take the time to write an open message to anyone who’s interested in the role.§        §At STG we’re recruitment die-hards and we love Recruitment Marketing. Here are three reasons why:§        §          §Recruitment Matters: §If you want a successful, growing organisation you need the best people, and that starts with nailing your recruitment. You won’t outperform your competitors if you don’t have the best people on your team. And you won’t have the best people on your team without great recruitment.§  §          §Recruitment §is§ Marketing:§ Marketing is everything you do to attract and nurture customers. Recruitment is everything you do to attract and nurture talent. Over the last decade we’ve shifted from an employer-driven market to a candidate-driven market. As a result, the most effective recruitment strategies are underpinned by best practice in marketing.§  §          §Employer Branding is critical: §Any successful marketing strategy starts with nailing your brand. Any successful recruitment strategy starts with nailing your employer brand. In the same way a consumer brand is how organisations market to customers, an employer brand is how they market to candidates. Every organisation has its own challenges, benefits and opportunities that make them unique: we help them bring this to life in a deeply authentic way. (In this role you'll work closely with our Employer Branding team to ensure we're providing a holistic service to our clients.)§        §        §Here’s what the Recruitment Marketing Coordinator role is all about (in 150 words):§        §You’ll craft and implement Recruitment Marketing (RM) campaigns for a range of roles and organisations. This involves working with clients to identify who they want to hire (skills, qualifications, experience, behavioural traits), creating a marketing and advertising strategy to find those types of people, and developing the marketing messaging for the role. §        §From there you will execute the strategy, posting ads to job boards, using digital search techniques, and using social media (where appropriate) to find top talent for your client. §        §Most of the marketing campaigns you'll work on will run for 4-6 weeks, though we have a number of repeat clients that you will have the opportunity to get to know and provide recruitment marketing support to on a longer-term, more strategic basis. §        §You’ll have the backup of your fellow RM team members as well as the STG Sales teams. And from me, of course!§        §You’ll be one of our “faces” of RM so it’s important that you’re confident when it comes to talking to clients. Our salespeople uncover great recruitment marketing opportunities every week, and will introduce you as a RM Specialist to explain our approach.§        §(Okay, that was 188 words, close enough!)§        §Here are three more reasons this is a great opportunity for the right person (I like lists of three!):§        §          §When it comes to career development, we’ll invest in training, and give you the opportunity to get to know other parts of the business. If you’re interested in leadership in the future, we’re firm believers in promoting from within, and leadership opportunities will open up in this team and other parts of the business over the next 12-36 months. §          §We’re a stable organisation (20 years in the industry) but we’re also growing, innovative, and open to new ideas. Our business has performed well over the past 8 “COVID months” and we’re ahead of our forecast year to date.§          §Remuneration is circa $50,000 - $55,000 plus super. You can expect your earnings to increase year on year in line with results and career progression.§        §        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§Hi! My name's Andrea, I'm the CEO at Scout Talent Group (STG).§ § §(I know this is an unusual format for a job advertisement … keep reading to find out why I took this approach!)§ §First of all, here’s some info about STG:§ §We’re a services-enabled software company, delivering recruitment and talent solutions to help our clients hire great people in order to grow their organisations. Our Purpose (our ‘Why’) is to§ connect people to grow companies, careers and communities§.§ §It’s also an exciting time to be a part of the team. We’re paving the way when it comes to talent software and recruitment services, and we plan to IPO in 3 years.§ §I’m looking for high performers who align with our company values to jump on board for the ride. Our Recruitment Marketing Coordinators report directly to our Operations Leader, Alexa Littleton, and Recruitment Marketing is a hugely important part of our business.§ §With this in mind, I thought I’d break out of the standard job ad mould, and take the time to write an open message to anyone who’s interested in the role.§ §At STG we’re recruitment die-hards and we love Recruitment Marketing. Here are three reasons why:§ §Recruitment Matters: §If you want a successful, growing organisation you need the best people, and that starts with nailing your recruitment. You won’t outperform your competitors if you don’t have the best people on your team. And you won’t have the best people on your team without great recruitment.§  § §Recruitment §is§ Marketing:§ Marketing is everything you do to attract and nurture customers. Recruitment is everything you do to attract and nurture talent. Over the last decade we’ve shifted from an employer-driven market to a candidate-driven market. As a result, the most effective recruitment strategies are underpinned by best practice in marketing.§  § §Employer Branding is critical: §Any successful marketing strategy starts with nailing your brand. Any successful recruitment strategy starts with nailing your employer brand. In the same way a consumer brand is how organisations market to customers, an employer brand is how they market to candidates. Every organisation has its own challenges, benefits and opportunities that make them unique: we help them bring this to life in a deeply authentic way. (In this role you'll work closely with our Employer Branding team to ensure we're providing a holistic service to our clients.)§ §Here’s what the Recruitment Marketing Coordinator role is all about (in 150 words):§ §You’ll craft and implement Recruitment Marketing (RM) campaigns for a range of roles and organisations. This involves working with clients to identify who they want to hire (skills, qualifications, experience, behavioural traits), creating a marketing and advertising strategy to find those types of people, and developing the marketing messaging for the role. § §From there you will execute the strategy, posting ads to job boards, using digital search techniques, and using social media (where appropriate) to find top talent for your client. § §Most of the marketing campaigns you'll work on will run for 4-6 weeks, though we have a number of repeat clients that you will have the opportunity to get to know and provide recruitment marketing support to on a longer-term, more strategic basis. § §You’ll have the backup of your fellow RM team members as well as the STG Sales teams. And from me, of course!§ §You’ll be one of our “faces” of RM so it’s important that you’re confident when it comes to talking to clients. Our salespeople uncover great recruitment marketing opportunities every week, and will introduce you as a RM Specialist to explain our approach.§ §(Okay, that was 188 words, close enough!)§ §Here are three more reasons this is a great opportunity for the right person (I like lists of three!):§ §When it comes to career development, we’ll invest in training, and give you the opportunity to get to know other parts of the business. If you’re interested in leadership in the future, we’re firm believers in promoting from within, and leadership opportunities will open up in this team and other parts of the business over the next 12-36 months. § §We’re a stable organisation (20 years in the industry) but we’re also growing, innovative, and open to new ideas. Our business has performed well over the past 8 “COVID months” and we’re ahead of our forecast year to date.§ §Remuneration is circa $50,000 - $55,000 plus super. You can expect your earnings to increase year on year in line with results and career progression.§ § §§§§
